name: Sunrise Mart Êó•Á≥ª„Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº
address: 12 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: convenience_store, deli, asian_grocery_store, meal_takeaway, supermarket, home_goods_store, grocery_store, food_store, japanese_restaurant, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a very disappointing experience at this restaurant. The fish was not fresh and tasted sour, which ruined the meal. This makes me doubt the quality and reliability of this place as a Japanese restaurant. To make matters worse, I experienced stomach pain after eating here today, raising concerns about their food safety standards. I strongly urge the restaurant to improve their ingredient freshness and quality control.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The restaurant sells many kinds of Japanese-style bento, such as udon noodles and Japanese fried chicken. There are 2-3 tables in front of the restaurant and some seats on the second floor. The environment in the restaurant is clean, the air conditioning temperature is moderate and comfortable, and the attitude of the staff is good.
The fried chicken bento I bought was cold, which is a pity. It would have tasted better if it was hot. If you come here to buy lunch, it is recommended to order directly from the staff. The freshly made meals are more delicious when they are hot.
The sashimi sushi is much more delicious. The sashimi is very fresh. If you dare to eat it, I recommend buying it.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Must tryüßã
Yuzu iced tea

Selective vegetarian food options however, the drinks tasted really good.
Good for a quick stop to stock up on yum food.
The prices are not crazy and it‚Äôs feasible!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a beautiful spot with real Japanese vibes! üáØüáµüçõüçúüçô
The onigiri is a must-try! The curry was rich, and the ramen hit the spot.
Honestly, I wanted to try everything‚Ä¶ but I was way too full üòÖ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A small market to the side, and then a food space where you get udon, soba, rice balls, sushi, etc. Prices are ok; the soba was salty, and the karaage was cold (need to warm up in the microwave, but then not as good as fresh / hot crunch). Seating upstairs and a few downstairs. Pay for food first, then pick up from the grill/ordering area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: MORTON WILLIAMS SUPERMARKETS
address: 140 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Meeting with clients on 57th street this morning‚Ä¶ Stopped for lunch at Morton Williams. Who even knew there‚Äôs such a location as 6 1/2 Avenue? Anyway, plenty of fresh food to choose from. Undecided at first, but, the lasagna soup (I know, it‚Äôs summer, but, I love soup) caught my eye & I just had to have it. Added a sandwich & a bottle of water and headed upstairs in the spacious seating area to enjoy my meal. Free wi-fi too!. Only complaint, was, the ceiling in the bathroom looked like it was going to fall on my head.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Morton Williams Supermarkets is a fantastic place to shop for all your grocery needs. The store is always clean, well-organized, and fully stocked with a wide variety of fresh produce, quality meats, and specialty items. I appreciate their selection of organic and international products, which makes it easy to find unique ingredients for any recipe. The staff is consistently friendly, helpful, and quick to assist with any questions or recommendations. The checkout process is efficient, and the overall shopping experience is smooth and enjoyable. Whether you're doing a big weekly shop or just grabbing a few essentials, Morton Williams is a reliable and convenient choice. Highly recommend!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great supermarket. Good prices on products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went there to buy Clubtails..very hard to find in my..3.99$...and they had all the flavors.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'For a supermarket and cafe in midtown a couple of blocks from Central Park, you can‚Äôt beat this place for quality and price. Go straight to the deli and select a huge sandwich or ask for a custom one like I did, grilled chicken and mozzarella. Only $9 folks, incredible. I took it upstairs and got a big pour glass of wine and while there is no ambience, save your vibe for later. Come here to eat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Morton Williams Supermarkets
address: 908 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very Good Super market in Manhattan on 48 Street, Grocery, vegetable, fruits, & so many products available & cafe is also available, & it is open 24 Hours.......', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unfortunately, the prices have gone sky high, but you know we love the people that work there with an exception many of us are in the neighborhood and have made friends there. However, from time to time, I have gotten very bad chicken and therefore have gotten into the habit of puncturing the cellophane to smell it. Last month a butcher I don‚Äôt know yelled at me for doing it and I told her I didn‚Äôt want to get stuck with bad chicken when I got home and sure enough the chicken was bad well this week I bought chicken again and I didn‚Äôt puncture the cellophane because I didn‚Äôt feel like being yelled at and sure enough it was bad chicken and I was too tired to go back. A very famous chef of mine who is now retired told me today he got stuck last week as well with bad chicken so it‚Äôs not my imagination and the attitude of the butcher is there even if you do return it they‚Äôre very arrogant unfortunately otherwise all the department in that store I love lovely people and I really love going there. Unfortunately the chef will never return so you lost a customer there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Staying at the Barclay Intercontinental, we wanted to get some fruits, nuts, water etc. and wanted to visit aa real supermarket. We found one 2 blocks away Morton Williams which was really well stocked with everything we needed and more. Easy to find everything and very friendly staff. We loaded up and will return when we visit NYC again in that area. Highly recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I just needed a cucumber, but they were all semi rotting. Looked for protein, but no luck. Nicely organized nonetheless. A lady at the front cash was counting money and I asked if her cash was open, but she just ignored me. Probably the most insulting thing a person in a retail store can do and I'll never go back here. Apparently, counting money is more important than basic customer service. Was not impressed at all.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fabulously displayed fruits and veggies supermarket, you can find anything you need in here, the shop floor staff super friendly and helpful', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The Food Emporium
address: 810 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Thank you Food Emporium NYC!!! $50 Cake that was ready in one day- that absolutely stunned my partner and his friends on his birthday! Everyone said the cake looked amazing and it tasted great!!! Special thank you to Mildred and the bakery! I live local and they will now be my go-to for special occasion cakes!

P.s. (added some decor of my own from home)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'More than $18 purchase pictured below. Apples non-organic. Strawberries partially rotten. Other customer waiting at check out showed middle finger for no reason - there was no issue at check out.

As rip-off and low class as it gets.

UPDATE LATE OCTOBER 2025, ORIGINAL REVIEW EARLY SEPTEMBER:
Blueberries now $16.99 (see additional photo)

Fyi: got the "cheap" blueberries, not the ones pictured in the separate photo.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I like Food Emporium, the variety of items are great. We went looking for kiwi üçá  but they didn't have.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Food Emporium
810 8th Ave.
New York, NY 10019

The outer skin was crisp, but kind of shriveled.  But, do not be deceived because but it tastes a lot better than it looks.

#RotisserieChicken #tisserie #chicken #foodemporium', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome selection of grab-and-good fresh food options, including sushi, chicken, sandwiches, salads, wraps, many more. The bakery was impressive, as well as the $12.99/lb hot deli bar. Really glad we stopped and enjoyed the sushi, as well as fish, rice and broccoli. Enjoyed.

The beer selection is also impressive of NY selections.

I did not explore the grocery store, but it looked really good. Looks like an excellent spot for locals as well as tourists.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hashi Market
address: 330 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Hashi Market is a fun place to shop if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Japanese groceries. They have a good selection of sushi, snacks, noodles, and even unique items like matcha and sesame soft-serve ice cream. The store is clean and organized, and it‚Äôs easy to find what you need. Prices are a little higher compared to regular supermarkets, but that‚Äôs expected for imported goods. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great spot if you‚Äôre craving Japanese treats or want to explore new flavors!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'In the new York and new jersey area, outside of Mitsuwa Japanese market, this is the one that has almost every categories of Japanese items you will need except alcohol .
It is a much much smaller one compared to to Mitsuwa, but good enough for Manhattan.

First floor they have fresh made soft serve ice cream, hot foods, and all necessary noodles, ready to eat food, snacks and limited fresh produce.

Second floor, it‚Äôs the cutie floor, there are adorable asian characters, make ups, plushies, chinaware, and more.

Limited staff in the shop for stocking, cleaning, and register, but service were efficient and some of the staff are very friendly.

Value, I cannot say it‚Äôs the best, after comparing to Teso and some other Chinese owned market, the pricing over here is slight higher.

Location, convenient, center of Manhattan. No parking. High walking score.

Do recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great Japanese Market and Fujiissa is attached to this location where you should absolutely grab a drink from.

They have a great selection of prepared cold food items to go such as sushi and hot items as well like Katsu don.

It is slightly priced higher but it is a very convenient location next to K-Town so you can do all your Korean / Japanese grocery shopping in one go - if you wanted to.

What you absolutely MUST do while here is to go down one floor below to check out the basement level - they have a fully-stocked Canmake cosmetic product offering as it seems not many are aware of this particular location yet!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is a paradise for Japanese culture lovers! It has everything ‚Äî from fresh produce and fruits to a wide variety of Japanese snacks, famous chocolates like Royce, and adorable collectible toys that will melt your heart. Walking through the aisles feels like being back in Japan. The store is clean, fully stocked, and the staff is super friendly. Highly recommended stop for anyone in the area!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I spent $30 here on salmon sushi for my kids‚Äô lunch. The packaging said it was good for a couple more days, but when I opened the boxes both had a terrible smell ‚Äî the salmon was clearly expired. Absolutely disgusting. Serving spoiled fish under a false expiration date is a serious health risk, and it shows they don‚Äôt care about freshness or their customers. I‚Äôll never buy anything from this place again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fushimi Market
address: 838 6th Ave 5th floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: grocery_store, tea_house, asian_grocery_store, food_court, chinese_restaurant, supermarket, food_store, sushi_restaurant, japanese_restaurant, american_restaurant, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The store was nice and clean. The food I got was alright but I ended up not eating most of it.. Recommend buying food already made and ready to go. There‚Äôs an upstairs area that‚Äôs great for hanging out with friends and has a microwave. Would come here again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I really liked that they had a wide variety of prepared foods ready to eat. It's also great that there's a space where you can sit down and enjoy your meal right there! We tried the yakisoba, but unfortunately it wasn‚Äôt very good‚Äîthe noodles were overcooked and that was pretty much all there was to it. I had the vegetarian one, and my partner had another kind (I can't remember the name), but he felt the same‚Äîtoo much pasta and not much flavor. That said, the mini-market was great for finding Japanese ingredients!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came here around 9 PM and was impressed by how many discounted items were still available after 8. The store is spacious with a seating area, which made it easy to relax while charging my phone. Lots of variety‚Äîgroceries, warm food, and even some fun blind boxes. Staff were friendly and helpful. A great late-night stop with more to offer than your average convenience store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "A treasure trove of Asian flavors with great value.

Fushimi market offers an array of authentic Asian grocery items alongside a remarkable restaurant experience. The beverage section stands out with its colorful variety in different sizes and flavors.

The prepared food counter deserves special mention. Their beef bulgogi features tender, flavorful meat accompanied by great cooked rice, though the portion size might challenge a single person.

The wonton soup strikes an ideal balance in both taste and quantity. While the Taiwan mango milk drink was pleasant but not extraordinary.

The multiple ordering options - kiosks, staff assistance and self service - provide welcome flexibility, complemented by the kitchen's staff efficiency.

The second floor eating area maintains cleanliness but remains purely functional rather than atmospheric, potentially becoming noisy during busy periods.

What truly distinguishes Fushimi market is its exceptional value, high quality food at reasonable prices. Though the eating utensils and napkins could benefit from an upgrade, these shortcomings hardly detract from the whole experience.

This awesome place is absolutely worth returning, next visits I will try their ramen, fried chicken, bubble tea and way more options.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of my best Asian place in general. When you‚Äôre visiting midtown manhattan and you‚Äôre a big fan of Korean, Japanese, and Chinese food and groceries, this is your heaven. They have enough dine in seats so that you can have food you just bought from them. +small restaurant and they sell rare imported beers too.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target Grocery
address: 112 W 34th St., New York, NY 10120, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'They refuse to let 4 prospective customers in at 11:55pm even though store hours extend to 12am.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wanted to use the toilet but Greg (old guy)  was saying the code changes every week and did nothing to open it up. My woman friend got the code right away.  After I asked three times, he opend the employees' restroom and kept ignoring me. I had to wait a while until another employee came along. I came here to buy joyride candy and use the toilet. I'm glad the manager came to open it up. From a 1* to 2*, you don't treat customers like Greg!!!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you know this location from years ago, youd be extremely surprised how much nicer it looks. Rare quality/price balance in the city!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Good store at least for buying something small (like water and snacks) when you're walking around in NYC. Friendly cashier.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Not your everyday grocery store to what I'm used too in the UK, however has everything you'd need", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fairway Market of Chelsea
address: 766 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, market, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I don‚Äôt get it. A kosher section and you let non service dogs in which is against the law federal and state. But good thins are this store has a wide selection and after six stores in Chelsea it has good prices and it‚Äôs CLEAN. VERY CLEAN except for the canine. I wonder if they wipe him/ her. BUT HERE IS THE KICKER: service. There isn‚Äôt any except the security guard who greeted me on entrance and helped me with a cart since there were no baskets. I couldn‚Äôt find anyone to help but then it hit me- it‚Äôs a holiday. But what really slapped me in the face was the check out woman. I said I needed help at the self check out. She snarled at me 5.  5.   5.  Omg I said I was on the other side and I politely said. I don‚Äôt no where 5 is plus being a senior citizen my hearing isn‚Äôt the best. This is sad since this to me is one of the better stores in our neighborhood. Oh well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "We walked in late the other night. At first we weren't sure if the store was still open but we saw people walk in so we followed. My mother and I walked in to purchase a beverage. We ended up browsing some items and suddenly were told by an employee that the store was closed. They were very rude! We were very surprised since we heard no announcement, and were never stopped by any employee who passed us or saw us in the aisles. We barely had less than a handfull of items to purchase so I went to the self checkout register. My mom ended up taking back an item to its original place. Employees gave both of us dirty looks. I understand wanting to go home and the store being closed. But if that's the case they should be more professional in the way the store closing process is done. Don't get grumpy and rude for customers who weren't aware! Next time have someone stand at the door to warn or make sure no last minute customers come in at closing time. Never coming back to the store after such a rude experience. Make sure you don't come in close to 9pm on a Sunday!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I was working in the area and while passing by decided to come in to see if they had the same display of oils as they used to in a Brooklyn Red hook location, which closed a while back. They didn't.. but as I walked through, I saw an amazing olive bar, really cool and expansive. (which by the way saved the review) because Sushi was terrible.. I often grab other supermarket sushi while in a rush, and it's never bad... this one, however, I do not recommend..", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The quality of goods and  with pretty good prices for the Chelsea area this store impressed me UNTIL checkout WHICH WAS A NIGHTMARE.\n\nI was snarled at when I asked for help. I was even reprimanded when I didn‚Äôt know where checkout number 5. My receipt says Scot was the checker but this was a young lady with attitude. I am sorry I am a senior citizen. I am sorry as a Dr that I did not know how to do self check out. I am sorry.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I don't go anywhere exempt fairway! They'll have at least 1 brand on sale in every isle like a specific bread, orange juice, fruits.  The big powerade for $1.40!! I haven't seen that price since the 90s. Really good grocery store for a budget.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Dainobu
address: 36 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Updated:  My family has shopped in the W56th Store 2 - 3 times a month for years. Yesterday, I purchased three pieces of salmon sashimi from this store, each priced at $34.99/lb and labeled as weighing 0.27 lbs. Each package was charged at $9.44.

After walking home, I thought it was an odd coincidence that all weighed the same. So I carefully weighed each of the pieces using a precise kitchen scale. (see attached photos) Following were the actual weights:

Piece 1: 111g
Piece 2: 113g
Piece 3: 108g

Since 0.27 lbs equals approximately 122.5 grams, each piece was noticeably underweight, despite being labeled and priced as 0.27 lbs. Based on the per-pound price, I was overcharged by approximately $2.71 in total.

The owner provided the explanation below, asked for me to travel back to the store so they could refund me ($2.71).', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Small but mighty Japanese supermarket where you can get groceries, entree, and sushi. Was really impressed by the selection; finding items that I have not seen in other Japanese supermarket or outside of Japan before. A worthwhile stop especially if you are looking for snacks and Japanese beauty/skin care products!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Compact, super convenient Japanese grocery store with ready made bento and sushi to go with what I call "micro" sizing and pricing so it's perfect for singletons or small parties to grab a bite and necessities on the fly.  Asian has a saying that even though a sparrow is small, it's all fully equipped and ready to go. This is such a capable and versatile shop.  Hands down a great shop and highly recommended üòç. Plus yummy fresh sushi with a small side of tobiko roe üëç. Perfect size without over buying and quenched the cravings ... Hit the spotü§£', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love Dainobu and have been grabbing lunch here for years. Today I came in and picked up a bento lunch that had a cockroach sitting right at the top of the container. Check your food carefully before buying/eating! Makes me think twice about coming back.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This was the rudest Japanese store I‚Äôve ever been to in the world, no exaggeration. I had marked this place on Google Maps for quite a while because the reviews were great, and I was really looking forward to visiting. Today, I happened to be nearby, so I finally went in and bought a variety of snacks.

I also needed a nail clipper at that time, but the only one I saw was for babies. So, I asked a store clerk‚Äîa Japanese lady with yellow hair‚Äîif they had nail clippers. She responded in a very impatient and rude tone, simply saying ‚ÄúYes.‚Äù I then pointed out that the one I found was for babies and asked if they had one for adults. She became visibly annoyed and aggressively led me to where the baby nail clippers were, and said rudely ‚ÄúThis is for babies.‚Äù I said I know that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm looking for an adult one. She impatiently walked me over to another shelf, showing me a different product, saying ‚ÄúThis is expensive.‚Äù I told her, ‚ÄúI know this brand.‚Äù She just repeated ‚ÄúThis is expensive‚Äù back to me and walked away.

I didn‚Äôt say anything further, bought the nail clipper, and left. I have no idea why she was so hostile, but I‚Äôm never coming back to this store again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1095 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'From a traveler‚Äôs perspective, am just excited to revisit Whole Foods again. Same vibe with higher price tags. First floor sells grab&go foods and second floor sells hot meals. The sprits section can be better but won‚Äôt complain.

There are a lot of security guards near the entrance area. Overall a nice place to have in the middle of Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When I‚Äôm in the city I go to whole foods for my needs, I love their butchery counter that has very fresh meat. The vegetables are amazing as well, the hot bar has a wide variety of food though I wish they would change it up sometimes.

When you buy flowers from here they can make you a pretty bouquet üíê free of charge. Prime members get good deals throughout the store.

The only aggravating thing is that customer service desk that‚Äôs supposed to serve as a till never is open or available. They always just send you to the regular checkout counter. I was buying flowers the other day and they refused to let me pay for them there which is closer to the florist department. Whole Foods can make this process more efficient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 6th Avenue is a great place for grocery shopping, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables that are always well-stocked and of high quality. Prices are reasonable for the freshness and quality you get, and the store is clean, organized, and easy to navigate, making the shopping experience enjoyable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The food bar is so fresh and there‚Äôs a lot of variety. Definitely a good choice for healthy lunch, and the top floor seating has a great view
However, there is some cons.

Bathroom line is very full because of the location. Checkout can also be a hassle during busy hours because of the lack of employees, at least during the times I went.

But overall a great place to get food and buy a few grocery items. Just needs organizing the people traffic especially during busy hours.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôm truly surprised at their inability to replenish their stocks. Are we already facing a supply crisis? For the last three days they haven‚Äôt replenished their stocks. I have been going daily to buy a chocolate cereal but it‚Äôs not there. In fact, every day the shelves get more and more empty without being replenished. It‚Äôs truly pathetic that in the middle of one of the most busiest commercial and tourist spots in the country, we have such shortages.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly - Flatiron
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: gift_shop, cafe, market, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "A local friend recommended that I had to walk through the market before I leave and she was spot on. I could have spent all afternoon here eating and sampling and watching the cutting, chopping and folding of all the delicious food. Since I fly I only got the tomato pie but man was it good even a couple hours later at LGA. I did purchase a bag of dry garlic and chili bowtie pasta  for home since you can carry on dry goods. Can't wait to find a complimentary recipe to make them.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I give Amalfi by Serra in Eataly, NYC a 3 stars. I had ravioli which was good but not exceptional. However, the appetizer burrata was very good. I‚Äôm not particularly keen with the decor, the ceiling has all plastic plants and flowers not to my knowledge taste.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Ahhh love this place! Came here twice on our week vacation and was impressed both times! They have tons of gluten free options for dinner and dessert. Loved being able to visit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We went for lunch here during office hours. You walk through a nice Italian supermarket to reach this restaurant which is under the same roof.
Its right opposite the Madison Park.
I went for the set lunch menu which was truly bang for the buck.
The tuna was served to perfection. The breads served with extra Virgin olive oil was lovely.
We opted for the Tiramisu Conoli and the spin to made my day. Probably the best Tiramisu I have had in the US.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Always feel like you are eating the freshest food at Eataly. Since you are surrounded by products and groceries, it certainly adds to the feeling. Love the Italian accent of the service personnel and the specials. Don‚Äôt count calories if you are headed there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 675 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Artistic balloons, face painting for memorable birthdays and events @thecolorcrew_nyc and thecolorcrew-nyc Artistic and reliable party entertainment. I love the unique and detailed face painting- the kids were enchanted. The balloons were ridiculously elaborate- crowned, super hero‚Äôs, botanical and princesses. Well worth the price for entertainment as guests were absorbed watching the Color Crew make the magic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was never a big Trader Joe‚Äôs fan. I always thought that their things were kind of too generic. I was dead wrong. This particular store on 6th and 21st changed my view. After trying many different things from here over time, I‚Äôm all in! I really like this place. Although this one is a very small store, it‚Äôs got a lot of great things at decent prices. The produce section is pretty good, as to is the frozen foods and meat departments. The bread area is great, with lots of interesting things.

Expect a very long checkout line most of the time, but it moves quickly. The staff is very friendly and the place is nice and clean. What‚Äôs not to like when you combine that with pretty good prices and selection? This place is a winner. Check it out if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I just love Trader Joe‚Äôs. There‚Äôs always something seasonal to buy. Look at these Fall leaf shaped and coloured corn tortilla chips for example!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Trader Joe‚Äôs in Chelsea is a great spot for affordable, quality groceries in Manhattan. The selection of private-label products, snacks, and fresh items is excellent, and the staff is friendly and helpful even during busy hours.

The store does get very crowded, especially in the afternoons and on weekends, with narrow aisles and long checkout lines. Visiting early in the morning makes for a much more relaxed shopping experience.

Overall, a solid Trader Joe‚Äôs with fair prices and good quality, just not ideal if you‚Äôre in a hurry.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Finally managed to visit one of their outlets, albeit a smaller one along 6th Avenue. Fruits, flowers, vegetables and cheese selections were incredible, looked so super fresh and at reasonable discounts/prices. The queue moves efficiently here and it‚Äôs relatively easy to identify and locate items across the store. All the staff are incredibly nice and friendly. Great place to shop for all your essential items, dailies, household, perishables and more.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 200 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Trader Joe‚Äôs
üìç 200 E 32nd Street, New York, NY 10016

Trader Joe‚Äôs at 200 E 32nd St is a great store with fresh fruits, vegetables, dry fruits, snacks, and groceries at reasonable prices. The staff are friendly and helpful. It can get crowded at busy times, but overall it‚Äôs a convenient place for quality shopping.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love Trader Joe‚Äôs.  My son just moved to the neighborhood so I wanted to stock his fridge. No place else can you get beautiful fresh flowers, fruits, vegetables, cheese and meat at reasonable prices.  Plenty of unique items too.  Nice assortment of spices and Condiments.  Stock up on seasonal items, they go fast.  Staff is always friendly, go out of their way to help and always with a smile.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The store is spacious and has a wide variety of products. Although not necessarily the cheapest, most brands are available. Fresh and delicious strawberries, reasonably priced.
There were many customers queuing to check out (about 20-30 people, occupying an aisle). I don't know if it was good luck, but there were many cash registers working in the store (more than 10 were visible). The waiting time was about 10 minutes. The checkout speed was very fast, and the overall shopping experience was satisfactory.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It can be very busy at that location at a certain time after work but the lines move very fast. I had my stuff ringed up by a young lady name Juanita and she was incredibly sweet and patient. She kept telling me to take my time and I laughed because I felt pressured to quickly put my stuff away. I thought that was incredibly kind because you can‚Äôt find that in most stores now they are ready to take the next customer and get you out. Definitely love how friendly everyone is there!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Great customer service! Found everything I wanted and a few surprises...the rice & lentil onion rings are oh so delicious! Finally I can eat a healthier option! A gluten free snack that contains milk. I couldn't stop at one; They're all gone & I miss Trader Joe's too ü§©", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart
address: 38 W 32nd St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'What a fantastic grocery store! The meat section and selection is top quality! The variety of produce is excellent and very fresh! I live in the Midwest and how I would love to have an H Mart in my neighborhood! Be sure and  visit the upstairs for a quick meal and more great shopping deals.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love Hmart. I go all the time if I can but I prefer the Fort Lee NJ one bc they always have the best prices and variety and stuff I love even if it‚Äôs not the biggest in size like Edison NJ. So w that said this location is great and in the heart of Korea town on 32nd street between Broadway and 5th avenue but bc the rent is so high as you can imagine the Manhattan commercial rental rates‚Ä¶the food prices are high unless there‚Äôs a sale. It‚Äôs not terrible bc it‚Äôs definitely not cheap. But if you are in Manhattan and need some authentic Korean grocery items Hmart is the gold standard. Hmart is also known to be very clean and their produce and fruit and vegetables to be washed and presentable and the store is always kept as clean as possible with all that foot traffic so you don‚Äôt smell anything bad. Koreans are obsessed about clean and I am not complaining. I really appreciate it. I would rather buy my meat and veggies and fruit from a place that values cleanliness and organization.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Visited H Mart in Koreatown NYC and had a great time exploring. We had dinner at a Korean BBQ restaurant. I tried the candied grapes and strawberries‚Äîsweet, crunchy, and totally addictive! I also browsed one of the beauty stores inside with popular TikTok skincare and makeup finds. Perfect spot for Korean snacks, fresh groceries, and trendy beauty picks‚Äîall in the heart of Midtown.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Hmart on 32nd street is a ripoff market.  I was going to buy a chill flakes that was made in Korean.  As you can see the picture on the shelf the label price was $7.99.  And when I going to check out the chili flakes, the price  came out $26.99.  Which was a ridiculous price difference.  I told the cashier and  he wasn‚Äôt polite nor friendly.  He told me to speak to the manager.  The manager, who can‚Äôt speak English and was very rude too. If you goes to Wholefoods or shop rite they will honor the price was showing on the shelf, but not in H mart market.  For sure, I will never go back again.  I found other Hmart same item and price is lower than 32nd street.  Plus Hmart should have a manager, who spoke a better English!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I am very disappointed with this H-Mart (Korea Town). They sold me an expired mochi package. I got it from the front display table, so I trusted it was fresh. I didn‚Äôt check the date until after I already ate it. Why are they selling and charging customers for expired items? It feels like the store only focuses on money and not on customer safety. This is unacceptable and very careless. Please check your products before selling to people.

I bought it on September month.
You can check the date (2025/06/26) in the picture.
Why are you guys still kept it on the front display table and sold it to customers?', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 10 Columbus Cir Ste Sc101, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I rarely writw reviews on google map but this time I have said they really deserve it. This is the best whole foods in Manhattan. Peter (I think that was his name) helped me carrying my bags upstairs, he was so kind and joyfull! He teamed with Mirlene (I made sure I had their name because thwy were so nice really) I spent every week $$$ because variety of options, quality of products and so many hard workers keeping everything nice and organize for customers.
Top notch', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods Market is always one of the busiest spots‚Äîespecially the elevator, which is constantly packed with people coming and going. The in-store restaurant is equipped with restrooms, and the entire market is always buzzing with activity, so expect to wait in line no matter when you go. That said, one of the best things to do in the summer is grab some fresh sushi and a cold soda here, then head to Central Park for the perfect picnic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently visited this Whole Foods and had an excellent experience. I picked up some Whole Grain Checkers cereal and a vegan chocolate bar, both of which were exactly what I was looking for. The store was well-stocked and organized, which made shopping a breeze.

A special shout-out to John, the cashier, who was wearing a "Cashier of 2019" badge‚Äîhe‚Äôs still doing an amazing job! His friendly demeanor and efficient service made the checkout process smooth and quick. It's rare to see such consistent quality in service, and John‚Äôs professionalism is definitely appreciated.

Overall, this store always provides a great shopping experience, and I‚Äôll certainly be back. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "If you read past Google reviews, you'll see customers reporting RACISM, RACIAL PROFILING, AND DISCRIMINATION at this store. The pattern is clear, and the manager‚Äôs dismissive attitude is part of the problem. That‚Äôs why these experiences continue.

I reported a serious incident involving mistreatment that strongly appeared to be racist and discriminatory by an employee in the seafood department. What shocked me most was not only the behavior of the employee, but also the store‚Äôs refusal to take any meaningful action or even acknowledge wrongdoing. According to the manager, KUNHO, I will receive neither an apology from the employee nor any follow-up from the store. He questioned whether my experience was real but wouldn‚Äôt even attempt to verify what happened while I was still physically present in the store. When I offered to wait so he could check the camera, he told me I could wait as many hours as I liked, and he still wouldn‚Äôt check it because he was ‚Äúvery busy.‚Äù What kind of manager responds like that? Shame on you, KUNHO.

To the employee: If you do not want to interact with customers respectfully, why not work at a place where you do not need to deal with customers? That way, you will have no opportunity to mistreat customers, and more people will be happy.

To the store manager KUNHO: I hope you and your family will never be mistreated like that in any place by any employee like yours, and if that unfortunately happens, the issue will be resolved effectively by a good store manager‚Äînot someone like you.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I personally feel like this location is the easiest to find items that are well priced. Compared to the SoHo location for example, there are less rows of empty shelves.
The line moves quickly here as well. The major downside is the seating area.
A few years back this seating area had a coffee shop and juice bar but that‚Äôs been replaced by an Amazon pick up center. The seating is minimal in my opinion, but that could be because so many other locations have more space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 226 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Whole Foods Market ‚Äì East 57th Street, New York

This Midtown East Whole Foods is clean, modern, and very convenient for nearby residents and office workers. The store offers fresh produce, bakery, groceries, and prepared foods with Amazon Prime deals available. However, the aisles are a bit narrow and it can get crowded during peak hours. Prices are on the higher side, as expected at Whole Foods, and the selection is slightly smaller compared to larger locations. Overall, it‚Äôs a good option for quality groceries and quick meals, but best to shop during off-peak times for a smoother experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Reporting on my return to the Amazon Return Center at Whole Foods on east 57th st.  Reported return on line at Amazon and the took my wife‚Äôs two pants to this center to process. The return center is upstairs next to the coffee stand. The guy on duty today was very pleasant and efficient.  Waited a few minutes as two people were in line. Total time in and out was 15 minutes.  This is why so many people love to shop from Amazon on line - returns are so easy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazon return times can be very long due to lines (and they make you go upstairs). If you go after work, be prepared for it to take  20-25 minutes to process your Amazon return.
I got a reply from Whole Foods telling me to visit a certain website to give more feedback. But even that just put me in a queue for an agent who never came. I feel like Amazon does not value my time at all and I will try to shop there less in the future as a result. The store does not manage their lines well for returns and there was not good signage. One of the lines was much longer than the other one because one of them had staff support (but I didn‚Äôt notice that at first).  It‚Äôs a huge inconvenience in nyc to have to get to a Whole Foods, and on top of that it‚Äôs on the second floor (with stairs not an elevator/escalator), and then insult to injury was the long line.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was not expecting the store to be that big. We did find everything we where looming for. Everything was fresh and good. We were able to use our canadian prime account to get the discount at the register. The staff were super nice with us.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very crowded, hard to find items with minimal labeling on the shelfs, items are moved frequently to different locations in the store, mainly self checkout, only few cashiers at the checkout lane. It is a supermarket that identifies as who knows what. Need to simplify.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 63 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have never really shopped in Whole Foods until I started to come to return my Amazon purchases. I decided to try out their croissants and then I saw they had sourdough bread. I tried both and I fell in love! I started to try their organic fruits, veggie salads, and just recently I finally bought food to go. I really liked their juicy rosemary chicken breast and their mozzarella creamy pasta. I also got my bf dark chocolate almonds and he liked them too! I honestly wish there were at least 2 Whole Foods in every borough so then customers wouldn‚Äôt have to travel to another borough! In the mean time I will just continue to shop in Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Let‚Äôs see the only thing I‚Äôm not rooting for at this location is the pricing for hot food and to me it‚Äôs a total ripoff system they have with this scale you place the food on . Now the mac and cheese is a 8. The soups are a 7 the  sides are and 8 overall you will not go wrong as far as taste is concerned . Myb once I tired the food and it seemed tasteless but overall I ate there with cash money by accident multiple times cuz it‚Äôs no reason I should pay that much in a supermarket for food even if I was a billionaire by choice cuz now I‚Äôm saving my money . If I can change the cheap box‚Äôs  and sizes for the food as well as prices would be my favorite store . Those chefs works hard . Now the supermarket always clean and busy . I would sit and eat and hope that adjustments are made cuz that was June 28 I realized this but everyone is diff I just feel the food buffet style as suggested and one day it did make me happy eating it', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "While convenient and nicely situated, this Whole Foods doesn't give you the full stack of offerings you're used to from Whole Foods and it seems understocked. It's almost uninspiring to shop there, despite the pretty all-glass building.  Also, not sure what's going on with the roasted chicken that goes missing, since sometimes you can't even find any to buy... and the hot bar is more like a mess. The quality has definitely gone down ever since Amazon bought Whole Foods. It's a shame really, but that's the tea, I guess.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Nice, clean, with decent selection, standard for whole foods. One other nice aspect about this location is that I have never had to wait in check out lines for more than 2-3 minutes; in fact majority of the time I don't have to wait at all", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '3rd time visiting this Whole Food for weekly supermarket runs. Ample choices, good produce selection, clean and spacious. Cashier service leaves a lot to be desired. If you need help with your groceries prepare not to get it. So, I recommend self checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 250 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Shopping at Whole Foods Market is interesting for me as I like to see all the aisles. This large location is on Seventh Avenue in Chelsea. As I enter, I am in the large vegetable and fruit section. Both organic and conventional varieties are available. Naturally organic prices are much higher. The fresh seafood and meat sections are next. Occasionally I get a salmon cake that I can saut√©. In the middle of the store is the prepared foods and salad bar which is by weight. The cheese section is also there. Plant based pizzas and cauliflower crusts are in refrigerated cases. A variety of domestic and international butters are here priced decently that sometimes I can afford to buy them. Egg cartons are still rationed at three per customer due to the avian flu that had started a while back. These eggs range in price from $7 upwards. I don‚Äôt buy them as they are too pricey for me. My favorite section are the yogurts and when they are on sale I like to get Ellenos mango or passion fruit. Valley Shepherd Farm is another yogurt brand that I like a lot. Aisles are filled with teas, coffees, grains and the usual varieties of foods most supermarkets have. The body area is colorful and I like browsing here for deodorants on sale and the occasional face cleanser. One cannot forget the ice cream selections of which there are many. I am partial to Jeni‚Äôs Splendid ice cream in Wildberry Lavender and Dark Chocolate. Freshly baked breads, cakes and cookies are here too. I like the ‚ÄúLast Chance‚Äùwhere items are heavily discounted. One can either go to the self checkout machines or to the cashier. Magazines and temptations are always as one is waiting to pay. One needs self control not to go berserk! Two clean restrooms are here too which is convenient. Customer service is good with everyone trying to help you. Security guards are also manning the store and the entrance to avoid any incidents.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you‚Äôre looking for a top-tier supermarket with an exceptional fresh counter, this place is a hidden gem. The seafood, meat, and specialty products are of outstanding quality, making it a go-to destination for food lovers and home chefs alike.

The seafood section is particularly impressive‚Äîalways fresh, well-stocked, and offering a wide variety of fish and shellfish. Whether you‚Äôre looking for wild-caught salmon, fresh oysters, or high-quality shrimp, you‚Äôll find it here. The staff is knowledgeable and can even provide recommendations on the best ways to prepare your selection.

The meat counter is just as remarkable, offering premium cuts of beef, lamb, and poultry. The butchers are skilled and happy to assist with custom cuts or special requests. You can really taste the quality, whether you‚Äôre grilling a steak or slow-cooking a roast.

Beyond seafood and meat, the store boasts an excellent selection of specialty products, from gourmet cheeses to rare international ingredients. The variety ensures that you can find everything you need for a high-end meal at home.

Customer service is top-notch, with friendly and helpful staff always ready to assist. The store is clean, well-organized, and makes shopping a pleasant experience.

If quality and freshness are your priorities, this supermarket is a must-visit. Highly recommended!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "It was my first and last time in this supermarket.
The employees were incredibly kind.
And the items for sale are of excellent quality.
I really liked the supermarket
I would like to shop here more often
But I think it's a bit far from Germany.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is a sizable Whole Foods Market with a very good hot and cold self-service food area. Fruits and vegetables are also fresh, the meat section is serving up fresh cuts while keeping the display case filled with additional freshly cut options. The lines tend to move fairly quickly no matter how long the line may be and there's always someone at the front of the line assisting customers as they see their register number being called.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I always love a Whole foods store, but this isn't my favourite one in the area.
I didn't find it to be laid out as well as the other stores and had to wait a while for the 'qualified person' to beat up my pizza slice.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 450 W 33rd St, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Fresh Salad Bar and Hot Foods to go.

I really enjoyed the big selections of fresh salad and hot roast chickens that came as a whole one or 1/2.

There was ready to eat macaroni cheese.
Hot chicken bites with chilli sauce.
Chicken wings, potato wedges, Chicken thigh pieces, cooked vegetables all very nice.
We had sushi on other days to try as much foods as possible!

There is just so much more‚Ä¶', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'They have everything you need from supermarket. Ready to eat food, hot and cold serve also cooking station with sushi bar. They have seating area for you too. Enjoy!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Perfection of a grocery store-restaurant hybrid concept.
Ultramodern indoor & outdoor doors dining areas with inspiring views.
Steps away from the High Line, Mall & much more.
5 stars for the helpful & courteous staff.
Must be a Flagship location.?
INCREDIBLE SELECTIONüòé', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unacceptable Experience ‚Äì Found a Worm in My Salad

I‚Äôve always trusted Whole Foods for quality and cleanliness, but this experience was beyond disappointing. I purchased a salad from the salad bar and discovered a worm in my food. This is absolutely unacceptable for any establishment, especially one that promotes such high standards and premium pricing.

Food safety and hygiene should never be compromised. It‚Äôs unsettling to think this could happen, and it makes me question the store‚Äôs food handling and inspection procedures. I hope Whole Foods takes immediate action to ensure this doesn‚Äôt happen to anyone else.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of the nicest Whole Foods stores I‚Äôve been in. I stopped in here when I was meeting my son for lunch at one Manhattan West. I thought it was a small store, but it just keeps going and going this store is big. It‚Äôs beautiful. Has everything you need a full sushi bar, premade sandwiches, a sandwich counter, a hot bar and plenty of seating in case you want to eat lunch in the store. Such a great experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Mercado Little Spain
address: 10 Hudson Yards, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: food_court, steak_house, spanish_restaurant, seafood_restaurant, grocery_store, food_store, store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Absolutely loved the lively and cheerful ambiance! The place is full of energy with an amazing selection of food and drinks to please every taste. It feels like stepping into a vibrant Spanish marketplace where you can sample a wide range of delicious tapas. The bar service is excellent, and it‚Äôs great that you can enjoy your drink while exploring around. The only tiny hiccup was figuring out where to order, but once settled, everything flowed smoothly. A wonderful spot for families and friends to relax, laugh, and enjoy a flavorful experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Mercado Little Spain is an incredible experience ‚Äî not just a restaurant, but a true celebration of Spanish culture and food!
The moment you walk in, you feel transported to Madrid or Barcelona with the lively atmosphere, beautiful d√©cor, and the smell of authentic Spanish dishes.
There are so many delicious options ‚Äî from tapas and paella to churros, jam√≥n, and fresh seafood. Everything is full of flavor and beautifully presented. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, happy to help you explore different tastes from Spain.
It‚Äôs also fun just to walk around the market area, grab a coffee, or try something sweet like churros con chocolate. Perfect for families, students, or friends looking to experience something unique in New York.
Mercado Little Spain is truly a must-visit ‚Äî a little piece of Spain in the heart of Manhattan!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "A lively and vibrant food hall serving up Spanish themed food and bev.

Liquid olives, charcuterie and bev were the highlight for us.

Personally am not big on shellfish so can't comment on that other than to say they had a wide selection and it was displayed nicely and looked fresh.

I think it's odd and unfortunate that they didn't have Ham Croquetas (only chicken).

The paella was decent, didn't blow me away but was not bad at all. Texture was on point and flavor was good.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Exceptional food. Excellent atmosphere. Service is tops, except at the coffee shop. Yet their orchata coffee and the torta de queso (cheesecake) are a must try! The ib√©rico ham and cheese flautas (sandwiches) are also at par. Beers, wines, all good!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Little Spain at Hudson Yards is the perfect hidden gem for authentic Spanish cuisine. You can find everything you crave ‚Äî from pulpo a la gallega and tortilla de patatas to churros and a delicious jam√≥n ib√©rico sandwich. The only downside was the staff at the seafood counter, who didn‚Äôt seem very friendly, but the server at the jam√≥n stand was the complete opposite ‚Äî very kind and attentive. Overall, a great experience, and I‚Äôll definitely be back to try the gazpacho!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Katagiri Japanese Grocery
address: 370 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "Great Japanese grocery store! They have an onigiri station and ramen station making fresh food daily! They also have a great selection of other snacks, drinks, and other cooking items. I stopped by for some of their fresh sushi and onigiri, very affordable pricing. It gets quite busy during lunch rush so just a word of caution. Don't wait too late in the day to stop by for fresh food because they might run out of your favorite. Get here early!!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Just discoverthis japanese market near my job! Great customer service and really affordable prices vs other Asian markets. They also have ramen! Can't wait to come back and try more things!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of the best Japan groceries in NY! they have good bento and fresh raw/cooked sushi. It has (a few) indoor bar seating for enjoying the food and restroom for customers.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love coming here especially before the train for a little snack. Great quality Japanese food. Always tend to get imagery and perf little treat. Quick service  and tons always available', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Japanese groceries looks pretty good and of good quality. The prepared food one level lower. Especially tonkotsu ramen. In American standard average in Japanese even lower', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Kalustyan's
address: 123 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: deli, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "A fantastic store in Manhattan for anyone who loves cooking or exploring global flavors! Kalustyan's has an incredible selection of international spices, herbs, teas, grains, sauces, and specialty ingredients from all over the world. The shop is well-organized, and the staff is helpful and knowledgeable. A true gem for food lovers ‚Äî you‚Äôll always discover something new here. Highly recommended!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'To my Persians. See photos.
Got 90% of what you are looking for.
Also got barabri and doogh abali!
Great spot to shop. You‚Äôll get lost in there and probably spend more than you need to. Hahaha. I wish I knew what to do with all these spices.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When you as a grown kid find candy land; have too many options to buy and try. For a foodie this is pure heaven. I went here with coworkers during lunch. We purchased candy for us to try, food to take home, spices to cook and tea options. We ran out of time so we plan to come back. The pistachio baklava was delicious. We loved it!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Kalustyan‚Äôs has been a wonderland of spices, herbs, teas, and more in Manhattan for ages. I‚Äôve had the pleasure of shopping here on many occasions. I love being able to select more varieties of curry than anywhere else in the city. I already have hot Jamaican curry, this time I chose Trinidadian curry. There are varieties from a vast number of countries, each with their own unique flavor profile. In addition, I was able to find Chinese herbs of Anjelica Sinensis or Dong Quai (women‚Äôs ginseng), a pepper popular in Nepal, a variety of American bbq spices, dried and chilis, and so much more!

I noticed they carry rose water, orange blossom water, lavender, many natural hair care products, different coffee types ranging from those commonly found and used in America to more international varieties and favorites like Turkish coffee and the copper coffee pot. There are many baking products like differing levels of dutch cocoa powder, sugar - demerara, coconut sugar, many more kinds. A large array of flour types, sprinkles and dragees, including the De Ruijter variety beloved in The Netherlands for fairy bread.

You‚Äôll find spices, herbs, ingredients, and sauces from all parts of the world. They also have some baklava and desserts near the register, even Dubai chocolate. In the back, there are many refrigerators and freezers with a variety of foods like Naan, Ras Malai, yogurts, meals, tapenades, olives, kefir, and so much more. Be sure to stop in if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood or visiting from abroad. This is a wonderful gem of a shop with many great options!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A One-of-a-Kind Spice Haven! ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Kalustyan‚Äôs in Manhattan is truly a gem for anyone passionate about spices and specialty ingredients. The store offers an unparalleled selection of spices, herbs, and international ingredients you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. From rare Indian spices to exotic Middle Eastern condiments, this place is a food lover‚Äôs paradise.

The quality of the products is exceptional, and the staff is knowledgeable, always ready to help you find exactly what you need. If you‚Äôre into cooking and love experimenting with flavors, Kalustyan‚Äôs is a must-visit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 301 W 50th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Missing CRITICAL feature: amazon returns.     It‚Äôs got my pizza, got my cookies, got my kombucha‚Ä¶.  It‚Äôs pretty, but overall it‚Äôs a disappoint because of the choice to omit such helpful part of the WF and Amazon experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Review for Denisse ‚Äì Whole Foods Customer Service Superstar

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Whole Foods, where I was assisted by an extraordinary employee named Denisse. Her exceptional professionalism and attention to detail truly stood out during my shopping experience, making a significant impact on my overall enjoyment and satisfaction.

Her genuine approach to customer service set the tone for the rest of my visit. Denisse's ability to anticipate my needs and provide tailored assistance was akin to a seasoned professional, ensuring that my shopping experience was seamless and efficient. Her knowledge about the products was impressive, and she took the time to explain the benefits of the items, which was incredibly helpful.

Denisse's attention to detail was evident in everything she did. Whether it was recommending complementary products, or addressing any concerns I had, her meticulous approach left no room for error. I felt confident in her guidance and appreciated her thoroughness in ensuring that my questions were answered and my needs met.

While interacting with Denisse, it became clear to me that her skills are underutilized in her current position. She possesses a natural talent for leadership and an ability to inspire those around her. Her calm demeanor, coupled with exceptional organizational skills, would undoubtedly make her a valuable asset in a managerial role.

I couldn't help but compare her to another impressive employee I encountered at the 96th Street Branch, who ultimately turned out to be the store manager lol. Both share a remarkable commitment to excellence and customer service, yet Denisse brought an additional warmth and personalized touch that I believe would thrive in a leadership position. Her potential for growth within Whole Foods is undeniable, and it would be a tremendous loss not to recognize and develop her capabilities further.

Considering Denisse's outstanding capabilities and the positive impact she has on customers, I strongly recommend that she be considered for a promotion. Elevating her to a managerial role would not only harness her skills for a greater purpose but also enhance the overall shopping experience for all customers lucky enough to cross paths with her. Whole Foods has the opportunity to further cultivate an exceptional employee in Denisse, and I am confident she would excel and continue to exceed expectations in a leadership capacity.

In summary, Denisse is a customer service star who should not go unnoticed. Her professionalism, attention to detail, and potential for a managerial role make her an indispensable asset to Whole Foods. Her dedication to providing an outstanding shopping experience deserves recognition and reward, and I urge Whole Foods to consider her for well-deserved career advancement.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'new to the neighborhood good selection only missing my favorite bar soap brand and detergent. really good selection anyway for a grab-and-go. overall clean and staff is really helpful and nice, Andrea at the customer service table is such a sweet heart and made me feel welcomed to my new grocery shop', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'FOOD SAFETY ISSUE, BRUSHED OFF TWICE.

I‚Äôm genuinely glad there‚Äôs a new Whole Foods Daily Shop in the neighborhood. It‚Äôs well-maintained, convenient, and has a great selection. I‚Äôve shopped there many times and wanted to see it succeed.

But today, I noticed the potatoes looked visibly green - even before checking out, I flagged it to a staff member. I was told ‚Äúit‚Äôs edible‚Äù and brushed off.

When I got home and peeled both potatoes I purchased, I saw the green went deep under the skin, which, as anyone with basic food safety knowledge knows, can indicate high levels of solanine, a toxic compound. That‚Äôs not safe, especially if you‚Äôre serving this to kids, elderly family members, or anyone with health sensitivities.

I went back and raised the concern with the manager. He refused to apologize for the negligence, claimed he ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt familiar with that fact‚Äù and needed to ‚Äúcheck,‚Äù yet in the same breath offered to start covering the potatoes to reduce light exposure. That contradiction alone tells me he wasn‚Äôt being straight with me.

I also asked what the plan was for training staff, so they stop casually dismissing legitimate concerns by telling customers food is ‚Äúedible‚Äù when it clearly may not be. He made it clear that staff training is his thing, and the tone implied I had no right to raise that question - even though the staff gave misinformation and clearly needs better guidance.

This isn‚Äôt about the $1.50. It‚Äôs about how both staff and management dismissed a clear food safety issue with zero accountability. I expected better - especially from a store that positions itself as a standard-bearer for quality. Very disappointed in how they handled this, and how little concern they showed for customer safety.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not a full service Whole Foods. Location was not able to accept Amazon returns despite information listed online.

I would recommend that they take one of the following actions to avoid unneeded confusion:

1. Get equipment to accept Amazon returns
2. Clarify on online maps that they are not a truly Whole Foods Market and adjust the instructions on Amazon to not direct customers to this location', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Sunrise Mart Êó•Á≥ª„Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº
address: 12 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: convenience_store, deli, meal_takeaway, supermarket, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, home_goods_store, japanese_restaurant, food_store, store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a very disappointing experience at this restaurant. The fish was not fresh and tasted sour, which ruined the meal. This makes me doubt the quality and reliability of this place as a Japanese restaurant. To make matters worse, I experienced stomach pain after eating here today, raising concerns about their food safety standards. I strongly urge the restaurant to improve their ingredient freshness and quality control.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The restaurant sells many kinds of Japanese-style bento, such as udon noodles and Japanese fried chicken. There are 2-3 tables in front of the restaurant and some seats on the second floor. The environment in the restaurant is clean, the air conditioning temperature is moderate and comfortable, and the attitude of the staff is good.
The fried chicken bento I bought was cold, which is a pity. It would have tasted better if it was hot. If you come here to buy lunch, it is recommended to order directly from the staff. The freshly made meals are more delicious when they are hot.
The sashimi sushi is much more delicious. The sashimi is very fresh. If you dare to eat it, I recommend buying it.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Must tryüßã
Yuzu iced tea

Selective vegetarian food options however, the drinks tasted really good.
Good for a quick stop to stock up on yum food.
The prices are not crazy and it‚Äôs feasible!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a beautiful spot with real Japanese vibes! üáØüáµüçõüçúüçô
The onigiri is a must-try! The curry was rich, and the ramen hit the spot.
Honestly, I wanted to try everything‚Ä¶ but I was way too full üòÖ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A small market to the side, and then a food space where you get udon, soba, rice balls, sushi, etc. Prices are ok; the soba was salty, and the karaage was cold (need to warm up in the microwave, but then not as good as fresh / hot crunch). Seating upstairs and a few downstairs. Pay for food first, then pick up from the grill/ordering area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: MORTON WILLIAMS SUPERMARKETS
address: 140 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Meeting with clients on 57th street this morning‚Ä¶ Stopped for lunch at Morton Williams. Who even knew there‚Äôs such a location as 6 1/2 Avenue? Anyway, plenty of fresh food to choose from. Undecided at first, but, the lasagna soup (I know, it‚Äôs summer, but, I love soup) caught my eye & I just had to have it. Added a sandwich & a bottle of water and headed upstairs in the spacious seating area to enjoy my meal. Free wi-fi too!. Only complaint, was, the ceiling in the bathroom looked like it was going to fall on my head.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Morton Williams Supermarkets is a fantastic place to shop for all your grocery needs. The store is always clean, well-organized, and fully stocked with a wide variety of fresh produce, quality meats, and specialty items. I appreciate their selection of organic and international products, which makes it easy to find unique ingredients for any recipe. The staff is consistently friendly, helpful, and quick to assist with any questions or recommendations. The checkout process is efficient, and the overall shopping experience is smooth and enjoyable. Whether you're doing a big weekly shop or just grabbing a few essentials, Morton Williams is a reliable and convenient choice. Highly recommend!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great supermarket. Good prices on products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went there to buy Clubtails..very hard to find in my..3.99$...and they had all the flavors.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'For a supermarket and cafe in midtown a couple of blocks from Central Park, you can‚Äôt beat this place for quality and price. Go straight to the deli and select a huge sandwich or ask for a custom one like I did, grilled chicken and mozzarella. Only $9 folks, incredible. I took it upstairs and got a big pour glass of wine and while there is no ambience, save your vibe for later. Come here to eat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Gastro Market
address: 235 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, sandwich_shop, bagel_shop, breakfast_restaurant, deli, meal_delivery, food_delivery, bakery, food_store, store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Loved the deli style buffet, fresh, tasty, and full of great options! Great for lunch or dinner. The sandwiches are amazing: warm, crusty, and clearly made with care. Everything was well presented and the place was clean and inviting. A perfect stop for a quick, satisfying meal in the city.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place was actually such a shock and delight. I got a gluten free breakfast burrito!! Gluten free. Breakfast. Burrito. What?! Amazing.
Their breakfast burrito doesn‚Äôt have the standard fillings - it has cold cuts and banana peppers. But it‚Äôs actually really good.  For $12, not bad. And it literally lasted me 3 meals.
The buffet bar is pretty bougee. Looks delicious.
They have a random amount of Korean food. Kimbap and some Korean groceries.
There‚Äôs a small place to sit inside.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The hot bar is the BOOOOMB!!! Delicious food, amazing customer service. Discount with cash.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love love love. I‚Äôm gluten intolerant so to have everything in the buffet clearly marked is so wonderful! And the food is delicious. Great coffee too. Will be coming back a few times I think!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best thing about this place is that it is open 24 hours and that includes the buffet, which is a variety of hot dishes as well as salads and fruit, everything is fresh and clean.

On the downside, it's not like an average supermarket, I didn't find stuff I'd consider "basic" like brie, pretzels, sparkling water, wrapped lemon cake, etc. (they do have Lay's chips which is a favorite of mine but only in small pricey size).

The market seems to specialise in Asian food, and of every item there are countless varieties. Unfortunately as I cannot read the signs, I didn't try any of that.

PS: it would be good if more of the staff could speak English...', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Morton Williams Supermarkets
address: 908 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very Good Super market in Manhattan on 48 Street, Grocery, vegetable, fruits, & so many products available & cafe is also available, & it is open 24 Hours.......', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unfortunately, the prices have gone sky high, but you know we love the people that work there with an exception many of us are in the neighborhood and have made friends there. However, from time to time, I have gotten very bad chicken and therefore have gotten into the habit of puncturing the cellophane to smell it. Last month a butcher I don‚Äôt know yelled at me for doing it and I told her I didn‚Äôt want to get stuck with bad chicken when I got home and sure enough the chicken was bad well this week I bought chicken again and I didn‚Äôt puncture the cellophane because I didn‚Äôt feel like being yelled at and sure enough it was bad chicken and I was too tired to go back. A very famous chef of mine who is now retired told me today he got stuck last week as well with bad chicken so it‚Äôs not my imagination and the attitude of the butcher is there even if you do return it they‚Äôre very arrogant unfortunately otherwise all the department in that store I love lovely people and I really love going there. Unfortunately the chef will never return so you lost a customer there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Staying at the Barclay Intercontinental, we wanted to get some fruits, nuts, water etc. and wanted to visit aa real supermarket. We found one 2 blocks away Morton Williams which was really well stocked with everything we needed and more. Easy to find everything and very friendly staff. We loaded up and will return when we visit NYC again in that area. Highly recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I just needed a cucumber, but they were all semi rotting. Looked for protein, but no luck. Nicely organized nonetheless. A lady at the front cash was counting money and I asked if her cash was open, but she just ignored me. Probably the most insulting thing a person in a retail store can do and I'll never go back here. Apparently, counting money is more important than basic customer service. Was not impressed at all.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fabulously displayed fruits and veggies supermarket, you can find anything you need in here, the shop floor staff super friendly and helpful', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The Food Emporium
address: 810 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews:
[{'text': 'Thank you Food Emporium NYC!!! $50 Cake that was ready in one day- that absolutely stunned my partner and his friends on his birthday! Everyone said the cake looked amazing and it tasted great!!! Special thank you to Mildred and the bakery! I live local and they will now be my go-to for special occasion cakes!

P.s. (added some decor of my own from home)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'More than $18 purchase pictured below. Apples non-organic. Strawberries partially rotten. Other customer waiting at check out showed middle finger for no reason - there was no issue at check out.

As rip-off and low class as it gets.

UPDATE LATE OCTOBER 2025, ORIGINAL REVIEW EARLY SEPTEMBER:
Blueberries now $16.99 (see additional photo)

Fyi: got the "cheap" blueberries, not the ones pictured in the separate photo.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I like Food Emporium, the variety of items are great. We went looking for kiwi üçá  but they didn't have.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Food Emporium
810 8th Ave.
New York, NY 10019

The outer skin was crisp, but kind of shriveled.  But, do not be deceived because but it tastes a lot better than it looks.

#RotisserieChicken #tisserie #chicken #foodemporium', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome selection of grab-and-good fresh food options, including sushi, chicken, sandwiches, salads, wraps, many more.
