The beer selection is also impressive of NY selections.

I did not explore the grocery store, but it looked really good. Looks like an excellent spot for locals as well as tourists.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Macy's
address: 151 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA
types: department_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'üòéI still tell my kids and grandkids that I am only 32 but I have known this store for over 40 years. Great place to shop. This is the Macy‚Äôs flagship department store. For a longtime, this was the largest department store in the world. Maybe it‚Äôs still is. You can almost find everything in this iconic store. The store is so big, you can spend the entire day here. Make sure you have a lot of money but you also have great prices and bargains. Only in New York City !', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The Christmas Market/Village/Square in the lower floor does not resonate well with the kind of Christmas market in Europe. It needs greater details in the decorations and stylistic interpretation perhaps a new translation to a Yankee Christmas is essential in the busiest time of the year.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Macy‚Äôs is a great place to shop, with brands for every budget‚Äîfrom quite affordable options to more premium labels. The building itself is beautiful and full of character, making the visit feel much more special than a regular department store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Christmas season is probably the best time to visit this place. It‚Äôs just so festive and the shopping discounts are really good. Make sure to add this in your diary when you‚Äôre visiting NY around Christmas.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Iconic department store with charm and vast selection, but slightly tricky to navigate.

Macy‚Äôs Herald Square offers a huge variety of products across 9 floors, from clothing and shoes to home goods. The old wood escalators add a charming, nostalgic feel to the shopping experience.

One downside is that the floor layout is inconsistent ‚Äî men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs sections don‚Äôt follow the same pattern, i.e. men and women shoes are on different floors, which can be confusing. Staff are generally helpful, but navigating the store requires patience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Apple Fifth Avenue
address: 767 5th Ave, New York, NY 10153, USA
types: electronics_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Magnificent store. Just like the product the store is also world class. Located in the most iconic place in NY city. The all glass architecture is an excellent work item. Array of products are also great. The sales team is awesome. And always willing to help.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best example of the Worst Customer service in the world!!
Apple,  get ur employees trained properly, i have never experienced this attitude from Apple staff anywhere around the world.. & this is your famous Apple 5th avenue store?!? üò≥
Behaviour of staff, i am picking up my new phone i get just get -‚ÄúHere u go!‚Äù !??
i asked whats happening with my trade in, they sent me to another person who idk how he ended up being senior in this store‚Ä¶.So rude & not using appropriate tone of voice or choice of words towards every customer who was waiting‚Ä¶
The only person who was helpful was the lady who took over to make my trade it process‚Ä¶at least she had patience with all of us who were doing data transfer‚Ä¶.
And i can‚Äôt get in touch with ur online customer support. You still owe me 100$ for the mistake that your support staff did with my online purchase‚Ä¶
I did not get my refund completely‚Ä¶. What‚Äôs happening here?', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We were walking near Central Park on a warm day and didn‚Äôt plan to stop‚Ä¶ but how could we resist the stunning glass cube that marks the entrance to this Apple store? üòç It looked so cool (literally and figuratively!) ‚Äî like a little oasis in the middle of the city. We stepped inside, walked down the beautiful spiral staircase, and suddenly we were in a buzzing world of Apple.

Even though we already own plenty of Apple devices, we just wanted to enjoy the vibe ‚Äî and it was worth it! The store is huge, bright, and full of energy. üîã So many people were browsing, buying, exploring. Several team members approached us kindly, and I‚Äôm sure anyone seriously looking to purchase something would get help quickly. They‚Äôre fast and attentive. ‚úÖ

It‚Äôs a great spot to cool down, explore the latest tech, and even take a little break ‚Äî yes, they do have clean public restrooms, which is a plus in NYC! üöªüòâ

Definitely recommend stopping by ‚Äî even just for the experience.
RECOMMENDED üíØ (Personally mine)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'An art piece masquerading as an Apple store. This flagship location is a testament to the extraordinary lengths Apple goes to create the ultimate premium feel from their products to their stores. Walking down the spiral staircase, you can see the expansive underground vault of tables and displays of the newest Apple product. Amidst all the electronics are nature, plenty of trees and greenery surround the store with a light refreshing ambiance. This greenery looks all well maintained and is calming to see. There is a large seating area to rest and free charging from magsafe pads. Plenty of staff to balance the huge flow of visitors and buyers here getting their new products set up or asking questions about their next purchase.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you buy your new iPhone here, you‚Äôre in the perfect spot to test out the camera right away. The store is located right next to Central Park ‚Äî an amazing place for nature photography ‚Äî and just steps away from some of the city‚Äôs most iconic buildings with stunning architecture that‚Äôs well worth capturing.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: FAO Schwarz
address: 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10111, USA
types: gift_shop, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Can‚Äôt say enough about this experience. My son had demo encounters by 4 different staff members. Andrew was so much fun! This man LOVES his job and is truly working in his purpose of adding happiness to the minds of small children. We saw the famous keyboard and soooooo much more. You have to go for yourself. My son loved it. The staff are excellent! This was a great experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love FAO since I saw Home Alone 2. Luckily I was able to go to the original this one is pretty fun still! We specifically went for the jelly cat Cafe! Every staff member we encountered was kind, there‚Äôs a lot of interactive displays, options to completely customize toys, and so many cool toys. Definitely worth the stop if you‚Äôre in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This has been the best toy store I‚Äôve been to for Jelly Cats! So happy to stop by and get exclusive NY editions for the little ones. They have a wide selection of other toys as well!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: UNIQLO 5th Avenue
address: 660 5th Ave, New York, NY 10103, USA
types: clothing_store, coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is a Great Store!!! Great products & Great team!!! Five 5 stars!!! Casual clothes for Men, Women and kids. A definite must-visit location - a large store with a wide range of good quality affordable selections and fully automated self check out technology - no individual scanning required. Highly recommend for anyone looking for stylish and reliable wardrobe!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Flagship store with multiple floors of clothing from different collabs, different styles, and different clothing types. There is also a coffee shop inside too but much of the seating area is occupied so you‚Äôll have to find seating in other areas. Plenty of trendy options and lots of clothing to mix and match. The interior is bright and well lit with lots of mannequins wearing tasteful outfits. Staff are available everywhere for your assistance.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'My wife loves to shop for both of us at Uniqlo.  The store is always packed full of people and the shelves and sacks are overflowing with trendy merchandise.  And there are always lots of items on sale.  They used to have a few seats at the top of the escalators for bored husbands to sit while their wives are happily shopping.  But today I found that most of the seats have been removed and replaced by racks of clothes.  Too bad. They need to put the seats back.
Stopped in again today so my wife could do some shopping.  Happy to see the store restored some seating for non shopping spouses.  Thank you.

Back again for my wife to shop more. This time I went to the second floor where they now have a coffee stand. I bought a house coffee, very tasty, and sat on one of the round seating areas.  Very comfortable place to wait.  Thank you Uniqlo!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A definite must-visit location - a large store with a wide range of good quality affordable selections! I got my best thermal wear from Uniqlo and always pop in for one item and leave with a bunch. What I can‚Äôt get over is the fully automated self check out technology - no individual scanning required.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very big which was amazing, they also got a cafe. Also a lot of different pieces, but of course not the best quality, since it‚Äôs fairly cheap. In my opinion also not very fashionable clothing, more like H&M style, but the basics are great.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Harry Potter Shop New York
address: 935 Broadway, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'This is an awesome experience, highly recommend to the Harry Potter lovers of the world. Grab a butter beer and walk around the store browsing all the cool things from Potter land! Bathrooms downstairs if you need them too.\n\nWish you could get the butter beer in a regular cup instead- or even refill. The ones you can buy don‚Äôt taste quite as good as the one they serve.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Potterhead cannot miss this place when visitng New York. I was amazed with everything in there. All the merchs look so cute, I wanted to buy everything actually. I also like the cafe area which they have butterbeer, cakes, cookies. They also have mug washing area to take back home. They have everything like keychains, magnets, clothes, pins, snacks, stationeries, and more. I just knew that they have amazing decorated restrooms down stair, so, check it out.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The store is spacious and offers a wide variety of products. This place is simply magical. You can find everything from Bertie Bott‚Äôs Every Flavour Beans to an actual wand. You can relax with a Butterbeer or let your shopping spree run wild. If you are a Harry Potter fan, you NEED to visit here!  This was such a cool experience. Lots of cool decor and real props from the movies are displayed throughout the store. The prices might be a bit high, but you‚Äôre not just buying merchandise you‚Äôre buying the experience itself.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Are you kidding me?! How was that show possible?! Mind BLOWING!!! The cast is so amazing, we went last night 11/6/25 and it was everything I dreamed broadway would be. As an OG HP fan I loved every second of it and can‚Äôt wait to see it again because it‚Äôs worth it!! Oh and the theater decor is stunning!!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Truly an amazing store! Kinda pricey, but loved all the merch and stunning decor. Definitely worth the trip if you don't buy anything - no cost to enter to experience two floors of Harry Potter goodness.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Saks Fifth Avenue
address: 611 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, jewelry_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Visited Saks 5th Ave to put my noise on a few new scents. Michael & another sales associate were super helpful at the Creed counter. I only travel with my 1 carry on and personal item when I fly, so I couldn‚Äôt buy a big bottle; though I was able to get a small flask and they were kind enough to not only fill my atomizer with the scent I really enjoyed but they have me a few samples as well. If you have a budget on splurge on fragrance and want top tier service, don‚Äôt hesitate to stop by the Creed counter. You‚Äôll be in good hands.

Unika B. & Co.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '‚Ä¢ Chanel at Saks Fifth Avenue Review

I may have blown into Saks on my last NY trip looking more ‚Äúpost-tornado Dorothy‚Äù than fashion icon (New York humidity is a ‚Äúwicked Witch‚Äù on its own‚Ä¶) but the Chanel peeps didn‚Äôt bat a lash.

Shannen D. Was my ‚ÄúGlinda‚Äù of the day, she was patient, gracious & unbothered.  She helped me find the perfect pair of new Chanel sunnies.

Then appeared the ‚ÄúWizard of Accessories‚Äù himself ‚Äî a kind gentleman who whisked my  new sunglasses behind a secret door & returned them with the perfect fit!  Magically adjusted, no smoke or mirrors, just perfect.

No flying monkeys, just warm smiles & excellent service.  (The next time I need ruby slippers, I know exactly where to look‚Ä¶)  I will definitely return on my next trip, this shopping afternoon was dreamy‚Ä¶ üíñ

#ChanelSunnies üòé
#Saks5thAveStyle üóΩ
#NYCLuxuryShopping üõçÔ∏è
#ChanelChic ‚≠êÔ∏è
#FifthAveFashionista üíÉ
#Siggie_E üíã', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Hands down the best Saks that I've ever visited. Friendly and personable professionals in the store. Incredibly clean and tidy considering the significant amount of foot traffic that comes through daily. When visiting the Chanel fragrance section (2nd floor), I was greeted and assisted by the most pleasant and customer centric person I've ever encountered - Maria. While I enjoy fragrances immensely and have a fairly extensive collection, my interaction with Maria was about 95% of why I chose to make a purchase today (Bleu de Chanel Parfum). She was such a joy to work with, extremely knowledgeable about the products, and provided information prompting you to think before purchasing. She doesn't sell but rather helps you buy - I admire this characteristic in a retail professional. Whenever I'm in town again I will visit this store and likely buy again solely because of Maria!

Thank you for the wonderful experience today, Maria! You're a value add to the company for certain; I, as well as "they," need more people like you in the business!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beautiful store and great experience at Saks! ‚ú® We bought a Vilhelm Parfumerie fragrance and absolutely loved it. Highly recommend! üåü', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "My husband and I were pre-holiday perfume shopping in NYC so of course we went to Saks Fifth Ave. There's an entire floor just for perfume at Saks, and it's wonderful. We were so please to meet Etta at what has to be the niche fragrance center of the world. She manages the artisan corner of niche perfumes, including Xerjoff  Maison Crivelli, Matiere Vilhelm Parfumerie and many others. She was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. We definitely look forward to working with her in the future.  #itsbetterwithetta #europerfumes.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The LEGO¬Æ Store Fifth Avenue
address: 636 5th Ave, New York, NY 10020, USA
types: store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The LEGO Store on 5th Ave in New York is not just a store, it‚Äôs a full-on experience. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by massive LEGO sculptures that are genuinely jaw-dropping. There‚Äôs a huge rainbow ‚Äútree‚Äù in the center with little scenes hidden inside it (we loved the squirrel and the tiny LEGO world tucked into a little window). It feels like stepping into a life-sized LEGO fantasy world.

The attention to detail in these builds is incredible. They‚Äôve got a giant Hulk you can sit next to, a LEGO Statue of Liberty with a friendly face, and characters and scenes tucked into every corner. Even if you‚Äôre not a kid, it‚Äôs impossible not to smile.

The store layout is fun to explore, and the staff were friendly and patient even with how busy it gets. There‚Äôs a wide range of sets for all ages and interests, plus build-your-own mini-figures if you want something personalized.

It is crowded (it‚Äôs 5th Ave‚Ä¶), but honestly it just adds to the energy. It feels like everyone there is excited and having fun.

Whether you‚Äôre a LEGO fan or just looking for something magical to experience in NYC, this place is absolutely worth stopping in.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An absolute must-visit! The LEGO Store on 5th Avenue is incredible ‚Äì from the huge, detailed LEGO sculptures to the massive selection of sets for all ages. The atmosphere is fun and inspiring, and the staff are super friendly and helpful. It feels like stepping into a world of creativity. Whether you're a lifelong LEGO fan or just curious, this place will amaze you. A true highlight of New York City!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '"We took our kids to the LEGO Store near Rockefeller Center and it was an absolute blast! The store was a treasure trove of creativity and imagination, with towering LEGO displays and interactive exhibits. The kids were completely enthralled by the vast array of LEGO sets and minifigures on display.

The staff were super friendly and helpful, and the kids loved building their own creations at the play areas. We also got to see the iconic NYC skyline made out of LEGO bricks, which was amazing. The store was super kid-friendly, and we appreciated the variety of LEGO themes and products available.

If you're looking for a fun and interactive experience for kids (or adults!) who love LEGO, this store is a must-visit. We can't wait to come back and explore again!"', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An absolute Lego lovers dream! I was in paradise! I got lucky when I walked in and saw that they had Toothless in stock since it wasn't online! Employees are super nice and the store decently busy! Will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'LEGO Store Fifth Avenue ‚Äî ‚Äúa cathedral made of bricks and childhood nostalgia.‚Äù

You don‚Äôt enter this place ‚Äî you ascend into it. Two floors of architectural self-confidence, glowing bricks, and that very specific LEGO-plastic scent that immediately time-travels you to age 8.

The first thing that hits you is the taxi ‚Äî a life-sized New York yellow cab made entirely out of LEGO bricks. It‚Äôs the kind of thing that makes grown adults stop mid-sentence and whisper ‚Äúokay, that‚Äôs insane.‚Äù

Staff here are borderline too nice ‚Äî they greet you with the kind of cheerful energy usually reserved for theme park employees or people who‚Äôve just discovered coffee. They actually know the sets, and will casually point you to the UCS Millennium Falcon like it‚Äôs a bag of chips.

Upstairs is where it gets surreal: you can design your own minifigure, print it, and suddenly realize you‚Äôve paid $12 for a tiny plastic version of yourself holding a coffee mug ‚Äî and it was worth every cent.

There‚Äôs an interactive digital lab where your builds come alive on screens, a Pick & Build wall that feels like LEGO sushi-train, and enough visual chaos to keep your inner child screaming for an hour.

Yes, it‚Äôs crowded. Yes, the tourists will photobomb you mid-selfie with a LEGO taxi. But that‚Äôs New York ‚Äî and honestly, if you can‚Äôt handle a crowd at a LEGO cathedral on Fifth Avenue, that‚Äôs on you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: M&M'S New York
address: 1600 Broadway, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: candy_store, chocolate_shop, tourist_attraction, dessert_shop, confectionery, gift_shop, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Great experience overall! Staff were very kind and helpful, and the store is colorful and fun ‚Äî perfect for photos. I loved the Mood Machine (mine said ‚ÄúCreamy Color‚Äù). But prices are really high ‚Äî personalized M&M‚Äôs start at $20‚Äì$30 and even small souvenirs cost about $10. I‚Äôd recommend this place only if you have some extra money to spend ‚Äî it‚Äôs fun, but definitely expensive.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The store is just amazing. It is so big with so many m&m flavours. They have a cookie crunch flavoured m&m‚Äôs and don‚Äôt miss it out because it was soooo good. They also have merchandise here. I love the store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'M&M‚Äôs at 1600 Broadway is a playful, visually stunning destination‚Äîperfect for indulging in a whimsical chocolate wonderland. It‚Äôs compact, colorful, and brings nostalgic joy. name: Target

reviews: [{'text': 'TARGET Expect more pay less. But if you're a Target fan, why not. Although smaller scale, this store still provides the basic needs and quality from the employees you would expect. name: Nintendo NEW YORK
address: 10 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10020, USA
types: store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I like to come to Nintendo New York every year when my family comes to the city around Christmas time... I was in the city earlier for a different event and this was my best visit yet! The shelves were stocked, it wasn't too crowded, and there was a bunch of new merchandise for the various sections. They like to move the Amiibo around a lot, but their selection stays the same if that's what you're looking for. They added a huge section of Pikmin stuff, which was pretty cool. Checking out, I met a cashier named Omar, and he was super kind and helpful. I bought a couple Legend of Zelda items and he told me some fun facts and made nice conversation over it. I asked for directions and he offered to pull out his phone and help.
All in all, a very nice visit. Will return around Christmas!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lots of fun for those who love Nintendo products! And for those not familiar with Nintendo. They had plenty of Switch 2s to try out with their TVs. 2 stories of merchandise. Kind and helpful staff. Clean store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'For Nintendo fans, this place is a true paradise. You can explore the latest consoles on the main floor and take a nostalgic trip upstairs where the history of Nintendo comes alive with smiles from the past. The staff are friendly and attentive, whether you‚Äôre shopping for consoles or picking out some cool apparel. A must-visit for every Nintendo enthusiast!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of my ‚Äúneeded stop-ins‚Äù when I‚Äôm in the city. The store‚Äôs displays are always changing and the inventory is also kept fresh.

There‚Äôs tons to look at. If you have kids, plan to take a while to look at everything (and keep an eye out for hidden details). There are several places for selfies/pictures with Nintendo characters.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'An amazing store for any Nintendo fan! Surprisingly affordable items, and fun decor. Definitely worth a stop!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: B&H Photo Video
address: 420 9th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: electronics_store, home_goods_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Review of B&H Photo and Electronics, New York City

During a recent trip to New York City, I stumbled upon B&H Photo and Electronics while walking back to our hotel after breakfast, and I couldn't be more thrilled! As a longtime fan of their online store, I was excited to explore their massive physical location. The scale of the store was astonishing; it truly felt like a playground for anyone interested in photography and electronics.

One of the coolest features was the overhead rail system that transports orders directly from the stockroom to the sales staff (check out one of the videos I made of the rail system). It was fascinating to watch in action!

My wife, who usually isn't as enthusiastic about these kinds of places, even found herself enjoying the visit, and our son couldn‚Äôt get enough of the driving video games set up throughout the store.

The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, making our surprise stop a delightful experience. Even though we hadn‚Äôt planned on such an impromptu visit, we ended up having a fantastic time exploring.

I highly recommend stopping by B&H Photo and Electronics if you‚Äôre in New York City‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience you won't want to miss!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is great! Second time here and there‚Äôs so much to see! It‚Äôs so fun to look around in and the staff is so knowledgeable. They‚Äôre online store is just as good, and either online or in store if I have any questions, they are always answered.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not only do they have a large assortment of brands and styles, but the staff is really knowledgeable and wants to be helpful. The sales person that worked with me gave me great advice that I tried out the next day and I was so happy. I was thinking of going back just to chat with him lol. Here‚Äôs a photo I took this weekend with my new lens.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'What is essentially a playground for anybody interested in photo and film. The staff are courteous and very knowledgeable about the subject at hand. They are patient and let you test equipment, and are eager to teach concepts to you, even if it isn‚Äôt directly related to the sale. I would highly recommend anyone interested in photo and film to check this place out!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Walking into B&H is truly a unique experience. Every aisle feels like stepping into a technological theme park: cameras, lenses, drones, entire studios ready to be tested. The best part is that you can actually touch, try, and feel the power of each piece of equipment.

The staff is incredibly attentive and makes you feel right at home. The used section is full of hidden gems and is always worth checking out. And the logistics? Absolutely fascinating! You get a ticket, pay at the register, and then watch your product arrive on tracks straight from the stockroom to your hands it‚Äôs impossible not to be impressed.

I‚Äôve shopped there before and was always very well taken care of. Besides selling, they also buy used equipment at fair prices, which only adds to the trust and the excitement of coming back.

B&H is not just a store it‚Äôs a must-visit destination for anyone passionate about audiovisual. I simply love being there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target
address: 112 W 34th St., New York, NY 10120, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, child_care_agency, electronics_store, furniture_store, home_improvement_store, home_goods_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "they have a lot of stuff here that is so useful around the home and sometimes they have excellent sale prices

they definitely do not price gouge. remember this is Midtown New York City. it should be very expensive and it's not. for example I bought a spoon for two dollars. this is basically the price of the dollar store except it's in the absolute center of New York City.

they also have a large amount of food including fresh produce which is incredible. i mean i bought a completely fresh pomegranate ($2.69 for a medium-large AND really fresh!) in feb 2025, along with some other produce. they also have a large selection of meats ice cream frozen foods and so much more

absolutely excellent store

the lines are not really that long because they are constantly moving as they have so many self checkouts and active cashiers", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Target 34th Street is a Multi floor store with a variety of different clothing, home, and grocery options. It is definitely one of the bigger Target stores in Midtown Manhattan. The store is positioned close to other popular retailers such as the Macy‚Äôs across the street and near a Subway station which makes it convenient. The area can get quite busy though.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came here a few days ago and I have never seen a store below ground before that was the coolest thing to me! It was like shopping in a big basement. I‚Äôm from Delaware so we don‚Äôt have underground stores but I thought it was gonna be some small little thing but it‚Äôs a full size store down here. I felt like I no clipped and went to the back rooms I got scared for a second. Definitely a good concept though space wise .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Store manager Randy at 34th Street is rude, disrespectful and confrontational. I went this morning to make a return and  buy a few items. I saw that a sheet set was on clearance. I got the register and the sales associate explained it was ringing full price. Then store manager Randy comes and rudely explain it‚Äôs not on clearance. I explained it was the same sheets that had clearance tickets on the floor. He was rude, had poor customer service and dismissive. Then return the sheet set back to the clearance wall. I mentioned that I wanted to return a shower cap that I purchased online since I didn‚Äôt realize that it was open at the top. He said he won‚Äôt because the flowered shower cap has stains. I explained that it was never used. Once again he ignores me and walks off. I will not shop at this store again. Not sure what happened to target customer service but it is very disappointing the treatment I received today.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Exactly what you would expect from a Target - organized layout, massive floors, plenty of range of items, and anything you can think of. It‚Äôs a pretty large outlet here at 34th street, with clothings, daily essentials, homeware, fresh foods and groceries. There‚Äôs also electronic gadgets and an array of toys for kids. Always love how spacious the aisles are and how friendly everyone is towards the customers. Cashier checkout is efficient as well. Lovely convenience and departmental store. They are not too heavy on clothings here so won‚Äôt expect to see big discounts but still worth a visit nonetheless!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Nordstrom NYC Flagship
address: 225 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "It was an awesome visit to this multi-level store. I haven't seen anything like it. This store has 7 floors drdicated to women's fashion and accessories, skincare and makeup, spa and beauty services, dining, and alterations and tailoring on site. It has a bistro and a bar! I've never seen anything like it!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We walked over to west 57th and Broadway for my wife to shop for dress pants.  The store is very bright and huge on multi levels.  Pretty busy today as well.
Fortunately for me, I found a couple of spots on the 4th floor to sit and wait.  Very comfortable as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Not much of a selection women's cocktail dress wise. But otherwise has wide variety beauty products and other items.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Holas. I recently underwent breast explant surgery. It was time for new bras! I was fitted with my implants in Rack Shack in Brooklyn.
Nordstrom is a few blocks away from me and I heard great things about how they fit there. So I decided to try.
Nordstrom is just a beautiful store.
I requested  a fitting. Two friendly humans were available for this process. Both Joanne and Jabria were professional, thorough and focused.
I had no idea I was a 32DDD after surgery.
I purchased two Fantasie Demure bras,  beige and black.
The entire shopping experience was very positive upon entry of the store, during the fitting, purchase, browsing the shoe department and my exit.
This was an excellent shopping and fitting experience.
As a transgender woman of color who is a midtown West diva, I was serviced beautifully. I will return and ask for both of these folks for future lingerie needs.
I highly recommend.
Thank you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I looove this store!  Since I live so close I always find what I need and don‚Äôt have to go Bergdorf or Saks anymore. Everything is easy to find, unlike Saks after their renovation.

The customer service is always outstanding.

It‚Äôs always good to have your personal shopper/associate which is Warren B  who‚Äôs is a manager in men‚Äôs shoes.   If there is something I need and can‚Äôt stop into the store he will get it for me and send it.   I‚Äôve been working with him for a while and just realized that I never reviewed my favorite store and Sales Associate!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1095 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'From a traveler‚Äôs perspective, am just excited to revisit Whole Foods again. Same vibe with higher price tags. First floor sells grab&go foods and second floor sells hot meals. The sprits section can be better but won‚Äôt complain.

There are a lot of security guards near the entrance area. Overall a nice place to have in the middle of Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When I‚Äôm in the city I go to whole foods for my needs, I love their butchery counter that has very fresh meat. The vegetables are amazing as well, the hot bar has a wide variety of food though I wish they would change it up sometimes.

When you buy flowers from here they can make you a pretty bouquet üíê free of charge. Prime members get good deals throughout the store.

The only aggravating thing is that customer service desk that‚Äôs supposed to serve as a till never is open or available. They always just send you to the regular checkout counter. I was buying flowers the other day and they refused to let me pay for them there which is closer to the florist department. Whole Foods can make this process more efficient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 6th Avenue is a great place for grocery shopping, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables that are always well-stocked and of high quality. Prices are reasonable for the freshness and quality you get, and the store is clean, organized, and easy to navigate, making the shopping experience enjoyable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The food bar is so fresh and there‚Äôs a lot of variety. Definitely a good choice for healthy lunch, and the top floor seating has a great view
However, there is some cons.

Bathroom line is very full because of the location. Checkout can also be a hassle during busy hours because of the lack of employees, at least during the times I went.

But overall a great place to get food and buy a few grocery items. Just needs organizing the people traffic especially during busy hours.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôm truly surprised at their inability to replenish their stocks. Are we already facing a supply crisis? For the last three days they haven‚Äôt replenished their stocks. I have been going daily to buy a chocolate cereal but it‚Äôs not there. In fact, every day the shelves get more and more empty without being replenished. It‚Äôs truly pathetic that in the middle of one of the most busiest commercial and tourist spots in the country, we have such shortages.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly - Flatiron
address: 200 5th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, cafe, market, gift_shop, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "A local friend recommended that I had to walk through the market before I leave and she was spot on. Can't wait to find a complimentary recipe to make them.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I give Amalfi by Serra in Eataly, NYC a 3 stars. I had ravioli which was good but not exceptional. name: Trader Joe's
address: 675 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Artistic balloons, face painting for memorable birthdays and events @thecolorcrew_nyc and thecolorcrew-nyc Artistic and reliable party entertainment. I love the unique and detailed face painting- the kids were enchanted. The balloons were ridiculously elaborate- crowned, super hero‚Äôs, botanical and princesses. Well worth the price for entertainment as guests were absorbed watching the Color Crew make the magic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was never a big Trader Joe‚Äôs fan. I always thought that their things were kind of too generic. I was dead wrong. This particular store on 6th and 21st changed my view. After trying many different things from here over time, I‚Äôm all in! I really like this place. Although this one is a very small store, it‚Äôs got a lot of great things at decent prices. The produce section is pretty good, as to is the frozen foods and meat departments. The bread area is great, with lots of interesting things.

Expect a very long checkout line most of the time, but it moves quickly. The staff is very friendly and the place is nice and clean. What‚Äôs not to like when you combine that with pretty good prices and selection? This place is a winner. Check it out if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I just love Trader Joe‚Äôs. There‚Äôs always something seasonal to buy. Look at these Fall leaf shaped and coloured corn tortilla chips for example!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Trader Joe‚Äôs in Chelsea is a great spot for affordable, quality groceries in Manhattan. The selection of private-label products, snacks, and fresh items is excellent, and the staff is friendly and helpful even during busy hours.

The store does get very crowded, especially in the afternoons and on weekends, with narrow aisles and long checkout lines. Visiting early in the morning makes for a much more relaxed shopping experience.

Overall, a solid Trader Joe‚Äôs with fair prices and good quality, just not ideal if you‚Äôre in a hurry.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Finally managed to visit one of their outlets, albeit a smaller one along 6th Avenue. Fruits, flowers, vegetables and cheese selections were incredible, looked so super fresh and at reasonable discounts/prices. The queue moves efficiently here and it‚Äôs relatively easy to identify and locate items across the store. All the staff are incredibly nice and friendly. Great place to shop for all your essential items, dailies, household, perishables and more.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Nike House of Innovation NYC

name: T.J. Maxx
address: 250 W 57th St, New York, NY 10107, USA
types: department_store, jewelry_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Lots of cute stuff!! This specific location has many different items to choose from in all the sections. Would recommend this specific location for bags, clothes, and home decor. The line goes by really fast at this location. This specific store is in busy area since it‚Äôs close to 59th so be aware that there will be a lot of people in the store. Overall, the items I saw for spring time were really cute!! Be sure to check out the upstairs for some cool home decor!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great store, just make sure to set aside time to look around. The shoe selection might be the weakest, but the clothing, bags, and home items are excellent.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Good TJ Maxx store on the 8th avenue & 57th Street. It's a multi store with escalators and an elevator to go up/down. The restrooms are on the 3rd floor. Well stocked. Good prices.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When our tropical Bermuda cruise was diverted to Nova Scotia with 66¬∞ weather,  TJ Maxx to the rescue!\nWe were able to get swear pants and hoodies for a reasonable price', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The employees were less than helpfully, down right obnoxious most of them. It was mad crazy packed full of shoppers who didn't make this anymore memorable. Its a small store with not alot of merchandise and an can barely hold the volume of people that bumrush that place.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Best Buy
address: 531 5th Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: electronics_store, home_goods_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Jose from the Geek Squad was truly wonderful to interact with. Not only did he assist me with my issue, but he also went out of his way to ensure my needs were fully met. The other customer sitting beside me also expressed heartfelt appreciation for Jose‚Äôs kindness and willingness to help. His genuine care made my entire visit to the store feel genuinely worthwhile. Highly recommend this store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The 5th Avenue store is a great Best Buy location with a total of 4 floors containing a wide selection of technology and home appliances. The staff are friendly and each floor feels clean and well organised. The store does not feel crowded and there are also customer restrooms on the lower level which are mostly clean and well maintained. Not significantly different from other Best Buy locations in the city.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I bought a "GoPro HERO13" action camera at this BEST BUY location,

I made a online order for "Store Pickup", I'am happy with my NEW "GoPro HERO13" action camera,

My online shopping & store pickup expierence was great.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very helpful stuff. Teo helped me a lot and was always willing to answer any of my questions and even asked a nice lady to help with cards and billing tips. Great humour and vibes as well. Totally recommended!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The store has a wide selection of electronics and household items, and the location is convenient in Midtown. Staff were friendly, but the service felt a bit rushed and it took some time to find someone who could really help with technical questions. Prices are okay, but not always the best compared to other options in the city or online. Overall, a decent place for quick purchases, but not perfect if you need detailed advice or the absolute best deals.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 675 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Artistic balloons, face painting for memorable birthdays and events @thecolorcrew_nyc and thecolorcrew-nyc Artistic and reliable party entertainment. I love the unique and detailed face painting- the kids were enchanted. The balloons were ridiculously elaborate- crowned, super hero‚Äôs, botanical and princesses. Well worth the price for entertainment as guests were absorbed watching the Color Crew make the magic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was never a big Trader Joe‚Äôs fan. I always thought that their things were kind of too generic. I was dead wrong. This particular store on 6th and 21st changed my view. After trying many different things from here over time, I‚Äôm all in! I really like this place. Although this one is a very small store, it‚Äôs got a lot of great things at decent prices. The produce section is pretty good, as to is the frozen foods and meat departments. The bread area is great, with lots of interesting things.

Expect a very long checkout line most of the time, but it moves quickly. The staff is very friendly and the place is nice and clean. What‚Äôs not to like when you combine that with pretty good prices and selection? This place is a winner. Check it out if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I just love Trader Joe‚Äôs. There‚Äôs always something seasonal to buy. Look at these Fall leaf shaped and coloured corn tortilla chips for example!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Trader Joe‚Äôs in Chelsea is a great spot for affordable, quality groceries in Manhattan. The selection of private-label products, snacks, and fresh items is excellent, and the staff is friendly and helpful even during busy hours.

The store does get very crowded, especially in the afternoons and on weekends, with narrow aisles and long checkout lines. Visiting early in the morning makes for a much more relaxed shopping experience.

Overall, a solid Trader Joe‚Äôs with fair prices and good quality, just not ideal if you‚Äôre in a hurry.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Finally managed to visit one of their outlets, albeit a smaller one along 6th Avenue. Fruits, flowers, vegetables and cheese selections were incredible, looked so super fresh and at reasonable discounts/prices. The queue moves efficiently here and it‚Äôs relatively easy to identify and locate items across the store. All the staff are incredibly nice and friendly. Great place to shop for all your essential items, dailies, household, perishables and more.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 233 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I absolutely love shopping at Trader Joe's. Always spacious and clean, and always enough cashiers.  I love the variety of frozen foods that you wouldn't usually see at a regular supermarket, and their prices are affordable too. TraderJoe's meals are easy to prepare, especially when you come in from a long day and don't know what's for dinner.  Could never just go for a couple things, I end up needing 3 pairs of hands because I get 2 of everything ü§¶üèæ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è I love shopping at Trader Joe's.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As a trainer working with Woody, a middle-aged, overweight Catahoula Pit mix, I've been on the lookout for high-value reinforcements that truly motivate him. The Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips have been a fantastic find in our training regimen.
Woody absolutely goes wild for these! The "Beef Recipe" seems to be a huge hit, making them incredibly effective for reinforcing positive behaviors, especially given that he's a middle-aged dog we're working on getting back to a healthy weight. Alongside bananas, which he also enjoys, these jerky strips provide a powerful incentive without adding too many extra calories when used strategically.
One of my main priorities with Woody, especially as an overweight dog, is managing his energy levels and ensuring he stays cool during our sessions. The compact size of these jerky strips means I can break them into smaller pieces for frequent rewards without overfeeding, which is crucial for calorie control. Plus, they're easy to carry and don't get messy, making them perfect for outdoor training sessions where keeping Woody comfortable and cool is paramount.
Overall, I highly recommend Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips for anyone looking for a high-value, palatable treat for their dog, especially for those working with an overweight or middle-aged dog like Woody. They've been an excellent addition to our training toolkit, helping us make significant progress while keeping him motivated and happy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An incredible place to go shopping for groceries.

I was particularly impressed with their affordable organic options and the wide range of flavors that you won't find in your typical grocery store.

Whether it's their delicious frozen meals, fresh produce, or quirky snacks, there's always something exciting to discover at Trader Joe's.

Plus, the layout and organization of the store made it easy to find everything I needed.

Their private-label products and friendly staff exceeded my expectations, which keeps me coming back for more.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love this location of Trader Joe‚Äôs ! Its my favorite and I‚Äôm always greeted and helped by the friendly staff ‚Ä¶Xavier especially, he‚Äôs one of those exceptional employees who smile is warm and inviting always eager to help me when I shop or need to see if my favorite snacks are in stock . MY FAVORITE STORE !!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love the staff of Trader Joe‚Äôs. Extremely friendly and helpful. I‚Äôm looking for something that has zero stocks, the staff who is senior already go the extra mile to help me look in the stockroom and find the item for me since I can‚Äôt go back anymore.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Wegmans
address: 770 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is an incredible grocery store if you‚Äôre looking for high quality produce, packaged snacks, and prepared foods. They make sushi, Asian bowls, cakes, breads, and cookies.

You can easily get lost here wandering the aisles.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Omg I love this place. I discovered wegmans back in 2012 when I lived in Syracuse. I brought the lobster salad which I give. 5/10 when I opened it but 10/10 as leftovers. The winner was the chocolate dome petit. For 8 dollars it was so worth it. I‚Äôm not a pastry eater but I had this and now I want to buy it again. The cake was soft and the moose was delicious. Will be back soon. No pics of the lobster salad because it‚Äôs gone lol but pic of the cake .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The interior design is astounding, it looks very not New York, looks a bit Southern and Midwestern.

Price is not as bad as Whole food.

Has many cook food station for you to order.

Not too bad for a first impression of Wegman in NYC.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very large supermarket with all the basics with a very good selection of Asian items, seafood and fresh meals/hot/cold food compared to other large supermarkets like Fairway or Wholefoods. Prices are quite decent and definitely recommend.

They have some of the best prices for ice cream pints of which they have a large selection. It does not feel as upscale as whole foods and the price difference reflects it, but the quality is still very good and comparable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love this store. Wonderful selection of foods and the staff here are amazing. More specifically the sandwiches and salads. I had a salad that was hand crafted and OUT OF THIS WORLD. Angela who works in this department was very kind and helped me choose a sandwich that was made fresh and was quite tasty and definitely worth the price as well. Truly a great go to for grabbing food on the go- highly recommend. Super clean and organized.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 95 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I stopped into Whole Foods looking for something healthy to eat they have such a wide selection of fresh and healthy options. At first, I was leaning toward a salad, but then I saw the pizza and decided to give it a try since I love pizza, and honestly in New York you can‚Äôt really go wrong with it.

I grabbed a slice and it was pretty good cheesy, flavorful, and satisfying. It‚Äôs not your typical greasy slice; it had a fresher taste, and I liked the balance of toppings. Definitely a decent option when you‚Äôre hungry and want something quick.

What‚Äôs also nice is that Whole Foods has seating upstairs, so you can enjoy your food right there after shopping. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend trying their pizza. You can buy it by the slice or get a whole pie, and for a grocery store, it‚Äôs surprisingly solid.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Couldn‚Äôt spend 5 mins in this store before being followed. Once I complained one of the security guards/employees began to give his unsolicited input and the verbally assaulted me, saying ‚ÄúI need a man to calm me down‚Äù . This is the type of employees this store hires for customer service positions. He worried about me when he should be worried about working to afford a haircut.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very spacious and clean store with a wide variety of fresh food and baked goods. I highly recommend the sushi rolls,they‚Äôre always fresh and really tasty. In the sushi section, you can grab chopsticks and extra soy sauce, so don‚Äôt forget to take them before you leave. You can enjoy your food upstairs in their dining area, where there‚Äôs a nice view from the window. It‚Äôs also a great option if you want to take your food to go. Friendly staff and a relaxed, pleasant atmosphere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I shop here for the vegan and organic options that are hard to find elsewhere. This is my neighborhood Whole Foods and it‚Äôs really disappointing to see how little they care about keeping the water fountains and bathrooms maintained and usable. Especially with the need for water this time of year. They just got a new fountain with a water bottle filler, but within the first couple days the filter status had a red light. They fixed that after about a week. But now, for several weeks, the water bottle filler has only been working very very slowly. It takes about 5-10x longer to fill a bottle than normal depending on the size, and I always feel rude because there‚Äôs always someone behind me waiting to fill theirs. Oh and the amount of bottles it says has been saved is going up normally so it thinks it‚Äôs dispensing more water than it is. The last time I used it it never stopped when I took the bottle away.
The part where you sip from stopped working at all a couple weeks ago. The water coming out has no pressure so it just goes down.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Here I am, blissfully scanning my groceries. To my surprise a woman that works at whole foods start screaming in my ear about something not scanning. I'm trying to explain to her that I lost my voice but I am doing separate transactions and will be using another card for the rest of my groceries. She's ignores me and keeps repeating something didn't scan, mind you I'm tryna scan the rest of my items but she is blocking the scanner and hovering over me. Girl, relax. She finally moves so I can finish scanning. She's hootin and hollering to her coworkers about me. I promise you it's not that serious. There was no need for her blood pressure to be raised, I KNOW you ain't getting paid enough for all that. And SHE WAS COMPLETELY IN THE WRONG. I come to this whole foods all the time and have done separate transactions a handful of times without incident. Again, relax. It's too early and you're doing far far too much", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 63 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have never really shopped in Whole Foods until I started to come to return my Amazon purchases. I decided to try out their croissants and then I saw they had sourdough bread. I tried both and I fell in love! I started to try their organic fruits, veggie salads, and just recently I finally bought food to go. I really liked their juicy rosemary chicken breast and their mozzarella creamy pasta. I also got my bf dark chocolate almonds and he liked them too! I honestly wish there were at least 2 Whole Foods in every borough so then customers wouldn‚Äôt have to travel to another borough! In the mean time I will just continue to shop in Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Let‚Äôs see the only thing I‚Äôm not rooting for at this location is the pricing for hot food and to me it‚Äôs a total ripoff system they have with this scale you place the food on . Now the mac and cheese is a 8. The soups are a 7 the  sides are and 8 overall you will not go wrong as far as taste is concerned . Myb once I tired the food and it seemed tasteless but overall I ate there with cash money by accident multiple times cuz it‚Äôs no reason I should pay that much in a supermarket for food even if I was a billionaire by choice cuz now I‚Äôm saving my money . If I can change the cheap box‚Äôs  and sizes for the food as well as prices would be my favorite store . Those chefs works hard . Now the supermarket always clean and busy . I would sit and eat and hope that adjustments are made cuz that was June 28 I realized this but everyone is diff I just feel the food buffet style as suggested and one day it did make me happy eating it', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "While convenient and nicely situated, this Whole Foods doesn't give you the full stack of offerings you're used to from Whole Foods and it seems understocked. It's almost uninspiring to shop there, despite the pretty all-glass building.  Also, not sure what's going on with the roasted chicken that goes missing, since sometimes you can't even find any to buy... and the hot bar is more like a mess. The quality has definitely gone down ever since Amazon bought Whole Foods. It's a shame really, but that's the tea, I guess.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Nice, clean, with decent selection, standard for whole foods. One other nice aspect about this location is that I have never had to wait in check out lines for more than 2-3 minutes; in fact majority of the time I don't have to wait at all", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '3rd time visiting this Whole Food for weekly supermarket runs. Ample choices, good produce selection, clean and spacious. Cashier service leaves a lot to be desired. If you need help with your groceries prepare not to get it. So, I recommend self checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Tashkent Supermarket Halal Food
address: 378 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "This is a fascinating place that is a feast for the eyes and belly, if you know what you want. My daughter and I went here on my recent trip, but I was having some tooth issues so I didn't buy the delicious looking, honey-coated pistachio butterfly because it looked too crunchy.

I was a little astonished that there was no difference in price between something as expensive looking as a seafood salad with huge shrimp, calamari and more - and common salads. I also deducted a star because I went back with my friend a few days later and was sorely disappointed that they don't set up any of the bar stuff until 9 am. That's perfectly understandable for the hot and cold bar.

But you guys are completely missing the boat for New Yorkers looking to pick up one of your delectable pastries in the morning on the way to work. And I will sadly have to wait until my next visit to NYC to try the pastry that looked so inviting!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I used to ‚Äútravel‚Äù all the way down to Brighton Beach for their food - so thrilled to have found it in Manhattan! The ultimate food paradise of ‚Äúpost-Soviet‚Äù regional cuisines - Russian, Ukrainian, Central Asian, all of it! And it‚Äôs truly tastes like home ü§© huge love for the job you‚Äôre doing!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is the most comprehensive buffet-style supermarket I‚Äôve seen in Manhattan! Despite its compact size, it‚Äôs packed with everything you could need for travel or daily life in NYC.

The variety of freshly prepared foods blew me away‚ÄîAsian, Middle Eastern, Japanese, Italian, European, and classic American dishes, all vibrant, flavorful, and incredibly fresh. I was amazed at how many options were available, with new dishes being cooked right there.

Beyond the food, the store is fully stocked with other essentials. It‚Äôs super convenient, located close to the subway and NYU. My only regret is not living closer! This place is a gem for travelers or locals looking to save on delicious, affordable meals. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Happened upon this market in the village after walking around for hours and looking to buy some water. I thought oh, what fun, an Uzbek market, I'd like to give them my money instead of a corporate chain.

Oh, when I walked in, it was entering a wonderland. They had so much on offer. Bars and bars of hot food, fresh cold salads, manti, samsa, perozhki, kutabi, pastries, plov,  buffet, and if that's not enough, a made-to-order station where you can get schwarma or other hot foods to order.

There were staff everywhere making sure the self-serve food was staying clean and fresh. Replacing if needed and keeping an attentive eye on it to ensure food safety.

This wasn't even everything! I didn't get pictures of the bakery and pastries section, the deli, the produce, the cold cases, or the dry goods aisles!

I only got a few peroshki, some cut watermelon for the hot day, baba ghanoush, and drinks, since I was walking and not done for the day, but it is conveniently located right on TOP of a subway entrance.

I can't wait to go back and go big with everything I want. (Bonus, English-speaking staff but Uzbek, too, if you want to talk in Uzbek üòä)", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pros: Still looking brand new and very high-end. The selection is awesome - eastern European, Russian and Central Asian produce, really good breads. The buffet is spectacular. Last but not least, located right over the subway entrance. Cons: the buffet items seem to be about 20% pricier than in Tashkent stores in Queens and Brooklyn. Verdict: highly recommended.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 400 Grand St Cellar, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The store is bright and clean. The space is smaller than other branches. They sell daily necessities and food, but the variety is slightly less. Just personal feeling. But you still can buy what you need. When checking out, although there are many people, there are also many staff at the open counter, so it is quick to get your turn.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is my favorite grocery store! The store policy on purchases is very customer centric. If a customer is unhappy about a purchase, the managers will make it right either through a refund or replacement. The management and staff are friendly and helpful too. The Grand Street store is clean and spacious. There are always cart handle wipes available. They carry a large assortment of organic foods. New products are introduced every week or two. TJs is also a great option if you want to buy fresh flowers and plants too. Generally, all the prices are pretty reasonable. My only complaint is I wish they carried more vegan products.

It's important to note that each store is different. The Trader Joe's on 22nd & 6th Ave and 14th Street are awful! Both are very busy and small, so maneuvering with a cart is somewhat difficult. Also, the store on 22nd Street never provides cart handle wipes for customers. The dispenser is always empty or broken!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Been coming here for the past 3 years and not a single bad experience. Prices are unbeatable and food is always fresh. I would always look forward to checkout as staff members are always super kind and friendly. The food quality is great and well preserved. I would say the bathroom is sometimes out of order or not maintained its best condition but otherwise, this is one of my favorite places to shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Efficient layout, nice selection, quick lines (Friday midday in August).  Very low prices vs. other grocery chains.  Friendly and especially thoughtful and efficient checkout from Georgina - probably the most efficient bag-packer of any grocery store I've been to.  Lady probably crushes at Tetris.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '1st time visiting this location. Love the layout and endless offerings of fruits and veggies.
I was desperate for a box of cornflakes. The prices are excellent for my budget.
I will be visiting weekly to stock up on my goodies.
Thanks to Cashier #5 who assisted me and carried my groceries to his register.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 4 Union Sq E, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very good Whole Foods Market in front of the famous Union Square Park. Well stacked, organized, and has a good salad ü•ó and hot food ü•ò section. I had a feeling that some items in this particular store are little bit more expensive than that of Hudson. The security in this store is a bit hiked.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Deli service is appalling. Plenty of staff walking around, but none tending to customers, despite making eye contact and noticing there is a line. The singular employee slicing meat even asked them to help and they didn‚Äôt.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of my favorite Whole Foods stores. They have a lot of organic varieties. Our family likes them very much. My kids only like the beef and milk here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Union Square is undoubtedly my favourite location in the city. Although it tends to be quite crowded most of the time,  I still absolutely love it. The store offers an excellent selection of fresh produce, well-organized aisles. Despite the occasional bustle, shopping there remains an enjoyable experience every single time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is a fantastic place right in the heart of the City ! You have groceries, lunch, cafe with ample seating ‚Äì all rolled into one. Their coffee is good and actually less expensive than cafes around here. The food is great ‚Äî fresh ingredients, caloric information, healthy options and I would say hard-to-beat prices ( $14 for an entree and two sides is the best special ). Their cafe offers 90-minute seating with a table for every group ‚Äî each table seats four, but they are places side-by-side on the Union Sq side, so large groups can sit here too. And of course the views can‚Äôt be beat!  The restrooms are a bit small, if there‚Äôs one negative.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 142 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ªü™ªü™∑üíÆüåºü•Äüåª
I had the most delightful experience at Trader Joe's recently, thanks to their stunning and affordable flower selection! I picked up two breathtaking orchids for just $14.99 each‚Äîa price that‚Äôs truly unbeatable. After checking multiple locations, this store stood out not only for its affordability but also for its focus on plants and flowers, which makes it feel like a hidden gem for floral lovers.
What made the visit even more special was the joy these orchids brought to two of my friends on their birthdays. It felt amazing to gift something so beautiful without breaking the bank.
The staff was incredibly helpful and thoughtful, offering great tips on how to care for the orchids and keep them thriving. I was able to pop in while running errands and get everything I needed quickly and efficiently.
If you're looking for economical yet elegant flowers, this Trader Joe's location is a must-visit.  üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ª", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I often go this place to grab salad but yesterday I found bug in my Trader Joes Salad. name: Whole Foods Market
address: 250 7th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Shopping at Whole Foods Market is interesting for me as I like to see all the aisles. This large location is on Seventh Avenue in Chelsea. As I enter, I am in the large vegetable and fruit section. Both organic and conventional varieties are available. Naturally organic prices are much higher. The fresh seafood and meat sections are next. Occasionally I get a salmon cake that I can saut√©. In the middle of the store is the prepared foods and salad bar which is by weight. The cheese section is also there. Plant based pizzas and cauliflower crusts are in refrigerated cases. A variety of domestic and international butters are here priced decently that sometimes I can afford to buy them. Egg cartons are still rationed at three per customer due to the avian flu that had started a while back. These eggs range in price from $7 upwards. I don‚Äôt buy them as they are too pricey for me. My favorite section are the yogurts and when they are on sale I like to get Ellenos mango or passion fruit. Valley Shepherd Farm is another yogurt brand that I like a lot. Aisles are filled with teas, coffees, grains and the usual varieties of foods most supermarkets have. The body area is colorful and I like browsing here for deodorants on sale and the occasional face cleanser. One cannot forget the ice cream selections of which there are many. I am partial to Jeni‚Äôs Splendid ice cream in Wildberry Lavender and Dark Chocolate. Freshly baked breads, cakes and cookies are here too. I like the ‚ÄúLast Chance‚Äùwhere items are heavily discounted. One can either go to the self checkout machines or to the cashier. Magazines and temptations are always as one is waiting to pay. One needs self control not to go berserk! Two clean restrooms are here too which is convenient. Customer service is good with everyone trying to help you. Security guards are also manning the store and the entrance to avoid any incidents.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you‚Äôre looking for a top-tier supermarket with an exceptional fresh counter, this place is a hidden gem. The seafood, meat, and specialty products are of outstanding quality, making it a go-to destination for food lovers and home chefs alike.

The seafood section is particularly impressive‚Äîalways fresh, well-stocked, and offering a wide variety of fish and shellfish. Whether you‚Äôre looking for wild-caught salmon, fresh oysters, or high-quality shrimp, you‚Äôll find it here. The staff is knowledgeable and can even provide recommendations on the best ways to prepare your selection.

The meat counter is just as remarkable, offering premium cuts of beef, lamb, and poultry. The butchers are skilled and happy to assist with custom cuts or special requests. You can really taste the quality, whether you‚Äôre grilling a steak or slow-cooking a roast.

Beyond seafood and meat, the store boasts an excellent selection of specialty products, from gourmet cheeses to rare international ingredients. The variety ensures that you can find everything you need for a high-end meal at home.

Customer service is top-notch, with friendly and helpful staff always ready to assist. The store is clean, well-organized, and makes shopping a pleasant experience.

If quality and freshness are your priorities, this supermarket is a must-visit. Highly recommended!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "It was my first and last time in this supermarket.
The employees were incredibly kind.
And the items for sale are of excellent quality.
I really liked the supermarket
I would like to shop here more often
But I think it's a bit far from Germany.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is a sizable Whole Foods Market with a very good hot and cold self-service food area. Fruits and vegetables are also fresh, the meat section is serving up fresh cuts while keeping the display case filled with additional freshly cut options. The lines tend to move fairly quickly no matter how long the line may be and there's always someone at the front of the line assisting customers as they see their register number being called.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I always love a Whole foods store, but this isn't my favourite one in the area.
I didn't find it to be laid out as well as the other stores and had to wait a while for the 'qualified person' to beat up my pizza slice.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart Manhattan

reviews:
[{'text': 'A very clean, beautiful, organized Korean market. But the prices are crazy. Worth going, there is a lot of variety of products. They‚Äôre normally only 5.99-6.99 per bottle. Absolutely ridiculous.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was walking home from dinner with my big bro and he hit me with "Aye I need to pick up some oyster sauce, wanna pop into the grocery store with me?" That's some grown man business, picking up some oyster sauce from the Korean market lol. Respect.

We popped in and H Mart was PACKED. Standing room only. I perused around while big bro hunted for his oyster sauce, and I wanted to buy everything. So many snacks I had never seen before. I almost bought some meat as they had such a wide selection of things I never see at TJs or Whole Foods, but it was lowkey pretty expensive and my pockets are on featherweight.
