I took it upstairs and got a big pour glass of wine and while there is no ambience, save your vibe for later. Come here to eat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart
address: 210 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Food ain‚Äôt worth the overbearing security. At first I figured if you have so much security then maybe that‚Äôs because the food is so good the people are stealing it. It‚Äôs not good.  It‚Äôs okay, probably won‚Äôt finish my $20 meal of a tea, corn dogs and a chicken sandwich.

I wonder why they have the security then‚Ä¶', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Really compressive selection of Asian and non Asian groceries. The hot food selection is great and the sushi is well stocked. Drink aisle is great too. You can find most common items here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve been an avid shopper of hmart at diff locations throughout the city. But the last few times I‚Äôve picked up any cooked foods or lunch items from this location, they have tasted off‚Ä¶.they very much seem stale and repackaged‚Ä¶.i couldn‚Äôt down the fried chicken‚Ä¶.it tasted weird.

The location in morning side heights has much fresher cooked foods.

Also, yes the security guard is a bit intimidating!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If this security guard harasses you or unfairly targets you, please contact H Mart‚Äôs corporate customer support, file a formal complaint with the NYC Department of Human Rights, and spread the word!

Based on my experience and other reviews, he has a history of targeting Black and Latino customers without any justification, and the store is doing nothing about it! Please make your voice heard!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great selection of Asian groceries ‚Äî you‚Äôll find everything from ingredients for any dish you‚Äôre cooking to a hot bar, Korean skincare, cute home goods, and even a photo booth. I genuinely enjoy what they offer.

However, the shopping experience can feel a bit tense due to the heightened security. Shoppers aren‚Äôt allowed to use their own bags while browsing, there‚Äôs a large surveillance screen displaying live camera feeds of the store, and the security guard‚Äôs presence can feel overly watchful ‚Äî following closely and making it hard to browse comfortably.

There‚Äôs no self-checkout either, which adds to the sense of being monitored. I understand the need for loss prevention, but compared to nearby stores like CVS that use simple product locks, the approach here feels excessive for the location.

It‚Äôs a great store with a lot to love ‚Äî I just wish the environment felt a little more relaxed.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Gastro Market
address: 235 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, sandwich_shop, deli, bagel_shop, bakery, breakfast_restaurant, food_store, meal_delivery, food_delivery, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Loved the deli style buffet, fresh, tasty, and full of great options! Great for lunch or dinner. The sandwiches are amazing: warm, crusty, and clearly made with care. Everything was well presented and the place was clean and inviting. A perfect stop for a quick, satisfying meal in the city.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place was actually such a shock and delight. I got a gluten free breakfast burrito!! Gluten free. Breakfast. Burrito. What?! Amazing.
Their breakfast burrito doesn‚Äôt have the standard fillings - it has cold cuts and banana peppers. But it‚Äôs actually really good.  For $12, not bad. And it literally lasted me 3 meals.
The buffet bar is pretty bougee. Looks delicious.
They have a random amount of Korean food. Kimbap and some Korean groceries.
There‚Äôs a small place to sit inside.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The hot bar is the BOOOOMB!!! Delicious food, amazing customer service. Discount with cash.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love love love. I‚Äôm gluten intolerant so to have everything in the buffet clearly marked is so wonderful! And the food is delicious. Great coffee too. Will be coming back a few times I think!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best thing about this place is that it is open 24 hours and that includes the buffet, which is a variety of hot dishes as well as salads and fruit, everything is fresh and clean.

On the downside, it's not like an average supermarket, I didn't find stuff I'd consider "basic" like brie, pretzels, sparkling water, wrapped lemon cake, etc. (they do have Lay's chips which is a favorite of mine but only in small pricey size).

The market seems to specialise in Asian food, and of every item there are countless varieties. Unfortunately as I cannot read the signs, I didn't try any of that.

PS: it would be good if more of the staff could speak English...', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Morton Williams Supermarkets
address: 908 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very Good Super market in Manhattan on 48 Street, Grocery, vegetable, fruits, & so many products available & cafe is also available, & it is open 24 Hours.......', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unfortunately, the prices have gone sky high, but you know we love the people that work there with an exception many of us are in the neighborhood and have made friends there. However, from time to time, I have gotten very bad chicken and therefore have gotten into the habit of puncturing the cellophane to smell it. Last month a butcher I don‚Äôt know yelled at me for doing it and I told her I didn‚Äôt want to get stuck with bad chicken when I got home and sure enough the chicken was bad well this week I bought chicken again and I didn‚Äôt puncture the cellophane because I didn‚Äôt feel like being yelled at and sure enough it was bad chicken and I was too tired to go back. A very famous chef of mine who is now retired told me today he got stuck last week as well with bad chicken so it‚Äôs not my imagination and the attitude of the butcher is there even if you do return it they‚Äôre very arrogant unfortunately otherwise all the department in that store I love lovely people and I really love going there. Unfortunately the chef will never return so you lost a customer there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Staying at the Barclay Intercontinental, we wanted to get some fruits, nuts, water etc. and wanted to visit aa real supermarket. We found one 2 blocks away Morton Williams which was really well stocked with everything we needed and more. Easy to find everything and very friendly staff. We loaded up and will return when we visit NYC again in that area. Highly recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I just needed a cucumber, but they were all semi rotting. Looked for protein, but no luck. Nicely organized nonetheless. A lady at the front cash was counting money and I asked if her cash was open, but she just ignored me. Probably the most insulting thing a person in a retail store can do and I'll never go back here. Apparently, counting money is more important than basic customer service. Was not impressed at all.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fabulously displayed fruits and veggies supermarket, you can find anything you need in here, the shop floor staff super friendly and helpful', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The Food Emporium
address: 810 8th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Thank you Food Emporium NYC!!! $50 Cake that was ready in one day- that absolutely stunned my partner and his friends on his birthday! Everyone said the cake looked amazing and it tasted great!!! Special thank you to Mildred and the bakery! I live local and they will now be my go-to for special occasion cakes!

P.s. (added some decor of my own from home)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'More than $18 purchase pictured below. Apples non-organic. Strawberries partially rotten. Other customer waiting at check out showed middle finger for no reason - there was no issue at check out.

As rip-off and low class as it gets.

UPDATE LATE OCTOBER 2025, ORIGINAL REVIEW EARLY SEPTEMBER:
Blueberries now $16.99 (see additional photo)

Fyi: got the "cheap" blueberries, not the ones pictured in the separate photo.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I like Food Emporium, the variety of items are great. We went looking for kiwi üçá  but they didn't have.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Food Emporium
810 8th Ave.
New York, NY 10019

The outer skin was crisp, but kind of shriveled.  But, do not be deceived because but it tastes a lot better than it looks.

#RotisserieChicken #tisserie #chicken #foodemporium', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome selection of grab-and-good fresh food options, including sushi, chicken, sandwiches, salads, wraps, many more. The bakery was impressive, as well as the $12.99/lb hot deli bar. Really glad we stopped and enjoyed the sushi, as well as fish, rice and broccoli. Enjoyed.

The beer selection is also impressive of NY selections.

I did not explore the grocery store, but it looked really good. Looks like an excellent spot for locals as well as tourists.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hashi Market
address: 330 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Hashi Market is a fun place to shop if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Japanese groceries. They have a good selection of sushi, snacks, noodles, and even unique items like matcha and sesame soft-serve ice cream. The store is clean and organized, and it‚Äôs easy to find what you need. Prices are a little higher compared to regular supermarkets, but that‚Äôs expected for imported goods. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great spot if you‚Äôre craving Japanese treats or want to explore new flavors!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'In the new York and new jersey area, outside of Mitsuwa Japanese market, this is the one that has almost every categories of Japanese items you will need except alcohol .
It is a much much smaller one compared to to Mitsuwa, but good enough for Manhattan.

First floor they have fresh made soft serve ice cream, hot foods, and all necessary noodles, ready to eat food, snacks and limited fresh produce.

Second floor, it‚Äôs the cutie floor, there are adorable asian characters, make ups, plushies, chinaware, and more.

Limited staff in the shop for stocking, cleaning, and register, but service were efficient and some of the staff are very friendly.

Value, I cannot say it‚Äôs the best, after comparing to Teso and some other Chinese owned market, the pricing over here is slight higher.

Location, convenient, center of Manhattan. No parking. High walking score.

Do recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great Japanese Market and Fujiissa is attached to this location where you should absolutely grab a drink from.

They have a great selection of prepared cold food items to go such as sushi and hot items as well like Katsu don.

It is slightly priced higher but it is a very convenient location next to K-Town so you can do all your Korean / Japanese grocery shopping in one go - if you wanted to.

What you absolutely MUST do while here is to go down one floor below to check out the basement level - they have a fully-stocked Canmake cosmetic product offering as it seems not many are aware of this particular location yet!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is a paradise for Japanese culture lovers! It has everything ‚Äî from fresh produce and fruits to a wide variety of Japanese snacks, famous chocolates like Royce, and adorable collectible toys that will melt your heart. Walking through the aisles feels like being back in Japan. The store is clean, fully stocked, and the staff is super friendly. Highly recommended stop for anyone in the area!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I spent $30 here on salmon sushi for my kids‚Äô lunch. The packaging said it was good for a couple more days, but when I opened the boxes both had a terrible smell ‚Äî the salmon was clearly expired. Absolutely disgusting. Serving spoiled fish under a false expiration date is a serious health risk, and it shows they don‚Äôt care about freshness or their customers. I‚Äôll never buy anything from this place again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target Grocery
address: 112 W 34th St., New York, NY 10120, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'They refuse to let 4 prospective customers in at 11:55pm even though store hours extend to 12am.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wanted to use the toilet but Greg (old guy)  was saying the code changes every week and did nothing to open it up. My woman friend got the code right away.  After I asked three times, he opend the employees' restroom and kept ignoring me. I had to wait a while until another employee came along. I came here to buy joyride candy and use the toilet. I'm glad the manager came to open it up. From a 1* to 2*, you don't treat customers like Greg!!!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you know this location from years ago, youd be extremely surprised how much nicer it looks. Rare quality/price balance in the city!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Good store at least for buying something small (like water and snacks) when you're walking around in NYC. Friendly cashier.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Not your everyday grocery store to what I'm used too in the UK, however has everything you'd need", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Macy's
address: 151 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA
types: department_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'üòéI still tell my kids and grandkids that I am only 32 but I have known this store for over 40 years. Great place to shop. This is the Macy‚Äôs flagship department store. For a longtime, this was the largest department store in the world. Maybe it‚Äôs still is. You can almost find everything in this iconic store. The store is so big, you can spend the entire day here. Make sure you have a lot of money but you also have great prices and bargains. Only in New York City !', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The Christmas Market/Village/Square in the lower floor does not resonate well with the kind of Christmas market in Europe. It needs greater details in the decorations and stylistic interpretation perhaps a new translation to a Yankee Christmas is essential in the busiest time of the year.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Macy‚Äôs is a great place to shop, with brands for every budget‚Äîfrom quite affordable options to more premium labels. The building itself is beautiful and full of character, making the visit feel much more special than a regular department store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Christmas season is probably the best time to visit this place. It‚Äôs just so festive and the shopping discounts are really good. Make sure to add this in your diary when you‚Äôre visiting NY around Christmas.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Iconic department store with charm and vast selection, but slightly tricky to navigate.

Macy‚Äôs Herald Square offers a huge variety of products across 9 floors, from clothing and shoes to home goods. The old wood escalators add a charming, nostalgic feel to the shopping experience.

One downside is that the floor layout is inconsistent ‚Äî men‚Äôs and women‚Äôs sections don‚Äôt follow the same pattern, i.e. men and women shoes are on different floors, which can be confusing. Staff are generally helpful, but navigating the store requires patience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Apple Fifth Avenue
address: 767 5th Ave, New York, NY 10153, USA
types: electronics_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Magnificent store. Just like the product the store is also world class. Located in the most iconic place in NY city. The all glass architecture is an excellent work item. Array of products are also great. The sales team is awesome. And always willing to help.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best example of the Worst Customer service in the world!!
Apple,  get ur employees trained properly, i have never experienced this attitude from Apple staff anywhere around the world.. & this is your famous Apple 5th avenue store?!? üò≥
Behaviour of staff, i am picking up my new phone i get just get -‚ÄúHere u go!‚Äù !??
i asked whats happening with my trade in, they sent me to another person who idk how he ended up being senior in this store‚Ä¶.So rude & not using appropriate tone of voice or choice of words towards every customer who was waiting‚Ä¶
The only person who was helpful was the lady who took over to make my trade it process‚Ä¶at least she had patience with all of us who were doing data transfer‚Ä¶.
And i can‚Äôt get in touch with ur online customer support. You still owe me 100$ for the mistake that your support staff did with my online purchase‚Ä¶
I did not get my refund completely‚Ä¶. What‚Äôs happening here?', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We were walking near Central Park on a warm day and didn‚Äôt plan to stop‚Ä¶ but how could we resist the stunning glass cube that marks the entrance to this Apple store? üòç It looked so cool (literally and figuratively!) ‚Äî like a little oasis in the middle of the city. We stepped inside, walked down the beautiful spiral staircase, and suddenly we were in a buzzing world of Apple.

Even though we already own plenty of Apple devices, we just wanted to enjoy the vibe ‚Äî and it was worth it! The store is huge, bright, and full of energy. üîã So many people were browsing, buying, exploring. Several team members approached us kindly, and I‚Äôm sure anyone seriously looking to purchase something would get help quickly. They‚Äôre fast and attentive. ‚úÖ

It‚Äôs a great spot to cool down, explore the latest tech, and even take a little break ‚Äî yes, they do have clean public restrooms, which is a plus in NYC! üöªüòâ

Definitely recommend stopping by ‚Äî even just for the experience.
RECOMMENDED üíØ (Personally mine)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'An art piece masquerading as an Apple store. This flagship location is a testament to the extraordinary lengths Apple goes to create the ultimate premium feel from their products to their stores. Walking down the spiral staircase, you can see the expansive underground vault of tables and displays of the newest Apple product. Amidst all the electronics are nature, plenty of trees and greenery surround the store with a light refreshing ambiance. This greenery looks all well maintained and is calming to see. There is a large seating area to rest and free charging from magsafe pads. Plenty of staff to balance the huge flow of visitors and buyers here getting their new products set up or asking questions about their next purchase.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you buy your new iPhone here, you‚Äôre in the perfect spot to test out the camera right away. The store is located right next to Central Park ‚Äî an amazing place for nature photography ‚Äî and just steps away from some of the city‚Äôs most iconic buildings with stunning architecture that‚Äôs well worth capturing.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: FAO Schwarz
address: 30 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10111, USA
types: gift_shop, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Can‚Äôt say enough about this experience. My son had demo encounters by 4 different staff members. Andrew was so much fun! This man LOVES his job and is truly working in his purpose of adding happiness to the minds of small children. We saw the famous keyboard and soooooo much more. You have to go for yourself. My son loved it. The staff are excellent! This was a great experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love FAO since I saw Home Alone 2. Luckily I was able to go to the original this one is pretty fun still! We specifically went for the jelly cat Cafe! Ended up hanging out for quite some time and getting a mix of fun stuff!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Our girls were excited about the Jellycat experience. The staff is really in character and excited to be there. There is such a huge variety of stuffed animals. There is something for everyone. Although it is busy you move quickly.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve been through as an adult a few times, but going through it with a toddler is a different and magical experience. Every staff member we encountered was kind, there‚Äôs a lot of interactive displays, options to completely customize toys, and so many cool toys. Definitely worth the stop if you‚Äôre in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This has been the best toy store I‚Äôve been to for Jelly Cats! So happy to stop by and get exclusive NY editions for the little ones. They have a wide selection of other toys as well!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: UNIQLO 5th Avenue
address: 660 5th Ave, New York, NY 10103, USA
types: clothing_store, coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is a Great Store!!! Great products & Great team!!! Five 5 stars!!! Casual clothes for Men, Women and kids. A definite must-visit location - a large store with a wide range of good quality affordable selections and fully automated self check out technology - no individual scanning required. Highly recommend for anyone looking for stylish and reliable wardrobe!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Flagship store with multiple floors of clothing from different collabs, different styles, and different clothing types. There is also a coffee shop inside too but much of the seating area is occupied so you‚Äôll have to find seating in other areas. Plenty of trendy options and lots of clothing to mix and match. The interior is bright and well lit with lots of mannequins wearing tasteful outfits. Staff are available everywhere for your assistance.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'My wife loves to shop for both of us at Uniqlo.  The store is always packed full of people and the shelves and sacks are overflowing with trendy merchandise.  And there are always lots of items on sale.  They used to have a few seats at the top of the escalators for bored husbands to sit while their wives are happily shopping.  But today I found that most of the seats have been removed and replaced by racks of clothes.  Too bad. They need to put the seats back.
Stopped in again today so my wife could do some shopping.  Happy to see the store restored some seating for non shopping spouses.  Thank you.

Back again for my wife to shop more. This time I went to the second floor where they now have a coffee stand. I bought a house coffee, very tasty, and sat on one of the round seating areas.  Very comfortable place to wait.  Thank you Uniqlo!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A definite must-visit location - a large store with a wide range of good quality affordable selections! I got my best thermal wear from Uniqlo and always pop in for one item and leave with a bunch. What I can‚Äôt get over is the fully automated self check out technology - no individual scanning required.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very big which was amazing, they also got a cafe. Also a lot of different pieces, but of course not the best quality, since it‚Äôs fairly cheap. In my opinion also not very fashionable clothing, more like H&M style, but the basics are great.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Saks Fifth Avenue
address: 611 5th Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, jewelry_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Visited Saks 5th Ave to put my noise on a few new scents. Michael & another sales associate were super helpful at the Creed counter. I only travel with my 1 carry on and personal item when I fly, so I couldn‚Äôt buy a big bottle; though I was able to get a small flask and they were kind enough to not only fill my atomizer with the scent I really enjoyed but they have me a few samples as well. If you have a budget on splurge on fragrance and want top tier service, don‚Äôt hesitate to stop by the Creed counter. You‚Äôll be in good hands.

Unika B. & Co.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '‚Ä¢ Chanel at Saks Fifth Avenue Review

I may have blown into Saks on my last NY trip looking more ‚Äúpost-tornado Dorothy‚Äù than fashion icon (New York humidity is a ‚Äúwicked Witch‚Äù on its own‚Ä¶) but the Chanel peeps didn‚Äôt bat a lash.

Shannen D. Was my ‚ÄúGlinda‚Äù of the day, she was patient, gracious & unbothered.  She helped me find the perfect pair of new Chanel sunnies.

Then appeared the ‚ÄúWizard of Accessories‚Äù himself ‚Äî a kind gentleman who whisked my  new sunglasses behind a secret door & returned them with the perfect fit!  Magically adjusted, no smoke or mirrors, just perfect.

No flying monkeys, just warm smiles & excellent service.  (The next time I need ruby slippers, I know exactly where to look‚Ä¶)  I will definitely return on my next trip, this shopping afternoon was dreamy‚Ä¶ üíñ

#ChanelSunnies üòé
#Saks5thAveStyle üóΩ
#NYCLuxuryShopping üõçÔ∏è
#ChanelChic ‚≠êÔ∏è
#FifthAveFashionista üíÉ
#Siggie_E üíã', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Hands down the best Saks that I've ever visited. Friendly and personable professionals in the store. Incredibly clean and tidy considering the significant amount of foot traffic that comes through daily. When visiting the Chanel fragrance section (2nd floor), I was greeted and assisted by the most pleasant and customer centric person I've ever encountered - Maria. While I enjoy fragrances immensely and have a fairly extensive collection, my interaction with Maria was about 95% of why I chose to make a purchase today (Bleu de Chanel Parfum). She was such a joy to work with, extremely knowledgeable about the products, and provided information prompting you to think before purchasing. She doesn't sell but rather helps you buy - I admire this characteristic in a retail professional. Whenever I'm in town again I will visit this store and likely buy again solely because of Maria!

Thank you for the wonderful experience today, Maria! You're a value add to the company for certain; I, as well as "they," need more people like you in the business!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beautiful store and great experience at Saks! ‚ú® We bought a Vilhelm Parfumerie fragrance and absolutely loved it. Highly recommend! üåü', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "My husband and I were pre-holiday perfume shopping in NYC so of course we went to Saks Fifth Ave. There's an entire floor just for perfume at Saks, and it's wonderful. We were so please to meet Etta at what has to be the niche fragrance center of the world. She manages the artisan corner of niche perfumes, including Xerjoff  Maison Crivelli, Matiere Vilhelm Parfumerie and many others. She was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. We definitely look forward to working with her in the future.  #itsbetterwithetta #europerfumes.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The LEGO¬Æ Store Fifth Avenue
address: 636 5th Ave, New York, NY 10020, USA
types: point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The LEGO Store on 5th Ave in New York is not just a store, it‚Äôs a full-on experience. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by massive LEGO sculptures that are genuinely jaw-dropping. There‚Äôs a huge rainbow ‚Äútree‚Äù in the center with little scenes hidden inside it (we loved the squirrel and the tiny LEGO world tucked into a little window). It feels like stepping into a life-sized LEGO fantasy world.

The attention to detail in these builds is incredible. They‚Äôve got a giant Hulk you can sit next to, a LEGO Statue of Liberty with a friendly face, and characters and scenes tucked into every corner. Even if you‚Äôre not a kid, it‚Äôs impossible not to smile.

The store layout is fun to explore, and the staff were friendly and patient even with how busy it gets. There‚Äôs a wide range of sets for all ages and interests, plus build-your-own mini-figures if you want something personalized.

It is crowded (it‚Äôs 5th Ave‚Ä¶), but honestly it just adds to the energy. It feels like everyone there is excited and having fun.

Whether you‚Äôre a LEGO fan or just looking for something magical to experience in NYC, this place is absolutely worth stopping in.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An absolute must-visit! The LEGO Store on 5th Avenue is incredible ‚Äì from the huge, detailed LEGO sculptures to the massive selection of sets for all ages. The atmosphere is fun and inspiring, and the staff are super friendly and helpful. It feels like stepping into a world of creativity. Whether you're a lifelong LEGO fan or just curious, this place will amaze you. A true highlight of New York City!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '"We took our kids to the LEGO Store near Rockefeller Center and it was an absolute blast! The store was a treasure trove of creativity and imagination, with towering LEGO displays and interactive exhibits. The kids were completely enthralled by the vast array of LEGO sets and minifigures on display.

The staff were super friendly and helpful, and the kids loved building their own creations at the play areas. We also got to see the iconic NYC skyline made out of LEGO bricks, which was amazing. The store was super kid-friendly, and we appreciated the variety of LEGO themes and products available.

If you're looking for a fun and interactive experience for kids (or adults!) who love LEGO, this store is a must-visit. We can't wait to come back and explore again!"', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An absolute Lego lovers dream! I was in paradise! I got lucky when I walked in and saw that they had Toothless in stock since it wasn't online! Employees are super nice and the store decently busy! Will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'LEGO Store Fifth Avenue ‚Äî ‚Äúa cathedral made of bricks and childhood nostalgia.‚Äù

You don‚Äôt enter this place ‚Äî you ascend into it. Two floors of architectural self-confidence, glowing bricks, and that very specific LEGO-plastic scent that immediately time-travels you to age 8.

The first thing that hits you is the taxi ‚Äî a life-sized New York yellow cab made entirely out of LEGO bricks. It‚Äôs the kind of thing that makes grown adults stop mid-sentence and whisper ‚Äúokay, that‚Äôs insane.‚Äù

Staff here are borderline too nice ‚Äî they greet you with the kind of cheerful energy usually reserved for theme park employees or people who‚Äôve just discovered coffee. They actually know the sets, and will casually point you to the UCS Millennium Falcon like it‚Äôs a bag of chips.

Upstairs is where it gets surreal: you can design your own minifigure, print it, and suddenly realize you‚Äôve paid $12 for a tiny plastic version of yourself holding a coffee mug ‚Äî and it was worth every cent.

There‚Äôs an interactive digital lab where your builds come alive on screens, a Pick & Build wall that feels like LEGO sushi-train, and enough visual chaos to keep your inner child screaming for an hour.

Yes, it‚Äôs crowded. Yes, the tourists will photobomb you mid-selfie with a LEGO taxi. But that‚Äôs New York ‚Äî and honestly, if you can‚Äôt handle a crowd at a LEGO cathedral on Fifth Avenue, that‚Äôs on you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: M&M'S New York
address: 1600 Broadway, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: candy_store, chocolate_shop, tourist_attraction, gift_shop, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Great experience overall! Staff were very kind and helpful, and the store is colorful and fun ‚Äî perfect for photos. I loved the Mood Machine (mine said ‚ÄúCreamy Color‚Äù). But prices are really high ‚Äî personalized M&M‚Äôs start at $20‚Äì$30 and even small souvenirs cost about $10. I‚Äôd recommend this place only if you have some extra money to spend ‚Äî it‚Äôs fun, but definitely expensive.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The store is just amazing. It is so big with so many m&m flavours. They have a cookie crunch flavoured m&m‚Äôs and don‚Äôt miss it out because it was soooo good. They also have merchandise here. I love the store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'M&M‚Äôs at 1600 Broadway is a playful, visually stunning destination‚Äîperfect for indulging in a whimsical chocolate wonderland. It‚Äôs compact, colorful, and brings nostalgic joy. Just be mindful of prices and the current escalator accessibility‚Äîit‚Äôs still a fun and worthwhile stop, especially for families and candy lovers exploring Times Square.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "There were so many M&Ms!! I'll never be able to eat that many in my lifetime! Really cool place to go to. I think it is 3 stories high. There's a section where you can design your own M&M. name: Target
address: 237 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA

reviews: [{'text': 'TARGET Expect more pay less. Exceptional value for money in a prime tourist location Times Square where generally prices are higher than average for goods and services.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Had no idea there was a Target in Times Square,  a lower level Target that is. But if you're a Target fan, why not. Although smaller scale, this store still provides the basic needs and quality from the employees you would expect.  And the bottled water is less expensive than on Times Square.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This Target was a lifesaver during our visit to NYC. Located just near times square, its perfect, clean and friendly service.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great location, thanks goodness there‚Äôs a target right here in Times Square.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "When I first came into this target it got me confused because it's like going in the back of the store because it's coming from the back you have to go into the store then go down to escalators and then everything that you need like the cash register and the toys is all the way in the back but either way this one girl that ringed me up when I bought stuff she was very friendly and nice.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Nintendo NEW YORK
address: 10 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10020, USA
types: point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I like to come to Nintendo New York every year when my family comes to the city around Christmas time... I was in the city earlier for a different event and this was my best visit yet! The shelves were stocked, it wasn't too crowded, and there was a bunch of new merchandise for the various sections. They like to move the Amiibo around a lot, but their selection stays the same if that's what you're looking for. They added a huge section of Pikmin stuff, which was pretty cool. Checking out, I met a cashier named Omar, and he was super kind and helpful. I bought a couple Legend of Zelda items and he told me some fun facts and made nice conversation over it. I asked for directions and he offered to pull out his phone and help.
All in all, a very nice visit. Will return around Christmas!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lots of fun for those who love Nintendo products! And for those not familiar with Nintendo. They had plenty of Switch 2s to try out with their TVs. 2 stories of merchandise. Kind and helpful staff. Clean store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'For Nintendo fans, this place is a true paradise. You can explore the latest consoles on the main floor and take a nostalgic trip upstairs where the history of Nintendo comes alive with smiles from the past. The staff are friendly and attentive, whether you‚Äôre shopping for consoles or picking out some cool apparel. A must-visit for every Nintendo enthusiast!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of my ‚Äúneeded stop-ins‚Äù when I‚Äôm in the city. The store‚Äôs displays are always changing and the inventory is also kept fresh.

There‚Äôs tons to look at. If you have kids, plan to take a while to look at everything (and keep an eye out for hidden details). There are several places for selfies/pictures with Nintendo characters.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'An amazing store for any Nintendo fan! Surprisingly affordable items, and fun decor. Definitely worth a stop!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: B&H Photo Video
address: 420 9th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: electronics_store, point_of_interest, home_goods_store, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Review of B&H Photo and Electronics, New York City

During a recent trip to New York City, I stumbled upon B&H Photo and Electronics while walking back to our hotel after breakfast, and I couldn't be more thrilled! As a longtime fan of their online store, I was excited to explore their massive physical location. The scale of the store was astonishing; it truly felt like a playground for anyone interested in photography and electronics.

One of the coolest features was the overhead rail system that transports orders directly from the stockroom to the sales staff (check out one of the videos I made of the rail system). It was fascinating to watch in action!

My wife, who usually isn't as enthusiastic about these kinds of places, even found herself enjoying the visit, and our son couldn‚Äôt get enough of the driving video games set up throughout the store.

The staff were incredibly kind and helpful, making our surprise stop a delightful experience. Even though we hadn‚Äôt planned on such an impromptu visit, we ended up having a fantastic time exploring.

I highly recommend stopping by B&H Photo and Electronics if you‚Äôre in New York City‚Äîit‚Äôs an experience you won't want to miss!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is great! Second time here and there‚Äôs so much to see! It‚Äôs so fun to look around in and the staff is so knowledgeable. They‚Äôre online store is just as good, and either online or in store if I have any questions, they are always answered.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not only do they have a large assortment of brands and styles, but the staff is really knowledgeable and wants to be helpful. The sales person that worked with me gave me great advice that I tried out the next day and I was so happy. I was thinking of going back just to chat with him lol. Here‚Äôs a photo I took this weekend with my new lens.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'What is essentially a playground for anybody interested in photo and film. The staff are courteous and very knowledgeable about the subject at hand. They are patient and let you test equipment, and are eager to teach concepts to you, even if it isn‚Äôt directly related to the sale. I would highly recommend anyone interested in photo and film to check this place out!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Walking into B&H is truly a unique experience. Every aisle feels like stepping into a technological theme park: cameras, lenses, drones, entire studios ready to be tested. The best part is that you can actually touch, try, and feel the power of each piece of equipment.

The staff is incredibly attentive and makes you feel right at home. The used section is full of hidden gems and is always worth checking out. And the logistics? Absolutely fascinating! You get a ticket, pay at the register, and then watch your product arrive on tracks straight from the stockroom to your hands it‚Äôs impossible not to be impressed.

I‚Äôve shopped there before and was always very well taken care of. Besides selling, they also buy used equipment at fair prices, which only adds to the trust and the excitement of coming back.

B&H is not just a store it‚Äôs a must-visit destination for anyone passionate about audiovisual. I simply love being there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target
address: 112 W 34th St., New York, NY 10120, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, child_care_agency, furniture_store, electronics_store, clothing_store, home_improvement_store, point_of_interest, home_goods_store, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "they have a lot of stuff here that is so useful around the home and sometimes they have excellent sale prices

they definitely do not price gouge. remember this is Midtown New York City. it should be very expensive and it's not. for example I bought a spoon for two dollars. this is basically the price of the dollar store except it's in the absolute center of New York City.

they also have a large amount of food including fresh produce which is incredible. i mean i bought a completely fresh pomegranate ($2.69 for a medium-large AND really fresh!) in feb 2025, along with some other produce. they also have a large selection of meats ice cream frozen foods and so much more

absolutely excellent store

the lines are not really that long because they are constantly moving as they have so many self checkouts and active cashiers", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Target 34th Street is a Multi floor store with a variety of different clothing, home, and grocery options. It is definitely one of the bigger Target stores in Midtown Manhattan. The store is positioned close to other popular retailers such as the Macy‚Äôs across the street and near a Subway station which makes it convenient. The area can get quite busy though.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came here a few days ago and I have never seen a store below ground before that was the coolest thing to me! It was like shopping in a big basement. I‚Äôm from Delaware so we don‚Äôt have underground stores but I thought it was gonna be some small little thing but it‚Äôs a full size store down here. I felt like I no clipped and went to the back rooms I got scared for a second. Definitely a good concept though space wise .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Store manager Randy at 34th Street is rude, disrespectful and confrontational. I went this morning to make a return and  buy a few items. I saw that a sheet set was on clearance. I got the register and the sales associate explained it was ringing full price. Then store manager Randy comes and rudely explain it‚Äôs not on clearance. I explained it was the same sheets that had clearance tickets on the floor. He was rude, had poor customer service and dismissive. Then return the sheet set back to the clearance wall. I mentioned that I wanted to return a shower cap that I purchased online since I didn‚Äôt realize that it was open at the top. He said he won‚Äôt because the flowered shower cap has stains. I explained that it was never used. Once again he ignores me and walks off. I will not shop at this store again. Not sure what happened to target customer service but it is very disappointing the treatment I received today.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Exactly what you would expect from a Target - organized layout, massive floors, plenty of range of items, and anything you can think of. It‚Äôs a pretty large outlet here at 34th street, with clothings, daily essentials, homeware, fresh foods and groceries. There‚Äôs also electronic gadgets and an array of toys for kids. Always love how spacious the aisles are and how friendly everyone is towards the customers. Cashier checkout is efficient as well. Lovely convenience and departmental store. They are not too heavy on clothings here so won‚Äôt expect to see big discounts but still worth a visit nonetheless!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Nordstrom NYC Flagship
address: 225 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "It was an awesome visit to this multi-level store. I haven't seen anything like it. This store has 7 floors drdicated to women's fashion and accessories, skincare and makeup, spa and beauty services, dining, and alterations and tailoring on site. It has a bistro and a bar! I've never seen anything like it!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We walked over to west 57th and Broadway for my wife to shop for dress pants.  The store is very bright and huge on multi levels.  Pretty busy today as well.
Fortunately for me, I found a couple of spots on the 4th floor to sit and wait.  Very comfortable as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Not much of a selection women's cocktail dress wise. But otherwise has wide variety beauty products and other items.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Holas. I recently underwent breast explant surgery. It was time for new bras! I was fitted with my implants in Rack Shack in Brooklyn.
Nordstrom is a few blocks away from me and I heard great things about how they fit there. So I decided to try.
Nordstrom is just a beautiful store.
I requested  a fitting. Two friendly humans were available for this process. Both Joanne and Jabria were professional, thorough and focused.
I had no idea I was a 32DDD after surgery.
I purchased two Fantasie Demure bras,  beige and black.
The entire shopping experience was very positive upon entry of the store, during the fitting, purchase, browsing the shoe department and my exit.
This was an excellent shopping and fitting experience.
As a transgender woman of color who is a midtown West diva, I was serviced beautifully. I will return and ask for both of these folks for future lingerie needs.
I highly recommend.
Thank you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I looove this store!  Since I live so close I always find what I need and don‚Äôt have to go Bergdorf or Saks anymore. Everything is easy to find, unlike Saks after their renovation.

The customer service is always outstanding.

It‚Äôs always good to have your personal shopper/associate which is Warren B  who‚Äôs is a manager in men‚Äôs shoes.   If there is something I need and can‚Äôt stop into the store he will get it for me and send it.   I‚Äôve been working with him for a while and just realized that I never reviewed my favorite store and Sales Associate!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1095 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'From a traveler‚Äôs perspective, am just excited to revisit Whole Foods again. Same vibe with higher price tags. First floor sells grab&go foods and second floor sells hot meals. The sprits section can be better but won‚Äôt complain.

There are a lot of security guards near the entrance area. Overall a nice place to have in the middle of Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When I‚Äôm in the city I go to whole foods for my needs, I love their butchery counter that has very fresh meat. The vegetables are amazing as well, the hot bar has a wide variety of food though I wish they would change it up sometimes.

When you buy flowers from here they can make you a pretty bouquet üíê free of charge. Prime members get good deals throughout the store.

The only aggravating thing is that customer service desk that‚Äôs supposed to serve as a till never is open or available. They always just send you to the regular checkout counter. I was buying flowers the other day and they refused to let me pay for them there which is closer to the florist department. Whole Foods can make this process more efficient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 6th Avenue is a great place for grocery shopping, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables that are always well-stocked and of high quality. Prices are reasonable for the freshness and quality you get, and the store is clean, organized, and easy to navigate, making the shopping experience enjoyable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The food bar is so fresh and there‚Äôs a lot of variety. Definitely a good choice for healthy lunch, and the top floor seating has a great view
However, there is some cons.

Bathroom line is very full because of the location. Checkout can also be a hassle during busy hours because of the lack of employees, at least during the times I went.

But overall a great place to get food and buy a few grocery items. Just needs organizing the people traffic especially during busy hours.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôm truly surprised at their inability to replenish their stocks. Are we already facing a supply crisis? For the last three days they haven‚Äôt replenished their stocks. I have been going daily to buy a chocolate cereal but it‚Äôs not there. In fact, every day the shelves get more and more empty without being replenished. It‚Äôs truly pathetic that in the middle of one of the most busiest commercial and tourist spots in the country, we have such shortages.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Louis Vuitton
address: 6 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This isn‚Äôt just a boutique, it‚Äôs a fashion landmark. The glass-and-steel building stands out as an icon of luxury shopping in New York City. Step inside and you‚Äôll find soaring ceilings, a stunning spiral glass staircase, and exclusive designs you won‚Äôt see anywhere else. From the legendary trunks to limited-edition handbags, high-fashion ready-to-wear, and jaw-dropping art displays‚Äîevery corner feels like a museum of style. The vibe changes constantly with rotating installations, so even if you‚Äôre just browsing, it‚Äôs an experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is super cool but it isn‚Äôt the actual store which was disappointing. The store is across the street. We still went but we were hoping to see the second bigger LV store and was under the assumption it would be packed with endless options at this size, semi disappointing.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'my experience here went well. As soon as I entered, I was greeted and given directions to where I wanted to go. Upon reaching upstairs, I was greeted by Karen, who was very attentive and welcoming. She quickly located the shoes I came for and even showed me two pieces in that collection. Overall great experience as always!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went to Louis Vuitton to buy a perfume, but the customer service was terrible. The staff were not attentive at all. Even the helper who started assisting me kept leaving to help other clients, and I had to wait a long time for any attention.

When I asked questions about the perfume, they didn‚Äôt seem interested or knowledgeable, and the overall attitude felt rude. For a luxury brand like Louis Vuitton, I expected much better service and respect.

The perfume itself wasn‚Äôt impressive either ‚Äî the scent didn‚Äôt last long and didn‚Äôt feel worth the high price. I left the store feeling disappointed and frustrated.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This was my very first visit to the Louis Vuitton store in New York City and my first Louis Vuitton purchase. I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a more amazing experience!

Stephanie made us feel completely welcome and special.  She was not only incredibly knowledgeable, but also so patient and enthusiastic in helping me find the perfect bag. Stephanie made the entire experience fun, personal, and exciting. She showed us beautiful options, offered great advice, and made me feel confident in my choice.

I left the store absolutely thrilled and couldn‚Äôt stop smiling! I‚Äôm beyond happy with my new bag and can‚Äôt wait to show it off. Huge thank you to Stephanie for making my first Louis Vuitton experience unforgettable! üëú‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: ZARA
address: 660 5th Ave, New York, NY 10103, USA
types: clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Zara is a very expensive nonsense brand. Also any time I'm in the area and the coffee is kicking in and I can't find a public bathroom, I just use the dressing rooms. Astoundingly, the staff has never confronted me about this, which leads me to believe it's okay.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I came 20 minutes before closing, I'm extremely disappointed with this specific store, the security guard was homophobic and disrespectful and wouldn't let me in when I explained I had to do a simple exchange. The hours clearly say until 9 pm when I came at 8:40 and this is unacceptable because I left work early to make it here, waste of time.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Liberty Bagels Midtown
address: 260 W 35th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: bagel_shop, juice_shop, sandwich_shop, breakfast_restaurant, bakery, restaurant, coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Unbelievable bagels and great service!

I stopped by Liberty Bagels Midtown during a mother‚Äìdaughter weekend in NYC, and it did not disappoint! It‚Äôs an easy walk from 5th Avenue, and even though the line forms outside, it moves quickly thanks to the nice gentleman managing the flow of traffic.

Orders are handled super efficiently‚Äîpickups are brought right to the door for fast access. Inside there‚Äôs a small standing bar, and outside you‚Äôll find a few tables on the patio if you want to enjoy your food there.

The staff was friendly, the service was quick, and the food was incredible. I had a blueberry bagel with egg, sausage, and cheese‚Äîhonestly one of the best bagels I‚Äôve ever had. And don‚Äôt skip the hash browns‚Äîthey‚Äôre worth it!

Highly recommend this spot for anyone craving a true New York bagel experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Go for the Rainbow bagel. You know you want to. We did and enjoyed it along with some other bagel options. Bonus: you can also get a red white and blue Liberty bagel. Plenty of cream cheese choices too. The crowds were wild but manageable. Started outside and they let you in one group at a time. Then you wait inside in a split line to order. Then you wait again in the pickup line once it‚Äôs ready. Whole process took about 20 min or so. Limited seating/standing outside. Share if you need to or take to go. Must try spot if in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Even at 8:30 am on a Sunday in October, this place was packed. Service was fast and friendly. I ordered a blueberry bagel with maple bacon cream cheese and bacon - and it was divine! The cream cheese is THICK & rich. The combination of salty and sweet was perfection a the bagel was fluffy and delicious. The decor is iconic and I highly recommend Liberty Bagels!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Liberty bagels is a great option to grab bagels. They have a wide variety of bagels available, and a lot of schmear flavors. Their sandwich options also looked great. Service was kind of slow, but maybe it was because our bagels were toasted, it took longer for them to prepare them than others who ordered after

We grabbed the Garlic bagel with the jalapeno schmear, toasted and the jalapeno cheddar bagel with chipotle schmear, toasted

The garlic bagel combo was an amazing 9.5/10, and the jalapeno cheddar combo was a solid 8/10', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "We had heard this place was ultra-popular because of their bagels, so we tried it for breakfast on a Friday morning. When we walked up, the place was packed (I mean packed!) and people were eating outside on the sidewalk where some tables have been placed and there's even a covered patio to use! Good sign, right? So we ordered our bagels and breakfast sandwiches and took them back to our hotel. They had a Halloween bagel so I thought I'd be festive and they that with pumpkin cream cheese. The flavor of the cream cheese was fine but not outstanding and the bagel itself was much chewier than I expected ü§î. The feedback from the group was the same thing about their bagels. They have a ton of good-looking cream cheese options and fun themed sandwiches so I would definitely order something here again but I wonder if the popularity is more based on history or the food? You'll have to decide for yourself.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 66 Broadway, New York, NY 10005, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Updates: Whole Foods hot bar never disappoints us‚Ä¶ It always provides a wide range of simple, healthy, delicious foods that you can eat during a day.

Previously reviewed:
This would be one of our go-to places for healthy meals.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fresh Salad bar and hot foods.

All foods so tasty and fresh.
So spoilt for choice in everything.
So enjoyed my Salads, Roast chicken , Sushi, Chicken wings, macaroni cheese, drinks, yogurt and fruits', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market at 66 Broadway is a sleek addition to the Financial District. The store is well-organized, making it easy to find what you need. The prepared foods section offers a variety of options, though some items can be hit or miss. Checkout lines move efficiently, even during busy hours. It‚Äôs a convenient spot for quality groceries and a quick bite in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Coffe, pastries, fruits and veggies salads, juices, fresh food like soups, all meats dishes and rice, pastas, by pound or sizes just ready to grab and go or take in the large dinner area. Panty at really good prices just ready to pick up for your daily meals,', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods is an amazing addition to FiDi. Today I picked up La Fermiere Yogurt which always hits that sweet spot, perfect for munchies üçÉüå±ü•¨ after a gardening session or a late night snack. The lavender infusion puts me right to sleep at night.

The staff is welcoming and friendly, when I pick up the Chefs dinner the Chef really hooks it up. I‚Äôm on a high protein diet and appreciate the generous portions. The salad bar is always well stocked and organized & the coffee shop is awsome. The almond croissants are addictive ‚ÄºÔ∏è

Cool experience today. The butchers are samurai, at this location.

Meal prep by Jeff Bezos', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 270 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': '‚ù§Ô∏èüá∫üá∏ today I picked up Electrolytes by Noom, Just Water, & a Banana Cinnamon Koia. I was happy to run into Jess Coleman‚Äôs family nearby also Patrons of this whole-foods.

I spoke with his father about community engagement, and how much this wholefoods brings our community together.

Just got a Koia vanilla Bean to start our day & a few Lacroix before we head to Sirius dog run.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pizza here is surprisingly good. The food bar itself is top quality. One of the best Whole Foods in the city. Very large layout. Endless organic products.
Great location too by WTC, financial district, and hudson river park.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "üåª Unforgettable Service at Whole Foods‚ÄîThanks to Samantha!
I had the absolute pleasure of being helped by Samantha at the flower section inside Whole Foods, and I truly cannot say enough good things about her. From the moment I walked up hoping to find sunflowers for my sister‚Äîher favorite flower‚ÄîSamantha greeted me with warmth and genuine care.
üíê Above and Beyond Service There was only one bouquet of sunflowers available, so I decided to get roses instead. While waiting for them to be wrapped, I asked Samantha if there were any more sunflowers. She kindly asked me to wait and said she‚Äôd check in the back. She magically returned with the most stunning sunflowers I‚Äôd ever seen‚Äîfresh, golden, and vibrant, like sunshine bundled into stems. She wrapped them with beautiful attention to detail, adding her own artistic touch to make them feel like a true gift.
üòä A Touch of Humanity and Knowledge With a cheerful smile, Samantha shared a little sunflower lore, including the fact that they‚Äôre the national flower of Ukraine‚Äîsomething I hadn‚Äôt known. That moment turned a simple purchase into a meaningful encounter. She didn‚Äôt just sell flowers‚Äîshe offered joy, warmth, and a touch of culture all in one.
üåü More Than a Transaction Samantha elevated the experience from routine to unforgettable. Her kindness and enthusiasm were contagious‚Äîleaving me with a huge smile and attracting admiration wherever I went with the sunflowers.
If you ever find yourself near the flower counter at Whole Foods and Samantha‚Äôs there, trust me: you're in for more than just a bouquet. You're in for a moment of grace, beauty, and genuine human connection.
Thank you, Samantha, for turning a simple errand into a lasting memory. üåª‚ú®
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Revisited with Hope to Upgrade My Review ‚Äî Unfortunately, Things Got Worse

I came back to Whole Foods Tribeca hoping to update my last review and give the store a better rating ‚Äî as 99% of my reviews are positive. Sadly, what I witnessed made that impossible.

A known bottle and can collector, carrying two filthy bags filled with recyclables, was seen stealing what appeared to be hundreds of dollars in vitamins. He then made his way to the salad bar, where the dirty cans repeatedly brushed against the food. Shockingly, security watched and did nothing. I informed customer service, who also failed to act.

As customers, we deserve clean, healthy food and a basic standard of hygiene. This experience was unacceptable, and I will never return to the Tribeca Whole Foods salad bar again.

Please see the attached photos.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Every time I come here, I enjoy shopping and eating. You can find everything you need: fresh ingredients, ready-made meals, and a very large buffet with freshly prepared dishes. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and you never have to wait long at the checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hong Kong Supermarket
address: 157 Hester St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This place has almost everything. Food and seafood and vegetables and fruit and snacks and dairy and produce and meat and candy. The only thing that I would say is, it would be great if they were a little bit cleaner and it smells fresh. But this chain of groceries provide provides a lot of groceries for the community and Taurus alike because they have so many things that they sell here. It‚Äôs best not to drive a car because it‚Äôs such a hassle. You should be taking a subway or biking around to get here. It has 2 floors! Huge.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you are a fan of exotic foods and looking for a unique culinary experience, the "Hong Kong" supermarket in New York is definitely worth a visit. The store offers an impressive selection of Asian products, including rare fruits and vegetables that are hard to find in regular supermarkets.

The variety is remarkable ‚Äì you will find tropical fruits, exotic vegetables, and unique spices suitable for a wide range of Asian cuisines. Additionally, there is a rich selection of ready-to-eat foods, authentic sauces, and essential ingredients for traditional Chinese, Japanese, and Thai cooking.

The store is well-organized, making it easy to navigate, although it can get a bit crowded, especially during peak hours. Prices vary ‚Äì some items may be slightly more expensive compared to regular supermarkets, but given their quality and uniqueness, the shopping experience is well worth it.

In summary, "Hong Kong" is a must-visit destination for anyone who enjoys exploring new flavors and discovering high-quality Asian products. If you are looking to try something new or bring a taste of Asian cuisine home, this is the place for you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I purchased this fruit on Friday, July 11, in the afternoon. However, when I checked it this morning (Sunday, July 13), I found that it was spoiled and moldy. I went to the supermarket with my receipt, but they refused to exchange or refund the item.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beware when buying seafood at this supermarket.
On September 28 around 12:53 PM, I specifically chose a fish that was fresh. After handing it over to be descaled, I was given a different fish. When I got home, it smelled foul and had an unusual color. There‚Äôs not way it could have changed that much in such a short a short time- it clearly wasn‚Äôt the one I selected.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very disappointing experience with cashier #158 on this day. She was extremely rude and threw my shopping items as if they were garbage. When I pointed this out, she arrogantly responded, ‚ÄúJust report it to a manager; I don‚Äôt care.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not sure if this is a common issue or she just had a bad day, but I will never shop there again. There should be basic manners ÊïôÈ§ä in customer service. I do not recommend this store at all.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Jubilee Marketplace
address: 99 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
types: supermarket, food_court, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Overall rating: 3.5

I saw this place on TikTok from one of my favorite food creators and was very excited to try since I work in the area. I told one of my Korean coworkers about it, & when she looked at the pictures she didn‚Äôt seem convinced. I, still hopeful, went solo.

There were only maybe 2-3x Korean options, the rest was all Chinese and American which is fine‚Ä¶ I just went to try Korean hot food. Unfortunately I think I had higher expectations than reality. The food quality was just alright. Nothing special. Won‚Äôt be in my lunch rotations.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "be super careful about expiration dates. prices on produce are OK but for pantry staples and meat, go elsewhere. hot bar is nice since they lowered the price but it's good for convenience, not quality.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'You would never - in 1 million years - expect to see a place like this. And what I mean by "like this" is the fact that it offers all five-star, unbelievable, completely fresh prepared food in a well-maintained buffet environment at $11.99 a pound. As you walk around the store, it's shocking to see that some of the prices are less expensive than in Westchester County. It might be because of the proximity to Chinatown, but you'll see some photos, like turmeric in perfect pieces for $5.99 per pound. Good luck finding that price anywhere. Period. The entryway makes it look so unassuming that if you don‚Äôt know it‚Äôs there, you would probably never walk in. But please trust me, it is definitely worth the visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The food here is great & there's no shortage of a great selection.  You can enjoy cooked food, prepared salads, you pick salads & sandwiches to order, plus they are a fully stocked grocery store.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Delicious cheese burger for $2.75. Has everything on it you could want. And the supermarket has a great selection of unique ingredients at a very fair price.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Dumbo Market
address: 66 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Very nice market. It is quite late and they truly seem to be carrying a little of everything.

As you enter the store you will find the produce straight ahead, and a very good cafe and dining area on your right.

The coffee, espresso, and cappuccino are better and less expensive than the big green shop across the street. Great service at a great price. They also bake their own pastries.

In the back of the store you will find a salad bar that is reasonably priced and has a large variety of foods.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It was my first time in a store where fruits and vegetables were so perfectly laid out on the counter shelves, everything looked so fresh and bright. I especially remember that greens in large quantities in a container are not expensive. They also have a hot food bar, I didn‚Äôt try the food, but the smell was very good. I will definitely come back here again. There is also a coffee shop inside - which is also very useful :)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We took hot box food and it was amazing. Pretty pricey but tasty. Added bonus is that they also have seating area available. The only point of improvement is that we were looking to go to toilet as we saw some customers using it and then a staff member angrily advised this is for staff only. Put a sign then so people know.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '5 stars! This grocery store is very well organized and clean, which makes shopping here a breeze. The shelves are always well-stocked with a great variety of products, including fresh produce, international items, and everyday essentials. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of care goes into keeping things tidy and efficient. The staff is friendly, approachable, and always willing to help, which really enhances the experience. It‚Äôs a place that makes grocery shopping feel easy and enjoyable. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great market that sells organic and locally freshed produce and meats especially solid venison, lamb, and grass feed beef!! Highly recommend especially if you wanna get some good fresh kitchen food on top of it to complete the experience! Keep up the great job guys', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Deluxe Food Market
address: 79 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'We ended up frequenting this not so deluxe market because the pharmacy my MIL uses gave out gift cards after x number of prescription fills.

The market is narrow but spans the block between Elizabeth and Mott St. Half of the market serves groceries and the other, cooked foods. We primarily consume at the latter, which consists of a bakery, a BBQ counter, a sushi section, and hot food counter.

Prices are generally good and competitive. But a few times we would get fooled by a few bargains. They would flip or hide the burnt side of pork and put them on clearance, only for people like me who took the bait to find out the whole thing was inedible. We have caught them cheating on non-sale items as well. For example, hiding wing tips under the duck wings, attempting to mislead by placing a case of 8 plain dumplings in front of a buffet of fried dumplings which only come with 5 pieces, etc.  Every staff I have interacted with are not friendly if not outright rude, and will stiff you as if it‚Äôs their own business.  The cashier lines are normally long and chaotic.

In other words, even though the prices are good, the experiences have been awful.   I can really care less about this place; unfortunately, I will have to be back - thanks to the gift cards from the pharmacy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This Asian food market is a one-stop shop for all your Chinese food cravings. They have sections for poultry, frozen dumplings, hot pot, seafood, fresh vegetables, baked goods, roast meats, sushi, hot foods, and more. At the hot foods section, you can get a whole platter of vegetables and meat for under $5. We got a pork and veggies platter for $4.75 and a sago coconut milk for $1.75. You can also get congee for under $4 here. There's so many things that you can buy just for a couple dollars at this food market.

Deluxe Food Market is so bustling The place is packed from beginning to end and during meal times, it's shoulder to shoulder, which can get overwhelming. If you come at night before closing there's big market discounts on the food!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was here mainly for the large and really well stocked bakery section.
Gets really busy during lunch hours, so be prepared to stand in line at the cashiers with Chinese uncles pushing you every which way!
The food is really good value for money, and you would do well going here for staples like the giant BBQ pork buns over some local takeaways.
I also really liked their cocktail buns. Definitely check out this place when you‚Äôre in the are. Just don‚Äôt make my mistakes and grab so much food ‚Äúas a snack for later‚Äù that you spoil your dinner, lmao', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This market is busy, filled with people, and can be pretty overwhelming. However, there is a large section of boxes goods and prepared foods you can order. If you can get lucky, as for the fluffy scallion pancakes. They have plain and beef filled, but I think plain is better if you can get your hands on it! Nothing fancy, but it‚Äôs supposed to be only $2 each, and you can‚Äôt beat that for a warm bread.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'They have really good and cheap already made, to-go food box. But there‚Äôs also a few seats that you can kind of dine in. I had chicken rice and dumpling box, it was actually good! I‚Äôll try roast duck box next time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Sunrise Mart Êó•Á≥ª„Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº
address: 494 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: deli, meal_takeaway, asian_grocery_store, japanese_restaurant, supermarket, restaurant, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Very cute shop with lots of imported Japanese groceries. They have a nice lofted seating area where you can eat lunch or drink your beverage, it's a nice quiet place to chat. My boyfriend LOVES the french fries, which I guess are legendary. I don't but I do love their sushi, which may not be fancy but is made with care and love!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love coming here for groceries. They have so many great products at good prices. Don‚Äôt sleep on The food either. It‚Äôs very tasty and fresh.  Give them a try!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Sunrise Market is an absolute gem, especially for lovers of Japanese cuisine! This market offers a fantastic variety of fresh produce, specialty Japanese items, and ready-to-eat meals that cater to a wide range of tastes. One tip for first-timers: make sure to get there early if you're aiming for their popular lunch items. These delicious offerings tend to sell out quickly, and it's easy to see why ‚Äì everything is made fresh daily and bursting with authentic flavors.

The market is well-organized and spotlessly clean, making for a pleasant shopping experience. The selection of fruits and vegetables is top-notch, always fresh and vibrant. Their range of Japanese groceries is impressive, featuring everything from high-quality sushi-grade fish to a wide array of unique snacks and beverages you might not find elsewhere.

The ready-to-eat meals are a highlight. From sushi rolls to bento boxes, everything is prepared with great care and attention to detail. It's clear that the staff take pride in their work, and it shows in the quality of the food. Their homemade onigiri (rice balls) and freshly made tempura are not to be missed!

Speaking of the staff, they are always friendly and helpful, ready to assist with any questions or recommendations. Whether you're a local or just passing through, Sunrise Market is definitely worth a visit. It's a food lover's paradise, especially if you're a fan of Japanese cuisine. You won't be disappointed!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Fresh Japanese market food ‚Äì a spot to remember for healthy food seekers. A few tables by the large window let you relax and enjoy a fresh, healthy meal right in the heart of Soho. The staff are also happy to explain what's what if you ask them.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoy going here for lunch as they serve fresh flavorful food that conveniently is displayed for busy working adults on their lunch. However while I was checking out it slipped my mind to grab a bottle of water. I ask the cashier, Vivien, that I just purchased $25 worth of food and forgot to buy a water and she said ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt matter you still have to make the $10 minimum‚Äù and so I went ahead to grab items that makes the minimum and when I come to the register she grills me and rolls her eyes. You never know what someone is going through but my god there‚Äôs not of ounce of good customer service in her body. Won‚Äôt be coming back for a hot minute.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: 55 Fulton Market
address: 55 Fulton St, New York, NY 10038, USA

reviews:
[{'text': 'I‚Äôve been a customer of this store for 18 years. And all that time the management fools customers around with the fraudulent  charges. All neighborhood love this store because of its convenience. The store has almost everything! But sometimes you buy rotten fish or chicken. I don‚Äôt buy fish anymore at this place. All other stuff might be good or bad quality. But the most disgusting thing is the cashier charges which don‚Äôt show the market prices advertised and just ignored when you pay for it. Also they set the cheap brands for the price of real more quality brands. For example: the advertised clementines $4.99 /3lb they sell the cheap brand ‚Äúpremium citrus‚Äù picture attached. Today I was going to buy cranberry cheesecake $6.99 for 12oz. The cashier gave me the price $9.49 when all the line of these cakes had no charge like that. Picture attached. The manager Sammy have been lying for years trying to explain the wrong products and wrong charges. He just takes away the advertised prices after I tell him. How many people just overpaid? Plenty!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great neighborhood supermarket with international fare and decent prices for those of us in a budget. Today I‚Äôm glad I remembered that the cooks here are Mexican and  rotisserie chicken is pretty flavorful for only $5', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The cashier was so rude to me. She asked if i wanted a bag, i said yes but she thought i said no. When i said i need a bag she said‚ÄùOh now you want a bag!‚Äù I told her that i had previously said yes and then she snapped at me  ‚Äúdo you want it or not!‚Äù The cashier next to her started laughing. I then asked how much for the bag bc i would have to pay for the bag separately and she acted like i was giving her a hard time and turned her back on me. It was so weird.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'High end for key foods.

They have a large variety of deli counter and buffet foods for those working in the area. It‚Äôs in the back left of the main floor.

I‚Äôve yet to try it, but the store had a lot of other things I needed when I took these photos for future reference', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I always have problem with this Key Food where I have to take a pic of all the items I picked that‚Äôs on sale. If I don‚Äôt, there will be a problem. At the register, the sale item may scan at a different price. Some cashier are active in checking and some just so sure it‚Äôs the scanned price until I showed them the pic of the sale sign. This ice cream was on sale but was scanned a dollar more. The cashier was so sure that he had an attitude about it until I showed him the pic of the sale sign. Then when he had someone helped him fix it, he told me in a rude way‚Ä¶I fixed it. That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt come here much and when I do, I make sure to take a pic of the sale price sign.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]
