The owner is super friendly, perfect for all Thai ingredients.

What I‚Äôve seen there: Makrut lime leaves, galangal, Thai chilies, all types of noodles, Thai eggplant, sawtooth coriander, Thai basil, green pawpaw, Gapi, palm sugar, tamarind, shrimp soybean oil, Grachai, all types of Thai soy sauces, fish sauce, oyster sauce, Pandanus leaves, frozen banana leaves.

name: Peas & Pickles
address: 55 Washington St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I‚Äôve been a loyal, regular customer here for a long time ‚Äî I‚Äôve spent plenty of money and genuinely liked supporting this place. But recently, the way I‚Äôve been treated has made me feel unwelcome and frustrated.

It all seems to have shifted after a day when a woman who appeared to be homeless was standing on the public sidewalk near the entrance. She, like me, had darker brown features and politely asked me for help. I bought her an ice cream and a soda, and while I was inside gathering her items, the man behind the counter kept running in and out, yelling at her to ‚Äúget away,‚Äù even though she wasn‚Äôt inside or bothering anyone. I hurried to pay since she was waiting for me, so she wouldn‚Äôt keep getting yelled at.

A couple of weeks later, I came in and, after looking around indecisively, I gathered my things and sat briefly on a chair near the registers to get my payment ready. I‚Äôd been coming here for a long time, so you‚Äôd think the staff would recognize me by now ‚Äî I‚Äôm in there often enough. I understand employees need to monitor the store, but this felt unnecessary for someone who has consistently supported the business. Still, an employee promptly came and told me I couldn‚Äôt sit there because ‚Äúthe boss doesn‚Äôt like that,‚Äù even though I was preparing to check out and wasn‚Äôt bothering anyone. I got up, paid, and left quietly.

The first bigger issue was with the hot water which happened a couple of weeks after the chair incident ‚Äî I was told I had to pay, but the staff didn‚Äôt give me a price, they just told me ‚Äúyou‚Äôre good this time, but next time you have to pay,‚Äù so I bought and left two York bars with tap-to-pay for around $2 to cover it.

About a week later, they told me it was 50¬¢ per cup because I bought the noodles somewhere else (some guy I never met before was behind the counter and made up the charge on the spot). I showed them the noodles and asked them to please have their manager stock the store with them so that I could buy it from them instead. I then tried to pay $1 by card but was told there was a $5 card minimum. I left, got change, came back, and paid in cash. They gave me chopsticks for free that time, as they had plenty of other times when I used hot water while it was free for noodles whether bought in-store or at the market across the street.

Later that same day, I came in again to use the hot water. I immediately gave the guy 50¬¢, made my noodles as usual, and went to the register to get chopsticks ‚Äî like I had done many times before. That‚Äôs when I was suddenly told I had to pay for the chopsticks because I hadn‚Äôt bought the noodles in the store. The rules and prices kept changing, and It was repeatedly and inconsistently happening to me despite always being a fair, respectful, and loyal customer.

This inconsistent treatment makes me feel disrespected, and unwelcome. I‚Äôve supported this store happily, but after these incidents, I no longer feel comfortable coming here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came April 24 around 9:30 for a bagel.   The man waiting on my was nice but i noticed the sushi maker picking his nose behind the line.  He made eye contact and still picked away.  What‚Äôs even worse is he didn‚Äôt wash his hands after.  He just went back to making sushi.   I will definitely not return to this place', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I don‚Äôt usually write reviews, but this was really disappointing.
I bought a lunch box here, and they charged me including the weight of the paper container itself ‚Äî about 0.5 lb. That means I paid around $5‚Äì6 more than the actual food price.
When I pointed it out, the person just said, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs cheap for New York prices,‚Äù instead of fixing the issue.
That‚Äôs not how honest business should be done.
Please double-check the scale and receipt before paying!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The guy sold me an expired fruit yoghurt. Really pissed by quality of the food. It was expired for  more than 24 hours and there were at least 3 more units on the shelf. When confronted about it, he was not even ashamed of his act and blamed it on me that it's my responsibility to check the labels. I would not name names but he was a student who was shrugging away his responsibility for food quality . I knew that he was clearly aware of the food being spoilt. Can't believe this is happening in usa.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very nice supermarket that seems independent. We were visiting the neighbourhood and went in to buy drinks, it turnt out into a little shopping spree as they have a really nice assortment of products (from fresh food to everything you need). It‚Äôs lucky for the neighbourhood to have such a little gem nearby! The store is clean and well maintained. I see all the comments about the owner being unfriendly and rude - it is true that when we went in, the way we were looked at was really strange. However, having a little chat with the lady / owner when paying for our items, she opened up and was actually friendly. Don‚Äôt judge a book by its cover :) Extra points for the black cat walking around the store !', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Gristedes
address: 315 S End Ave, New York, NY 10280, USA
types: supermarket, atm, finance, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Stars are earned for consistency, in my eyes. I have been a customer of this Gristedes for no less than nine years. It has always been a quick spot items can be picked up. It is not a huge story. For what it is sizewise it has a good offering with product that is fresh.

The staff is friendly. There are faces I have known over the years. They are friendly.

If you have a complaint, tell the owner. He is not shy. He owns a radio station in NYC.

The store is down the street from Brookfield Mall, near enough by to the World Trade Center, near enough by to the Hudson River, across the street from where FINRA now has its NYC offices, I am told, in the heart of apartment buildings. It is taxi and bus proximate, next door to a mani pedi place.

As for prices? Dont blame the store, blame the politics. You voted it in if you are a New Yorker.....

Photos are not to be used without my written permission.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'consistently out of stock of things they used to carry. Anytime I buy an avocado here it‚Äôs rotten or moldy. Always check expirations what‚Äôs the point if I have to keep returning stuff. I only go in an emergency now and order everything online.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Gristedes is a large enough chain to not have to price gauge, but it appears they do, at least at this location. Many of the items here are significantly priced up. I was shocked at my total last night, when I initially went because I assumed it would be more affordable than Whole Foods. One example:

6 rolls of Bounty paper towels here are $28.99. Whole Foods same amount $20, $12 at Wegmans. The man at the register rang up the mozzarella twice which I did not catch until later (there was a line waiting on me and only one register open).

Something fishy is definitely going on here, especially because the owner of Gristedes is John Catsimatidis, whose net worth is $4.5 billion. If they had fair prices and improved their food quality and staffing, more customers would come in to the store - there would be no need to rip people off.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a disgusting grocery store, hope they leave the city, we certainly don‚Äôt need them as much as they need us', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Battery Park located, convenient distance to shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

Much better value for the bags meat than Impossible or beyond meat alternatives. 10/10 would recommend coming here to check out the options available', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Stumbled across these mini-marshmallows and wow‚Äîthey‚Äôre the unsung heroes of my hot chocolate game! reviews:
[{'text': 'Solid stock and selection across the board. This is the best general purpose supermarket in the immediate vicinity to the neighborhood and definitely bound to be the most well priced option since the others are much closer to the financial district. I‚Äôm pretty sure their grill is open from the beginning of the day well into the afternoon so if you‚Äôre looking for a breakfast sandwich or a made to order lunch you‚Äôve got a good shot are getting what you‚Äôre after. Good selection of produce and even some ready to eat salads make this a good stop for most people‚Äôs needs. Accepting contactless payment methods is a major plus for me as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'very small store with not many options but excellent fresh produce', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Good for quick stops, in and out... Not a GREAT variety of brands, but very moderately sensible prices.  Taking advantage of their reasonable sales weekly, is a great way to save even more cash... EBT Accepted.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Best grocery store ever, all the workers and the manager was super kind and helpful! The fruits were very fresh! Highly recommend the fresh cut fruits!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Complaint about this Cashier   Nicole (from my Receipt dated  5/6/26 -  invoice  00110602 -   Since  Cororate office DID NOT RSPOND TO MY EMAIL ,  I Deciced to post the letter (to corporate here to the rest of America to see)

My in-laws  / I visited the store as I   usually do to purchase my weekly groceries. At checkout, I had one reusable bag with me but no additional recycling bag. When I requested another bag, a woman named Nicole charged me 5 cents for it. I pointed out that individuals using EBT and SNAP benefits are exempt from this fee. Upon hearing this, I noticed her expression change, as if she was aware of the regulations but was acting as if she knew more about SNAP and EBT than I did. Fortunately, a short Latino man who worked in the store overheard our conversation and corrected her, stating that I was right.

It seems that her anger towards my 64-year-old in-law was far from resolved. She rang up my groceries without offering any assistance in bagging them. After completing the transaction, she stood with her arms crossed, awaiting the next customer. Furthermore, she carelessly dropped the receipt on my groceries and moved on to the next customer, disregarding my items. There was no expression of gratitude or acknowledgment.   I would ask you to  to review the camera footage, as it captures everything.

I am uncertain if she is new, but he mentioned that she has never interacted with this cashier before. It is essential for her to understand the importance of respect and adherence to protocols. If she is unfamiliar with the standard operating procedures (SOP), she should consult the manager rather than being confrontational and dismissive towards customers. Such behavior can significantly impact the reputation of a well-established brand like Key Food. I have been part of this establishment since 1977, and it takes years to cultivate a brand's name. A single misstep, such as the one made by Nicole, can tarnish Key Food's reputation. If this individual is unable to effectively engage with customers, she should not be representing your brand.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly
address: 101 Liberty St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: italian_restaurant, pizza_restaurant, grocery_store, cafe, food_store, event_venue, restaurant, bar, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "A wonderful restaurant and eateries. The atmosphere is lively and fun, and the Italian dishes are delicious and very fresh. The service is friendly and the staff is helpful. It's a pleasant experience that makes the place a special destination for food lovers.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Eataly is one of those places that manages to capture the true essence of Italy  from the aroma of freshly baked focaccia to the sound of baristas calling out espresso orders in Italian. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by a vibrant mix of markets, restaurants, and wine bars that make you forget you‚Äôre even in New York. The variety is unmatched. You can grab a perfect cappuccino in the morning, a fresh plate of pasta at lunch, and finish the evening with wine and tiramisu. The ingredients are incredibly fresh most of them imported directly from Italy. The pizza is a standout, especially the Margherita with its chewy crust and fragrant basil. The gelato counter is another must-stop; the pistachio flavor alone is worth the trip. One time I stopped by just to grab olive oil and ended up in a full conversation with one of the staff members about different types of truffle salts. He actually opened a jar for me to smell and recommended pairing it with roasted potatoes or scrambled eggs. That small, genuine gesture turned a quick errand into a memorable experience and yes, I left with the truffle salt and zero regrets.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely amazing! Fresh Italian cuisine that‚Äôs hard to put into words. The supermarket section is incredible, and I even got to watch mozzarella being made (and was given a sample!). The staff was so friendly, and the meals came in generous portions and were incredibly yummy. I had to make a coffee stop and get an affogato‚Äîwow, it was the perfect finish. The Italian soda was also a big plus! I love all the fresh options in the market, with the highest-quality ingredients. So many choices, and the view is just stunning.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Claudia Andreani was an excellent host, answered all of our questions about reservations. We were seated with a great view of the city and 9/11 Memorial. Our server, Cristian C, was attentive, answered our questions and responded professionally to the one food concern that we had. Great experience!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pasta is simply irresistible. The flavors are deep and rich, and the cheese adds the perfect creamy touch. The calamari appetizer impressed me as well‚Äîcrispy without being greasy, and packed with flavor.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 270 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, food_store, market, food, point_of_interest, health, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': '‚ù§Ô∏èüá∫üá∏ today I picked up Electrolytes by Noom, Just Water, & a Banana Cinnamon Koia. I was happy to run into Jess Coleman‚Äôs family nearby also Patrons of this whole-foods.

I spoke with his father about community engagement, and how much this wholefoods brings our community together.

Just got a Koia vanilla Bean to start our day & a few Lacroix before we head to Sirius dog run.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pizza here is surprisingly good. The food bar itself is top quality. One of the best Whole Foods in the city. Very large layout. Endless organic products.
Great location too by WTC, financial district, and hudson river park.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "üåª Unforgettable Service at Whole Foods‚ÄîThanks to Samantha!
I had the absolute pleasure of being helped by Samantha at the flower section inside Whole Foods, and I truly cannot say enough good things about her. From the moment I walked up hoping to find sunflowers for my sister‚Äîher favorite flower‚ÄîSamantha greeted me with warmth and genuine care.
üíê Above and Beyond Service There was only one bouquet of sunflowers available, so I decided to get roses instead. While waiting for them to be wrapped, I asked Samantha if there were any more sunflowers. She kindly asked me to wait and said she‚Äôd check in the back. She magically returned with the most stunning sunflowers I‚Äôd ever seen‚Äîfresh, golden, and vibrant, like sunshine bundled into stems. She wrapped them with beautiful attention to detail, adding her own artistic touch to make them feel like a true gift.
üòä A Touch of Humanity and Knowledge With a cheerful smile, Samantha shared a little sunflower lore, including the fact that they‚Äôre the national flower of Ukraine‚Äîsomething I hadn‚Äôt known. That moment turned a simple purchase into a meaningful encounter. She didn‚Äôt just sell flowers‚Äîshe offered joy, warmth, and a touch of culture all in one.
üåü More Than a Transaction Samantha elevated the experience from routine to unforgettable. Her kindness and enthusiasm were contagious‚Äîleaving me with a huge smile and attracting admiration wherever I went with the sunflowers.
If you ever find yourself near the flower counter at Whole Foods and Samantha‚Äôs there, trust me: you're in for more than just a bouquet. You're in for a moment of grace, beauty, and genuine human connection.
Thank you, Samantha, for turning a simple errand into a lasting memory. üåª‚ú®
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Revisited with Hope to Upgrade My Review ‚Äî Unfortunately, Things Got Worse

I came back to Whole Foods Tribeca hoping to update my last review and give the store a better rating ‚Äî as 99% of my reviews are positive. Sadly, what I witnessed made that impossible.

A known bottle and can collector, carrying two filthy bags filled with recyclables, was seen stealing what appeared to be hundreds of dollars in vitamins. He then made his way to the salad bar, where the dirty cans repeatedly brushed against the food. Shockingly, security watched and did nothing. I informed customer service, who also failed to act.

As customers, we deserve clean, healthy food and a basic standard of hygiene. This experience was unacceptable, and I will never return to the Tribeca Whole Foods salad bar again.

Please see the attached photos.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Every time I come here, I enjoy shopping and eating. You can find everything you need: fresh ingredients, ready-made meals, and a very large buffet with freshly prepared dishes. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and you never have to wait long at the checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hong Kong Supermarket
address: 157 Hester St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This place has almost everything. Food and seafood and vegetables and fruit and snacks and dairy and produce and meat and candy. The only thing that I would say is, it would be great if they were a little bit cleaner and it smells fresh. But this chain of groceries provide provides a lot of groceries for the community and Taurus alike because they have so many things that they sell here. It‚Äôs best not to drive a car because it‚Äôs such a hassle. You should be taking a subway or biking around to get here. It has 2 floors! Huge.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you are a fan of exotic foods and looking for a unique culinary experience, the "Hong Kong" supermarket in New York is definitely worth a visit. The store offers an impressive selection of Asian products, including rare fruits and vegetables that are hard to find in regular supermarkets.

The variety is remarkable ‚Äì you will find tropical fruits, exotic vegetables, and unique spices suitable for a wide range of Asian cuisines. Additionally, there is a rich selection of ready-to-eat foods, authentic sauces, and essential ingredients for traditional Chinese, Japanese, and Thai cooking.

The store is well-organized, making it easy to navigate, although it can get a bit crowded, especially during peak hours. Prices vary ‚Äì some items may be slightly more expensive compared to regular supermarkets, but given their quality and uniqueness, the shopping experience is well worth it.

In summary, "Hong Kong" is a must-visit destination for anyone who enjoys exploring new flavors and discovering high-quality Asian products. If you are looking to try something new or bring a taste of Asian cuisine home, this is the place for you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I purchased this fruit on Friday, July 11, in the afternoon. However, when I checked it this morning (Sunday, July 13), I found that it was spoiled and moldy. I went to the supermarket with my receipt, but they refused to exchange or refund the item.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beware when buying seafood at this supermarket.
On September 28 around 12:53 PM, I specifically chose a fish that was fresh. After handing it over to be descaled, I was given a different fish. When I got home, it smelled foul and had an unusual color. There‚Äôs not way it could have changed that much in such a short a short time- it clearly wasn‚Äôt the one I selected.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very disappointing experience with cashier #158 on this day. She was extremely rude and threw my shopping items as if they were garbage. When I pointed this out, she arrogantly responded, ‚ÄúJust report it to a manager; I don‚Äôt care.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not sure if this is a common issue or she just had a bad day, but I will never shop there again. There should be basic manners ÊïôÈ§ä in customer service. I do not recommend this store at all.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly - SoHo
address: 200 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: grocery_store, cafe, food_store, italian_restaurant, market, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'We were in the mood for pizza but wanted to sit down and some of the other places we had looked at were really busy.  when we passed by eatly we had heard about it so decided to check it out.

we were seated and greeted right away and right away ordered the rustico bread.  we then ordered the caesar salad plus marguerite pizza with eggplant.  the bread was supposed to come out first but the server messed up and everything came out at the same time.

the bread was very good, excellent in fact with good portion size and good taste.  the pizza was also good, more cheese and less eggplant but still a good, thin crust pizza.  the caesar salad was average as it was basically lettuce and dressing

overall good food and a nice ambiance', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Eataly SoHo ‚Äî My New Favorite Italian Spot in NYC üçù‚ú®

I finally stopped by Eataly in SoHo and wow‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm obsessed! The atmosphere is so warm and chic dim lighting, beautiful table settings, and that classic Italian energy that makes you feel like you‚Äôre on vacation in Milan.

I ordered the ravioli, and it was everything. Perfectly al dente pasta with the most flavorful sauce you can taste the freshness in every bite. I paired it with a glass of white wine that balanced it beautifully.

And then the dessert‚Ä¶ pure magic üçØ The pistachio cream topped with honey drizzle might be one of the best things I‚Äôve ever had rich, silky, and just sweet enough.

Service was amazing, the vibe was immaculate, and every detail felt so well-thought-out. Whether you‚Äôre here for a cute date night, a solo glass of wine, or a content-worthy meal Eataly delivers.

üìçSoHo, NYC
üí´ Must-try: The ravioli + pistachio dessert combo
üç∑ 10/10 ambience and presentation', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'i know it is now fall üçÇ and the weather has cooled down a lot. but it does not hurt to get iced, or even frozen, drinks.
Eataly Soho is my one and only spot for frozen espresso ‚òïÔ∏è ($7.25). this cremespresso is slushy-like espresso. it is super refreshing, mildly sweet, and still packed with caffeine for the day. i‚Äôd say it is creamier than slushy, but less than ice cream üç®

eataly is THE spot for italian groceries. i always get fresh pasta, sauces, and high quality cheese from here. their sandwiches, cakes, and pizza also look fire üçï

if you use too good to go app, you will also find eataly there. but i heard you will have to be fast at reserving eataly goodie bag bc it offers the best deal with high quality sandwiches, pasta, and bakery ü•ñ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not as large as other Eataly‚Äôs, especially their Vegas  location.  Dined at the restaurant and was very satisfied with our meal.  We had their MARGHERITA ‚ÄòA RUOTA DI CARRO‚Äô pizza.  That had to be one of the best pizza I ever had.  I couldn‚Äôt believe how thin the crust was.  So tasty.  I highly recommend their pizzas.

We also had their Fettuccine Alfredo.  The pasta was cooked al dente and was so good.  To finish off our lunch we had the PANNA COTTA AI FRUTTI DI BOSCO.  Great way to end our meal.

The only knock, they need a hostess to greet and seat parties as there was nobody there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Last time we visited, the appetizers were decent but the pastas were terrible. They got our order mixed up and insisted they were correct. The pasta was overcooked, as you can see in the photo I posted. The food also took at least 40 minutes, and when we asked why, they simply said there was a ‚Äúproblem in the kitchen.‚Äù On top of that, they charged extra for olives and pepperoni on the pizza without explaining the additional fees. The whole experience was disappointing.

However, after I left that review, the manager, Parker, replied and apologized for the inconvenience, offering us a gift card if we gave them another chance. We came back today, and the experience was completely different. They welcomed us warmly, offered us a complimentary appetizer and dessert, and also gave us a $50 gift card. On top of that, they surprised us with an extra pasta on the house. The food was much better this time, and the service had improved a lot as well.

It really felt like they cared about making things right.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Happier Grocery
address: 365 Canal St Ground Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have a conflicted review. As someone with a ton of food allergies, this place was a dream. SO many options, especially gluten free. I was super excited and it was like eye candy to look at all the fun brands they had. However, almost all of the food disappointed me. Expensive and not very expensive-tasting. The thing I enjoyed most was from Sixteen Mill Bakeshop, so it wasn‚Äôt exactly from Happier Grocery. However, the staff was very kind!! It‚Äôs also a beautiful place in a great location. Overall, I‚Äôd definitely come back, but I wouldn‚Äôt choose to have my whole meal here', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Although the prices are bit expensive you get variety of great healthy food options....\nI tried thier packed salad, sushi and hot food and everything was excellent üëå', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a cute spot with an amazing salad bar and unique beauty finds although does err a bit ‚Äòwoo woo‚Äô. The staff downstairs were so helpful and friendly but the checkout staff were rude and miserable, nothing happy about them.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is a grocery store to buy hard to access items. They sell  nuts, milks, chocolates, chips, coffee drinks, apparel, cheeses and so forth. Very few items overlap with pantry of whole foods, but those which do - the price point for most products is about $1-3 higher than whole foods. To give a sense of fanciness - the examples of items in each category are pistachio kernels, pistachio milk, sake chocolates, rose flavored potato chips. This shop is not for the masses. It is for people with a certain taste and preferences which demands a high purchasing power. I would recommend a visit to simply browse and pick a few items for novelty. Fruits, and veggies are reasonably priced. They also have a coffee bar. They also sell jackets which claim to protect against electromagnetic waves. The best and perhaps most useful item is Raw milk. They have partnered with Amish dairy and sell A2 raw milk and other dairy products on pre-order and pickup only basis. Overall, a very cool grocery store with high quality, unique products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place gets a lot of hype online and it‚Äôs definitely elevated from your typical NYC bodega but it‚Äôs still just a grocery store. Kind of a cross between Whole Foods, Erewhon, and a foodie boutique, it‚Äôs worth a look. Plenty of items to choose from on to levels including self care, grab and go food and pantry essentials. The store definitely gets crowded - mostly with tourists and browsers. Prices are high but they are pretty much everywhere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: La Parisienne
address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
types: cafe, sandwich_shop, coffee_shop, breakfast_restaurant, wine_bar, french_restaurant, grocery_store, brunch_restaurant, food_store, restaurant, bar, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Such a cute little French-style brunch spot! The place is small but super cozy with a nice vibe.

Got the latte and french toast with banana, blueberries, and almond flakes ‚Äî so good! Soft, not too sweet, and perfect with the coffee. The smoked salmon and avocado toast was fresh and flavorful too ‚Äî love the combo with lemon and dill.

Great spot to chill, grab brunch, and enjoy some quality food and coffee. Definitely a hidden gem worth checking out! ‚òïÔ∏èüíôü•ê', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had the salmon brioche and a croque madame, both were very good. The coffee was solid too, but the real highlight was the dessert: the chocolate tart with ice cream is a must-try. The staff was friendly and attentive. The only downsides were the size of the space, it can feel quite cramped when crowded and the smell; our clothes held onto the food odors after leaving.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Food was delicious and priced accordingly. A little tight but makes the experience that much more memorable.  Returned to breakfast here every morning we were in NYC. Highly recommend the French toast!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome french toasts, one of the best ones in NY. Everything about it was done right. Our coffees were not right the first time. I provided the feedback to waitstaff but the owner himself took over and brought us perfect lattes.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wonderful place with plenty of healthy options. I had the multigrain avocado toast with a side of roasted sweet potato‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Cozy, bright atmosphere that feels welcoming. Huge thanks to Dana for the warm, attentive service!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Jubilee Marketplace
address: 99 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
types: supermarket, food_court, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Overall rating: 3.5

I saw this place on TikTok from one of my favorite food creators and was very excited to try since I work in the area. I told one of my Korean coworkers about it, & when she looked at the pictures she didn‚Äôt seem convinced. I, still hopeful, went solo.

There were only maybe 2-3x Korean options, the rest was all Chinese and American which is fine‚Ä¶ I just went to try Korean hot food. Unfortunately I think I had higher expectations than reality. The food quality was just alright. Nothing special. Won‚Äôt be in my lunch rotations.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "be super careful about expiration dates. prices on produce are OK but for pantry staples and meat, go elsewhere. hot bar is nice since they lowered the price but it's good for convenience, not quality.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'You would never - in 1 million years - expect to see a place like this. And what I mean by "like this" is the fact that it offers all five-star, unbelievable, completely fresh prepared food in a well-maintained buffet environment at $11.99 a pound. As you walk around the store, it's shocking to see that some of the prices are less expensive than in Westchester County. It might be because of the proximity to Chinatown, but you'll see some photos, like turmeric in perfect pieces for $5.99 per pound. Good luck finding that price anywhere. Period. The entryway makes it look so unassuming that if you don‚Äôt know it‚Äôs there, you would probably never walk in. But please trust me, it is definitely worth the visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The food here is great & there's no shortage of a great selection.  You can enjoy cooked food, prepared salads, you pick salads & sandwiches to order, plus they are a fully stocked grocery store.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Delicious cheese burger for $2.75. Has everything on it you could want. And the supermarket has a great selection of unique ingredients at a very fair price.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Dumbo Market
address: 66 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Very nice market. It is quite late and they truly seem to be carrying a little of everything.

As you enter the store you will find the produce straight ahead, and a very good cafe and dining area on your right.

The coffee, espresso, and cappuccino are better and less expensive than the big green shop across the street. Great service at a great price. They also bake their own pastries.

In the back of the store you will find a salad bar that is reasonably priced and has a large variety of foods.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It was my first time in a store where fruits and vegetables were so perfectly laid out on the counter shelves, everything looked so fresh and bright. I especially remember that greens in large quantities in a container are not expensive. They also have a hot food bar, I didn‚Äôt try the food, but the smell was very good. I will definitely come back here again. There is also a coffee shop inside - which is also very useful :)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We took hot box food and it was amazing. Pretty pricey but tasty. Added bonus is that they also have seating area available. The only point of improvement is that we were looking to go to toilet as we saw some customers using it and then a staff member angrily advised this is for staff only. Put a sign then so people know.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '5 stars! This grocery store is very well organized and clean, which makes shopping here a breeze. The shelves are always well-stocked with a great variety of products, including fresh produce, international items, and everyday essentials. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of care goes into keeping things tidy and efficient. The staff is friendly, approachable, and always willing to help, which really enhances the experience. It‚Äôs a place that makes grocery shopping feel easy and enjoyable. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great market that sells organic and locally freshed produce and meats especially solid venison, lamb, and grass feed beef!! Highly recommend especially if you wanna get some good fresh kitchen food on top of it to complete the experience! Keep up the great job guys', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Rigor Hill Market
address: 227 W Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: cafe, grocery_store, bakery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Ordered the chicken bowl and the hot chocolate. The hot chocolate was as delicious and rich as I'd hoped with amazing marshmallows too. The chicken bowl was lackluster, especially for the price, with the chicken a bit dry
The roasted lemon was a nice touch and needed to bring some acidity and extra flavor. Service was quick though.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '(4.5/5) - really great bacon forward sandwiches, they just need more bacon!!! BLT was especially good, the garlic mayo was delish it just did really linger afterwards. The breakfast sandwich was less impressive and it needed the bacon forward +$3. The tomato paste was good‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs all. For $20? A bit pricy. Bread is fine but it doesn‚Äôt taste remarkably fresh or premium.

I like this place for sandwiches but I am not sure I see the value for money. Sandos are a good size for 1.

Staff are not terribly friendly - I got some unfriendly stares!

Outdoor seating. They also have fresh pressed juices, hot chocolate, coffee, matcha, bowls, cookies, pastries etc', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Lots of toddlers and dogs.

Best turkey sandwich I've ever had. Lots and lot of turkey yet not dry at all. Amazing.

Egg sandwich was also very unique. Had cheese and tomato sauce. Very good.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I'm ALWAYS on the hunt for amazing hot chocolate. When I saw an article raving about the hot cocoa at Rigor Hill Market, I knew I had to check it out.
Overall, my first visit to Rigor Hill Market was a letdown. The disappointing hot chocolate, the unpleasant sandwich I ordered, and the unfriendly service mean I won't be rushing back. Service with a side of annoyance üòí
The person at the front counter wasn't exactly winning any customer service awards. They seemed genuinely annoyed by my order, and the whole transaction felt rushed and unfriendly. Not a great first impression, especially for a first-timer like me.
To be fair, I did notice some healthy and refreshing-looking food options in their fridges. So, if that's your jam, maybe it's worth a look. They also have a small setup with a few stools and a countertop for eating. It's definitely a cozy, small space. In conclusion, there are plenty of other spots to try out in the city.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Rigor Hill Market is a gem for takeout. Their sandwiches are incredible‚Äîalways fresh, perfectly made, and packed with flavor. It‚Äôs hard to pick a favorite because everything I‚Äôve tried has been amazing. Pair a sandwich with one of their fresh juices, and you‚Äôve got the perfect meal. The juices are refreshing and made with top-notch ingredients, which you can really taste.

What I love most is the convenience. It‚Äôs the kind of place where you can grab your food and head out, but if you have the time, their outdoor seating area is a great spot to sit and enjoy your meal. It‚Äôs simple, laid-back, and adds to the charm of the whole experience.

Even though it‚Äôs a takeout-focused spot, you still feel a personal touch. The staff is always friendly and efficient, which makes the experience even better. You‚Äôre in and out quickly, but the food quality never feels rushed.

Rigor Hill Market has become a regular stop for me. Whether I‚Äôm looking for a quick, delicious lunch or a fresh juice to keep me going, it always hits the spot. If you‚Äôre in the area and haven‚Äôt checked it out yet, you‚Äôre seriously missing out. This place is all about great food, great drinks, and a no-fuss, enjoyable vibe. Highly recommend it!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Deluxe Food Market
address: 79 Elizabeth St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'We ended up frequenting this not so deluxe market because the pharmacy my MIL uses gave out gift cards after x number of prescription fills.

The market is narrow but spans the block between Elizabeth and Mott St. Half of the market serves groceries and the other, cooked foods. We primarily consume at the latter, which consists of a bakery, a BBQ counter, a sushi section, and hot food counter.

Prices are generally good and competitive. But a few times we would get fooled by a few bargains. They would flip or hide the burnt side of pork and put them on clearance, only for people like me who took the bait to find out the whole thing was inedible. We have caught them cheating on non-sale items as well. For example, hiding wing tips under the duck wings, attempting to mislead by placing a case of 8 plain dumplings in front of a buffet of fried dumplings which only come with 5 pieces, etc.  Every staff I have interacted with are not friendly if not outright rude, and will stiff you as if it‚Äôs their own business.  The cashier lines are normally long and chaotic.

In other words, even though the prices are good, the experiences have been awful.   I can really care less about this place; unfortunately, I will have to be back - thanks to the gift cards from the pharmacy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This Asian food market is a one-stop shop for all your Chinese food cravings. They have sections for poultry, frozen dumplings, hot pot, seafood, fresh vegetables, baked goods, roast meats, sushi, hot foods, and more. At the hot foods section, you can get a whole platter of vegetables and meat for under $5. We got a pork and veggies platter for $4.75 and a sago coconut milk for $1.75. You can also get congee for under $4 here. There's so many things that you can buy just for a couple dollars at this food market.

Deluxe Food Market is so bustling The place is packed from beginning to end and during meal times, it's shoulder to shoulder, which can get overwhelming. If you come at night before closing there's big market discounts on the food!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was here mainly for the large and really well stocked bakery section.
Gets really busy during lunch hours, so be prepared to stand in line at the cashiers with Chinese uncles pushing you every which way!
The food is really good value for money, and you would do well going here for staples like the giant BBQ pork buns over some local takeaways.
I also really liked their cocktail buns. Definitely check out this place when you‚Äôre in the are. Just don‚Äôt make my mistakes and grab so much food ‚Äúas a snack for later‚Äù that you spoil your dinner, lmao', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This market is busy, filled with people, and can be pretty overwhelming. However, there is a large section of boxes goods and prepared foods you can order. If you can get lucky, as for the fluffy scallion pancakes. They have plain and beef filled, but I think plain is better if you can get your hands on it! Nothing fancy, but it‚Äôs supposed to be only $2 each, and you can‚Äôt beat that for a warm bread.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'They have really good and cheap already made, to-go food box. But there‚Äôs also a few seats that you can kind of dine in. I had chicken rice and dumpling box, it was actually good! I‚Äôll try roast duck box next time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Gem Home
address: 181 Mott St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: cafe, grocery_store, food_store, home_goods_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Nice little cafe/home store!! It‚Äôs a good place to work outside the hrs of 11-3 bc most of the tables are no laptop zone at those times. They also have no public wifi!! Cardamom bun here was yummy though, but mostly pretty expensive for anything here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazing little cozy spot with a great selection of quick bites and drinks. I originally came to the area for that extremely hyped up pizza spot around the corner, but I‚Äôm so glad I skipped the long lines and those gentrified high pizza prices there and cane here instead. This hidden gem really hit the spot, and I‚Äôll definitely be coming back! Money and my time definitely well spent.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Actually feels like a home, especially with the choice of furniture and the layout. Loved the pastries, although the coffee could be better. Lots of market goods you can purchase as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '$19 sourdough plate. Everything cold, big plain slice of cheese, $4 soft egg not pre-cut open. Cold.
üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇ
Feels like those in the 18 century oil paintings.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely disappointing experience.

I had an extremely unpleasant interaction with a tall East Asian male staff member who tied his hair. My friend and I were still finishing our wine when he approached me immediately after I finished mine, asking if I wanted another. I said no, but he took the glass without a word and came back asking for payment‚Äîeven though we never asked for the check. My friend hadn‚Äôt even finished her drink.

It felt like we were being rushed out, and we ended up paying for our drinks under pressure. I‚Äôve lived in New York for three years, and this was one of the most uncomfortable service experiences I‚Äôve ever had.

What made it worse was when I left a 15% tip‚Äîhe audibly scoffed in front of us. Not a loud laugh, but enough for us to hear. It was humiliating and completely uncalled for.

I hope this staff member, whether he‚Äôs a manager or owner, reflects on how customers should be treated. I‚Äôm writing this because I don‚Äôt want others to go through what we experienced. No one deserves to feel disrespected at a place they chose to spend their time and money.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Sunrise Mart Êó•Á≥ª„Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº
address: 494 Broome St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: deli, asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, meal_takeaway, food_store, japanese_restaurant, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Very cute shop with lots of imported Japanese groceries. They have a nice lofted seating area where you can eat lunch or drink your beverage, it's a nice quiet place to chat. My boyfriend LOVES the french fries, which I guess are legendary. I don't but I do love their sushi, which may not be fancy but is made with care and love!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love coming here for groceries. They have so many great products at good prices. Don‚Äôt sleep on The food either. It‚Äôs very tasty and fresh.  Give them a try!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Sunrise Market is an absolute gem, especially for lovers of Japanese cuisine! This market offers a fantastic variety of fresh produce, specialty Japanese items, and ready-to-eat meals that cater to a wide range of tastes. One tip for first-timers: make sure to get there early if you're aiming for their popular lunch items. These delicious offerings tend to sell out quickly, and it's easy to see why ‚Äì everything is made fresh daily and bursting with authentic flavors.

The market is well-organized and spotlessly clean, making for a pleasant shopping experience. The selection of fruits and vegetables is top-notch, always fresh and vibrant. Their range of Japanese groceries is impressive, featuring everything from high-quality sushi-grade fish to a wide array of unique snacks and beverages you might not find elsewhere.

The ready-to-eat meals are a highlight. From sushi rolls to bento boxes, everything is prepared with great care and attention to detail. It's clear that the staff take pride in their work, and it shows in the quality of the food. Their homemade onigiri (rice balls) and freshly made tempura are not to be missed!

Speaking of the staff, they are always friendly and helpful, ready to assist with any questions or recommendations. Whether you're a local or just passing through, Sunrise Market is definitely worth a visit. It's a food lover's paradise, especially if you're a fan of Japanese cuisine. You won't be disappointed!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Fresh Japanese market food ‚Äì a spot to remember for healthy food seekers. A few tables by the large window let you relax and enjoy a fresh, healthy meal right in the heart of Soho. The staff are also happy to explain what's what if you ask them.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoy going here for lunch as they serve fresh flavorful food that conveniently is displayed for busy working adults on their lunch. However while I was checking out it slipped my mind to grab a bottle of water. I ask the cashier, Vivien, that I just purchased $25 worth of food and forgot to buy a water and she said ‚Äúit doesn‚Äôt matter you still have to make the $10 minimum‚Äù and so I went ahead to grab items that makes the minimum and when I come to the register she grills me and rolls her eyes. You never know what someone is going through but my god there‚Äôs not of ounce of good customer service in her body. Won‚Äôt be coming back for a hot minute.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

reviews:
[{'text': 'I‚Äôve been a customer of this store for 18 years. And all that time the management fools customers around with the fraudulent  charges. All neighborhood love this store because of its convenience. The store has almost everything! But sometimes you buy rotten fish or chicken. I don‚Äôt buy fish anymore at this place. All other stuff might be good or bad quality. But the most disgusting thing is the cashier charges which don‚Äôt show the market prices advertised and just ignored when you pay for it. Also they set the cheap brands for the price of real more quality brands. For example: the advertised clementines $4.99 /3lb they sell the cheap brand ‚Äúpremium citrus‚Äù picture attached. Today I was going to buy cranberry cheesecake $6.99 for 12oz. The cashier gave me the price $9.49 when all the line of these cakes had no charge like that. Picture attached. The manager Sammy have been lying for years trying to explain the wrong products and wrong charges. He just takes away the advertised prices after I tell him. How many people just overpaid? Plenty!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great neighborhood supermarket with international fare and decent prices for those of us in a budget. Today I‚Äôm glad I remembered that the cooks here are Mexican and  rotisserie chicken is pretty flavorful for only $5', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The cashier was so rude to me. She asked if i wanted a bag, i said yes but she thought i said no. When i said i need a bag she said‚ÄùOh now you want a bag!‚Äù I told her that i had previously said yes and then she snapped at me  ‚Äúdo you want it or not!‚Äù The cashier next to her started laughing. I then asked how much for the bag bc i would have to pay for the bag separately and she acted like i was giving her a hard time and turned her back on me. It was so weird.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'High end for key foods.

They have a large variety of deli counter and buffet foods for those working in the area. It‚Äôs in the back left of the main floor.

I‚Äôve yet to try it, but the store had a lot of other things I needed when I took these photos for future reference', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I always have problem with this Key Food where I have to take a pic of all the items I picked that‚Äôs on sale. That‚Äôs why I don‚Äôt come here much and when I do, I make sure to take a pic of the sale price sign.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Di Palo's Fine Foods
address: 200 Grand St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Di Palo‚Äôs is a real gem in Little Italy. The fresh cheese and cold cuts are topnotch, you can really taste the quality. They also have a great selection of oils and vinegars that make it hard to walk out emptyhanded. Oldschool spot with real character and worth the visit every time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very helpful and friendly. Love that they give you a sample of what you order. First time in New York and will definitely come back to visit again. The Calabrese specialty salami melts in your mouth. Delicious!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is absolutely amazing and the staff are super friendly. We had been walking all over NYC and we wanted to take home a little bit of Italy so we hit up Little Italy and was sent to Di Pablo‚Äôs for the BEST is what we was told. But once we got there they was CLOSED‚Ä¶ yes CLOSED but there was still people inside so we waited outside and when the door opened we asked if we could just grab some pictures of the amazing shop and he allowed us in. Talked to us and he even allowed us to pick a few things. We was very greatful. I got Some Prosciutto, smoked mozzarella and salami and let me tell you it was AMAZING. And the SHIP!!! You just have to call them personally to place your order. I can‚Äôt stress enough making sure you stop in and check out this amazing gem hidden way down in Little Italy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Di Palo‚Äôs Fine Foods is a true gem in the heart of Little Italy, offering an authentic Italian experience that feels like stepping into a piece of old New York. For over 100 years, this family-owned shop has been serving some of the finest Italian products in the city.

The selection of cured meats and cheeses is outstanding. I highly recommend the Porchetta‚Äîthinly sliced roasted pork, seasoned with just the right amount of rosemary. The Di Palo family and staff take their time with each customer, not only providing recommendations but also offering samples of their products.

While the shop can get crowded, especially on weekends, the wait is always worth it.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "DiPalo‚Äôs Cheese Shop in New York City is a true gem nestled in the heart of Little Italy. With a legacy spanning over a century, this family-run establishment offers an authentic taste of Italy that‚Äôs hard to find elsewhere. From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with warmth and genuine hospitality‚Äîstaff treat you like family, taking time to explain the origins and flavors of their products with passion and expertise.
The shop boasts an impressive selection of Italian cheeses, cured meats, and specialty items, many of which are imported directly from Italy. Whether you're looking for a creamy burrata, a sharp Parmigiano-Reggiano, or a silky prosciutto di Parma, DiPalo‚Äôs delivers top-tier quality. Their fresh mozzarella, made in-house, is a standout‚Äîdelicate, milky, and perfect for any dish.
Beyond the products, what makes DiPalo‚Äôs special is the experience. It‚Äôs not just a place to shop; it‚Äôs a place to learn, taste, and connect with Italian culinary tradition. The atmosphere is bustling yet intimate, with locals and tourists alike drawn in by the aroma and charm.
DiPalo‚Äôs is more than a cheese shop‚Äîit‚Äôs a cultural institution. Whether you're stocking up for a dinner party or just indulging in a personal treat, it‚Äôs worth the visit. Be prepared to wait during peak hours, but rest assured: the quality and service make it well worth your time.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Bubby's
address: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: american_restaurant, brunch_restaurant, bakery, breakfast_restaurant, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'went to Bubby‚Äôs for breakfast, and although it was packed with about a 45-minute wait, it was absolutely worth it. The atmosphere was lively and cozy, the kind of bustling New York breakfast spot that makes you feel like you‚Äôre part of something special.
I ordered the homemade home fries, which came Southern-style with saut√©ed onions and peppers. They were perfectly seasoned and had that crispy, golden edge that‚Äôs hard to get just right.
The highlight, though, was the fried chicken and pancakes served with bourbon maple syrup. The pancakes were fluffy and rich, with a twist, there‚Äôs sour cream in the batter, which gives them a subtle tang and an extra tender texture. It‚Äôs a small detail that makes a big difference.
I also sampled the cheese grits, and they were creamy, comforting, and full of flavor, a perfect side to round out the meal.
Overall, Bubby‚Äôs delivered a fantastic Southern-inspired breakfast experience right in the heart of NYC. If you don‚Äôt mind the wait, it‚Äôs a must visit spot for a hearty and memorable brunch.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Bubby's in Tribeca offers a very welcoming atmosphere with its rustic and cozy ambiance. We had the pleasure of trying the Pancake Flight and the Chicken and Pancakes. The chicken was prepared to perfection, being both crispy and juicy, while the pancakes were delightfully fluffy and flavorful, accompanied by a variety of toppings such as caramelized banana, walnuts, blueberry, Nutella, mixed berries, and whipped cream. I also enjoyed the refreshing Hibiscus Iced Tea, which included complimentary refills.

The staff provided exceptional service; they were notably friendly and attentive. Although we were informed of an approximate 45-minute wait, we were seated much sooner. The host thoughtfully engaged with those waiting in line outside and checked on us periodically, which was a kind gesture. Our waitress demonstrated excellent knowledge and efficiency throughout our visit.

Please be aware that the pricing is on the higher side, with an expected cost of $30-$50 per person.

The location is easily accessible via the #1 train at Franklin Street, the 2 or 3 trains at Chambers Street, or the A, C, or E trains at Canal Street.

It is conveniently situated near the 9/11 Memorial & Museum and other remarkable downtown attractions.

We recommend visiting for the excellent food and staying to explore the rich history, arts, and culture of the area..", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The hostess Lena was incredibly kind and very efficient. The line for a table was long, and yet she was able to get our party seated quickly. Our server Alex was also wonderful. She was nice and very attentive. The food was great, as always! Highly highly recommend Bubby‚Äôs for anyone who may be visiting the city. Thank you guys for a wonderful experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Friendly service and short wait. Don‚Äôt pass it up because of the lines - we didn‚Äôt wait as long as the originally quoted.
Great coffee and even better brunch food! We tried the pancake flight and eggs Benedict - both were so tasty! It seems like they use healthier ingredients because I‚Äôm sensitive to seed oils and heavily processed ingredients and I felt great afterwards.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love Bubby‚Äôs and waiting lines are not as bad as it seems.

Must have the Nutella and berry jam‚Äôs pancakes. Huge, definitely for, at least, 3 people sharing.
I usually split a salted and a sweet dish in 2 but pancakes are huge. Should go with plenty space for that brunch!

Fries are really good too. Not the house ones tho', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Century 21 NYC
address: 22 Cortlandt St, Manhattan, NY 10007, USA
types: department_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Century 21 NYC, located at 22 Cortlandt Street, New York, is back after reopening its famous flagship store. The new version is smaller than before but modern, clean, and well organized. You‚Äôll find designer clothing, shoes, and accessories, though the selection is not as wide as in the past and prices feel a bit higher than old Century 21 days. Still, it‚Äôs worth a visit for those who remember the iconic store and want to shop for recognizable brands in Lower Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I returned Century 21 after over 10 years.

When I was tourist, this place was my favorite. I would go crazy and picked up bargains from mountains of clothes.(longtime ago, the store was a place of chaos)

As others have mentioned, there are fewer products available now, but I was surprised at how organized the store is.

The fitting rooms are as beautiful as a high end boutique, and there are many private rooms, which is great!

It‚Äôs a discount store for brands items, so prices aren‚Äôt as cheap as Marshalls or TJ Max.
But I searched carefully and found a T-shirt for my husband and workout top for myself at a great price, so I‚Äôm happy.

I recommend going to the store as soon as it opens so you can enjoy shopping without others.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Had a blast in the Suit department yesterday.  Was there to get outfits for a wedding, and my mom came with for moral support and advice.  Derek took great care of us, was super kind and helpful, was responsive when I liked and didn't like things, and helped us find a couple fits that I was really happy with.  The tailor - Jack? - also really looked after us and was a lot of fun! Especially for someone who doesn't browse the suit department very often, it was a great experience and a real boost to have the two of them on our team üôè", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Most of their outlets were closed down post Covid and this is the only outlet available now across New York. Spanning across 4 floors, they still hold a very decent amount of branded and luxury fashion goods - from sunglasses, jackets, handbags, to shoes, jeans and undergarments. Designs and sizes will vary according to availability and what you see is also depending on your luck. Grab what you can once you have your eyes on it as you never know if that will be the last piece ever. Stall was well-organized generally and staff was helpful.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love the clearance items at C21 and the amazing designer items and great quality! My fav store!! Quality items, staff is patient and helpful, great deals. C21 cannot be beat. So grateful it‚Äôs back!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Mei Lai Wah
address: 41 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: chinese_restaurant, asian_restaurant, bakery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I was here with my buddy today and we stopped in for a quick bite. This is one of the best roast pork buns and shumai I ever had. Interestingly the fusion Chinese food I had in Peru might still be my favorite but this was great. The roast pork was tender and sweet, and the bun was nice and soft. I would have easily devoured another one but we still had other places to try. The shumai was packed with flavor and I enjoyed those just as much.

They‚Äôre very busy as they should be, but the line moved fast. Within 2 minutes my order was taken and I got the food very fast. The roast pork bun was $2.50 and shumai was $6.50. The menu online shows $3 and $7.50 so the prices must have recently gone down or the menu is just wrong. I would definitely come back here and try the pineapple pork bun.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The legendary ‚Äúpineapple‚Äù bbq pork bun lives up to its reputationüëçGlad that we came early while there‚Äôs no line but it‚Äôs a treat that‚Äôs worth the wait. The bun has perfect crust, generous tasty juicy filling in a thin sweet bun roll. And the size is decently large.  Also highly recommend the ‚ÄúBig‚Äù special bun. It‚Äôs basically a meal in large steam bun with tons of filling with pork, chicken, Veggies, Chinese sausage, even eggs.  Very very tasty and a real low cost and quick power-up as a refill for touring NYC and Chinatown and nearby areas.  We did not sit down and just inhaled the buns next to the shop and moved onto the next destination ü§£ Overall a great visit for the bun.  Totally worth the trip ü•∞', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of the most famous Chinese bakeries in Manhattan‚Äôs Chinatown, and I‚Äôd heard so much about it from food vloggers that I had to try it for myself. I went with a friend on a weekend afternoon, and even though it was later in the day, the place was still packed. We waited about 10 minutes in line, but the staff kept things moving quickly, and once we ordered, our food came right away since everything is freshly baked and ready to go.

The selection is huge, but we decided to stick with their signature items: the pineapple-crusted pork bun and the original pork bun. Both were delicious, but the pineapple version really stood out. It‚Äôs essentially the same soft, savory pork bun, but topped with a golden pineapple crust that adds a crunchy texture and a subtle sweetness‚Äîit feels like a deluxe upgrade of the classic. The original pork bun was flavorful and satisfying as well, filled generously with savory pork.

These buns work great as a snack or can easily be shared between two people. Overall, it was a fun and tasty stop, and I‚Äôd definitely come back to try more of their offerings.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great buns at affordable prices!
I loved both the pineapple roast pork buns and the roast pork buns ‚Äî sweet, savory, and uniquely delicious. The line is split into two (cash and card), and I waited about 10‚Äì15 minutes. Once I placed my order, the buns came out within a minute or two. The pork does have some fat, so if you prefer lean meat, this might not be for you. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try the egg yolk bun ‚Äî it‚Äôs something I can‚Äôt find anywhere else near where I live!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I first heard about this place through my boyfriend and his sister. She came on vacation and came back from NY with 2 bags of these delicious pork buns!!!
I tell you one of the BEST flavors I‚Äôve tried in my life! The buns are soft and fresh, and the pork is deliciously flavored! ü§§
BRING CASH!!! Because it‚Äôs faster to pay at the end; line for cards is usually slower. (If you are in a hurry that is)

PS: The buns are only $2.50 each !!!!! ü´®', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: ZARA
address: 503 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Zara ‚Äì SoHo, NYC
üìç 503 Broadway, New York, NY 10012

This is hands-down my favorite Zara location in the city. The store is huge, super clean, and always well-stocked with a great variety of clothes, including trendy seasonal pieces and classic staples. If you‚Äôre a Zara lover, this one is worth the visit.

What really makes the SoHo location stand out for me is how organized it is. Unlike some other Zara stores in NYC that can feel chaotic, this one has a separate line for purchases and returns, which makes everything so much smoother. I went on a weekend and was pleasantly surprised that the line to check out moved quickly.

The layout is spacious, and the fitting rooms were open and functioning, which is not always the case in busy Manhattan locations.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Highlights:
‚Ä¢ Best Zara in NYC for selection and space
‚Ä¢ Separate return and purchase lines (huge plus!)
‚Ä¢ Clean, organized, and less chaotic than other branches
‚Ä¢ Located right in SoHo, perfect for a shopping day out', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I visited Zara‚Äôs today and was disappointed with the experience. There were 27 people in line for returns online and 2 for in-store purchases, but only one associate working the cash register. It was clear the store wasn‚Äôt prepared to manage the crowd efficiently, which made for a frustrating experience. They really need to get their staffing and organization together. Also noticed the prices are really went up, see in the second video how they cover the previous price tag and how it compares to Europe', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The short security guard with the beard is a joke. He'll treat you like a criminal. I accidentally left a tag on my shirt that made the sensor go off. Their system failed and never texted me my receipt so instead of being a normal person, he starts to become condescending takes possession of my clothes and tells me to go upstairs and figure it out for myself without my clothes that I had just paid almost $300 for. Then after being incredibly difficult the other security guard with the glasses who is also an absolute joke takes my clothes from the other security guard brings me upstairs then leaves me there and doesn't get a manager or anything like that. I had to find someone myself and he was the nicest person I dont understand why the security guards there are trained to treat everyone like they're criminals. Don't bother coming to this location there are plenty of others Zaras", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'After four years of shopping at this location and Zara locations all over the globe, I have only returned one item. today I attempted to make a return 2, the cashier and the manager claimed they couldn‚Äôt accept the product back because it was wrinkled &  there was a difference in color. I did not see the color difference. I tried on the shirt once at home. I told him that. does fabric wrinkling communicate how I treated the item or about the material Zara uses? Terrible experience & rude staff.
Starting today shop exclusively Aritzia!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Be sure to LOVE what you buy because returns are a NIGHTMARE if you end up losing or throwing away the receipt and you do not give them your email or phone number at the time of purchase. I even asked for a gift card rather than money back and the location cannot provide anything without a receipt. IF you do not know the exact date, amount of purchase down to the penny, sku # and store location, they cannot find your purchase and you will struggle to get any credit. Most ridiculous system for such a large corporation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target
address: 255 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA

name: Eataly
address: 101 Liberty St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: italian_restaurant, pizza_restaurant, cafe, event_venue, grocery_store, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "A wonderful restaurant and eateries. The atmosphere is lively and fun, and the Italian dishes are delicious and very fresh. The service is friendly and the staff is helpful. It's a pleasant experience that makes the place a special destination for food lovers.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Eataly is one of those places that manages to capture the true essence of Italy  from the aroma of freshly baked focaccia to the sound of baristas calling out espresso orders in Italian. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by a vibrant mix of markets, restaurants, and wine bars that make you forget you‚Äôre even in New York. The variety is unmatched. You can grab a perfect cappuccino in the morning, a fresh plate of pasta at lunch, and finish the evening with wine and tiramisu. The ingredients are incredibly fresh most of them imported directly from Italy. The pizza is a standout, especially the Margherita with its chewy crust and fragrant basil. The gelato counter is another must-stop; the pistachio flavor alone is worth the trip. One time I stopped by just to grab olive oil and ended up in a full conversation with one of the staff members about different types of truffle salts. He actually opened a jar for me to smell and recommended pairing it with roasted potatoes or scrambled eggs. That small, genuine gesture turned a quick errand into a memorable experience and yes, I left with the truffle salt and zero regrets.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely amazing! Fresh Italian cuisine that‚Äôs hard to put into words. The supermarket section is incredible, and I even got to watch mozzarella being made (and was given a sample!). The staff was so friendly, and the meals came in generous portions and were incredibly yummy. I had to make a coffee stop and get an affogato‚Äîwow, it was the perfect finish. The Italian soda was also a big plus! I love all the fresh options in the market, with the highest-quality ingredients. So many choices, and the view is just stunning.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Claudia Andreani was an excellent host, answered all of our questions about reservations. We were seated with a great view of the city and 9/11 Memorial. Our server, Cristian C, was attentive, answered our questions and responded professionally to the one food concern that we had. Great experience!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pasta is simply irresistible. The flavors are deep and rich, and the cheese adds the perfect creamy touch. The calamari appetizer impressed me as well‚Äîcrispy without being greasy, and packed with flavor.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: POP MART
address: 185 Greenwich St C1, L2055, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Our obsession lately and they now have it in NYC located in the Oculus mall on the second floor. This was a nice store but still only had a small selection and some old but not all the latest models. Prices are going up and probably due to tariff price hikes. The staff are helpful when they can. Would still come back to browse when I come back again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pop Mart is a colorful, eye-catching store that feels like stepping into a playful art gallery mixed with a toy wonderland. Its shelves are lined with rows of beautifully designed ‚Äúblind box‚Äù collectibles‚Äîsmall figurines sealed in mystery packaging, so you never know which character you‚Äôll get until you open it. The designs range from cute and whimsical to edgy and artistic, featuring collaborations with well-known artists and Pop Mart‚Äôs own iconic characters like Molly, Dimoo, and Skullpanda.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Such a cute little store. I came in to see if by some infinitesimal chance they had any Labubus. I asked a helpful employee who directed me to the register where I was able to select a big into energy blind box! The cashier was friendly and let ppl choose whichever box they wanted from the shelf behind the register. You never know so if you're nearby might as well stop in to see if you'll be lucky enough to snag something. Lots of other non-Labubu toys and figurines available too.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Went to this location for a Labubu pickup. Small store but lots of options.
Pros: They actually had Labubus for sale (Wings of Fortune and Coke - 2 per person).
Beautiful understanding ‚ÄúSister‚Äù that worked fast.
Cons: Manager is rude (tall guy).
Cashier wasn‚Äôt knowledgeable (brunette).
No shopping bags. They really expect you to carry boxes out of the store in your hand if you don‚Äôt have a bag with you. SMH', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is such a fun store and definitely recommend if you‚Äôre in the area. The staff are amazing and kind, pretty chill and don‚Äôt cause any issues. They had a pretty good stock but did not have everything I was looking for. Do note they do not sell Labubus, you have to do online store pickup only. Overall this is a great store! ‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}]
