name: Printemps New York
address: 1 Wall St, New York, NY 10005, USA
types: department_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a bad experience originally and they rectified it expeditiously. They were so gracious, polite, and helpful in the process.

The location itself has a very abundant inventory of French products from skincare, hair care, and luxury fashion. It is clean, well organized, and the interior design is top notch. Laura Gonzalez did a phenomenal job especially on the red room.

If you ever need French brand items and nice designer pieces, this is the place. Lucia and Alec were so sweet as well.

I will definitely be back for the lovely cafe, bar, and staff who were so kind and generous.

Highly recommend!! ‚ò∫Ô∏è', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve been following Gonzalez‚Äôs work for a while and of course have to make this pitstop for her first major creation in the US! It‚Äôs everything I was dreaming about and beyond! So amazed by how she created this space, every corner is pic worthy. The material she and the team behind Printemps ended up choosing to use reflects exactly how much they care about this business. Honestly so blown away by it. And the staff were super friendly. I was approached in a gentle way and once I mentioned my flight is upcoming and I‚Äôm just here for a quick browse they left me along and just enjoy my time there. Will def come back for shopping and dining!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I love the store's ambiance. It has several areas that explore art through decoration and highlight brands, all blending together to form a grand interactive work of art. I really like the intriguing and colorful layout with its expressive use of unusual materials. The winding paths between stairs, ramps, and the perfume tunnel intrigued me. It's truly an artistic immersion. I was able to buy a perfume and received excellent service. I want to go back to try the facial spa and have a drink while I buy something else. Printemps New York is more than a store; it's an artistic experience. üß°", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Printemps is a luxury interior designers dream store. The details carried throughout each space are exquisite and so well thought out. Mixed metals, materials, tiles and stone. I love this place! I have had drinks in the Red room a couple times now, (only comment is I wish there was soft music playing-it is too quiet!) however the cocktails are delicious and perfect before shopping the gorgeous curated collections.
I found some beautiful heels, with the help of Annette, who absolutely made my shopping experience personalized! She gave a tour to my husband and I, and went above and beyond helping us both try on numerous shoes to find the right pair. Can‚Äôt wait to be back and shop with her, thank you!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "A very nice department store, but the staff were not engaging with anyone except themselves. I didn't really see anyone buying anything there, which is sad. Imagine people going all the way down there to buy something, and no one even saying hello, except the doorman. It‚Äôs so sad because if people made it there to look at the place, they could be a little more genuine in converting that foot traffic. It is a beautiful department store, and I can only imagine how much they spent to build it. However, if they don‚Äôt improve their customer service and talent, this place won‚Äôt be open for long.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: T.J. Maxx
address: 483 Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: department_store, jewelry_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'October 7th, 2025
I‚Äôve placed an online order and decide to return some items since it doesn‚Äôt fit and successfully returned 2 items. The manager took my phone and started look at my order and show it to cashier. It was really uncomfortable for me but I decided just let it go.
On October 14th, 2025 I‚Äôve decide to return another item and was refused since I don‚Äôt have plastic bag/packaging anymore.

When I asked Nancy M COORDINATOR who helping me to show me the return policy regarding the need for the plastic bag, she informed me that policies are not available in the store. I also requested to see any guidelines she was following to demand the original packaging, but this was also refused.

I reviewed the TJ Maxx return policy for online orders, specifically the "returning in store" section, which states:

"In store returns, which are also subject to the above restrictions, are accepted within 40 days of your order date. If your purchase is eligible for an in store return, bring your item(s) and either your shipping confirmation email (printed or on mobile device) or the barcode/order number from your online order details to your nearest store location. To make in-store returns quicker and easier, bring the plastic packaging your items arrived in."

The policy does not state that the plastic packaging is a mandatory requirement for a return, only that it can make returns "quicker and easier."
Furthermore, Nancy M argued with me in front of other customers in a rude and disrespectful manner. She did not attempt to resolve my problem and left while I was still trying to ask questions. I remained polite and calm, simply trying to understand why I was able to return one pair of jeans without the plastic bag but was refused for the second. I was left alone without explanation or help and ultimately decided to leave the store, which was quite disheartening and humiliating as TJ Maxx is one of my favorite stores. Be careful when come for the return in store and keep all plastic packaging you have to easy and smooth return. But my customer experience was really traumatic so I decide not to deal with TJ MAXX anymore.

‚ÄºÔ∏èUpdate:‚ÄºÔ∏è
I contacted TJ Maxx customer service, and they got back to me surprisingly fast ‚Äî within just two days! The store manager, Melissa, personally called me to set up an appointment so I could return my item. I was able to return it and receive a full refund, even without the original package or plastic bag! What a surprise‚ÄºÔ∏è

However, I have to note that I didn‚Äôt receive any kind words or an apology during the process. Nancy, the coordinator who was working that day, once again acted as if she didn‚Äôt notice me ‚Äî just like during my previous visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A charming retail shop. It has 3 stories of bargains. The store is very clean and the staff are courteous. If you are traveling from out of town, plan on purchasing an extra suitcase üß≥ to haul your findings. We did üòÇ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lovely TJMaxx with a lot of awesome brand items. It is very busy and people tend to love the store so things run out fast! There are three floors and I love their bedding selections! Definitely a place to visit for household items and clothes!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The manager is so lazy! She‚Äôd rather lose customers than help her ONE cashier. While in line 4 customers walked out due to wait time while Zena the manager fumbled with what looks like a RDT. Didn‚Äôt apologize for the wait. And when people asked if there‚Äôs only one cashier she says ‚Äúyes only one‚Äù and turns her back to them. Meanwhile her beauty team is huddle up chatting.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Without a doubt, this would be the reason I would come back to US, no kidding! This is the best store, I couldn't believe the prices they had here! As an European, I wanted to spend every last dollar here (and I think I did). The only flaw is the fact they didn't have the size of sneakers I wanted to buy, so now I have to look for them in Europe on much bigger price.

Please make delivery to Europe possible! ‚ù§Ô∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 270 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, food_store, food, market, point_of_interest, health, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': '‚ù§Ô∏èüá∫üá∏ today I picked up Electrolytes by Noom, Just Water, & a Banana Cinnamon Koia. I was happy to run into Jess Coleman‚Äôs family nearby also Patrons of this whole-foods.

I spoke with his father about community engagement, and how much this wholefoods brings our community together.

Just got a Koia vanilla Bean to start our day & a few Lacroix before we head to Sirius dog run.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pizza here is surprisingly good. The food bar itself is top quality. One of the best Whole Foods in the city. Very large layout. Endless organic products.
Great location too by WTC, financial district, and hudson river park.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "üåª Unforgettable Service at Whole Foods‚ÄîThanks to Samantha!
I had the absolute pleasure of being helped by Samantha at the flower section inside Whole Foods, and I truly cannot say enough good things about her. From the moment I walked up hoping to find sunflowers for my sister‚Äîher favorite flower‚ÄîSamantha greeted me with warmth and genuine care.
üíê Above and Beyond Service There was only one bouquet of sunflowers available, so I decided to get roses instead. While waiting for them to be wrapped, I asked Samantha if there were any more sunflowers. She kindly asked me to wait and said she‚Äôd check in the back. She magically returned with the most stunning sunflowers I‚Äôd ever seen‚Äîfresh, golden, and vibrant, like sunshine bundled into stems. She wrapped them with beautiful attention to detail, adding her own artistic touch to make them feel like a true gift.
üòä A Touch of Humanity and Knowledge With a cheerful smile, Samantha shared a little sunflower lore, including the fact that they‚Äôre the national flower of Ukraine‚Äîsomething I hadn‚Äôt known. That moment turned a simple purchase into a meaningful encounter. She didn‚Äôt just sell flowers‚Äîshe offered joy, warmth, and a touch of culture all in one.
üåü More Than a Transaction Samantha elevated the experience from routine to unforgettable. Her kindness and enthusiasm were contagious‚Äîleaving me with a huge smile and attracting admiration wherever I went with the sunflowers.
If you ever find yourself near the flower counter at Whole Foods and Samantha‚Äôs there, trust me: you're in for more than just a bouquet. You're in for a moment of grace, beauty, and genuine human connection.
Thank you, Samantha, for turning a simple errand into a lasting memory. üåª‚ú®
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Revisited with Hope to Upgrade My Review ‚Äî Unfortunately, Things Got Worse

I came back to Whole Foods Tribeca hoping to update my last review and give the store a better rating ‚Äî as 99% of my reviews are positive. Sadly, what I witnessed made that impossible.

A known bottle and can collector, carrying two filthy bags filled with recyclables, was seen stealing what appeared to be hundreds of dollars in vitamins. He then made his way to the salad bar, where the dirty cans repeatedly brushed against the food. Shockingly, security watched and did nothing. I informed customer service, who also failed to act.

As customers, we deserve clean, healthy food and a basic standard of hygiene. This experience was unacceptable, and I will never return to the Tribeca Whole Foods salad bar again.

Please see the attached photos.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Every time I come here, I enjoy shopping and eating. You can find everything you need: fresh ingredients, ready-made meals, and a very large buffet with freshly prepared dishes. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and you never have to wait long at the checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Westfield World Trade Center
address: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: shopping_mall, department_store, gift_shop, shoe_store, clothing_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The Westfield World Trade Center Mall stands as a stunning symbol of resilience and rebirth in the heart of Lower Manhattan. Beneath the magnificent white wings of the Oculus, this architectural masterpiece unites commerce, art, and remembrance in one breathtaking space. Every corner reflects the enduring spirit of New York City and the unyielding strength of a nation that rose from tragedy with grace and determination. Beyond its world-class shopping and dining, the mall serves as a living tribute to American perseverance‚Äîwhere innovation meets memory, and where the promise of tomorrow proudly honors the sacrifices of the past', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The mall opened on August 16, 2016, as the largest shopping complex in Manhattan, with 125 retail spaces. It replaced The Mall at the World Trade Center, the ...
Situated at the portal of Lower Manhattan where millions of global travelers walk accross ‚Äì Westfield World Trade Center has become an instantly identifiable landmark like no other.

This architectural marvel and the most complete retail destination in New York City showcases 80+ fashion, health, beauty, lifestyle, and technology brands under the magnificent roof of the iconic Santiago Calatrava designed Oculus.

Anchored by Eataly NYC Downtown and Epicerie Boulud, fresh food and fine dining also take center stage. The Oculus at Westfield World Trade Center has become Lower Manhattan's newest meeting places and home to a multitude of community events, headline entertainment, art and cultural programming, and social activities.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This needs no introduction but it‚Äôs a beautiful architectural masterpiece and a must-see building when you‚Äôre in New York. It‚Äôs easily accessible by train but I‚Äôd recommend walking down Manhattan if you had time. It also has access to Battery Park via Brookfield Place which is another good place to visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Westfield World Trade Center is absolutely massive‚ÄîI don‚Äôt think I had enough time to see everything! The space is beautiful, modern, and filled with so many great shops. I enjoyed window shopping, trying on clothes, and testing out perfumes. Overall, it was such a fun experience and definitely worth a visit if you‚Äôre sightseeing in NYC.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'There is a kiosk in the Oculus. The name is ‚Äú1898 New York.‚Äù There‚Äôs a story behind the name and that story is history.
They have a collection of sweatshirts, hoodies, T-shirts and that unique in color and in Design. and they also have jewelry. I am sending you photographs because the price on these clothing are well-made in Australia and they go from 100 and down.  Then they go up with the Jewelry. Lovely girls that were there very lovely girls.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Sloomoo Institute
address: 475 Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: amusement_center, playground, museum, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Surprise my daughter with a visit ! Tickets were affordable but do not buy yourself unless you want to make slime. The exhibit was wonderful, lots of colors, lots of hands on activities, VERY CLEAN as well loved that the most I think :) , and the staff were so friendly. We are from CT and I even asked staff for local food suggestions which were not a disappointment. We will come visit again! Weekday was a good pick for us to come visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We planned a 3 day trip to NY to visist Sloomoo and other landmarks, we were incredibly excited to visit with our daughter, who loves slime.

Unfortunately, the experience nearly turned into a complete disaster because of the guy at the entrance.
At first, I thought maybe we were just stupid tourists, because that‚Äôs exactly how he made us feel. But then I noticed he treated other guests the same way. He was extremely rude and dismissive, to the point that my daughter kept asking, ‚ÄúWhy was he so mean to us?‚Äù

I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt , maybe he‚Äôs just tired of repeating the same instructions all day, but seriously, you are the first impression of the entire experience, and that interaction was just disgusting and made us reconsider, so we opted not to do premium experience because of this.

Thankfully, the rest of the staff was more in line with what you‚Äôd expect at a children‚Äôs attraction, friendly, engaging, and patient. I understand working with kids all day can be exhausting, but there‚Äôs no excuse for hostility, especially at a place meant to spark joy.

Now, for the good: The slime activities themselves were fantastic. It‚Äôs truly a slime lover‚Äôs paradise, fun, and creative. I wish I had more time to read the wall about the history of slime, but we had to move quickly through the different sections.

Like most children‚Äôs museums and attractions, it‚Äôs definitely overpriced. But we loved the DIY slime kits. This was by far the highlight of the visit. The variety of textures and scents was impressive.

A few tips if you plan to go:

Only come if it fits your budget.
Definitely prepay your tickets. Find some deals and discounts if you can.
Don‚Äôt rely on just the QR code. Make sure you‚Äôve signed the waiver beforehand.
Don‚Äôt enter through the back like some families did (without paying).

Once you leave, you cannot re-enter, so take your time and enjoy every area before heading out.

The only true joy I took from this trip was watching my daughter make her slime. This was a one and done for us.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "We had an absolute blast here!!  Our school held a field trip here as a reward for a year of hard work for the kids.  They had so much fun!  They closed the doors to the public for us and they treated us all like royalty!  The kids got to play in every nook and cranny of the venue.  They even got to make their own slime!!  Don't hesitate, this is a fantastic place for kids to play and learn!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Sloomoo Institute NYC was such an amazing experience! From the friendliness of every staff member to the incredible sensory fun of the slime, with its cool textures and amazing scents, everything was perfect. We loved choosing charms, mixing our own slimes, and of course, the ultimate highlight: having slime poured all over us!

It‚Äôs a super fun, kid-friendly NYC experience that we highly recommend. We‚Äôll definitely be going back. Thank you, Sloomoo, for the unforgettable memories! üíñ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This experience exceeded my expectations! My sister, daughter and I had a ball! We had so many favorite parts. We not only enjoyed watching people get slimed but we also enjoyed watching the staff have a good time doing the sliming. :) Their giggles made it so funny to watch. My daughter had questions about her slime so she asked for help. Tracey (I think that's her name) was very attentive and sweet. It warmed my heart watching them interact.
Sloomoo Crew- Thank you for making it a fun time!", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Liberty Bagels Wall Street
address: 32 Broadway, New York, NY 10004, USA
types: bagel_shop, sandwich_shop, bakery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Great bagels, super chewy, lots of flavor. The variety of cream cheeses is insane! Lots of sandwich options available too. We came 3 different days and the line was always fast, the speed to get everyone through is incredible.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The best loaded bagel sandwiches I've ever had! Such a fun place, definitely a must try while in New York. The staff at this location was so fun and helpful. The food was really quick and tasty. There was seating in the back which was great too. Yum üòã", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came by for breakfast, there was a bit of a wait but not too long, large choice of bagels, I had the Nova Bagel - smoked salmon and cream cheese - and it was absolutely delicious and filling. They don‚Äôt have cappuccino or cream coffee which was a little bit disappointing but they do have a lot of other drinks. There are some tables for seating even though it can be a bit of a wait. They also have lots of types of bagels including colored ones. Recommended !!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'OH YEAHHHH. These are some good New York bagels, exactly as I‚Äôve hoped and imagined. I think they got me with the photos because 90% of that pink stuff is tomato and not salmon. But they do not skimp you on the cream cheese. Also plenty of bagels and cream cheeses to choose from, I loved building my own scallion and garlic bagel YUM', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'My oldest kid had this on her New York bucket list! It surely did not disappoint! The best part of it was the unexpected above and beyond amazing customer service from Mostafa! He did such a great job, running the business of the store given that it is in one of the busiest locations of Manhattan! He was so efficient and kind managing his team to help take great care of every customer and was crazy fast! The bagels were not just the best bagels I‚Äôve ever tasted, but Also, the most memorable with all of the fun colors and amazing taste! Their cream cheese was out of this world! Putting these two things together, made us come back for day two and came back to the specific location, hoping that we would run into Mostafa again! Let me tell you, It really stood out that he went out of his way to make sure myself, and this other customer who had a stroller taken care of and had us and our families exit a stroller friendly private exit! That‚Äôs putting the customer first and taking care of us! Thank you!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: MUJI SOHO
address: 455 Broadway, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: department_store, furniture_store, home_improvement_store, home_goods_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "Stopped by while I was in the area to grab a container that was big enough to store my pup‚Äôs harness and leash for easy access. This store is pretty big and even has a clothing section (women's section on the main floor and men's section downstairs) compared to the other locations. A lot of people were browsing the stationery area where there were a plethora of nice pens and notebooks (took me back to my high school days). I didn‚Äôt know they also sold snacks and other food items which are near the register. I ended up picking a large white plastic container that came with a translucent lid (you do have to pay separately for the container and the lid, which ended up being about $13 or so). Would recommend it if you need household items that are simple and affordable.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazing! I different culture‚Äôs IKEA. It was so clean and simple and affordable and satisfying to walk around. We got a whole basket worth without intending to buy anything when we walked in. Great quality! I would highly recommend a visit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This particular location has a terrible wait time for fitting rooms. About 50% of this two-storey store is dedicated to apparel and has only 3 fitting rooms. It takes forever to have your turn. I sincerely wish that the management would fix this. Muji stores have excellent aromatherapy products, good food items, and absolutely terrible stationary. The pens went dry within 90 days. In food items, soups are recommended, a unit comes with 4 packs for $ 7 and is quite delicious. Apparel is good too. The aesthetics of the apparel is unisex and may not be to everyone's liking.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'On 9/23 around 4pm I was in this location looking for right angle pile short socks in white size 9-11. I went up to the cash register with another in a different color to see if the employer could do a stock check in another location with my correct size and color. The sales associate was heavy set and brown skin and had an accent. She said no other stores had it and that all stores have the same stock. I asked her nicely, ‚Äúcan you check in the system to make sure‚Äù She continued to dismiss the request and would not at least look in the system. She spent more time denying that request than actually doing her job and checking for me which would have been a lot quicker. Before I even asked her about the stock check, it looked like she didn‚Äôt even want to deal with me. Anyhow, instead of pressing her to look in the system and I told her I‚Äôll think about it. I went ahead and called Muji at Hudson Yards and they told me they had the socks I was looking for. I told them over the phone that I was at Muji in SoHo and that this particular employee couldn‚Äôt even do a store locator search to help me find the product I needed closest to me. I had to travel all the way to Muji in Hudson Yards to get the product and there is no telling if there was a Muji that was closer by which would have been very helpful. Hopefully a manager coaches her about this as I felt she was dismissive and didn‚Äôt want to help me at all. Typical\nRetail burnout culture employee who really doesn‚Äôt care either way. I', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Great stationary and clothing shop! My husband and I visit Muji every time we're in New York City. They have so many notebooks and pens to choose from, and then of course they have so much home decor and clothing as well. There's so much to look at, and honestly the prices are pretty affordable for the quality of the item. If you're in the area, I highly recommend checking out this spot!", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Apple World Trade Center
address: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: electronics_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I recently got the chance to check out the Freedom Tower at the World Trade Center, and while exploring, I stopped by the Apple Store and wow, this place is incredible! The store is huge, beautifully designed, and the energy inside matches the amazing architecture of the building itself.

I had a chance to check out the new iPhone 17 Pro Max, and that phone is üî• super light, powerful, and the camera is really impressive. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the overall experience was just great.

If you‚Äôre in the area, definitely stop by it‚Äôs not just an Apple Store, it‚Äôs an experience inside one of the most beautiful buildings in New York City.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Friendly, beautiful location in the Occulus World Trade Center, nice vibe to the area also. Well supplied with Apple products and easy access to the NYC subway system. Clean, well maintained. Stop by and visit WTC memorial while you are there also.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I visited the Apple Store with a heavy heart for, my iphone SE was working fine except for the fact that it had no space left. I loved everything about my old phone- the size, the grip, the capabilities. It was a nice, simple elegant phone. I really didn‚Äôt want these newer larger ones. I hold onto my phones for many years. Hence I was not excited about this inevitability: the acquisition of a new phone.
Fortunately I was assisted by 3 amazing human beings who took the time (a lot of time) to empathize, hear me and help me navigate this new road. Riyan spent a lot of time helping me through an otherwise anxiety-ridden experience (theres so much information here and it can be overwhelming), after he helped me Kevin D stepped and also was immensely kind and tried to help guide me through potential payment options and finally Christopher G ensured that I had everything I needed on my new phone and felt comfortable enough to be on my way.
Im an old soul- Im not super keen on new technologies so these types of experiences can be daunting. I had been planning this trip to the Apple Store  for 5 months and only just went in. Thanks to Riyan, Kevin D and Christopher G I left feeling pretty great and also excited to explore this new device.

Many many thanks for your kindness and your time üíúüôèüèΩ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I had a quick and pleasant experience at this store. Mo helped me out as soon as I walked in. I arrived very early to avoid the crowds and it was perfect timing. I traded in my iPad and set up my new device on site. This location is located in a massive mall/train station so I recommend going early because a lot of people come in after work and it can get super busy. The store is located inside of the Oculus World Trader Center.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Inconsistent/odd energy from the staff at this location. I came in to have help setting up my new MacBook Air and get assistance with an old one. I walked in the first level and approached a staff member to ask where to go for my appointment. She seemed confused as to why I was walking up to her, then proceeded to look me up and down with a tone of suspicion as she directed me where to go. Maybe it‚Äôs because I was carrying my laptops in a backpack? The employees upstairs were more friendly. Anyways, when they began my appointment a staff named Art helped me. Although his service was friendly, he was helping several other customers at the same time as me and his attention was divided throughout my set up process. He also didn‚Äôt know what one of the apps does on my new laptop. I asked him to ask someone please and he did but I felt during the session that I was slightly burdening. I asked about another app and he said ‚Äúno one really uses that.‚Äù Okay? He did apologize and I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs his fault he was assigned several customers at once, but it left a less than desirable impression as a customer who was excited to learn about my new device.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Conwell Coffee & Cocktail Hall
address: 6 Hanover St, New York, NY 10005, USA
types: cafe, coffee_shop, breakfast_restaurant, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This place is gorgeous. For vibes alone it deserves 5 stars. What a cool place to sit and enjoy a cup of coffee or tea. I got a London Fog and it was delicious. Pretty good amount of seating for the space. A lot of people come here to work. Will definitely be back to do just that.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Perfect place to have coffee in financial district. I came across while walking in the street and it is one of the best coincidences of a coffee place for me.

Prices are great for the place. The artwork on the main wall, music choice, even the desk lamps, coffee, banana bread; all was perfect.

Also, seems great place to co-work.

Food were looking nice, will spare some time for the next time.

Cortado was highly deep and tasty, but portion of it was smaller than it should be.

Also, latte was good too, but little bit cold.

Having cold water always ready in the area is also a nice gesture.

Banana bread is highly recommended, moisture and the taste was great.

It feels like a time travel inside, highly recommend a visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great good. Delicious coffee. Such a cute and unique retro space. And on Sat evening live DJ with ‚ÄúThe Vintage DJ‚Äù is a blast.  Highly recommended. Must check it out.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wonderful start to the day. A nice cortado that has the perfect coffee to milk ratio. The croissant was buttery and the cold soup was bright. The french toast was a bit sweet though you could avoid that by not double dipping.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Located in an old bank, this cafe transports you to the 1920s Art Deco style. They serve coffee, food, and pastries. The servers are all dressed up and the service takes a while ‚Äî not a grab-and-go type place. Sit down, listen to the music, & enjoy the experience.

The actual cortado was medium-bodied. They also threw in a biscoff-like biscuit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: L'Appartement 4F
address: 115 Montague St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
types: bakery, wine_bar, food_store, bar, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Best bakery in nyc! The smell alone is heavenly! Regulars for their raspberry and chocolate almond croissants!! Everything here is delicious. We love the pistachio rose, the cinnamon role. The croissant muffins - cruffins? Amazing!! Their bread; basically can‚Äôt go wrong! We also had dinner here for my bday weekend and it was so romantic and cozy. Food was top. Love this place!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Very cute bakery in a fun area of Brooklyn, be prepared for the line outside that moves quickly. We tried the raspberry croissant and a cinnamon roll. I liked the cinnamon roll more than the croissant. The croissant was too sweet for my taste, it had a heavier topping and was different than what I've had in other bakeries. Their bread and other items looked great, I'd opt for something less sweet next time. There is quite a bit of seating inside and it's super cute, plus there's a restroom. The staff moves quickly to serve customers.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'WOW - the inviting smell of butter drew me right in! I have tried the kouign amann, raspberry croissant, baguette, and coffee here. My friend enjoyed the raspberry kouign amann and a latte. Delicious pastry shop, really down to earth people working there, and the upstairs is the perfect lofted space to catch up with a friend or get some work done. Plus if you sit up top you have a great view of the warm pastry fresh from the oven. Cant go wrong with anything here!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Stopped by to try one of the raspberry croissants. The line wasn't too bad on a Sunday morning. I love that they have the window outside and you get your pastries while you are there. This croissant was everything a croissant should be - buttery, flaky, and delightful! Definitely recommend checking this place out - its worth the hype.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Despite the long queue and the influencer hype I was not that impressed. Pain au chocolat had very little chocolate. The regular croissant was just fine. Not worth lining up in my opinion. Cute inside and some nice seating upstairs.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1095 6th Ave, New York, NY 10036, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'From a traveler‚Äôs perspective, am just excited to revisit Whole Foods again. Same vibe with higher price tags. First floor sells grab&go foods and second floor sells hot meals. The sprits section can be better but won‚Äôt complain.

There are a lot of security guards near the entrance area. Overall a nice place to have in the middle of Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'When I‚Äôm in the city I go to whole foods for my needs, I love their butchery counter that has very fresh meat. The vegetables are amazing as well, the hot bar has a wide variety of food though I wish they would change it up sometimes.

When you buy flowers from here they can make you a pretty bouquet üíê free of charge. Prime members get good deals throughout the store.

The only aggravating thing is that customer service desk that‚Äôs supposed to serve as a till never is open or available. They always just send you to the regular checkout counter. I was buying flowers the other day and they refused to let me pay for them there which is closer to the florist department. Whole Foods can make this process more efficient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 6th Avenue is a great place for grocery shopping, offering a wide variety of fresh fruits and vegetables that are always well-stocked and of high quality. Prices are reasonable for the freshness and quality you get, and the store is clean, organized, and easy to navigate, making the shopping experience enjoyable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The food bar is so fresh and there‚Äôs a lot of variety. Definitely a good choice for healthy lunch, and the top floor seating has a great view
However, there is some cons.

Bathroom line is very full because of the location. Checkout can also be a hassle during busy hours because of the lack of employees, at least during the times I went.

But overall a great place to get food and buy a few grocery items. Just needs organizing the people traffic especially during busy hours.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôm truly surprised at their inability to replenish their stocks. Are we already facing a supply crisis? For the last three days they haven‚Äôt replenished their stocks. I have been going daily to buy a chocolate cereal but it‚Äôs not there. In fact, every day the shelves get more and more empty without being replenished. It‚Äôs truly pathetic that in the middle of one of the most busiest commercial and tourist spots in the country, we have such shortages.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 405 E 59th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Trader Joe's is one of my favorite grocery stores! They have a great selection of unique and high-quality products at reasonable prices. The fresh produce, snacks, frozen meals, and seasonal items are always worth checking out. Staff is friendly, helpful, and the store is usually well-organized. A great place for grocery shopping!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Trader Joe‚Äôs is one of my absolute favorite grocery stores in all of New York City ‚Äî and beyond. The quality of the products is consistently excellent, the staff is always friendly and welcoming, and I‚Äôve never had a single issue shopping there. In a city where things often go wrong, this store truly stands out as one of the best on the market.

I recommend Trader Joe‚Äôs to everyone I know ‚Äî it‚Äôs reliable, affordable, and full of great energy.

The only downside I‚Äôd love to see addressed is the lack of a delivery option. If delivery were available, I would gladly shop more often each week and save the time it takes to travel from my home, which is about 40 blocks away. It would make a huge difference.

Overall, I give this store a full 10 stars and send my best wishes to the amazing team and creators behind this beautiful space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of the most spacious TJ‚Äôs locations I‚Äôve been to, they were well stocked which is always a plus. The store is quite beautiful inside I just couldn‚Äôt take pictures because the store was super crowded. I love that TJ MAXX is next door, perfect location for two of my favorite stores.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Best place to shop groceries! I have never seen such a big Trader Joe‚Äòs. We got everything we needed. As we proceeded to the checkout, we met our cashier ADRIAN! He was just amazing: friendly, professional and fast! He bagged everything perfectly for us! Thank you! Keep up the fantastic work!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pretty crowded but everyone is nice. A lot of people in line but it moves so quickly and the cashers are quicker! The location is perfect because its right by the bridge and busses! Its in a little plaza with TJ Max right next door. I personally love to shop here!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 22-43 Jackson Ave, Long Island City, NY 11101, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I‚Äôve been coming to this Trader Joe‚Äôs ever since it first opened, and it has become a part of my daily routine. The location is very convenient from my home, and I usually stop by every morning. I really appreciate the wide variety of products they offer, which makes shopping here easy and enjoyable.\n\nThe only small downside is that recently the store hasn‚Äôt always been opening exactly at 8:00 a.m. as posted, which can be a bit inconvenient when I plan my morning around it. Aside from that, I‚Äôm very satisfied and grateful for having this store in my neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'spacious compared to other Trader joe‚Äôs in the NYC area. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the incredibly long line as the line goes super fast, thank god to all the cashiers. Trader joe‚Äôs really thought about this carefully. I usually shop in the inner isles first and then the outside walls as I wait on line and grab whatever I need otherwise you‚Äôll keep saying excuse me nonstop to the people blocking the sections to just go online and pass by those sections anyway. Great location!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love the energy of the people at all trader joe location.  They really value the customer time with all those cashiers.  The line be long but it goes so far, every cashiers is greeting us with a smile. Trader keep up the great work. We the pay is great people tend to smile  alot lol.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best deals, good fresh quality and indeed affordable! Everything in the photos was from Trader Joes. Valentines was made easy, and that chocolate mousse cake was spectacular. Thank Trader Joe!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I asked for utensils at the cashier, and they informed me that they no longer have them available. Later, I went to the office area and asked an Asian gentleman with a mustache about it. He didn‚Äôt even turn around or properly respond‚Äîhe just said one word, ‚Äúno,‚Äù without offering any explanation or information about when utensils might be available again. The staff should be trained on how to provide courteous and professional customer service to every customer. Best', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 200 E 32nd St, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Trader Joe‚Äôs
üìç 200 E 32nd Street, New York, NY 10016

Trader Joe‚Äôs at 200 E 32nd St is a great store with fresh fruits, vegetables, dry fruits, snacks, and groceries at reasonable prices. The staff are friendly and helpful. It can get crowded at busy times, but overall it‚Äôs a convenient place for quality shopping.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love Trader Joe‚Äôs.  My son just moved to the neighborhood so I wanted to stock his fridge. No place else can you get beautiful fresh flowers, fruits, vegetables, cheese and meat at reasonable prices.  Plenty of unique items too.  Nice assortment of spices and Condiments.  Stock up on seasonal items, they go fast.  Staff is always friendly, go out of their way to help and always with a smile.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The store is spacious and has a wide variety of products. Although not necessarily the cheapest, most brands are available. Fresh and delicious strawberries, reasonably priced.
There were many customers queuing to check out (about 20-30 people, occupying an aisle). I don't know if it was good luck, but there were many cash registers working in the store (more than 10 were visible). The waiting time was about 10 minutes. The checkout speed was very fast, and the overall shopping experience was satisfactory.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It can be very busy at that location at a certain time after work but the lines move very fast. I had my stuff ringed up by a young lady name Juanita and she was incredibly sweet and patient. She kept telling me to take my time and I laughed because I felt pressured to quickly put my stuff away. I thought that was incredibly kind because you can‚Äôt find that in most stores now they are ready to take the next customer and get you out. Definitely love how friendly everyone is there!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Great customer service! Found everything I wanted and a few surprises...the rice & lentil onion rings are oh so delicious! Finally I can eat a healthier option! A gluten free snack that contains milk. I couldn't stop at one; They're all gone & I miss Trader Joe's too ü§©", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart
address: 38 W 32nd St 2nd floor, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'What a fantastic grocery store! The meat section and selection is top quality! The variety of produce is excellent and very fresh! I live in the Midwest and how I would love to have an H Mart in my neighborhood! Be sure and  visit the upstairs for a quick meal and more great shopping deals.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love Hmart. I go all the time if I can but I prefer the Fort Lee NJ one bc they always have the best prices and variety and stuff I love even if it‚Äôs not the biggest in size like Edison NJ. So w that said this location is great and in the heart of Korea town on 32nd street between Broadway and 5th avenue but bc the rent is so high as you can imagine the Manhattan commercial rental rates‚Ä¶the food prices are high unless there‚Äôs a sale. It‚Äôs not terrible bc it‚Äôs definitely not cheap. But if you are in Manhattan and need some authentic Korean grocery items Hmart is the gold standard. Hmart is also known to be very clean and their produce and fruit and vegetables to be washed and presentable and the store is always kept as clean as possible with all that foot traffic so you don‚Äôt smell anything bad. Koreans are obsessed about clean and I am not complaining. I really appreciate it. I would rather buy my meat and veggies and fruit from a place that values cleanliness and organization.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Visited H Mart in Koreatown NYC and had a great time exploring. We had dinner at a Korean BBQ restaurant. I tried the candied grapes and strawberries‚Äîsweet, crunchy, and totally addictive! I also browsed one of the beauty stores inside with popular TikTok skincare and makeup finds. Perfect spot for Korean snacks, fresh groceries, and trendy beauty picks‚Äîall in the heart of Midtown.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Hmart on 32nd street is a ripoff market.  I was going to buy a chill flakes that was made in Korean.  As you can see the picture on the shelf the label price was $7.99.  And when I going to check out the chili flakes, the price  came out $26.99.  Which was a ridiculous price difference.  I told the cashier and  he wasn‚Äôt polite nor friendly.  He told me to speak to the manager.  The manager, who can‚Äôt speak English and was very rude too. If you goes to Wholefoods or shop rite they will honor the price was showing on the shelf, but not in H mart market.  For sure, I will never go back again.  I found other Hmart same item and price is lower than 32nd street.  Plus Hmart should have a manager, who spoke a better English!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I am very disappointed with this H-Mart (Korea Town). They sold me an expired mochi package. I got it from the front display table, so I trusted it was fresh. I didn‚Äôt check the date until after I already ate it. Why are they selling and charging customers for expired items? It feels like the store only focuses on money and not on customer safety. This is unacceptable and very careless. Please check your products before selling to people.

I bought it on September month.
You can check the date (2025/06/26) in the picture.
Why are you guys still kept it on the front display table and sold it to customers?', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 226 E 57th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Whole Foods Market ‚Äì East 57th Street, New York

This Midtown East Whole Foods is clean, modern, and very convenient for nearby residents and office workers. The store offers fresh produce, bakery, groceries, and prepared foods with Amazon Prime deals available. However, the aisles are a bit narrow and it can get crowded during peak hours. Prices are on the higher side, as expected at Whole Foods, and the selection is slightly smaller compared to larger locations. Overall, it‚Äôs a good option for quality groceries and quick meals, but best to shop during off-peak times for a smoother experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Reporting on my return to the Amazon Return Center at Whole Foods on east 57th st.  Reported return on line at Amazon and the took my wife‚Äôs two pants to this center to process. The return center is upstairs next to the coffee stand. The guy on duty today was very pleasant and efficient.  Waited a few minutes as two people were in line. Total time in and out was 15 minutes.  This is why so many people love to shop from Amazon on line - returns are so easy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazon return times can be very long due to lines (and they make you go upstairs). If you go after work, be prepared for it to take  20-25 minutes to process your Amazon return.
I got a reply from Whole Foods telling me to visit a certain website to give more feedback. But even that just put me in a queue for an agent who never came. I feel like Amazon does not value my time at all and I will try to shop there less in the future as a result. The store does not manage their lines well for returns and there was not good signage. One of the lines was much longer than the other one because one of them had staff support (but I didn‚Äôt notice that at first).  It‚Äôs a huge inconvenience in nyc to have to get to a Whole Foods, and on top of that it‚Äôs on the second floor (with stairs not an elevator/escalator), and then insult to injury was the long line.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was not expecting the store to be that big. We did find everything we where looming for. Everything was fresh and good. We were able to use our canadian prime account to get the discount at the register. The staff were super nice with us.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very crowded, hard to find items with minimal labeling on the shelfs, items are moved frequently to different locations in the store, mainly self checkout, only few cashiers at the checkout lane. It is a supermarket that identifies as who knows what. Need to simplify.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 63 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have never really shopped in Whole Foods until I started to come to return my Amazon purchases. I decided to try out their croissants and then I saw they had sourdough bread. I tried both and I fell in love! I started to try their organic fruits, veggie salads, and just recently I finally bought food to go. I really liked their juicy rosemary chicken breast and their mozzarella creamy pasta. I also got my bf dark chocolate almonds and he liked them too! I honestly wish there were at least 2 Whole Foods in every borough so then customers wouldn‚Äôt have to travel to another borough! In the mean time I will just continue to shop in Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Let‚Äôs see the only thing I‚Äôm not rooting for at this location is the pricing for hot food and to me it‚Äôs a total ripoff system they have with this scale you place the food on . Now the mac and cheese is a 8. The soups are a 7 the  sides are and 8 overall you will not go wrong as far as taste is concerned . Myb once I tired the food and it seemed tasteless but overall I ate there with cash money by accident multiple times cuz it‚Äôs no reason I should pay that much in a supermarket for food even if I was a billionaire by choice cuz now I‚Äôm saving my money . If I can change the cheap box‚Äôs  and sizes for the food as well as prices would be my favorite store . Those chefs works hard . Now the supermarket always clean and busy . I would sit and eat and hope that adjustments are made cuz that was June 28 I realized this but everyone is diff I just feel the food buffet style as suggested and one day it did make me happy eating it', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "While convenient and nicely situated, this Whole Foods doesn't give you the full stack of offerings you're used to from Whole Foods and it seems understocked. It's almost uninspiring to shop there, despite the pretty all-glass building.  Also, not sure what's going on with the roasted chicken that goes missing, since sometimes you can't even find any to buy... and the hot bar is more like a mess. The quality has definitely gone down ever since Amazon bought Whole Foods. It's a shame really, but that's the tea, I guess.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Nice, clean, with decent selection, standard for whole foods. One other nice aspect about this location is that I have never had to wait in check out lines for more than 2-3 minutes; in fact majority of the time I don't have to wait at all", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '3rd time visiting this Whole Food for weekly supermarket runs. Ample choices, good produce selection, clean and spacious. Cashier service leaves a lot to be desired. If you need help with your groceries prepare not to get it. So, I recommend self checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Katagiri Japanese Grocery
address: 370 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "Great Japanese grocery store! They have an onigiri station and ramen station making fresh food daily! They also have a great selection of other snacks, drinks, and other cooking items. I stopped by for some of their fresh sushi and onigiri, very affordable pricing. It gets quite busy during lunch rush so just a word of caution. Don't wait too late in the day to stop by for fresh food because they might run out of your favorite. Get here early!!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Just discoverthis japanese market near my job! Great customer service and really affordable prices vs other Asian markets. They also have ramen! Can't wait to come back and try more things!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of the best Japan groceries in NY! they have good bento and fresh raw/cooked sushi. It has (a few) indoor bar seating for enjoying the food and restroom for customers.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love coming here especially before the train for a little snack. Great quality Japanese food. Always tend to get imagery and perf little treat. Quick service  and tons always available', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Japanese groceries looks pretty good and of good quality. The prepared food one level lower. Especially tonkotsu ramen. In American standard average in Japanese even lower', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target Grocery
address: 237 W 42nd St, New York, NY 10036, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Best time to go is in the morning.  Because I returned in the evening, this mini Target was overflowing with tourists.  Understandably limited in what they offer because they are one floor in size.  Some items are locked up.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It was nice to find a Target in Manhattan. We bought some water and sandwiches there. The sandwiches felt a bit expensive for what they contained.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great store. Lots of choice and mostly decent prices. Also target backtracked on anything that isn't right wing so yeah.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Located near Time Square, buy your groceries and other things here, instead of spending too much at convenience stores.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Sunrise Mart Êó•Á≥ª„Çπ„Éº„Éë„Éº
address: 12 E 41st St, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: convenience_store, deli, meal_takeaway, supermarket, home_goods_store, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, japanese_restaurant, food_store, restaurant, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a very disappointing experience at this restaurant. The fish was not fresh and tasted sour, which ruined the meal. This makes me doubt the quality and reliability of this place as a Japanese restaurant. To make matters worse, I experienced stomach pain after eating here today, raising concerns about their food safety standards. I strongly urge the restaurant to improve their ingredient freshness and quality control.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The restaurant sells many kinds of Japanese-style bento, such as udon noodles and Japanese fried chicken. There are 2-3 tables in front of the restaurant and some seats on the second floor. The environment in the restaurant is clean, the air conditioning temperature is moderate and comfortable, and the attitude of the staff is good.
The fried chicken bento I bought was cold, which is a pity. It would have tasted better if it was hot. If you come here to buy lunch, it is recommended to order directly from the staff. The freshly made meals are more delicious when they are hot.
The sashimi sushi is much more delicious. The sashimi is very fresh. If you dare to eat it, I recommend buying it.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Must tryüßã
Yuzu iced tea

Selective vegetarian food options however, the drinks tasted really good.
Good for a quick stop to stock up on yum food.
The prices are not crazy and it‚Äôs feasible!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a beautiful spot with real Japanese vibes! üáØüáµüçõüçúüçô
The onigiri is a must-try! The curry was rich, and the ramen hit the spot.
Honestly, I wanted to try everything‚Ä¶ but I was way too full üòÖ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A small market to the side, and then a food space where you get udon, soba, rice balls, sushi, etc. Prices are ok; the soba was salty, and the karaage was cold (need to warm up in the microwave, but then not as good as fresh / hot crunch). Seating upstairs and a few downstairs. Pay for food first, then pick up from the grill/ordering area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: MORTON WILLIAMS SUPERMARKETS
address: 140 W 57th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Meeting with clients on 57th street this morning‚Ä¶ Stopped for lunch at Morton Williams. Who even knew there‚Äôs such a location as 6 1/2 Avenue? Anyway, plenty of fresh food to choose from. Undecided at first, but, the lasagna soup (I know, it‚Äôs summer, but, I love soup) caught my eye & I just had to have it. Added a sandwich & a bottle of water and headed upstairs in the spacious seating area to enjoy my meal. Free wi-fi too!. Only complaint, was, the ceiling in the bathroom looked like it was going to fall on my head.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Morton Williams Supermarkets is a fantastic place to shop for all your grocery needs. The store is always clean, well-organized, and fully stocked with a wide variety of fresh produce, quality meats, and specialty items. I appreciate their selection of organic and international products, which makes it easy to find unique ingredients for any recipe. The staff is consistently friendly, helpful, and quick to assist with any questions or recommendations. The checkout process is efficient, and the overall shopping experience is smooth and enjoyable. Whether you're doing a big weekly shop or just grabbing a few essentials, Morton Williams is a reliable and convenient choice. Highly recommend!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great supermarket. Good prices on products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went there to buy Clubtails..very hard to find in my..3.99$...and they had all the flavors.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'For a supermarket and cafe in midtown a couple of blocks from Central Park, you can‚Äôt beat this place for quality and price. Go straight to the deli and select a huge sandwich or ask for a custom one like I did, grilled chicken and mozzarella. Only $9 folks, incredible. I took it upstairs and got a big pour glass of wine and while there is no ambience, save your vibe for later. Come here to eat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Morton Williams Supermarkets
address: 908 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10017, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very Good Super market in Manhattan on 48 Street, Grocery, vegetable, fruits, & so many products available & cafe is also available, & it is open 24 Hours.......', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unfortunately, the prices have gone sky high, but you know we love the people that work there with an exception many of us are in the neighborhood and have made friends there. However, from time to time, I have gotten very bad chicken and therefore have gotten into the habit of puncturing the cellophane to smell it. Last month a butcher I don‚Äôt know yelled at me for doing it and I told her I didn‚Äôt want to get stuck with bad chicken when I got home and sure enough the chicken was bad well this week I bought chicken again and I didn‚Äôt puncture the cellophane because I didn‚Äôt feel like being yelled at and sure enough it was bad chicken and I was too tired to go back. A very famous chef of mine who is now retired told me today he got stuck last week as well with bad chicken so it‚Äôs not my imagination and the attitude of the butcher is there even if you do return it they‚Äôre very arrogant unfortunately otherwise all the department in that store I love lovely people and I really love going there. Unfortunately the chef will never return so you lost a customer there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Staying at the Barclay Intercontinental, we wanted to get some fruits, nuts, water etc. and wanted to visit aa real supermarket. We found one 2 blocks away Morton Williams which was really well stocked with everything we needed and more. Easy to find everything and very friendly staff. We loaded up and will return when we visit NYC again in that area. Highly recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I just needed a cucumber, but they were all semi rotting. Looked for protein, but no luck. Nicely organized nonetheless. A lady at the front cash was counting money and I asked if her cash was open, but she just ignored me. Probably the most insulting thing a person in a retail store can do and I'll never go back here. Apparently, counting money is more important than basic customer service. Was not impressed at all.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fabulously displayed fruits and veggies supermarket, you can find anything you need in here, the shop floor staff super friendly and helpful', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Jubilee Marketplace (Supermarket)
address: 145 West St Floor 1, Brooklyn, NY 11222, USA
types: supermarket, deli, butcher_shop, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, cafe, market, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This supermarket is so big and a lots of stuff.
Including fresh market, Fruit and vegetables and also meat.
I love Jubilee sushi department. So wow. There are fresh and yummy.
This supermarket also provides free wifi as well. So convenient.
And the one that I also recommend is fresh orange juice. It is best orange juice in town for me.

Still a lot of things that I want to try and I will comeback by soon for sure.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Free wifi available. Friend dragged us over to try the omakase sampler but they probably sold out immediately. Sign ays they stock at noon and at 4:30. Tried another kaisen. To be honest most raw fish is the same to me, so it was just okay to me. I'm sure it's good, but my palate can't tell.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Jubilee market is the stuff of legends. $4.99 for a whole rotisserie chicken for a small grocery store? How could you not respect that?! There is no way they are making money on this‚Ä¶

I went in expecting this bird to be mid just because of the price point, but this thing was BANGIN. Breast was pretty tender, skin was fantastic, and this thing was full of flavor. I couldn‚Äôt believe my tastebuds.

It turns out they are selling Pat LaFrieda birds, who is a famous supplier of high quality meats to top restaurants and food establishments‚Ä¶ AND IT SHOWS!

I ended up giving it an 8.4/10 on my chicken ranking, which ranks it #6 out of 25 grocery store chickens I have currently tried.

This place has me looking at apartments in Greenpoint. You‚Äôd need a forklift to keep me out of here.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The cheapest burgers you're ever going to find in this city, and very tasty! Bring cash, they sell at very low margins to pass savings to customers! Jubilee Marketplace is a Korean family owned business and they're a pillar of the community, committed to quality and low prices. 4.99$ whole rotisserie chicken just like Costco! 5$ for a chunky double patty smash burger with crispy onions, bacon, dripping with cheese. I would come here every day if I could!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I tried it today was so good! They restock the shelves around noon/4:30 p.m. üòçüç£üç± ($15 salmon rice bowl, $18 chirashi rice bowl, $18 bluefin tuna rice bowls and NY cheapest Omakase bento). (Update) Ps. I  was there Friday around 11:55a all sold out üôÑ', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hashi Market
address: 330 5th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Hashi Market is a fun place to shop if you‚Äôre looking for authentic Japanese groceries. They have a good selection of sushi, snacks, noodles, and even unique items like matcha and sesame soft-serve ice cream. The store is clean and organized, and it‚Äôs easy to find what you need. Prices are a little higher compared to regular supermarkets, but that‚Äôs expected for imported goods. Staff are friendly and helpful. Great spot if you‚Äôre craving Japanese treats or want to explore new flavors!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'In the new York and new jersey area, outside of Mitsuwa Japanese market, this is the one that has almost every categories of Japanese items you will need except alcohol .
It is a much much smaller one compared to to Mitsuwa, but good enough for Manhattan.

First floor they have fresh made soft serve ice cream, hot foods, and all necessary noodles, ready to eat food, snacks and limited fresh produce.

Second floor, it‚Äôs the cutie floor, there are adorable asian characters, make ups, plushies, chinaware, and more.

Limited staff in the shop for stocking, cleaning, and register, but service were efficient and some of the staff are very friendly.

Value, I cannot say it‚Äôs the best, after comparing to Teso and some other Chinese owned market, the pricing over here is slight higher.

Location, convenient, center of Manhattan. No parking. High walking score.

Do recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great Japanese Market and Fujiissa is attached to this location where you should absolutely grab a drink from.

They have a great selection of prepared cold food items to go such as sushi and hot items as well like Katsu don.

It is slightly priced higher but it is a very convenient location next to K-Town so you can do all your Korean / Japanese grocery shopping in one go - if you wanted to.

What you absolutely MUST do while here is to go down one floor below to check out the basement level - they have a fully-stocked Canmake cosmetic product offering as it seems not many are aware of this particular location yet!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is a paradise for Japanese culture lovers! It has everything ‚Äî from fresh produce and fruits to a wide variety of Japanese snacks, famous chocolates like Royce, and adorable collectible toys that will melt your heart. Walking through the aisles feels like being back in Japan. The store is clean, fully stocked, and the staff is super friendly. Highly recommended stop for anyone in the area!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I spent $30 here on salmon sushi for my kids‚Äô lunch. The packaging said it was good for a couple more days, but when I opened the boxes both had a terrible smell ‚Äî the salmon was clearly expired. Absolutely disgusting. Serving spoiled fish under a false expiration date is a serious health risk, and it shows they don‚Äôt care about freshness or their customers. I‚Äôll never buy anything from this place again.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target Grocery
address: 112 W 34th St., New York, NY 10120, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'They refuse to let 4 prospective customers in at 11:55pm even though store hours extend to 12am.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wanted to use the toilet but Greg (old guy)  was saying the code changes every week and did nothing to open it up. My woman friend got the code right away.  After I asked three times, he opend the employees' restroom and kept ignoring me. I had to wait a while until another employee came along. I came here to buy joyride candy and use the toilet. I'm glad the manager came to open it up. From a 1* to 2*, you don't treat customers like Greg!!!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you know this location from years ago, youd be extremely surprised how much nicer it looks.
