The hours clearly say until 9 pm when I came at 8:40 and this is unacceptable because I left work early to make it here, waste of time.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Nordstrom Rack
address: 865 6th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA
types: department_store, shoe_store, clothing_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Good Nordstrom Tack in Manhattan. A three-story well organized store that has all fashion items that someone thinks of. Prices are very good. Women, men, and kids may find all they need to complete their fashion statement.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This store is great. The shoe section is on point! I have bought many  outfits from here over the years. They carry a lot of good brands at discounted prices. The lines are often very long, however, that's the only drag. You should go.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Huge and clean Nordstrom Rack in NYC. 3 floors packed with clothes, shoes etc for men and women. Large variety! Also this store has fragrances, bags and home products available.\n\nThough I didn't find anything to purchase on my visit, I noticed long lines at checkout (a recurring theme in the reviews). So checkout process can be maybe slow.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'In between TK Max and primark is where you‚Äôd find Nordstrom. Crazily enough they have Brands and clothes worth several hundreds of Dollars but it gives Dollar Shop vibe. It‚Äôs definitely not made for a good shopping experience', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I am not too sure how Nordstrom plans on improving the customer service experience when they deny their loyal paying customers the usage of previously available restrooms. It is unfortunate that in this day and age when other establishments are partial to the biological needs of their clients, this establishment is losing it's class and customer service and going in the direction of a McDonalds or a Dunkin Donuts with archaic hostile consumer practices. They are expanding this business model to other locations and ensuring their reputability goes to the toilet. They can comment and make excuses on my review, but that does not deny the fact that they will not improve the experience unless they listen to their paying customers and serve their needs accordingly. They will lose business as clients seek out needs at other friendly establishments that do not engage in as such .", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 405 E 59th St, New York, NY 10022, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Trader Joe's is one of my favorite grocery stores! They have a great selection of unique and high-quality products at reasonable prices. The fresh produce, snacks, frozen meals, and seasonal items are always worth checking out. Staff is friendly, helpful, and the store is usually well-organized. A great place for grocery shopping!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Trader Joe‚Äôs is one of my absolute favorite grocery stores in all of New York City ‚Äî and beyond. The quality of the products is consistently excellent, the staff is always friendly and welcoming, and I‚Äôve never had a single issue shopping there. In a city where things often go wrong, this store truly stands out as one of the best on the market.

I recommend Trader Joe‚Äôs to everyone I know ‚Äî it‚Äôs reliable, affordable, and full of great energy.

The only downside I‚Äôd love to see addressed is the lack of a delivery option. If delivery were available, I would gladly shop more often each week and save the time it takes to travel from my home, which is about 40 blocks away. It would make a huge difference.

Overall, I give this store a full 10 stars and send my best wishes to the amazing team and creators behind this beautiful space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of the most spacious TJ‚Äôs locations I‚Äôve been to, they were well stocked which is always a plus. The store is quite beautiful inside I just couldn‚Äôt take pictures because the store was super crowded. I love that TJ MAXX is next door, perfect location for two of my favorite stores.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Best place to shop groceries! I have never seen such a big Trader Joe‚Äòs. We got everything we needed. As we proceeded to the checkout, we met our cashier ADRIAN! He was just amazing: friendly, professional and fast! He bagged everything perfectly for us! Thank you! Keep up the fantastic work!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pretty crowded but everyone is nice. A lot of people in line but it moves so quickly and the cashers are quicker! The location is perfect because its right by the bridge and busses! Its in a little plaza with TJ Max right next door. I personally love to shop here!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Kinokuniya New York
address: 1073 6th Ave 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10018, USA
types: book_store, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Kinokuniya is a rare sanctuary in the heart of Midtown Manhattan‚Äîjust across from Bryant Park‚Äîwhere books, design, and culture come together in quiet harmony. We visited on a Sunday evening, and found the store gently humming with calm energy, perfect for unhurried exploration.

The bookstore spans three thoughtfully organized levels. The ground floor features a beautifully curated selection of English-language literature, contemporary fiction, children‚Äôs books, and elegant gifts. The second floor is a wonderland for manga lovers, with both Japanese and translated volumes, as well as anime collectibles, Ghibli-themed treasures, and fan-favorite merch. A small Japanese caf√© tucked into this level serves melonpan, onigiri, matcha lattes, and more‚Äîperfect for a reflective break. The basement houses a stunning array of Japanese stationery‚Äîfountain pens, washi tape, notebooks, and tools for those who treasure the handwritten word.

The space is warmly lit, spacious, and well-organized, inviting you to browse at your own pace. Though prices lean premium, every corner feels carefully curated, more akin to a cultural gallery than a typical retail store.

Closest Subway: Bryant Park (B/D/F/M), 5th Ave (7), or Times Square (1/2/3/N/Q/R/W/S)

Whether you‚Äôre seeking a rare art book, the latest manga, a quiet corner with tea, or the tactile joy of exquisite stationery, Kinokuniya offers an experience that nourishes the senses. A must-visit for readers, wanderers, and lovers of crafted beauty. It was easily one of the highlights of our visit to New York City.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love this store! Being from Texas, we have a Kinokuniya in Katy, but it‚Äôs a lot smaller compared to this New York location. If you‚Äôre a fan of manga, hard-to-find Japanese magazines, fashion, anime‚Äîbasically anything Japan-related‚Äîyou‚Äôll love it here. My whole family does! I did notice this location didn‚Äôt have Gundam figures, but they did have plenty of Tamashii Nations ones, which was awesome to see. Definitely worth a visit', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This shop was FULL!!! Lots of staff, customers, and so many new products that I‚Äôve seen online but never in person (until now)!

I loved the selection of notebooks in harder-to-find sizes, like A5. The colorful washi tape and stamping tools. I skipped the books and pens, which is a lot of the store.

On this visit from out of town, I left very happy with my purchase of a cotton handkerchief, a sheet of goldfish stickers, and an enamel Aquatic Animal pin. Each is beautiful and well made.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I have been waiting to take my daughter here for over a year and the store didn‚Äôt disappoint!
We returned the next day because she wanted more Japanese things that we cannot get at home! Definitely recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I really like this bookstore! My friend introduced me to it, never realized I had passed it so many times, lol. There's many different genres of books they even had art books! I saw some interesting titles that I'll add to my reading list. Loved the magna selection and pins. I found the Wicked book, excited to read that! Definitely have to visit again!", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Ulta Beauty
address: 51 W 34th St., New York, NY 10001, USA
types: hair_salon, hair_care, beauty_salon, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'So many great beauty finds ‚Äî you‚Äôll never leave empty-handed! üíã Just skip the perfume sample set (they‚Äôre just free testers). Loved the Starface acne patches for teens!\n\nManyo Factory cleansing oil is pure magic ‚Äî my teen daughter told her friends about it, and now half her class is obsessed. üá∞üá∑‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Jen Jinks has been my go-to in the hair salon here for years for my highlights, color and cuts and I cannot recommend her enough! Not only does she always get the exact color that I want, but she does so in a way that protects the health and quality of my hair- which any blonde will know takes a great amount of care and skill and requires a very experienced colorist. I‚Äôm so glad to have found her after past bad experiences, she really is the only hairstylist I will trust!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Kayla at the 34th street Ulta was AMAZING! They found the perfect shade of It cosmetics, lipgloss, and was super funny. This is always my favorite Ulta to go to. THANK YOU KAYLAAA!!!!!!the brides maid crew I‚Äôm a part of adored her. :) will be back solely to see her haha :)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'just was informed that their staff is horrible to employees based on what they wear!! this is a disgrace i do not and have never been to a makeup store and cared about their outfits, to dress code somebody and send them home knowing they are low on funds is next level of unclassy behavior. i hope ulta higher ups are aware of the situation as well as the blatant disrespect of the manager katherine to speak in a degrading way to the sweet employee infront of me (a paying customer) will NOT be going back to this location after seeing this first hand', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The staff here are just the best , I have never known any store in New York to have such wonderful chatty staff, very helpful', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 2073 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The lines can get really long at some times, but it goes by pretty quickly. Last time I went, they had a rule where each customer could only get one carton of eggs, but I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs still a thing or not. They have great variety of flowers for valentine‚Äôs day too.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Store is underground over two floors.
The queue can be quite long. Sometimes one line goes way faster than the other which can be annoying.
Some really friendly staff.
Good selection of products!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Always friendly service! The cashier named Alexa was especially lovely and kind and deserve a special shout out.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Cashiers routinely somehow decide that the items in my cart are no good - apparently my chicken looked unsafe for consumption, then another day, it was raspberries. By doing so, all they're accomplishing is throwing out perfectly good food (none of the items that they pointed out as looking bad were actually "bad"). Please just focus on scanning my items. No small talk or unsolicited safety concerns are needed.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoyed shopping at the Trader Joe‚Äôs on 72nd.  It was my first time shopping at this location.  The employees and managers were very nice.   I met a pleasant employee name Shaun.  He was very helpful and polite.  He was very informative.  I will return and shop again.  Thank you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 670 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Love this Trader Joe store. Convenient to cross the Park via 96St. Everyone so nice. 1st time trying the frozen breaded Cod, very delicious, nice hearty all fish, light breading. Add in some grilled seasoned "Ready Veggies", spinach, tomato. Thank you TJ. Please open a store in the East 90's. ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I've been to this location before over a year ago because I live on the other side of the park and I decided to go to get a vegan frozen dish and I wind up buying a whole lot more. I forgot how good Trader Joe's really is I highly recommended for great and good eats! The staff is great as well and very helpful.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Clearly, I love this place. I rely on them for some of my staples: Tofu, gazpacho ingredients, whole grain flour tortillas, giant bars of well-priced 72% Belgian chocolate. I have found some great plants here. I feel fortunate to have this store within walking distance of my apartment. They have a public restroom (as does 72/Bdwy); let‚Äôs face it, sometimes that‚Äôs super helpful. Thank you for existingüôÇ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Produce is not that great but prices are good. Staff are always nice. If you like DOGS they are plenty of them here. Not joking

December 2024 update close to the staff. They do an excellent job on a Sunday night when
the line is super long.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Great, well stocked location, not as busy as some other New York Trader Joe's , very reasonable prices and friendly staff members", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 10 Columbus Cir Ste Sc101, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I rarely writw reviews on google map but this time I have said they really deserve it. This is the best whole foods in Manhattan. Peter (I think that was his name) helped me carrying my bags upstairs, he was so kind and joyfull! He teamed with Mirlene (I made sure I had their name because thwy were so nice really) I spent every week $$$ because variety of options, quality of products and so many hard workers keeping everything nice and organize for customers.
Top notch', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods Market is always one of the busiest spots‚Äîespecially the elevator, which is constantly packed with people coming and going. The in-store restaurant is equipped with restrooms, and the entire market is always buzzing with activity, so expect to wait in line no matter when you go. That said, one of the best things to do in the summer is grab some fresh sushi and a cold soda here, then head to Central Park for the perfect picnic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently visited this Whole Foods and had an excellent experience. I picked up some Whole Grain Checkers cereal and a vegan chocolate bar, both of which were exactly what I was looking for. The store was well-stocked and organized, which made shopping a breeze.

A special shout-out to John, the cashier, who was wearing a "Cashier of 2019" badge‚Äîhe‚Äôs still doing an amazing job! His friendly demeanor and efficient service made the checkout process smooth and quick. It's rare to see such consistent quality in service, and John‚Äôs professionalism is definitely appreciated.

Overall, this store always provides a great shopping experience, and I‚Äôll certainly be back. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "If you read past Google reviews, you'll see customers reporting RACISM, RACIAL PROFILING, AND DISCRIMINATION at this store. The pattern is clear, and the manager‚Äôs dismissive attitude is part of the problem. That‚Äôs why these experiences continue.

I reported a serious incident involving mistreatment that strongly appeared to be racist and discriminatory by an employee in the seafood department. What shocked me most was not only the behavior of the employee, but also the store‚Äôs refusal to take any meaningful action or even acknowledge wrongdoing. According to the manager, KUNHO, I will receive neither an apology from the employee nor any follow-up from the store. He questioned whether my experience was real but wouldn‚Äôt even attempt to verify what happened while I was still physically present in the store. When I offered to wait so he could check the camera, he told me I could wait as many hours as I liked, and he still wouldn‚Äôt check it because he was ‚Äúvery busy.‚Äù What kind of manager responds like that? Shame on you, KUNHO.

To the employee: If you do not want to interact with customers respectfully, why not work at a place where you do not need to deal with customers? That way, you will have no opportunity to mistreat customers, and more people will be happy.

To the store manager KUNHO: I hope you and your family will never be mistreated like that in any place by any employee like yours, and if that unfortunately happens, the issue will be resolved effectively by a good store manager‚Äînot someone like you.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I personally feel like this location is the easiest to find items that are well priced. Compared to the SoHo location for example, there are less rows of empty shelves.
The line moves quickly here as well. The major downside is the seating area.
A few years back this seating area had a coffee shop and juice bar but that‚Äôs been replaced by an Amazon pick up center. The seating is minimal in my opinion, but that could be because so many other locations have more space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1551 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I want to give a huge shout-out to Sarjo in the bakery department! Her customer service was absolutely incredible. She was so sweet, patient, and genuinely went above and beyond to help me pick out the perfect cake for my brother‚Äôs birthday. You can tell she‚Äôs a hard worker who truly cares about her customers.

Thank you, Sarjo, for making the experience so easy and enjoyable. Whole Foods is lucky to have someone like you on their team!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Time 9.49pm 10/10/2025
The worst ever experience not in Whole Food but ii our life. As we were checking out almost at last item the costumer next to us broke down in floor with loud noice a glass bottle . We were scary first because the glasses spread all over. Just as we were making sure to pay the next cashier , her name on tag was Monica ,without excusing or asking if we can move over , with the worst attitude and a rudeness ,with a manner of insulting said:
Move over don‚Äôt block my space !
As we told her we can‚Äôt because is plenty with glasses and slippery and we ready to leave she continue;
I don‚Äôt care just move move ‚Ä¶ And continue to be more aggressive until we ask her for name and took the picture of the floor‚Ä¶.
Everything is on camera and we want to be open and check this case because we don‚Äôt feel comfortable to shop in our favorite place Whole Food..', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve shopped here many times but on several occasions I‚Äôve been overcharged at the counter. When I asked why the woman at the express checkout simply insisted that the price was correct.

Today for example there was a clear offer: 4 avocados for $5 for Prime members. I scanned my Prime QR code at checkout yet she charged me $9.96. When I showed her a photo of the price tag she just shrugged and said she had no idea about it. Very disappointing experience being overcharged repeatedly and met with indifference.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Consistently unhelpful staff and customer service. Once had 10 items in the check out then grabbed two little chocolates while waiting in the line.  After a 10 minute wait, they refused to take me and forced me to leave the items behind or get into another, even longer line.  Another time was carrying a handful of food and items fell out of my hands. I asked a stock person to help me find a basket.  They told me to go to another floor to get one myself.  Place is a maze and you can never find anything.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Worst WF in NYC. I call it Hell Foods. Dirty, poorly stocked, impossible to get a cart around all of the boxes, people, etc., because of the awful design. Checkout is a special hell, with never enough cashiers and not enough room for shoppers to navigate this area. I noticed the bulk section is gone, most likely due to the disgusting state of that section. This location should be shut down and  the store should be moved to a better space with a better layout. It serves the entire UES and it's just too small, dirty, difficult to navigate, inefficient and always a depressing experience. I give it zero stars but I have to give it one to post this comment. Uesiders deserve better!", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 808 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a disturbing experience with a female security contractor at this Whole Foods. During a conversation, she mocked my accent verbatim, made a racist comment about my supposed ethnic origin, and told me to ‚Äúgo shop in Chinatown instead.‚Äù She then asserted that everything in the store ‚Äúbelongs to her,‚Äù using that as justification for rude and intimidating behavior.

This is unacceptable at any retailer, especially one that claims to value inclusion. I‚Äôm asking management to review the relevant camera footage, address the contractor‚Äôs behavior with her employer, and ensure all staff and third-party personnel receive training on anti-harassment and anti-discrimination. I‚Äôd also appreciate a follow-up from the store manager regarding what corrective actions will be taken.

She is unprofessional and unethical.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Belinda was a great help at customer service she quickly identified the problem and provided outstanding service to get to a solution. Thank you so much Belinda and the Whole Foods team Will definitely continue shopping here thanks to the outstanding staff!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoy this grocery store as an option in our neighborhood. Their produce is excellent. Their variety in prepared foods, cheese and frozen foods is the best in this whole neighborhood I think. It beats Key Food and Trader Joe‚Äôs by miles. I enjoy the self serve food bars, these I do find pricey but sometimes I need the convenience. Their produce store also has a nice vibe to it and their self care section is quite good.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very large supermarket serving the Upper Westside, with very fully stocked shelves and slightly higher prices. They also had free shrimp samples', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As far as uptown WholePaychecks go, this spot is far superior to the Harlem spot. And by that I mean the service and layout.

The butcher and fish counter associates are both serviceable and much better than the zombies in deli/premade (consistently the most attitude). 80% will give you stank face, 18% indifferent and on rare occasions, a unicorn will be spotted, the one who‚Äôs actually care about good service. Still, it‚Äôs better than 125th branch‚Äôs 99% stank face average.

The product here is standard WF. On occasion, they‚Äôll have a good selection of grass fed Venison and Bison and Pasteur raised meats. There‚Äôs a few local items in some departments.

The 12 for $12 oyster Friday is the move, get here before 2pm. The words out and there‚Äôs a few grandmas who literally come to buy the entire stock out. The early bird catches the worm.

They always run out of their branded coconut water (pink one) so when you see it out, grab some because it‚Äôll be days until they put more out. You‚Äôre welcome.

The service overall and checkout associates are hit or miss. If you remember WF before Amazon and before they came to the city and expect that level of service & quality- then you must have just came out of a Time Machine. That ship sailed a decade + ago. The vibe here is mostly indifferent, with an occasional mid level of job efficiency.

Sundays are a mess. Tuesday‚Äôs looks like an apocalypse hit the store. It‚Äôs usually the last day of the sales, which means most items are gone. If ya didn‚Äôt get here on Monday, it‚Äôs a wrap. If pastrami is ever on sale at the deli counter, get there the first day- Wednesday because it‚Äôs gone by Friday and they never seem to restock.

Checkout is 1000% faster than 59th street and Harlem. The self checkout is the hero but you knew that already, didn‚Äôt you Chad?', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1175 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, liquor_store, health, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 69th Street is a convenient spot for quick grocery runs. The store is clean and well-arranged, offering fresh produce, snacks, and everyday essentials. Since it‚Äôs a smaller-format store, the selection is more limited, and popular items can sell out quickly. Checkout can get crowded during peak hours, but overall it‚Äôs a handy option for nearby residents.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The new Whole Foods daily shops will take over the city, in a good way! It‚Äôs everything I like to get in the big stores but condensed into a small, fast space. Almond flour was literally 50% the cost of Gristedes (aka Gross-tedes). They are working on better priced options and features like Amazon One palm pay mean I don‚Äôt even need to get my wallet out when looking after my baby and carrying a million things. This place is popular after work - the line for checkout gets longer in the weekday evenings than I ever see it at weekends.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I visited this Whole Foods to return an Amazon package while traveling in New York, and it turned out to be incredibly convenient! The return process is on the second floor, where self-service machines and helpful staff make it quick and easy. Upstairs, there‚Äôs a small Kimaka coffee bar and plenty of seating areas, which was a pleasant surprise in such an expensive area. It‚Äôs perfect for a quick rest or even getting some work done.

The first floor has the classic Whole Foods setup with a wide variety of products and plenty of checkout counters. While it‚Äôs not the tidiest, it‚Äôs impressive for Manhattan, where spacious places to sit and eat are rare. You can grab food from the first floor and relax upstairs. For a grocery store in such a busy area, this location offers a great shopping and dining experience. Highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre staying nearby‚Äîideal for shopping, resting, or even working for a bit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Case of mistaken identity. I thought it was another wholefoods i was used to years ago. I was disappointed that it wasn't and the right one was 6 to 7 blocks away. I however made a wonderful discovery üòÄ.  I hate yogurt but my sister had a new liking to it. I bought her a few and decided to try one and i was surprised by the case and texture of this yogurt. It was absolutely amazing. La fermiere passion fruit and mango.
I bought other things but who cares, I found a new liking to something I hated for years. It goes to show, you have to try the right thing before you like it.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wasn't sure if they were going to have a wide fresh foods section, but they do! And all of the produces were of high quality and wonderfully organized. So happy to have another Whole Foods in UES. The checkouts are mostly self-checkout, and they also have the checkout with palm functionality.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fairway Market of 74th Street
address: 2131 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'As my side hustle/passion project, I've been on a search to find the best grocery store rotisserie chicken in the world. Fairway is the current #1, and it's not even close. It's my 2018 LeBron. My Wayne Gretzky. My George Washington.

All this to say, my parents were on town for the weekend and we walked by this Fairway on the way to Central park, and they have a sign outside that says "Best Tissi in NYC according to @jnov_" which is kind of crazy, but I try not to get to high or to low. You can't ride the roller coaster, it will destroy you. I try to just work hard, control everything I can control, and let the chips fall where they may.

My parents, on the other hand, were JUICED. They made me take a picture with the sign, and when we walked inside to find the birds, they were giddy as another sign was there with the rack of rotisserie chickens completely empty. They started telling the employees that that's me and I‚Äôm the ‚ÄúTissi guy,‚Äù and I got really shy and embarrassed as I'm introverted by nature.

But at the same time, it does give me a warm and fuzzy feeling to have my parents be genuinely proud of me. There really is nothing like it. Shoutout to Steve and Nanc.

I will leave you with a quote that I saw on Tiktok the other day: "I can't celebrate my achievements because, in my mind, it was my obligation to achieve them."

SHOUTOUT TO FAIRWAY KEEP SLANGIN THEM BIRDS!

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Good prices, decent selection that good enough but not great. Wait for bottle return can be long; only 1 machine for each type of bottle. Machines break to often and‚Äùbottle people ‚Äú like this location.  Finding what you‚Äôre shopping for a turn into a scavenger hunt until you ‚Äúlearn‚Äù the store.  Navigating aisles often a challenge since they are very narrow.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fairway
2131 Broadway
New York, NY 10023

This chicken was perfectly seasoned with black pepper and a slightly pink center.

It definitely has a kick because of the fairly proportioned pepper seasoning.

#RotisserieChicken #tisserie #chicken #fairwaynyc #FairwayNation', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Fairway has the best smoked whitefish salad. I compared it with the famous grocery store down the street and Fairway wins hands down. Fairway, you're my favorite now!‚ù§Ô∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Miyokos cream cheese yes please! Also nuts for cheese smoke Gouda, country crock plant based whip cream.. this place has more vegan options than most in the upper west side', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fairway Market of 86th Street
address: 240 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I am disappointed with the repeated pricing issues at this supermarket. Several times I have picked up items clearly marked with a discount, but at checkout I was charged the original, higher price. When I brought it to the attention of the employee, I was told that the scanner showed the original price and that if I wanted proof, I should go back to the stand and take a picture of the label myself.

As a customer, I expect the shelf price to match what I‚Äôm charged at the register, and it should not be my responsibility to gather evidence. This has happened more than once, and it feels misleading and frustrating. I hope management takes this seriously and ensures that the prices displayed on the shelves are honored at checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I had one of the most horrible experiences at this Fairway which I go to nearly everyday to pick up fresh groceries to cook. Yesterday, I was at the store to buy a pack of salmon and a few fresh vegetables to prepare for dinner. Before I purchased the salmon, I specifically quadruple checked with the fishmonger and the Fairway representative guy (Jerome?)  who is always at the store offering his assistance to the customers in the store to see if the salmon is skinless since it wasn‚Äôt stated or printed on the packet. The fishmonger and Jerome kept telling me many times that it is skinless as it is a ‚Äúfilet.‚Äù After confirming it many times and I asked about 4 times to make sure it is skinless. To my disappointment, the salmon‚Äôs skin was still intact and I was prepping my dinner for the night. I had to pull out the skin on my own with force as I‚Äôm not a fishmonger and experience with de-skinning the salmon, a quarter of my fish was ruined. Also, as I don‚Äôt know how to take out the skin properly, the fish was still attached with this dark layer which caused it to be extremely fishy. It was such a waste because dinner was ruined and fish was too fishy to be eaten. Today I went back to the store to pick up a fresh baked French baguette and charcuterie. I saw Jerome again and told him my disappointment with the salmon with the skin issue. I showed him the picture and he was apologetic and offered to refund for a store credit. He walked with me to two ladies at Fairway who is some sort of manager and they said there is nothing they could do. The fish does have skin and I need to ask the fishmonger at the seafood counter to take off the skin, although Jerome confirmed and told her that I was told by the store fishmonger that it is ‚ÄúSkinless.‚Äù I was so embarrassed and wasted my breath just talking to the useless, incompetent team of Fairway. She didn‚Äôt apologize at all and kept pretending that she doesn‚Äôt know what her team (Jerome) was talking about. I am utterly disgusted with her and how she managed the entire situation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wow!!! The rudest service (!!!). Prices on the labels are not matching up to the prices at the checkout. No managers are supervising, or seems to care. Incredibly expensive as well, for the same stuff you can get cheaper even at Whole foods.  Wow. So disappointed', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I dropped by to buy gluten-free pie crusts, as Key Food and Whole Foods don‚Äôt stock them. They‚Äôre a bit pricey at $6.89 each, but they have them, along with a lot of other gluten-free grocery items.

Grocery prices look a bit higher here. Self checkout is fast and convenient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The people that work here are rude. It is Wednesday night June 4. I was at Fairway at about 830.The checkout staff, particularly the girls, displayed a rude attitude that is unacceptable. One girl even said, "I told you to wait a second," and I was taken aback by her tone. Customers should never be spoken to in such a disrespectful manner. When another staff member came over to ask what had happened, she was just as dismissive. I took my receipt from her, and then a male employee interjected, telling me how to take the receipt. The behavior I witnessed is unprofessional, and it seems like there are serious issues with the staff. I will never go to the store again, and if I could file a bigger complaint, I totally will. They need to retrain and rehire new staff.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: SIX 60 ONE - KOSHER ON AMSTERDAM
address: 661 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: supermarket, sandwich_shop, catering_service, deli, food_delivery, meal_takeaway, grocery_store, bakery, food_store, store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'They sell kabocha squash. I have looked for this in every grocery store in NYC and no one has it. But, they do! Their chicken is so fresh‚Äîmakes the best bone broth! Their prices are  reasonable. And have a question about a meat you might need? They‚Äôll provide you the butchers phone number and you can make arrangements. Incredible customer service! I love this place.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wonderful new supermarket on Amsterdam in the UWS. They‚Äôve packed such a huge assortment of items into a small footprint it‚Äôs amazing. You can really find everything you need plus many specialty items from the Middle East. The prepared foods are great (especially the hummus and eggplant dishes) and the staff is really friendly. I‚Äôve added it to my regular shopping loop (with TJs and Health Nuts).', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great selection and prices were surprisingly reasonable. I just finished a $4.99 spicy tuna sandwich which was quite tasty! And they even had Elite popping chocolate which can be hard to find even in Israel

The only way to make this place better would be if it had Speed Dating for the UWS singles!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I ordered $300 of food from Six60One more than 24 hours before it was due to be delivered. With no call, no email, no text, no warning whatsoever, Six60One delivered my order around two hours before Shabbat WITHOUT ANY MEAT. My kitchen is broken and I have a full-time job and two young children which is why I spent so much money on delivery. No one picked up the phone at the shop (I called at least five times) and then I had to then stop what I was doing and try to run to the store before it closed, as basically all other kosher options were closed by that point. I was offered nothing more than an ‚ÄúOops, we‚Äôre sorry‚Äù - not any discount or refund on the food I ended up purchasing - not even a refund on the delivery fee after I had to make the trip myself. I have now followed up with a manager three times with no response. Six60one cannot be relied upon to deliver food for Shabbat. This experience has been shameful.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "If you're ever in the area you must make a stop here.
Amazing store great staff and decent prices.
The food here is out of this world, from raw ingredients like produce to meat with everything in the middle to ready food they have everything from freshly baked goods to fresh Sushi and an amazing Deli.
Will definitely go back.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eli's Market
address: 1411 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, bakery, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Beautifully arranged market with fresh ingredients, great sandwiches, and friendly service. The produce is always top quality, and their bakery items never disappoint. Seating can be limited, but the delicious food and cozy neighborhood vibe make it a must-stop on the UES.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is a stunningly maintained market with an amazing selection of hard to find things and variety all in one place.  I know the prices can be higher, but that's what you have to expect in order to maintain a place with standards this high.  The bakery items are always so fresh and so good, they make the best store croissant in the city.  The service and staff are helpful and friendly and the quality and presentation can't be beat.  Complaints about the prices are pointless because you can always go to Food Bazaar if all you care about is price.  This is a wonderful place to stop in the neighborhood to pick up a few of your favorite things.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went a couple of times for the dessert bar. Noted their strawberry desserts where looking good. Bought some for my kid. It seems they make their cakes in-House and cut into portions. Overall, the place is clean and products looked well maintained. Fast cashier lines as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Is Eli's on the way out? I mean, just like Eli's old place, The Vinegar Factory, it seems like nobody is ever there- must do most of their business with deliveries. I've relied on them for years to have the best, freshest foods and gourmet groceries and they still come through with great stuff. But it's the little things that can tell you which way the wind is blowing. This past week, Eli's began charging for ice packs- you know, those frozen blocks of gel that you put with your perishable foods so they make it home in good shape. Up until about a week ago, these were free, which is fair since you pay a premium for pretty much everything in the store. Do you really want to risk that $30 piece of poached salmon getting gross on the way home? No, you don't. But now there's a charge for those little blocks of freshness. I get having to charge if you're filling up your basket with them or if you're not getting anything else, but when you've just spent $200 on a single bag of groceries, it's a little insulting that you need to pay even more just because you don't live around the corner. So I go back to my original question- is Eli's on the way out? If they need to start charging for these little ice packs to maintain the financial health of the store, it doesn't make me feel too confident about what the future holds for this Upper East Side treasure.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This grocery store is amazing, and stuff is super friendly. Davis from the cheese section was so helpful and friendly that for sure I‚Äôll be coming back again next week.

They have a high quality range of products and staff is knowledgeable too, from Spanish ham, to fresh fish, nuts, a delectable
Section of cheeses, pasta‚Ä¶etc, I just love this place.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Key Food Supermarkets
address: 530 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
types: supermarket, butcher_shop, deli, grocery_store, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Still has a butcher counter that wraps meat in paper. Local milk in glass bottles with $2 returns. The Polish grandma at register 3 knows I want my rye bread sliced thin. Smells like fresh dill and baking bread, nothing like fluorescent-lit supermarkets.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'So, I. always looked away from the narrow aisles, and generally unpleasant store environment because they are often price leaders. I was a loyal customer, AT LEAST once to twice a week.   Recently, Keyfood has introduced this idiotic "digital coupon" process by which you can get additional discounts by "clipping" coupons on the internet.  Well, the system confuses people, is clearly prone to glitching, and there is NO IN STORE TERMINAL for patrons to use, if needed, to "clip" coupons.  Also, instead of only listing the electronic coupons that are relevant  for your chosen store, you have to sift through about 300 coupons, that represent EVERY STORE in the Keyfood system. This makes it very easy to miss a coupon.  The other day the system glitched, and the coupon that I electronically clipped was not clipped.  Manager had NO INTEREST in making it right.  I loath these multilayered discounts. IF YOU WANT TO HAVE A SALE, THEN HAVE IT, BUT DO NOT MAKE IT A CONFUSING MULTILAYERED SYSTEM. They admitted that MANY patrons were having issues with the electronic coupons.  I am so disgusted at the store's lack of an in-store customer use terminal and the utter incompetence of the manager at night. Keep. your store. You have lost a lifetime of patronage..', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This was hands down my worst grocery shopping experience in the city. The aisles are hardly wide enough to fit the grocery carts they provide. And at 6pm on a Friday, the store was cluttered with crates of supplies to restock the shelves... Most stores decide to do this late at night, but I guess rush hour works just as well?', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It is convenient to have Key Food in our neighborhood. I was able to find some vegetables that the kids like in this store. I plan to shop more often there to discover what more they are offering.

I gave this five stars based on how convenient it is to me. I don‚Äôt mind crowned store or certain selections as long as I can have fresh produces and milk within minutes from my home door to door. I know how to pick fresh meat, so I will buy or not buy based on my judgement of the meat. However, I usually shop for fresh vegetables because we prefer a plant-based diet (and I don‚Äôt want to drag sweet potatoes for blocks away from home, nor do I like to send my sweet athlete husband to drag those potatoes).

I found the staff very friendly, which is always nice.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Frankie is the best butcher ‚Äî the weekly specials are well priced and he will cut exactly what you want if it‚Äôs not on the shelf. Reason enough to go to this store, even if the aisles are crowded and the manager is rude.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

Got oranges with a clear price 3 for 2$ came to cashier and it became almost 9$. The manager absolutely stupid couldn‚Äôt resolve the issue. He was eating his food at the check out desk having no clue how to resolve the issue. No idea where were the oranges 3 for 2 or why the pile of oranges had that price tag. The same issue happened in the past with eggs and milk much higher price at the check out.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'just bought a bunch of frozen items and came home to find that they had previously melted and been refrozen :( also have seen expired items on shelves here many times. buyers beware!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve been here many times. The merchandise is orderly and easily searched. The fruit and vegetables are carefully prepared and freshened. I returned some Boars Head deli meat in the recall effortlessly. Their prices are not the lowest but they have sale items that compensate.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Brooklyn Fare
address: 75 W End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: grocery_store, food_delivery, supermarket, food_store, store, food, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Nice supermarket however they‚Äôre not very friendly. You have the big buff security guards standing by the camera guarding the building. They think everybody is stealing and they got the young girls with the long lashes who are rude. These people should probably take a customer service class.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "One of my favorite grocery stores in the area - clean, well stocked and very reasonable prices given the location. Also, in the rare event I arrive shortly before closing hours (sorry, sometimes it happens), nobody ever gives me wry faces or chases me out. Quite the opposite, I've only dealt with polite and patient, laid back staff. Thank you.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Brooklyn Fare is not your average grocery store; it transcends the mundane experience of shopping for daily necessities and transforms it into an awe-inspiring adventure. I recently had the pleasure of visiting this remarkable establishment, and I must admit that it left an indelible impression on me. From the moment I stepped inside, I was immersed in a world of culinary delights, surrounded by an unimaginable array of products that would make any food lover's heart skip a beat.

Upon entering Brooklyn Fare, one cannot help but be captivated by the sheer magnitude of its offerings. The store's shelves are thoughtfully stocked with an astounding variety of goods, ranging from pantry staples to exotic delicacies. The aisles are meticulously organized, ensuring that every product is easily accessible. It's like stepping into a cornucopia of flavors, where the possibilities seem endless.

What sets Brooklyn Fare apart from other grocery stores in the neighborhood is the staggering selection it boasts. While nearby bodegas and gourmet grocery stores may have limited offerings, Brooklyn Fare takes it to a whole new level. It feels almost surreal to wander through the aisles, gazing at walls filled with pint-sized ice cream, tuna, and countless other items. It evokes a sense of childlike wonder, akin to experiencing a supermarket for the first time.

One of the highlights of my visit was discovering the vast selection of gourmet and specialty products. Brooklyn Fare caters to the most discerning palates, providing an extensive assortment of high-quality items that are often challenging to find elsewhere. Whether you're searching for rare spices, artisanal cheeses, or imported delicacies, this store has it all. It's a treasure trove for food enthusiasts, inspiring culinary experimentation and expanding horizons.

Apart from its incredible variety, Brooklyn Fare excels in providing an immersive and welcoming atmosphere. The staff members are knowledgeable, friendly, and always ready to offer assistance. They exude a genuine passion for food, eager to share their expertise and make recommendations. This creates a pleasant shopping experience, where customers can engage with the staff and discover new culinary delights.

Furthermore, the store's commitment to quality is evident in every aspect. The fresh produce section showcases an impressive selection of vibrant fruits and vegetables, meticulously arranged to ensure optimal freshness. The butcher counter presents an assortment of premium cuts, appealing to even the most discerning carnivores. It's a testament to Brooklyn Fare's dedication to sourcing the finest ingredients for its customers.

In conclusion, Brooklyn Fare is a grocery store unlike any other. It transcends the boundaries of a traditional supermarket and transforms shopping into an extraordinary experience. Its unparalleled selection, encompassing everything from everyday essentials to gourmet treasures, is a testament to the store's commitment to culinary excellence. Whether you're a food aficionado or simply seeking to explore the world of flavors, Brooklyn Fare is a must-visit destination that will leave you in awe and redefine your perception of what a grocery store can be.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I noticed pretty much the same problem as this comment from: Jacqueline Cadwelle (This supermarket is very prejudiced, they don't like to help us black people, they will just watch you and look you up and down as if you are stealing. They don't greet you, they just tell you the price and ask if you want a bag,
I will not shop here again.
The power is always off, they are constantly having their own conversations at the checkouts and the security guards will make you feel uncomfortable by watching you the whole time you are shopping and looking at you. They have a whole new staff which is all they need to work on their personality and work environment.) the customer service is not at all operational really not at all I asked for help with an item they were not even able to help me anymore they prefer to talk among colleagues they clearly told me no to manage on your own frankly it is really unpleasant disastrous after I don't mention the whole team, but a very large part. In short, I'm disappointed.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazing shopping experience, clean space, fresh produce, huge selection of groceries, knowledgeable and friendly staff and very professional. Plus, Takis intensity delivered here every week!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 2073 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The lines can get really long at some times, but it goes by pretty quickly. Last time I went, they had a rule where each customer could only get one carton of eggs, but I‚Äôm not sure if that‚Äôs still a thing or not. They have great variety of flowers for valentine‚Äôs day too.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Store is underground over two floors.
The queue can be quite long. Sometimes one line goes way faster than the other which can be annoying.
Some really friendly staff.
Good selection of products!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Always friendly service! The cashier named Alexa was especially lovely and kind and deserve a special shout out.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Cashiers routinely somehow decide that the items in my cart are no good - apparently my chicken looked unsafe for consumption, then another day, it was raspberries. By doing so, all they're accomplishing is throwing out perfectly good food (none of the items that they pointed out as looking bad were actually "bad"). Please just focus on scanning my items. No small talk or unsolicited safety concerns are needed.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoyed shopping at the Trader Joe‚Äôs on 72nd.  It was my first time shopping at this location.  The employees and managers were very nice.   I met a pleasant employee name Shaun.  He was very helpful and polite.  He was very informative.  I will return and shop again.  Thank you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 670 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Love this Trader Joe store. Convenient to cross the Park via 96St. Everyone so nice. 1st time trying the frozen breaded Cod, very delicious, nice hearty all fish, light breading. Add in some grilled seasoned "Ready Veggies", spinach, tomato. Thank you TJ. Please open a store in the East 90's. ‚ù§Ô∏è', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I've been to this location before over a year ago because I live on the other side of the park and I decided to go to get a vegan frozen dish and I wind up buying a whole lot more. I forgot how good Trader Joe's really is I highly recommended for great and good eats! The staff is great as well and very helpful.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Clearly, I love this place. I rely on them for some of my staples: Tofu, gazpacho ingredients, whole grain flour tortillas, giant bars of well-priced 72% Belgian chocolate. I have found some great plants here. I feel fortunate to have this store within walking distance of my apartment. They have a public restroom (as does 72/Bdwy); let‚Äôs face it, sometimes that‚Äôs super helpful. Thank you for existingüôÇ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Produce is not that great but prices are good. Staff are always nice. If you like DOGS they are plenty of them here. Not joking

December 2024 update close to the staff. They do an excellent job on a Sunday night when
the line is super long.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Great, well stocked location, not as busy as some other New York Trader Joe's , very reasonable prices and friendly staff members", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 10 Columbus Cir Ste Sc101, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I rarely writw reviews on google map but this time I have said they really deserve it. This is the best whole foods in Manhattan. Peter (I think that was his name) helped me carrying my bags upstairs, he was so kind and joyfull! He teamed with Mirlene (I made sure I had their name because thwy were so nice really) I spent every week $$$ because variety of options, quality of products and so many hard workers keeping everything nice and organize for customers.
Top notch', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods Market is always one of the busiest spots‚Äîespecially the elevator, which is constantly packed with people coming and going. The in-store restaurant is equipped with restrooms, and the entire market is always buzzing with activity, so expect to wait in line no matter when you go. That said, one of the best things to do in the summer is grab some fresh sushi and a cold soda here, then head to Central Park for the perfect picnic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently visited this Whole Foods and had an excellent experience. I picked up some Whole Grain Checkers cereal and a vegan chocolate bar, both of which were exactly what I was looking for. The store was well-stocked and organized, which made shopping a breeze.

A special shout-out to John, the cashier, who was wearing a "Cashier of 2019" badge‚Äîhe‚Äôs still doing an amazing job! His friendly demeanor and efficient service made the checkout process smooth and quick. It's rare to see such consistent quality in service, and John‚Äôs professionalism is definitely appreciated.

Overall, this store always provides a great shopping experience, and I‚Äôll certainly be back. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "If you read past Google reviews, you'll see customers reporting RACISM, RACIAL PROFILING, AND DISCRIMINATION at this store. The pattern is clear, and the manager‚Äôs dismissive attitude is part of the problem. That‚Äôs why these experiences continue.

I reported a serious incident involving mistreatment that strongly appeared to be racist and discriminatory by an employee in the seafood department. What shocked me most was not only the behavior of the employee, but also the store‚Äôs refusal to take any meaningful action or even acknowledge wrongdoing. According to the manager, KUNHO, I will receive neither an apology from the employee nor any follow-up from the store. He questioned whether my experience was real but wouldn‚Äôt even attempt to verify what happened while I was still physically present in the store. When I offered to wait so he could check the camera, he told me I could wait as many hours as I liked, and he still wouldn‚Äôt check it because he was ‚Äúvery busy.‚Äù What kind of manager responds like that? Shame on you, KUNHO.

To the employee: If you do not want to interact with customers respectfully, why not work at a place where you do not need to deal with customers? That way, you will have no opportunity to mistreat customers, and more people will be happy.

To the store manager KUNHO: I hope you and your family will never be mistreated like that in any place by any employee like yours, and if that unfortunately happens, the issue will be resolved effectively by a good store manager‚Äînot someone like you.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I personally feel like this location is the easiest to find items that are well priced. Compared to the SoHo location for example, there are less rows of empty shelves.
The line moves quickly here as well. The major downside is the seating area.
A few years back this seating area had a coffee shop and juice bar but that‚Äôs been replaced by an Amazon pick up center. The seating is minimal in my opinion, but that could be because so many other locations have more space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Zabar's
address: 2245 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
types: tourist_attraction, coffee_shop, cafe, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is a great neighborhood store. Usually very busy in the morning. They have all the Jewish food and breakfast options that you can think of and the service is usually good. This is a staple on the upper west side and has been around for years.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A delightful delicatessen wonderland‚ÄîZabar‚Äôs is packed with gourmet treasures. The cheese selection is incredible, and there‚Äôs no shortage of tempting sweets, specialty ingredients, and quality cooking supplies. Always a joy to explore, whether you‚Äôre shopping for something specific or just soaking in the classic New York atmosphere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lot's of good treats to enjoy and explore in this bakery. This place was the inspiration for Seinfeld's "Schnitzer's"  from where the infamous Marble Rye came from.   They have Babka too!  Chocolate, cinnamon and Apple!  I didn't know about the apple flavor', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Zabar's was a perfect experience. The menu, the employee service, the option to eat inside or outside while people watching,
-all of it was great. Definitely worth a stop on a weekend or if you're visiting from out of town. Pictured here: the Classic Nova Bagel", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Home away from home. A place for breakfast,lunch or anytime you want something nice and good to eat and drink.
I loved their bagels.  Had an everything bagel toasted with plain  cream cheese everyday.  But there's much more. You can sandwiches, soups,  muffins and all sort of yummy pastries, not to mention hot and cold beverages.
The staff is nice.
Definitely would recommend it.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1551 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I want to give a huge shout-out to Sarjo in the bakery department! Her customer service was absolutely incredible. She was so sweet, patient, and genuinely went above and beyond to help me pick out the perfect cake for my brother‚Äôs birthday. You can tell she‚Äôs a hard worker who truly cares about her customers.

Thank you, Sarjo, for making the experience so easy and enjoyable. Whole Foods is lucky to have someone like you on their team!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Time 9.49pm 10/10/2025
The worst ever experience not in Whole Food but ii our life. As we were checking out almost at last item the costumer next to us broke down in floor with loud noice a glass bottle . We were scary first because the glasses spread all over. Just as we were making sure to pay the next cashier , her name on tag was Monica ,without excusing or asking if we can move over , with the worst attitude and a rudeness ,with a manner of insulting said:
Move over don‚Äôt block my space !
As we told her we can‚Äôt because is plenty with glasses and slippery and we ready to leave she continue;
I don‚Äôt care just move move ‚Ä¶ And continue to be more aggressive until we ask her for name and took the picture of the floor‚Ä¶.
Everything is on camera and we want to be open and check this case because we don‚Äôt feel comfortable to shop in our favorite place Whole Food..', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve shopped here many times but on several occasions I‚Äôve been overcharged at the counter. When I asked why the woman at the express checkout simply insisted that the price was correct.

Today for example there was a clear offer: 4 avocados for $5 for Prime members. I scanned my Prime QR code at checkout yet she charged me $9.96. When I showed her a photo of the price tag she just shrugged and said she had no idea about it. Very disappointing experience being overcharged repeatedly and met with indifference.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Consistently unhelpful staff and customer service. After a 10 minute wait, they refused to take me and forced me to leave the items behind or get into another, even longer line.  Another time was carrying a handful of food and items fell out of my hands. I asked a stock person to help me find a basket.  They told me to go to another floor to get one myself.  Place is a maze and you can never find anything.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Worst WF in NYC. I call it Hell Foods. name: Whole Foods Market
address: 808 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a disturbing experience with a female security contractor at this Whole Foods. During a conversation, she mocked my accent verbatim, made a racist comment about my supposed ethnic origin, and told me to ‚Äúgo shop in Chinatown instead.‚Äù She then asserted that everything in the store ‚Äúbelongs to her,‚Äù using that as justification for rude and intimidating behavior.

This is unacceptable at any retailer, especially one that claims to value inclusion. I‚Äôm asking management to review the relevant camera footage, address the contractor‚Äôs behavior with her employer, and ensure all staff and third-party personnel receive training on anti-harassment and anti-discrimination. I‚Äôd also appreciate a follow-up from the store manager regarding what corrective actions will be taken.

She is unprofessional and unethical.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Belinda was a great help at customer service she quickly identified the problem and provided outstanding service to get to a solution. Thank you so much Belinda and the Whole Foods team Will definitely continue shopping here thanks to the outstanding staff!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoy this grocery store as an option in our neighborhood. Their produce is excellent. Their variety in prepared foods, cheese and frozen foods is the best in this whole neighborhood I think. It beats Key Food and Trader Joe‚Äôs by miles. I enjoy the self serve food bars, these I do find pricey but sometimes I need the convenience. Their produce store also has a nice vibe to it and their self care section is quite good.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very large supermarket serving the Upper Westside, with very fully stocked shelves and slightly higher prices. They also had free shrimp samples', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As far as uptown WholePaychecks go, this spot is far superior to the Harlem spot. And by that I mean the service and layout.

The butcher and fish counter associates are both serviceable and much better than the zombies in deli/premade (consistently the most attitude). 80% will give you stank face, 18% indifferent and on rare occasions, a unicorn will be spotted, the one who‚Äôs actually care about good service. Still, it‚Äôs better than 125th branch‚Äôs 99% stank face average.

The product here is standard WF. On occasion, they‚Äôll have a good selection of grass fed Venison and Bison and Pasteur raised meats. There‚Äôs a few local items in some departments.

The 12 for $12 oyster Friday is the move, get here before 2pm. The words out and there‚Äôs a few grandmas who literally come to buy the entire stock out. The early bird catches the worm.

They always run out of their branded coconut water (pink one) so when you see it out, grab some because it‚Äôll be days until they put more out. You‚Äôre welcome.

The service overall and checkout associates are hit or miss. If you remember WF before Amazon and before they came to the city and expect that level of service & quality- then you must have just came out of a Time Machine. That ship sailed a decade + ago. The vibe here is mostly indifferent, with an occasional mid level of job efficiency.

Sundays are a mess. Tuesday‚Äôs looks like an apocalypse hit the store. It‚Äôs usually the last day of the sales, which means most items are gone. If ya didn‚Äôt get here on Monday, it‚Äôs a wrap. If pastrami is ever on sale at the deli counter, get there the first day- Wednesday because it‚Äôs gone by Friday and they never seem to restock.

Checkout is 1000% faster than 59th street and Harlem. The self checkout is the hero but you knew that already, didn‚Äôt you Chad?', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Butterfield Market
address: 1150 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
types: butcher_shop, bagel_shop, florist, meal_takeaway, bakery, market, restaurant, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'We stopped by the Butterfield Market and ended up getting coffee, chicken salad, and a baguette. The chicken salad was excellent and the coffee and baguette were also good. They have a very large selection of food and were efficient in moving people through. I enjoyed browsing here and would come back for more of their deli products. The coffee was good but there are other places I would pick first.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great food , fresh food, hot soup, lentil, leek soup, and a great matzoh ball all the time. Sourdough bread, gourmet, good service and if you get a seat in front of the building, it‚Äôs much like a promenade where people walk back-and-forth and some of the beautiful clothing they are wearing, and these lovely lovely Retail stores right across the street from Butterfield.
Customer service and lots of customer service on the floor to help you with anything.
They are known for their yogurt, whether it‚Äôs cold or  it is very hot. Everyone is trying to get a cup or cone of their yogurt and they may have ice cream that I don‚Äôt know..', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Had their seasonal pumpkin soft serving today and it was phenomenal. I have been shopping here for years, and I love their prepared food. Everything is so clean and organized here. Absolutely adore this store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The market, situated in the Upper area, offers an array of fresh and appealing fare ‚Äî the sort one might rather sensibly purchase in the morning and enjoy leisurely in Central Park, rather than dining immediately at a restaurant. The quality, I must say, was notably superior to that of markets in the lower part of town, perhaps owing to the more refined neighbourhood. There was a splendid selection of produce and provisions, and just as I arrived, fresh sushi rolls and salads were being newly displayed. Observing the local residents eagerly adding them to their baskets lent a certain trustworthiness to the offerings, and I found myself thinking that I should very much like to return here more frequently on future visits to New York.

That said, the conduct of the staff left rather much to be desired. They were not especially attentive, nor did they convey any sense of warmth or regard for the customer ‚Äî merely attending to their tasks with a sort of detached efficiency. Still, one might say that simply carrying out one‚Äôs duties is, in such places, quite sufficient. In the end, I was rather grateful that the establishment prioritised cleanliness and quality produce over polished service.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We were walking through the park and decided to start looking for some lunch.  This was perfect!  This reminded me of what I imagine the Barefoot Contessa would be like.  There are benches outside or you can walk to the park for a picnic', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1175 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, health, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Whole Foods Market on 69th Street is a convenient spot for quick grocery runs. The store is clean and well-arranged, offering fresh produce, snacks, and everyday essentials. Since it‚Äôs a smaller-format store, the selection is more limited, and popular items can sell out quickly. Checkout can get crowded during peak hours, but overall it‚Äôs a handy option for nearby residents.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The new Whole Foods daily shops will take over the city, in a good way! It‚Äôs everything I like to get in the big stores but condensed into a small, fast space. Almond flour was literally 50% the cost of Gristedes (aka Gross-tedes). They are working on better priced options and features like Amazon One palm pay mean I don‚Äôt even need to get my wallet out when looking after my baby and carrying a million things. This place is popular after work - the line for checkout gets longer in the weekday evenings than I ever see it at weekends.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I visited this Whole Foods to return an Amazon package while traveling in New York, and it turned out to be incredibly convenient! The return process is on the second floor, where self-service machines and helpful staff make it quick and easy. Upstairs, there‚Äôs a small Kimaka coffee bar and plenty of seating areas, which was a pleasant surprise in such an expensive area. It‚Äôs perfect for a quick rest or even getting some work done.

The first floor has the classic Whole Foods setup with a wide variety of products and plenty of checkout counters. While it‚Äôs not the tidiest, it‚Äôs impressive for Manhattan, where spacious places to sit and eat are rare. You can grab food from the first floor and relax upstairs. For a grocery store in such a busy area, this location offers a great shopping and dining experience. Highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre staying nearby‚Äîideal for shopping, resting, or even working for a bit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Case of mistaken identity. I thought it was another wholefoods i was used to years ago. I was disappointed that it wasn't and the right one was 6 to 7 blocks away. I however made a wonderful discovery üòÄ.  I hate yogurt but my sister had a new liking to it. I bought her a few and decided to try one and i was surprised by the case and texture of this yogurt. It was absolutely amazing. La fermiere passion fruit and mango.
I bought other things but who cares, I found a new liking to something I hated for years. It goes to show, you have to try the right thing before you like it.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wasn't sure if they were going to have a wide fresh foods section, but they do! And all of the produces were of high quality and wonderfully organized. So happy to have another Whole Foods in UES. The checkouts are mostly self-checkout, and they also have the checkout with palm functionality.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Milano Market
address: 1582 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

I would recommend checking this place out if you‚Äôre in or near Central Park!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A friend kept urging me to check out the Milano Market on the corner of East 89th and Third Avenue and this morning, I walked in and LOVED the store.
