Really disappointing and it completely ruined my appetite. I hope they pay more attention to the freshness of their desserts.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Ouri's Market
address: 1160 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "On today's episode of Chicken Wars, we have Ouri‚Äôs. They have a few locations, but I went to the one on the Upper East Side. A whole chicken ran $25.99 which made me want to swallow a cactus. I felt like I took a baseball bat to the liver or got hit by a spinning back elbow from jon jones. Nonetheless, I‚Äôm here to find the best tissi, regardless of price.

As much as I wanted to hate it due to the price point, this chicken went CRAZY. Tender breast, great leg, elite skin. My only critique is that there wasn‚Äôt a lot of flavor in the meat itself, but it was still operating at a high level. I scored it 8.5/10, which ranks it tied for 5th with Wegmans out of 30 grocery stores I have currently tried. You could get 2.6 Wegmans chickens for this price, but that‚Äôs neither here nor there.

I will never be back because I‚Äôm never paying $25.99 for a chicken outside of Chicken Wars, but it was a great bird I can‚Äôt even lie.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This feels like you are in an episode of Kimmy Schmidt and everyone is Jaqueline. The stereotypical upper east side snobs. If you are visiting NYC, this would be a good place to see Upper East Side culture.  Come here as a cultural experience, but not to shop.  Gawk at the locals in their snobbery as they buy over priced and over marketed products. There is marble over 90% of the surfaces while every employee ignores you while you stand in front of them trying to order a coffee.
They have copied the smoothie of a popular LA market that they are clearly trying to mimic. Then watch rude customers hit your heel with their shopping cart and then get mad at you. My husband was walking though the aisles and a woman told him to get out of the way. He was behind a line of people so where was he supposed to go? The layout of the place is awful and has no flow so crowds lump and you can‚Äôt move.  I went in happy and came out so irritated by the terrible service, the upper East Side attitude and the general agro vibe of all in there. Thankfully we did not spend any money here. It‚Äôs just a funny cultural experience for anyone wanting a glimpse into upper east side ‚Äúhospitality ‚Äú and entitlement.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Although I have visited New York around ten times, I have rarely had the opportunity to shop at local markets. However, I happened to come across this one by chance, and it immediately struck me as clean and well-maintained.

When purchasing sushi, freshness is my top priority, and this place appeared to meet that standard with its relatively high level of hygiene. The fruits, coffee, and baked goods also looked fresh, and most notably, the steady stream of customers suggested that products were selling quickly and being replenished frequently.

Outside the market, several tables were available, making it a convenient spot for travelers to rest and enjoy their food in a relaxed setting.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beautiful supermarket -however, that‚Äôs where it ends.  The service at the bagel counter is disastrous and embarrassing for an establishment such as this one who prides  themselves to be an upscale supermarket. The service at   the bagel counter is horrendous. The bagel makers are extremely rude and very unhelpful. They are constantly running out of vegetables for the bagels-you‚Äôre in a supermarket go get it  or tell management to bring more v to the counter. I have gone so far as to offer to bring my own box of lettuce that I wanted in my sandwich. I write this review after visiting the bagel counter, many many times and hoping that it would be better but it‚Äôs really not and after looking at some of reviews, I noticed that many people share the same complaints. This is an easy fix and I hope you will do better in the future! Additionally, I share some photos of a box of Cut carrots that I purchased today notice,  that the box says fresh cut carrots, but please see the photos and describe to me how you call this fresh? Ouris, you can do better!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of the best places in New York City to get kosher meat. They have an extensive selection of dry-aged meat. However, the prices are high.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart
address: 210 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Food ain‚Äôt worth the overbearing security. At first I figured if you have so much security then maybe that‚Äôs because the food is so good the people are stealing it. It‚Äôs not good.  It‚Äôs okay, probably won‚Äôt finish my $20 meal of a tea, corn dogs and a chicken sandwich.

I wonder why they have the security then‚Ä¶', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Really compressive selection of Asian and non Asian groceries. The hot food selection is great and the sushi is well stocked. Drink aisle is great too. You can find most common items here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve been an avid shopper of hmart at diff locations throughout the city. But the last few times I‚Äôve picked up any cooked foods or lunch items from this location, they have tasted off‚Ä¶.they very much seem stale and repackaged‚Ä¶.i couldn‚Äôt down the fried chicken‚Ä¶.it tasted weird.

The location in morning side heights has much fresher cooked foods.

Also, yes the security guard is a bit intimidating!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If this security guard harasses you or unfairly targets you, please contact H Mart‚Äôs corporate customer support, file a formal complaint with the NYC Department of Human Rights, and spread the word!

Based on my experience and other reviews, he has a history of targeting Black and Latino customers without any justification, and the store is doing nothing about it! Please make your voice heard!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great selection of Asian groceries ‚Äî you‚Äôll find everything from ingredients for any dish you‚Äôre cooking to a hot bar, Korean skincare, cute home goods, and even a photo booth. I genuinely enjoy what they offer.

However, the shopping experience can feel a bit tense due to the heightened security. Shoppers aren‚Äôt allowed to use their own bags while browsing, there‚Äôs a large surveillance screen displaying live camera feeds of the store, and the security guard‚Äôs presence can feel overly watchful ‚Äî following closely and making it hard to browse comfortably.

There‚Äôs no self-checkout either, which adds to the sense of being monitored. I understand the need for loss prevention, but compared to nearby stores like CVS that use simple product locks, the approach here feels excessive for the location.

It‚Äôs a great store with a lot to love ‚Äî I just wish the environment felt a little more relaxed.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Butterfield Market - Lexington
address: 1114 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
types: sandwich_shop, chocolate_shop, candy_store, bakery, market, dessert_shop, confectionery, restaurant, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I‚Äôve been a gourmet grocery store enthusiast for a few months now. The smoothies here are okay. I‚Äôve had worse smoothies, but I‚Äôve also had much better smoothies. Overall, the bang-for-your-buck rating for Butterfield‚Äôs smoothies is 3/5. The 4 star review is because there is a good selection of non-smoothie items, pictured. They are all, as you might expect, super pricey. But the prepared food looked like a good portion size.
FYI: There‚Äôs a board on the wall with a list of 4 smoothies, but a few laminated pages of other options on another wall, with the ingredients listed so small I had to use my phone to zoom in to read it.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Honestly no notes on this soft serve froyo. It‚Äôs great. The texture is perfect. The peanut butter flavor in the PB frozen yogurt was great.

I loveeee that you can get 2 flavors in a small without swirling. That made my day.

My one complaint is that the line moves SLOW. Like it doesn‚Äôt take long for them to make the froyo, but their points system at check out is the bottleneck. It just takes so long to put in an email & phone number.

They have all sorts of other desserts, meals, prepped food that looks super good. Good selection of gluten free and vegan options.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Amazing, simple, JUMBO frozen yogurt. They put the toppings tucked inside which I respect. Mango and vanilla were both incredible. Texture is perfect. Just a high quality froyo!

Also a cute market inside with hippy / trendy snacks. Upscale grocery store with a very wholesome elderly crowd. It is rejuvenating!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "On this episode of finding the best grocery store rotisserie chicken, we have Butterfield Market in the Upper East Side. It‚Äôs the land of Alo Sweats, Aritzia Puffers, and $10 rice and peas. Their whole vibe is trying to be like the Erewhon of NY.

I must note, there is an asterisk on this review. They only had a cold rotisserie chicken that ran $20.99. When I asked the guy at the deli counter if they made any hot tissis, he said no but he could heat it up and it would still be good. As annoyed as I was at the pricepoint of $20.99, I respect the hell out of them for wanting smoke. Let the record show, Butterfield is ducking NO smoke.

One can‚Äôt help but wonder why they only sell a cold rotisserie chicken in the first place. What is the best use case for that? Kind of hurts my head‚Ä¶

Nonetheless, I got the heated up chicken and took it over to central park to rip the deceased bird limb from limb. Things started off well with the breast, as I felt it was going to land in the low 7 range. I was shocked how decent it was for it being heated up.

But then, the leg came a long. It was essentially inedible. Plywood dry. Sahara Desert dry. The dryness from the reheat reared its ugly head. I winced right as I bit into it, simultaneously reaching for the $5 Voss water I had just bought.

Final score was a 5.3/10. Terrible. But again, respect to Butterfield for stepping up to the plate. I also don't know if this really counts. I would absolutely come back to re-rate if they start selling a hot bird.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Tons of fresh produce and prepared lunch options. The market has a smoothie bar and coffee bar. Sushi, sandwiches, salads, with tons of great food to choose from.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Madison Fare
address: 1225 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Absolutely obsessed with this place! They serve frozen yogurt (froyo) instead of regular ice cream, and it‚Äôs some of the best I‚Äôve had. I tried their signature Pistachio Knafeh, and I‚Äôm seriously in love. It‚Äôs made with plain tart yogurt, pistachio crunch, pistachio butter, and fresh pistachios, such a perfect combo of creamy, crunchy, nutty, and tangy. Every bite was heavenly!

This is definitely my favorite so far, and I‚Äôm already planning to come back to try more flavors and topping combos. But honestly‚Ä¶ I still might get the Pistachio Knafeh again because it‚Äôs just that good ü•π

Highly recommend for any froyo lover looking for something a little elevated and unique.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'got the pistachio frozen yogurt after a 19 mile run and it absolutely hit. super creamy and not too sweet. a bit expensive but worth it once in a while. cute little spot with great presentation. perfect post-run or summer treat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Top contender for my favorite frozen yogurt in the city. It‚Äôs simple, it‚Äôs light, refreshing, creamy, and delicious. I got the ‚Äúplain Greek yogurt‚Äù which came with one drizzle of your choice (fruit, chocolate, or honey). The raspberry drizzle was great!!

They also have free olive oil to drizzle as much as you want which is a MUST. It really leveled up the frozen yogurt.

The pistachio one I‚Äôm sure is good but it just looks too sweet/heavy. I like how light the other ones are.

They also sell candy too. Smell benches outside. No indoor seating but it‚Äôs close to the park if you want to walk there to eat.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Me and my companions got the matcha, pistachio, and plain yogurt from Madison Fare. The yogurt itself was very tasty. I wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of the matcha yogurt as I didn‚Äôt think it tasted much like matcha and was simply sweet. The pistachio tasted much more like pistachio and was delicious, although $14 was a bit of an absurd price. Overall, tasty but not tasty enough for me to come back with the prices being so high.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The frozen yogurt here is absolutely delicious ‚Äî the best I‚Äôve ever had! It has the perfect balance of flavor: slightly tart, not overly sweet, and incredibly creamy. I especially loved the pistachio flavor, but honestly, all the toppings looked amazing. Definitely a treat worth giving yourself!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fairway Market of 74th Street
address: 2131 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'As my side hustle/passion project, I've been on a search to find the best grocery store rotisserie chicken in the world. Fairway is the current #1, and it's not even close. It's my 2018 LeBron. My Wayne Gretzky. My George Washington.

All this to say, my parents were on town for the weekend and we walked by this Fairway on the way to Central park, and they have a sign outside that says "Best Tissi in NYC according to @jnov_" which is kind of crazy, but I try not to get to high or to low. You can't ride the roller coaster, it will destroy you. I try to just work hard, control everything I can control, and let the chips fall where they may.

My parents, on the other hand, were JUICED. They made me take a picture with the sign, and when we walked inside to find the birds, they were giddy as another sign was there with the rack of rotisserie chickens completely empty. They started telling the employees that that's me and I‚Äôm the ‚ÄúTissi guy,‚Äù and I got really shy and embarrassed as I'm introverted by nature.

But at the same time, it does give me a warm and fuzzy feeling to have my parents be genuinely proud of me. There really is nothing like it. Shoutout to Steve and Nanc.

I will leave you with a quote that I saw on Tiktok the other day: "I can't celebrate my achievements because, in my mind, it was my obligation to achieve them."

SHOUTOUT TO FAIRWAY KEEP SLANGIN THEM BIRDS!

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Good prices, decent selection that good enough but not great. Wait for bottle return can be long; only 1 machine for each type of bottle. Machines break to often and‚Äùbottle people ‚Äú like this location.  Finding what you‚Äôre shopping for a turn into a scavenger hunt until you ‚Äúlearn‚Äù the store.  Navigating aisles often a challenge since they are very narrow.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fairway
2131 Broadway
New York, NY 10023

This chicken was perfectly seasoned with black pepper and a slightly pink center.

It definitely has a kick because of the fairly proportioned pepper seasoning.

#RotisserieChicken #tisserie #chicken #fairwaynyc #FairwayNation', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Fairway has the best smoked whitefish salad. I compared it with the famous grocery store down the street and Fairway wins hands down. Fairway, you're my favorite now!‚ù§Ô∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Miyokos cream cheese yes please! Also nuts for cheese smoke Gouda, country crock plant based whip cream.. this place has more vegan options than most in the upper west side', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Fairway Market of 86th Street
address: 240 East 86th St, New York, NY 10028, USA
types: grocery_store, market, supermarket, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I am disappointed with the repeated pricing issues at this supermarket. Several times I have picked up items clearly marked with a discount, but at checkout I was charged the original, higher price. When I brought it to the attention of the employee, I was told that the scanner showed the original price and that if I wanted proof, I should go back to the stand and take a picture of the label myself.

As a customer, I expect the shelf price to match what I‚Äôm charged at the register, and it should not be my responsibility to gather evidence. This has happened more than once, and it feels misleading and frustrating. I hope management takes this seriously and ensures that the prices displayed on the shelves are honored at checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I had one of the most horrible experiences at this Fairway which I go to nearly everyday to pick up fresh groceries to cook. Yesterday, I was at the store to buy a pack of salmon and a few fresh vegetables to prepare for dinner. Before I purchased the salmon, I specifically quadruple checked with the fishmonger and the Fairway representative guy (Jerome?)  who is always at the store offering his assistance to the customers in the store to see if the salmon is skinless since it wasn‚Äôt stated or printed on the packet. The fishmonger and Jerome kept telling me many times that it is skinless as it is a ‚Äúfilet.‚Äù After confirming it many times and I asked about 4 times to make sure it is skinless. To my disappointment, the salmon‚Äôs skin was still intact and I was prepping my dinner for the night. I had to pull out the skin on my own with force as I‚Äôm not a fishmonger and experience with de-skinning the salmon, a quarter of my fish was ruined. Also, as I don‚Äôt know how to take out the skin properly, the fish was still attached with this dark layer which caused it to be extremely fishy. It was such a waste because dinner was ruined and fish was too fishy to be eaten. Today I went back to the store to pick up a fresh baked French baguette and charcuterie. I saw Jerome again and told him my disappointment with the salmon with the skin issue. I showed him the picture and he was apologetic and offered to refund for a store credit. He walked with me to two ladies at Fairway who is some sort of manager and they said there is nothing they could do. The fish does have skin and I need to ask the fishmonger at the seafood counter to take off the skin, although Jerome confirmed and told her that I was told by the store fishmonger that it is ‚ÄúSkinless.‚Äù I was so embarrassed and wasted my breath just talking to the useless, incompetent team of Fairway. She didn‚Äôt apologize at all and kept pretending that she doesn‚Äôt know what her team (Jerome) was talking about. I am utterly disgusted with her and how she managed the entire situation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wow!!! The rudest service (!!!). Prices on the labels are not matching up to the prices at the checkout. No managers are supervising, or seems to care. Incredibly expensive as well, for the same stuff you can get cheaper even at Whole foods.  Wow. So disappointed', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I dropped by to buy gluten-free pie crusts, as Key Food and Whole Foods don‚Äôt stock them. They‚Äôre a bit pricey at $6.89 each, but they have them, along with a lot of other gluten-free grocery items.

Grocery prices look a bit higher here. Self checkout is fast and convenient.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The people that work here are rude. It is Wednesday night June 4. I was at Fairway at about 830.The checkout staff, particularly the girls, displayed a rude attitude that is unacceptable. One girl even said, "I told you to wait a second," and I was taken aback by her tone. Customers should never be spoken to in such a disrespectful manner. When another staff member came over to ask what had happened, she was just as dismissive. I took my receipt from her, and then a male employee interjected, telling me how to take the receipt. The behavior I witnessed is unprofessional, and it seems like there are serious issues with the staff. I will never go to the store again, and if I could file a bigger complaint, I totally will. They need to retrain and rehire new staff.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Williams-Sonoma
address: 10 Columbus Cir Suite 114, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: furniture_store, home_improvement_store, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, home_goods_store, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': '11/4/25 was my first time attending an event at this location for Martha Stewart‚Äôs book signing. Overall, it was a great experience. Martha was wonderful to meet, and the staff on-site was friendly and made the atmosphere comfortable.

The only real issue was the lack of clear event and photo guidelines beforehand. I reached out twice before the event by email and never received a response. When we arrived, we were told specifically there would be no posed photos and had to put our phones away.  Yet once inside, some attendees right in front of us were allowed to take posed photos while others followed the rules, which was frustrating and honestly disappointing. Better communication and consistency would make future events run smoother and feel fair for everyone.

That said, the night was still memorable, and the store itself is absolutely beautiful. ‚ú® I‚Äôd definitely return for future events, just hoping for clearer guidance next time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This location has been here for so long. They always deliver. Always clean, neat and visually appealing. Anytime I come here I smell something cooking, aromas of all sorts. They‚Äôre so friendly here, very welcoming. I love that some of the employees try or tried what they‚Äôre selling. Look how beautiful this store is. The details on the table set alone. If you‚Äôre looking for a staple piece, here‚Äôs the place.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'My aunt and I visited this store for the first time and were truly impressed. Renee gave us a warm welcome and patiently answered all of our questions. She and her colleagues were very professional and knowledgeable about the products.

Later, we noticed that the coffee machine we had chosen was available at a better price elsewhere, and they immediately helped us contact customer service to get a price match.

From the in-store experience to Williams Sonoma‚Äôs customer support, everything was top-notch. I highly recommend shopping here ‚Äî the excellent service truly gives you peace of mind.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We walked into Williams-Sonoma with no intention to buy anything however, within seconds of entering, Renee K. Came over and asked if we needed any help. As it happened we had been shopping for new dishes and Renee was incredibly helpful. By the time we left the store, we applied and received a Williams-Sonoma credit card ( Capital One) which will provide us with free shipping on our new dishes as well as all kinds of additional perks. We also bought a delicious container of their famous Peppermint Bark!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very upscale houseware store in the Shops at Columbus Circle. Very deep location, with two levels. The employees are very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. The store is very well stocked, with some very expensive items. Nice place to visit‚Ä¶‚ôøÔ∏è', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Made In New York Pizza
address: 421 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
types: pizza_restaurant, italian_restaurant, restaurant, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Had the vodka and Margherita pizzas and they were delicious, I especially loved the crust - thinner but a little chewy and crispy. The outside dining area is a nice bonus. Definitely will be back!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'So many great options for pizza slices and they all were very delicious! Staff is kind and very quick and efficient and the outdoor seating on the streets of Manhattan is great for any visitor, this is definitely my recommendation for pizza slices in NYC.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Quick and fast service and yet fresh and as amazing as it can get. The perfect place to experience as the name itself suggests the perfect new York pizza. An amazing variety of things crust and deep dish, veg and non veg options here to pair with a whole bunch of sodas in stock. Loads of internal seating and the outside ones come alive with the weather too!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

Hands down, the BEST New York-style pizza I‚Äôve had in a long time!
‚ÄúMade in New York Pizza‚Äù delivers everything you‚Äôd want in an authentic NYC slice‚Äîcrispy, thin crust with that perfect fold, rich and flavorful sauce, and just the right amount of cheese. The dough tastes fresh, the toppings are top quality, and you can tell they take real pride in every pie they make.

The atmosphere has that classic, no-frills NYC pizzeria vibe‚Äîquick, friendly service, clean space, and the smell alone is enough to make your mouth water the second you walk in. I grabbed a pepperoni and a white slice, and both were absolutely üî•üî•üî•.

Whether you‚Äôre a tourist wanting the real NYC pizza experience or a local looking for your go-to spot, this place is a must-visit. Trust me, one slice won‚Äôt be enough. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

üì∏ As someone who runs a creative agency focused on photography, videography, and marketing, I can say this spot is photogenic and flavorful.

If you‚Äôre a restaurant looking to level up your online presence, highlight your menu with mouth-watering visuals, or capture the soul of your brand on video ‚Äî I‚Äôd love to collaborate! DM me or visit my page to see how we can make your food and business stand out in a crowded digital world. üçïüé•üì±', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I have been to another branch of this place a bunch of times and always found the pizza to be quite decent. But a few years ago I stopped eating dairy and since they have no interest in making nondairy pizza (I once asked, and the response I got was a hard no), I stopped going. But tonight I wanted a slice and it was the only place that was open so I went for it. I ordered a margarita and, while the taste was consistent with the quality of pizza I‚Äôve had from them before, I was surprised at how much crust there was, what one other reviewer called ‚Äúa ton of crust.‚Äú I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve ever gotten a slice that was 30% crust (see photo). If quality is a concern, I don‚Äôt think they should sell slices like this one and maybe I should‚Äôve spoken up, but whatever. If I‚Äôm going to pay $5.50 for a slice, I would like one that comes with a proper amount of cheese and sauce, and not one in which so much of the real estate of the surface of the slice is just crust.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Citarella Gourmet Market - Upper East Side
address: 1313 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
types: market, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'A Food Lover‚Äôs Paradise on the Upper East Side!

Citarella Gourmet Market is hands down one of my favorite foodie destinations in NYC. If you haven‚Äôt been yet, you‚Äôre seriously missing out.

First things first ‚Äî the Raspberry Boat cookies. Oh. My. Goodness. These little gems are buttery perfection with just the right amount of raspberry jam ‚Äî a total must-try. Honestly, I could live on those alone.

Their cupcakes and cakes? Absolute heaven. Every bite feels like a celebration.

Seafood lovers, rejoice! The oysters are always fresh, briny, and delicious ‚Äî perfect for impressing guests or treating yourself.

And let‚Äôs talk indulgence ‚Äî Citarella‚Äôs caviar selection is my go-to for a luxurious Sunday brunch treat. They carry a nice variety, so there‚Äôs always something special to try.

The cherry on top? Their employees know their stuff! Whether you‚Äôre pairing wines, picking seafood, or craving the perfect pastry, they‚Äôre always helpful and full of great recommendations.

If you love gourmet food (or just really good cookies), Citarella is the spot to be. Go once, and you‚Äôll be hooked!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It‚Äôs a convenient location and food quality is good albeit expensive. But I am finally going to write about this one downside- which I‚Äôve experienced multiple times. When you go to citarella who expect high quality good and courteous staff. Not always so in produce dept. The men working in produce are often rude and fight patrons for space while we try to gather our produce from shelves. I realize stocking shelves  is important but rudeness is not!  They should train produce staff or get new. Room for improvement.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Nicely laid out food, very friendly staff and customers. Well stocked in fruit and vegetables though their prices keep going up... pity!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Always and reliably the freshest fruit, vegetables, broad-range of fish, and prepared foods.  Their homemade baba ghanoush and hummus are secrets.  Yes, not an inexpensive place to shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is an iconic market in NYC but not for the faint of heart. Prices are very high but so is the quality. I do not recommend buying any dry goods items you could get at a larger grocery store. Their fish and meat is superior quality.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Citarella
address: 2135 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

reviews: [{'text': "This place is one of my favorite grocery stores! üõí Citarella on the UWS üóΩ has everything you need - fruit üçé, vegetables ü•í, fresh meat üçñ, cheese üßÄ, canned goods ü•´, cakes üéÇ, drinks üçæ, snacks ü•®, salads ü•ó, and so much more! Staff üë®\u200düç≥ is super friendly and professional and service is quick! ‚è≤Ô∏è It's so fun walking üö∂ around and exploring üîç the fully stacked shelves. I wish I came here more often!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Everything they have is top notch.  I especially like their half roasted duck and their Sweet Potato Ginger soup.  Their fish and meats might cost more than other places, but it's fresh and good.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I don't really do reviews when I visit grocery stores, but Citarella on the Upper West Side is the exception. name: Agata & Valentina
address: 1505 1st Ave, New York, NY 10075, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "Was cool to see a fully gf supermarket but it's very small.

Also mainly sells brands like schar which can be bought anywhere (although their deli did look nice).

If you're in the area it‚Äôs worth checking out but otherwise wouldn‚Äôt bother.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Today on Chicken Wars, we have Agata & Valentina on the Upper East Side. A whole Asian seasoned bird ran $10.99, which gave my pockets a much needed break after the $26 chicken from Ouri‚Äôs. This is the 29th grocery store tissi I‚Äôve consumed in the past 2 months, so my palate is dialed in.

I took it to this beautiful park on the upper east side that I didn‚Äôt know existed. There are so many nooks and crannies of this city that I have yet to explore. It boggles my mind how much inspiration is in New York just waiting to be discovered.

I sat there, fighting off those vicious little birds as I started consumption. This chicken just didn‚Äôt do what I wanted it to do. It was pretty decent all around, but had no attributes that really made it stand out. It landed at a 7/10 for me, which lands it at 24th of 33 grocery store rotisserie chickens I have currently tried.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Reasonable prices for the high quality of the food. Quality produce! Good prepared food - perfect for those with little time to cook themselves. Excellent cheese selection with very helpful service. Only criticism- due to personal taste, some of the desserts are a bit too sweet. Overall love the store.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'First, Agatha and Valentina is a bit pricey.
But, there is no better place to pick up goodies for a special occasion and the hot food buffet (all three meals) compares to any restaurant out there.  The items they prepare are things I just wouldn‚Äôt dream to nor take the trouble to prepare at home.
They have three hot meal stations, a yummy selection of cookies and baked-on-premise pies and cakes, vegetables, cheeses, pastas, coffees‚Ä¶
The store is very clean, organized, well-managed, and in my opinion, the best shopping experience on the UES for foodies‚Ä¶', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The best thing about Agata is that practically everything is prepared onsite. That being said, you do pay a pretty premium for it, with some prices bordering on the ridiculous, even for the Upper East Side. The quality, though, is consistently top notch. I especially like the fish and meat departments because they can save you a ton of prep work.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: The Mount Sinai Hospital
address: 1468 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
types: pharmacy, hospital, point_of_interest, health, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "They ghosted me. I had a workers comp incident, inhaled some particles at work and have had a cough ever since. I came to them and Rabeea Khan basically brushed me off when I said my issue was caused from work, saying she can't confirm that for sure, even though my life was different clear as day before that incident. And it actually happened twice, inhaled the same thing months later for it to mess me up again. and we did a small test of me exhaling hard into a small machine and the person conducting the test said I was doing great, then Rabeea comes back into the room saying the test was done incorrectly and we got nothing. So theres miscommunication there

I communicated to them I'd be leaving the state in a month. I know that's asking a time restriction on them for their already busy schedule but that doesn't justify ghosting me. She said i'll do 2 tests then well have a followup visit. I did those 2 tests and never heard back. Even 2 hours after the first visit I call and email her assistant Saenz and got a message saying she wont be in office for like a week.

No followup visit was ever scheduled. And im still here coughing. I had one shot at getting treatment and having it taken care of by workers comp before I had to move, and I wasted it on these people. Now i have to start from scratch out of pocket in a new state

but everything besides being ghosted, the attitude of the staff everyone i met in the hospital was great and very warm.

Update: 3 weeks after making this review, I get a call from them. Picking up the conversation as if I had just gotten looked at by rabeea, when its been 6 months. Just an unacceptable sign of dysfunction with that whole company.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently had a surgical procedure done. My doctor was amazing and kind. Nurse and all the staff that I encounter were kind to me. The only downside was my surgical procedure got delayed due to a complication from a previous patient before me. I wish the nurse told me because I was just waiting in the room for over an hour. At the end my friend went up to the nursing station and asked. But things happen and I understood. I was really impressed one of the nurse from the surgery called to ask how I was doing next day. So thank you to that nurse.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I always had a great experience from Mt. Sinai (in the ER Department).  However I had surgery in the GP-2 at 1468 Madison, and the aftercare was not well.  They also do not give enough information on the plan beforehand for you to know what to expect.  So in periOperative care department/area, I got out at 4:20 PM on November 3rd.  I was trying to close the curtain, but barely had the energy to walk or get up.  The small drop-down table on the chair flipped down, and the 4 ounce apple juice fell on the floor.  The male, older nurse got angry and irate.  Then told me I need leave.  He actually had the audacity to later come and pick a fight (high tone and quick words) with me (very poor bedside manner); he could have just easily said ‚Äòsorry there was a misunderstanding.‚Äô  I told him we were probably having a cultural difference, and I told him he was being unprofessional.  He kept trying to argue with me, but I asked him to stop.  I wanted to get out of there so fast, I didn‚Äôt brush my teeth and put my used robe, sheets, and cover in the soiled laundry hamper (I didn‚Äôt want anybody complaining about any of my mess).  I haven‚Äôt eaten since yesterday, but my appetite is gone for today (that was enough argument to last me for the week).  The other fifty nurses were kind and nice.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I had the best experience at Mount Sinai during my time there. My situation was a rare condition and I traveled from Texas for the best doctors. Dr. Sylla and Dr. Greenwald were not only very personable, they were extremely knowledgeable and I knew that would be in the best hands. I had 100 percent confidence in both of them.  Everyone from pre-op to post- op were seamless in my care. The hospital was very well laid out and admissions were extremely helpful.  Overall, it is a beautiful place and doesn‚Äôt feel like a hospital at all. Everyone was amazing and a special shout out to one of my nurses, Chevette.  Not only is she an amazing nurse, she has so much compassion that is truly a gift.  She along with my care team deserves recognition for giving such excellent care.  Thank you all for your hard work and dedication in what you do. I will always be so grateful for all of you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The worst treatment ever. My mother in law is at the 10th floor she has cancer. The nurses are not good when you called them they are not around. Patients calling from different rooms screaming with pain and no consideration. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOSPITAL TO NO ONE. LOCATION ON 98TH STREET. THEY PUT A BAG FOR MY MOTHER AND NOW THEY SAID SHE DIDN'T NEED A BAG. NOW SHE HAS TO STAY WITH THAT BAG FOR ALL HER LIFE.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Ralph's Coffee
address: 888 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
types: coffee_shop, cafe, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Ralph‚Äôs Coffee is an absolute gem ‚Äî a perfect blend of style, quality, and classic New York charm. The moment you step inside, you‚Äôre greeted by the inviting aroma of freshly brewed coffee and the elegant Ralph Lauren aesthetic that makes the space feel both timeless and cozy.

The coffee is exceptional, rich and perfectly balanced, whether you choose a cappuccino, espresso, or their signature cold brew. Their pastries and light bites complement the drinks beautifully, with fresh ingredients and impeccable presentation.

The staff is friendly and professional, always welcoming and attentive, making every visit a pleasant experience. The atmosphere is calm yet sophisticated ‚Äî ideal for a quick coffee break, a casual meeting, or just people-watching in style.

Located in some of the city‚Äôs most iconic spots, Ralph‚Äôs Coffee captures the essence of refined simplicity. Every detail, from the green cups to the classic decor, reflects the brand‚Äôs dedication to quality and elegance.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
A must-visit for coffee lovers who appreciate good taste and timeless design.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love the store‚Äôs layout, both inside and out, it really draws you in, and the cozy atmosphere makes you want to stay longer.

The coffee is fair for the given price. Service is good, but expect a long line during busy hours, so come early, especially if you want to dine in.

The merchandise is super cute. Overall, it‚Äôs fun to visit, especially for a tourist.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It has a good athmosphere. You feel the quality of the place. The stuff is helpful. The coffee was very good but the brownie was a bit dry and i didnt like it much. I recommend the place. You should visit and drink a coffee and check the products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'What a fun team serving up some delicious coffees & pastries at this location. Although their was a line forming from the entrance, a wonderful young man came out to check on those wanting a table...THAT WAS US! So we went right in a sat down. Service was quick & friendly. My  specialty latte was creamy & full of flavor. The Lemon Cake was moist & my Chocolate Croissant was flakey & rich!

Great place to sit, sip & people watch! üòé', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a cute little spot with really pretty vibes! We had to wait in line for about 10 minutes, but the staff were super polite and kind. We showed up with a group of seven (yep, no reservation üòÖ), and they still managed to find us a table without any attitude‚Äîmajor points for that!

It was really busy though‚Äîlots of noise and chatting, so not exactly a chill or quiet place if that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre after. One of our coffees was forgotten, and we had to remind them a few times. It finally arrived when the rest of us had already finished our drinks‚Ä¶ but at least they didn‚Äôt charge us for it.

The good news? No one rushed us out, and we could sit and hang out as long as we wanted. Loved that. The coffee and croissants were tasty, and the iced matcha lemonade was surprisingly good! Refreshing and just the right amount of tangy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Target

types: department_store, shoe_store, clothing_store, electronics_store, furniture_store, home_improvement_store, home_goods_store, child_care_agency, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "I came here to buy a new PS5 controller, stood around for 10 minutes waiting for someone to unlock the case. Was able to get lots of snacks and drinks for our hotel room and the location was perfect from our room. Safe and nice area. Store very clean and well stocked.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'fairly small Target‚Äîit is below street level. subterranean convenience shopping in the Upper West Side / Lincoln Square area. the grocery area seems to be the largest area and has all your standard food items which works for me. this Target is fairly compact. not many employees, but self checkout is a breeze. not much to say about this Target except it‚Äôs a decent place to shop if you‚Äôre in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was parked at this location on June 29, 2022, at 10:40 PM in an area clearly marked with a taxi stand sign. This situation was both confusing and frustrating, and I believe the area should be properly marked and enforced to avoid future issues.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Low stock everything. [{'text': 'The lines can get really long at some times, but it goes by pretty quickly. name: Levain Bakery
address: 167 W 74th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: bakery, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Loved these!!! We were looking for amazing ny cookies and tried levain. Honestly these taste amazing and have only good things to say, very chewy, nice flavors and cute store! We asked them to heat the cookies and I feel like this is a MUST. I recommend to share the cookies with more people because they are very big. We tried the levain cookie, the double chocolate (which is very similar) and the seasonal cookie that had dark chocolate and cinnamon! So so good. These are also nice reheated. A bit expensive considering these are cookies but everything in nyc is. Try it with a friend!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'First time I tried it was delivered via Uber Eats. I had their chocolate chip walnut macadamia cookie which was vegan (only vegan option). $6.25 for one cookie. It‚Äôs gooey on the inside. You get it warm. When I went to try it at the store, there was a line. There‚Äôs almost always one each time I‚Äôve passed by. The line is quick at least it‚Äôs not as long as the one in noho. Staff were quick. It‚Äôs worth a try. There‚Äôs other popular cookie places, but I like this one the most considering the cookies seem tastier. Also a bit larger.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "First time visiting the original Levain Cookie store. A very small and cozy cookie store, there were already people sitting outside enjoying the cookies when we came in the morning. The cookies were warm and fresh, we purchased walnut/chocolate chips and dark chocolate chips cookies. I have to say I like the walnut one better. The cookies are full of chocolate chipsü•∞. Unlike other imitators, the cookies are full of goodies. It's best eaten with a cup of black coffee. I'm pleasantly impressed. Now, I have to walk off those extra calories in Central Park ü§£", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'So yummy! We got the 2 chip chocolate chip and it is heaven!! So gooey and chocolatey - definitely need a drink with it. We had to wait in line outside but it literally took like 5 minutes and only a couple minutes inside. I would definitely visit this location again!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A true taste of heaven! The two chip chocolate chip cookie is to die for! The slice of sour cream coffee cake was amazing, as well. One of our favorite stops for a treat during our time in the city and will definitely be back!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Broad Nosh Bagels Deli & Catering 58th Street
address: 314 W 58th St, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: bagel_shop, sandwich_shop, coffee_shop, breakfast_restaurant, hamburger_restaurant, deli, cafe, american_restaurant, bakery, food_store, restaurant, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Make sure you get here early!!! This place is definitely worth the wait. They have every kind of cream cheese you can imagine and all kinds of bagels that taste amazing.
Potato latkes are amazing!! And I also had the fresh carrot juice. Even though they have what seems like a long line it moves pretty quickly, so know what you want by the time you get to the front. And they have your stuff ready pretty quickly as well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Absolutely incredible! This spot is everything you want in a New York bagel shop ‚Äî fresh, vibrant, and full of flavor. The bagel with lox and cream cheese was perfection: soft, chewy bagel, rich cream cheese, and beautifully fresh salmon. Every bite tasted like it was made with care.

The display case alone is worth the visit ‚Äî loaded with every kind of cream cheese imaginable, fresh toppings, and beautiful sandwiches ready to go. You can tell they take pride in every detail, from the presentation to the quality of ingredients.

I paired my bagel with a smoothie, and it was the perfect combo to start the morning. Friendly staff, fast service, and an unbeatable selection. Easily a must-try breakfast stop in NYC!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Just an amazing bagel place and such a choice.  Found by doing a good old google search. Was always packed. Despite being so busy staff were amazing and service all off pat and to be honest was completely surprised how quick it all was as was expecting a long wait. We visited 3 times during our weeks stay and every bagel was amazing. My favourite was the cucumber cream cheese with smoked salmon. Managed to get a table inside twice and ate outside standing at one of the outside table. Would completely recommend.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Nova lox is really good!
We got one nova lox with an everything bagel and a lox scallion spread + tomato + cucumber on egg everything bagel.

The nova lox was really good, especially with all the veggies. The lox scallion spread was a little bit salty/overpowering so we liked the nova lox a lot more but it was worth a try.

The line was really long but moved pretty fast. Staff had to be efficient to move the line along, there wasn‚Äôt much time to ask questions.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I stopped by one day before the gym and was pleasantly surprised by how good everything was. The food was delicious and really filling. The bagels are huge and definitely big enough to share. Portion sizes are generous, and everything tasted fresh.

I got the everything bagel with smoked salmon and cream cheese, and it was absolutely delicious. It can get busy on the weekends, but the line moves quickly. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 10 Columbus Cir Ste Sc101, New York, NY 10019, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, point_of_interest, health, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I rarely writw reviews on google map but this time I have said they really deserve it. This is the best whole foods in Manhattan. Peter (I think that was his name) helped me carrying my bags upstairs, he was so kind and joyfull! He teamed with Mirlene (I made sure I had their name because thwy were so nice really) I spent every week $$$ because variety of options, quality of products and so many hard workers keeping everything nice and organize for customers.
Top notch', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods Market is always one of the busiest spots‚Äîespecially the elevator, which is constantly packed with people coming and going. The in-store restaurant is equipped with restrooms, and the entire market is always buzzing with activity, so expect to wait in line no matter when you go. That said, one of the best things to do in the summer is grab some fresh sushi and a cold soda here, then head to Central Park for the perfect picnic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently visited this Whole Foods and had an excellent experience. I picked up some Whole Grain Checkers cereal and a vegan chocolate bar, both of which were exactly what I was looking for. The store was well-stocked and organized, which made shopping a breeze.

A special shout-out to John, the cashier, who was wearing a "Cashier of 2019" badge‚Äîhe‚Äôs still doing an amazing job! His friendly demeanor and efficient service made the checkout process smooth and quick. It's rare to see such consistent quality in service, and John‚Äôs professionalism is definitely appreciated.

Overall, this store always provides a great shopping experience, and I‚Äôll certainly be back. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "If you read past Google reviews, you'll see customers reporting RACISM, RACIAL PROFILING, AND DISCRIMINATION at this store. The pattern is clear, and the manager‚Äôs dismissive attitude is part of the problem. That‚Äôs why these experiences continue.

I reported a serious incident involving mistreatment that strongly appeared to be racist and discriminatory by an employee in the seafood department. What shocked me most was not only the behavior of the employee, but also the store‚Äôs refusal to take any meaningful action or even acknowledge wrongdoing. According to the manager, KUNHO, I will receive neither an apology from the employee nor any follow-up from the store. He questioned whether my experience was real but wouldn‚Äôt even attempt to verify what happened while I was still physically present in the store. When I offered to wait so he could check the camera, he told me I could wait as many hours as I liked, and he still wouldn‚Äôt check it because he was ‚Äúvery busy.‚Äù What kind of manager responds like that? Shame on you, KUNHO.

To the employee: If you do not want to interact with customers respectfully, why not work at a place where you do not need to deal with customers? That way, you will have no opportunity to mistreat customers, and more people will be happy.

To the store manager KUNHO: I hope you and your family will never be mistreated like that in any place by any employee like yours, and if that unfortunately happens, the issue will be resolved effectively by a good store manager‚Äînot someone like you.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I personally feel like this location is the easiest to find items that are well priced. Compared to the SoHo location for example, there are less rows of empty shelves.
The line moves quickly here as well. The major downside is the seating area.
A few years back this seating area had a coffee shop and juice bar but that‚Äôs been replaced by an Amazon pick up center. The seating is minimal in my opinion, but that could be because so many other locations have more space.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Crumbl
address: 1195 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10021, USA
types: dessert_shop, bakery, confectionery, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The staff were extremely kind and professional. They helped me place an order for the next morning, and everything was ready right on time. The cookies were absolutely delicious ‚Äî they even survived the flight from New York to Berlin! Everyone who tried them was amazed. Highly recommended! üç™‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not what I was expecting. (In a bad way)

First, the staff needs to get better at interacting with customers. I walk in and they said welcome to crumbl but I was having some difficulty seeing if they took cash. A nice lady said yes and  to use the tablet at the front but I couldn‚Äôt figure out how to checkout. I realized they didn‚Äôt take the denomination I had so I left and went to get change. When I came back I figured out how the
checkout worked but then they wouldn‚Äôt even talk to me. I asked the young lady which cookie is her favorite and she totally didn‚Äôt respond. Maybe she didn‚Äôt  hear me which was fine since it was busy. When I was getting my change back I asked again but this time saying which cookie she would choose and just flipped the tablet and handed my change. After that I waited a few minutes (it was pretty fast and I will give the staff their cred for that) they called my name and just said here are your cookies and a bag is over there. They just put the box down and walked away quickly. I know the place is busy but they could at least haven given me a simple answer or just bagged my order. I‚Äôve never stepped into the business before so I would have liked some input before I chose. I would give 1 out of 5 starts mainly for that cashier.

Next ratings on the cookies themselves:

Fudge cookie: Very decadent and rich. If you a fan of super chocolate flavors you‚Äôll like it but it‚Äôs a very strong taste. Center is nice and soft but the edges are very hard. 2 out of 5

Reeces cookie: The chocolate flavor is way too strong and you can really only taste the peanut butter if you taste the filling alone. Not a good balance and not what I was expecting. 1 out of 5

Oreo cookie: This one actually tasted nice, but it‚Äôs not a cookie. This is just straight up cake. I would get it again but it‚Äôs not what I was expecting in texture when I think of cookies. Super soft and I would really want to eat this with a fork and knife.
4 out of 5

Chocolate chip: I believe the best way to find out how a cookie shop does their job is to leave ol‚Äô reliable chocolate chip as the be all, end all and this definitely left me with how I felt about these cookies. The taste was there but the implementation was not. It had the same problem as the fudge, soft in the center and the edges overcooked. I dont know what‚Äôs going on with how they are preparing their cookies but I think they need to rethink their process.

Overall I give this place a 2 out of 5. It wasn‚Äôt a complete disaster but they really need some better people skills. I understand they have a small area for customers and the place gets overcrowded fast but I know customer service is always important. I shouldn‚Äôt have felt like I was doing something wrong just by asking what flavors are good. It‚Äôs not like it was cheap. For the 4 cookies I basically spent 21 bucks after taxes so I was hopeful for better service and better flavors. I think the hype for this place is overblown.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I wanted to see what was all the hype and to my surprise these pretty cookies were not good. They seem to taste like they are half baked with a whole lot of sugar and pricey. The line was long and it wasn't even worth the wait. But the packaging is cute.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Service is good and so is the atmosphere although the place is small and cramped. Sometimes the cookies are good, sometimes not. Nothing wrong with the cookies just personal preference.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I like it. I think it‚Äôs like a very nice little quaint shop. It was my first time in an actual crumble so I do rate like the interior and everything else five stars. The only reason I‚Äôm reading at four and if we‚Äôre being honest, I would rate it 4 1/2 is because of the fact that the price is just a little bit too steep for me. You know like $18 for four cookies. It really does bother me a little bit but other than that the cookies are good. I do wish that they would have more than just like weekly flavors, especially if you don‚Äôt want or like the flavors that they have.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Zabar's
address: 2245 Broadway, New York, NY 10024, USA
types: coffee_shop, cafe, tourist_attraction, grocery_store, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is a great neighborhood store. Usually very busy in the morning. They have all the Jewish food and breakfast options that you can think of and the service is usually good. This is a staple on the upper west side and has been around for years.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A delightful delicatessen wonderland‚ÄîZabar‚Äôs is packed with gourmet treasures. The cheese selection is incredible, and there‚Äôs no shortage of tempting sweets, specialty ingredients, and quality cooking supplies. Always a joy to explore, whether you‚Äôre shopping for something specific or just soaking in the classic New York atmosphere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lot's of good treats to enjoy and explore in this bakery. This place was the inspiration for Seinfeld's "Schnitzer's"  from where the infamous Marble Rye came from.   They have Babka too!  Chocolate, cinnamon and Apple!  I didn't know about the apple flavor', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Zabar's was a perfect experience. The menu, the employee service, the option to eat inside or outside while people watching,
-all of it was great. Definitely worth a stop on a weekend or if you're visiting from out of town. Pictured here: the Classic Nova Bagel", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Home away from home. A place for breakfast,lunch or anytime you want something nice and good to eat and drink.
I loved their bagels.  Had an everything bagel toasted with plain  cream cheese everyday.  But there's much more. You can sandwiches, soups,  muffins and all sort of yummy pastries, not to mention hot and cold beverages.
The staff is nice.
Definitely would recommend it.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 1551 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA

reviews:
[{'text': 'I want to give a huge shout-out to Sarjo in the bakery department! Her customer service was absolutely incredible. She was so sweet, patient, and genuinely went above and beyond to help me pick out the perfect cake for my brother‚Äôs birthday. You can tell she‚Äôs a hard worker who truly cares about her customers.

Thank you, Sarjo, for making the experience so easy and enjoyable. Whole Foods is lucky to have someone like you on their team!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Time 9.49pm 10/10/2025
The worst ever experience not in Whole Food but ii our life. As we were checking out almost at last item the costumer next to us broke down in floor with loud noice a glass bottle . We were scary first because the glasses spread all over. Just as we were making sure to pay the next cashier , her name on tag was Monica ,without excusing or asking if we can move over , with the worst attitude and a rudeness ,with a manner of insulting said:
Move over don‚Äôt block my space !
As we told her we can‚Äôt because is plenty with glasses and slippery and we ready to leave she continue;
I don‚Äôt care just move move ‚Ä¶ And continue to be more aggressive until we ask her for name and took the picture of the floor‚Ä¶.
Everything is on camera and we want to be open and check this case because we don‚Äôt feel comfortable to shop in our favorite place Whole Food..', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I‚Äôve shopped here many times but on several occasions I‚Äôve been overcharged at the counter. When I asked why the woman at the express checkout simply insisted that the price was correct.

Today for example there was a clear offer: 4 avocados for $5 for Prime members. I scanned my Prime QR code at checkout yet she charged me $9.96. When I showed her a photo of the price tag she just shrugged and said she had no idea about it. Very disappointing experience being overcharged repeatedly and met with indifference.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Consistently unhelpful staff and customer service. name: Apple Upper West Side
address: 1981 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA
types: electronics_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Traded in my phone recently and was helped by a few very lovely people but ended up spending the most time with Jeanne who was absolutely delightfu! She worked with me for about an hour and a half trying to figure out a problem we were having authorizing my phone number with TMobile. Even though it was a frustrating process, she was so funny, sweet, and personable which made everything a bit more bearable! I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Jeanne and hope everyone who stops in gets a chance to connect with her. It definitely is a time-consuming process but I think the Apple crew at this location makes the process worth while.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Horrible experience trading in the iPhone. From not being allowed to activate the phone line to being stuck downstairs on Restore from iCloud for over 2 hours‚Ä¶. Trade-in should not be allowed if they can‚Äôt figure out how to properly restore people‚Äôs phones in a fast manner. Avoid this store by all costs!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Lorraine at the Apple Store on Broadway was absolutely amazing! She went above and beyond to fix both my phone and my granddaughter‚Äôs phone. She took the time, effort, and care needed to get everything working perfectly again. Her professionalism, patience, and dedication truly stood out. We‚Äôre so grateful for her help‚Äîthank you, Lorraine!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Every time I go to this Apple they treat me like I don‚Äôt got no money. I go there looking broke on purpose and the staff never approach me first once. Every time I walk away I see them in the reflection of the glass huddling up like highschoolers to talk about me cus they all curious about what I wanted. Wondering was he scammer, asking the co workers what he wanted . They don‚Äôt ever do that to the rich looking folks they wave away. Real classist vibes on there. They do it every time. It‚Äôs not hard to approach a customer who walks in the door it‚Äôs disgusting lowkey. Big mad I gotta give yall my money.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Apple‚Äôs customer service has gotten very poor as of late. My experience was on the level of an interaction with an airline.

I reserved a spot at 6.50pm on Sunday for a battery replacement of my iPhone. I checked in at 6.50pm, and I did not speak to anyone until 8pm. At 8.30pm, they informed me that I would either have to leave my phone overnight, or come in again the next day. I agreed to leave the phone overnight. I was informed that the phone would be ready when the Apple Store opened at 9am, but recommended I come in at 10am to be sure.

I came in at 10am, at which time, I was told that the phone is not ready and would not be ready for another hour.

So Apple was not able to meet any of their time commitments they made to me.

My recommendation, do not go this Genius Bar. If you do, try to schedule a time early in the morning. Make sure you understand when they will complete your service and that they contact you when the service is complete.

Horrible experience altogether.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Levain Bakery
address: 1484 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
types: bakery, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I finally made my way over to Levain Bakery in New York City, and like most people, I was curious to see what all the hype was about. I decided to try two of their most popular cookies: the oatmeal raisin and the original walnut chocolate chip. Both were undeniably delicious and lived up to their reputation. The texture was exactly what you want in a cookie crispy on the outside, soft and gooey on the inside. The oatmeal raisin had just the right amount of chew with plump raisins that didn‚Äôt overpower the dough, while the walnut chocolate chip had that perfect balance of rich chocolate chunks and crunchy walnuts. They‚Äôre definitely indulgent and satisfying, especially if you‚Äôve got a serious sweet tooth.

That being said, the one drawback for me is the price. The cookies are really expensive compared to what you‚Äôd expect for a bakery treat. Sure, they‚Äôre massive in size and heavy enough to share, but at the end of the day it‚Äôs still just a cookie. Honestly, if you‚Äôre someone who enjoys baking, you could probably recreate something similar at home for a fraction of the cost. But if you‚Äôre like me and don‚Äôt always want to go through the hassle of baking or if you just want to treat yourself without the effort Levain makes it worth the splurge every now and then.

The shop itself had a cozy, bustling vibe, with plenty of people stopping in and out, which added to the overall experience. The staff moved quickly, keeping the line going, which I appreciated.

In short, Levain is worth trying at least once. The cookies are unique, delicious, and definitely hit the spot, but the price keeps it from being an everyday indulgence. If you‚Äôre lazy or just visiting NYC, this is the place to grab a cookie that feels a little over-the top in the best way possible.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of New York City‚Äôs most renowned cookie shops, this place offers a wide variety of delicious cookies. I tried the chocolate chip cookies, and they were absolutely fantastic. The hype surrounding this place is well-deserved; it‚Äôs definitely worth a visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Exceptional cookies. Caramel coconut chocolate chip was outstanding. Dark chocolate peanut butter was really good too! If you are in the area I definitely recommend visiting this place. Bear in mind that one cookie per person is already more than enough.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'üòã Levain Bakery ‚Äì Upper East Side
Okay‚Ä¶ I get the hype now. These cookies are NEXT LEVEL! I thought they were just another NYC trend, but no ‚Äî there‚Äôs nothing like them. Crunchy on the outside, warm and gooey inside, with chocolate that literally melts in your mouth.

I tried the dulce de leche with coconut and wow‚Ä¶ it was love at first bite. Sweet but not overwhelming, with the perfect chewy texture. It‚Äôs huge too ‚Äî definitely shareable, but honestly, you‚Äôll want it all for yourself.

The vibe is cozy, the staff is fast and friendly, and even with the line, it‚Äôs worth every minute. If you‚Äôre around Central Park or the Upper East Side, don‚Äôt leave without grabbing one. Trust me ‚Äî once you taste it, you‚Äôll never look at cookies the same way again. üç™‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An absolute must-visit in NYC!
Levain Bakery lives up to the hype. Their cookies are insanely good‚Äîcrispy on the outside, gooey and warm on the inside, and packed with flavor. The classic Chocolate Chip Walnut is out of this world, but honestly, you can‚Äôt go wrong with any flavor.
Perfect spot for a sweet treat whether you're a local or just visiting the city.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Glace NY
address: 1266 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
types: ice_cream_shop, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, point_of_interest, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'As a soft serve fanatic, this is my new favorite in the city. I got a swirl of Meyer Lemon Greek Yogurt and Brown Butter Vanilla. I mean come on. So delicious.

I also tried their pistachio and it‚Äôs kind of unreal. A bit on the sweet side but it has whole pistachios in it!!

It‚Äôs $8 for soft serve, and $10 for a soft serve sundae. The sundae is quite a bit bigger (I think?) and comes with a shell. They look amazing, but the ice cream is honestly great on its down. I think a shell might overpower.

Their hard (?) ice cream sundaes get chopped up like Cold Stone / Marble Slab, which is fun!! The scoops are *small* for $7.50 though honestly.

There‚Äôs space to sit outside. Staff are super friendly.

Only complaint is the size for the price. It‚Äôs not very big.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely loved my visit to Glace NY! All of their ice cream is gluten-free. You‚Äôd never know it from the taste; everything was incredibly creamy, rich, and flavorful. Even the brownie bits on the frozen hot chocolate were glute free. The staff was super friendly and made the experience even sweeter. Can‚Äôt wait to come back and try more flavors!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had an excellent Frozen S‚Äômores Hot Chocolate at Glace ‚Äì absolutely delicious and unique! The texture and flavor were spot on, perfectly balancing the rich chocolate with the toasted marshmallow twist. On top of that, the service was amazing ‚Äì super friendly and attentive. Highly recommend stopping by if you‚Äôre in the area!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely loved their ‚ÄúClassic‚Äù, which is Hot Chocolate with Marshmallows and Whipped Cream.
The Hot chocolate was pretty amazing on its own; not too sweet. I‚Äôll definitely visit again to try some fall favorites next.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Went to Glace NY on Madison Ave and ordered their Frozen S‚Äômores Hot Chocolate. Yeah‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs as dangerous as it sounds. Rich chocolate, toasted marshmallow vibes, and somehow gluten-free ‚Äì but I‚Äôm not asking questions. One sip and I went from ‚Äòtough guy‚Äô to ‚Äòman contemplating his life choices‚Äô real quick. Staff was awesome, flavors were on point, and yes, I‚Äôd fight a bear to get another one. ü•∂üî•üç´', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 808 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, market, supermarket, food_store, point_of_interest, health, store, food, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had a disturbing experience with a female security contractor at this Whole Foods. During a conversation, she mocked my accent verbatim, made a racist comment about my supposed ethnic origin, and told me to ‚Äúgo shop in Chinatown instead.‚Äù She then asserted that everything in the store ‚Äúbelongs to her,‚Äù using that as justification for rude and intimidating behavior.

This is unacceptable at any retailer, especially one that claims to value inclusion. I‚Äôm asking management to review the relevant camera footage, address the contractor‚Äôs behavior with her employer, and ensure all staff and third-party personnel receive training on anti-harassment and anti-discrimination. I‚Äôd also appreciate a follow-up from the store manager regarding what corrective actions will be taken.

She is unprofessional and unethical.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Belinda was a great help at customer service she quickly identified the problem and provided outstanding service to get to a solution. Thank you so much Belinda and the Whole Foods team Will definitely continue shopping here thanks to the outstanding staff!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I enjoy this grocery store as an option in our neighborhood. Their produce is excellent. Their variety in prepared foods, cheese and frozen foods is the best in this whole neighborhood I think. It beats Key Food and Trader Joe‚Äôs by miles. I enjoy the self serve food bars, these I do find pricey but sometimes I need the convenience. Their produce store also has a nice vibe to it and their self care section is quite good.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very large supermarket serving the Upper Westside, with very fully stocked shelves and slightly higher prices. They also had free shrimp samples', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As far as uptown WholePaychecks go, this spot is far superior to the Harlem spot. And by that I mean the service and layout.

The butcher and fish counter associates are both serviceable and much better than the zombies in deli/premade (consistently the most attitude). 80% will give you stank face, 18% indifferent and on rare occasions, a unicorn will be spotted, the one who‚Äôs actually care about good service. Still, it‚Äôs better than 125th branch‚Äôs 99% stank face average.

The product here is standard WF. On occasion, they‚Äôll have a good selection of grass fed Venison and Bison and Pasteur raised meats. There‚Äôs a few local items in some departments.

The 12 for $12 oyster Friday is the move, get here before 2pm. The words out and there‚Äôs a few grandmas who literally come to buy the entire stock out. The early bird catches the worm.

They always run out of their branded coconut water (pink one) so when you see it out, grab some because it‚Äôll be days until they put more out. You‚Äôre welcome.

The service overall and checkout associates are hit or miss. If you remember WF before Amazon and before they came to the city and expect that level of service & quality- then you must have just came out of a Time Machine. That ship sailed a decade + ago. The vibe here is mostly indifferent, with an occasional mid level of job efficiency.

Sundays are a mess. Tuesday‚Äôs looks like an apocalypse hit the store. It‚Äôs usually the last day of the sales, which means most items are gone. If ya didn‚Äôt get here on Monday, it‚Äôs a wrap. If pastrami is ever on sale at the deli counter, get there the first day- Wednesday because it‚Äôs gone by Friday and they never seem to restock.

Checkout is 1000% faster than 59th street and Harlem. The self checkout is the hero but you knew that already, didn‚Äôt you Chad?', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

reviews:
[{'text': '‚ú® My First Visit to Crumbl (Upper West Side) ‚ú®

Today was my first ever trip to Crumbl, and I finally got to try their Pumpkin Square ‚Äî and wow, it was everything I hoped for and more. üçÇüéÉ The moment I walked in, the smell of fresh-baked cookies hit me, and it felt like stepping straight into fall. The staff were super friendly, the store was spotless, and the pink boxes made the whole experience even sweeter.

The Pumpkin Square itself? Chef‚Äôs kiss. It had that perfect blend of soft, spiced pumpkin flavor with the creamy frosting that melts in your mouth ‚Äî cozy, sweet, and a little nostalgic, like a pumpkin pie in cookie form. I can definitely see why everyone raves about Crumbl.

If you love fall desserts, this one‚Äôs a must-try. I‚Äôm already planning my next visit! üç™üíó', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I got 4 cookies which was in total $20 (I didn‚Äôt order any cookies with additional fees)  My friends and I took one bite of each and they tasted really mid. Not worth the hype, we stopped eating it immediately. The frosting was so thick and flavorless. One of the cookies melted super quickly, but that might have been because of the weather. However the service and atmosphere were really good, the shop overall was super cute and organized, and the guy that gave the cookies to us was really sweet.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The national gourmet, giant cookie and cake chain. Their desserts are good, but certainly more of a treat, or a gift, than a regular item.

Make sure to order on the app or the website, to avoid and lines or waiting.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I find these Crumbl cookies a real rip-off. My kids are crazy about them which I  very much regret as they are below average, not worth the hype at all, and last but not least - ultra expensive for the quality and lack of nutririon in them!!!

We also got a 4-pack previously worth $22.21. And they taste like nothing.

Is their business model sustainable? Maybe not. But was the cookie delicious? Hell yeah. We went for the standard chocolate chip. It was my husband‚Äôs birthday so I wrote that, none of the staff even said anything just handed us a cookie within seconds. Oh well.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

reviews:
[{'text': 'pretty big market area, with a bunch of stalls selling some pretty cool stuff. dont sleep on the inside area, some great sellers in there.

shout out to this mon and son juice stand out at the front by the entrance (on the right). amazing selection of the most refreshing juices - we tried the plain lemonade and the mango orange and hibiscus one and both were amazing, just what was needed on a a hot day', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Come and look for a precious things that you are not going to find in any regular store anymore. I can't recommend it enough‚Äîdefinitely a must-visit destination!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Underrated weekend activity in NYC!! I would recommend the store 10 out of 10 wonderful people very clean. The staff is very helpful just all in all wonderful service.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Horrible. I came in to replace my AirPod Pros, since I had apple care coverage. I made an appt for 5:10pm on Monday... I checked in at 4:50p, since I work around the corner‚Ä¶.. I  was not taken until 6:03‚Ä¶. They need more staff because I just wanted to replace two little AirPod pros‚Ä¶..which shouldn‚Äôt have taken almost an hour, with an appt‚Ä¶ AND THE WORST PART‚Ä¶. They didn‚Äôt even have the product I needed‚Ä¶. And I made this appt 3 days ago‚Ä¶.. so I have to now come back to pick up the piece they didn‚Äôt have‚Ä¶. Ridiculous!!!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love it, The Apple Store on the Upper West Side of Manhattan is a stunning luxury retail space. Located on Broadway at 67th Street, this store boasts a unique curved glass roof and a 54-foot-tall, 75-foot-wide, and 30-foot-deep glass front ¬π. The interior is just as impressive, with a spacious, well-lit area featuring four rows of display tables and a beautiful spiral glass staircase leading down to a lower level ¬≤.

This store is not only aesthetically pleasing, but it's also home to a "highly trained team" of over 200 employees, offering top-notch customer service and technical support ¬≥.
