name: Key Food Urban Marketplace
address: 52 Avenue A, New York, NY 10009, USA
types: supermarket, deli, butcher_shop, food_delivery, market, grocery_store, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Have you seen the prices at Key Food lately? It‚Äôs absurd. Many of their items are more expensive than the neighborhood pharmacies!
The Oatly milk cartons are almost always in terrible shape ‚Äî swollen, fermented, clearly left unrefrigerated at some point. And if you dare to mention it to the manager, he just points to the expiration date like that magically excuses neglecting basic food safety. Completely clueless about how perishables should be handled.
A box of Weetabix cereal? $7.59. Horizon milk? Nearly ten bucks.
It‚Äôs official: gentrification is complete in the East Village when Whole Foods starts looking like the cheaper option.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'never thought I‚Äôd ever give a grocery store a bad review but cashiers are consistently & incredibly rude - always give you attitude. I definitely don‚Äôt expect amazing customer service in nyc but only supermarket that sticks out in such ways. Prices are reasonable though sometimes is food past best by dates & fruits can be rotten (but good luck telling the staff). Shopping here always reminds me of why people don‚Äôt shop at Key Foods.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Unrealized potential is arguably the most frustrating thing in the world. Freddy Adu comes to mind. Bol Bol, Michael Beasley, Josh Rosen, Greg Oden, and Matt Lienart are all on the dome as well. It‚Äôs all right there, but for one reason or another, it just doesn‚Äôt come together.

All this to say, in my eternal journey to find the best grocery store rotisserie chicken, Key Food is a bird that came highly recommended. And I see why. This had all the makings of a great tissi: good looking crispy skin, $8.99 for a whole chicken, and came in a container as opposed to a plastic bag. It passed the eye test with flying colors. It just didn‚Äôt live up to the hype.

It was the only lukewarm chicken that I‚Äôve had on this journey. It was still a good chicken. The breast was decently tender, good flavor, crispy skin, but the leg was just dry. I‚Äôve never seen a dry leg. I needed water after every bite, which is crazy. I think it was just overcooked.

I still gave it a 7/10. Maybe a 7 is too high, maybe I just can‚Äôt see past the potential, but my heart is saying 7. If there‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôve learned in my 29 years here, it‚Äôs that I need to follow my heart.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov__', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This location has the best florist. The arrangements always look so special with the unique palette and interesting mix of blooms. This spot has been my go to flower-shop since moving to East Village and I reckon I‚Äôll keep coming back even if I leave the neighborhood. I hope they keep the guys working here because they truly are unparalleled artists!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is completely gross and unacceptable. The bakery items are moldy and the groceries are old. I bought some croissants from Key food and only saw they were moldy when I got home! Beware if you shop here and make sure you inspect everything you buy carefully.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 233 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I absolutely love shopping at Trader Joe's. Always spacious and clean, and always enough cashiers.  I love the variety of frozen foods that you wouldn't usually see at a regular supermarket, and their prices are affordable too. TraderJoe's meals are easy to prepare, especially when you come in from a long day and don't know what's for dinner.  Could never just go for a couple things, I end up needing 3 pairs of hands because I get 2 of everything ü§¶üèæ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è I love shopping at Trader Joe's.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As a trainer working with Woody, a middle-aged, overweight Catahoula Pit mix, I've been on the lookout for high-value reinforcements that truly motivate him. The Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips have been a fantastic find in our training regimen.
Woody absolutely goes wild for these! The "Beef Recipe" seems to be a huge hit, making them incredibly effective for reinforcing positive behaviors, especially given that he's a middle-aged dog we're working on getting back to a healthy weight. Alongside bananas, which he also enjoys, these jerky strips provide a powerful incentive without adding too many extra calories when used strategically.
One of my main priorities with Woody, especially as an overweight dog, is managing his energy levels and ensuring he stays cool during our sessions. The compact size of these jerky strips means I can break them into smaller pieces for frequent rewards without overfeeding, which is crucial for calorie control. Plus, they're easy to carry and don't get messy, making them perfect for outdoor training sessions where keeping Woody comfortable and cool is paramount.
Overall, I highly recommend Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips for anyone looking for a high-value, palatable treat for their dog, especially for those working with an overweight or middle-aged dog like Woody. They've been an excellent addition to our training toolkit, helping us make significant progress while keeping him motivated and happy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An incredible place to go shopping for groceries.

I was particularly impressed with their affordable organic options and the wide range of flavors that you won't find in your typical grocery store.

Whether it's their delicious frozen meals, fresh produce, or quirky snacks, there's always something exciting to discover at Trader Joe's.

Plus, the layout and organization of the store made it easy to find everything I needed.

Their private-label products and friendly staff exceeded my expectations, which keeps me coming back for more.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love this location of Trader Joe‚Äôs ! Its my favorite and I‚Äôm always greeted and helped by the friendly staff ‚Ä¶Xavier especially, he‚Äôs one of those exceptional employees who smile is warm and inviting always eager to help me when I shop or need to see if my favorite snacks are in stock . MY FAVORITE STORE !!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love the staff of Trader Joe‚Äôs. Extremely friendly and helpful. I‚Äôm looking for something that has zero stocks, the staff who is senior already go the extra mile to help me look in the stockroom and find the item for me since I can‚Äôt go back anymore.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Wegmans
address: 770 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is an incredible grocery store if you‚Äôre looking for high quality produce, packaged snacks, and prepared foods. They make sushi, Asian bowls, cakes, breads, and cookies.

You can easily get lost here wandering the aisles.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Omg I love this place. I discovered wegmans back in 2012 when I lived in Syracuse. I brought the lobster salad which I give. 5/10 when I opened it but 10/10 as leftovers. The winner was the chocolate dome petit. For 8 dollars it was so worth it. I‚Äôm not a pastry eater but I had this and now I want to buy it again. The cake was soft and the moose was delicious. Will be back soon. No pics of the lobster salad because it‚Äôs gone lol but pic of the cake .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The interior design is astounding, it looks very not New York, looks a bit Southern and Midwestern.

Price is not as bad as Whole food.

Has many cook food station for you to order.

Not too bad for a first impression of Wegman in NYC.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very large supermarket with all the basics with a very good selection of Asian items, seafood and fresh meals/hot/cold food compared to other large supermarkets like Fairway or Wholefoods. Prices are quite decent and definitely recommend.

They have some of the best prices for ice cream pints of which they have a large selection. It does not feel as upscale as whole foods and the price difference reflects it, but the quality is still very good and comparable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love this store. Wonderful selection of foods and the staff here are amazing. More specifically the sandwiches and salads. I had a salad that was hand crafted and OUT OF THIS WORLD. Angela who works in this department was very kind and helped me choose a sandwich that was made fresh and was quite tasty and definitely worth the price as well. Truly a great go to for grabbing food on the go- highly recommend. Super clean and organized.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 95 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I stopped into Whole Foods looking for something healthy to eat they have such a wide selection of fresh and healthy options. At first, I was leaning toward a salad, but then I saw the pizza and decided to give it a try since I love pizza, and honestly in New York you can‚Äôt really go wrong with it.

I grabbed a slice and it was pretty good cheesy, flavorful, and satisfying. It‚Äôs not your typical greasy slice; it had a fresher taste, and I liked the balance of toppings. Definitely a decent option when you‚Äôre hungry and want something quick.

What‚Äôs also nice is that Whole Foods has seating upstairs, so you can enjoy your food right there after shopping. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend trying their pizza. You can buy it by the slice or get a whole pie, and for a grocery store, it‚Äôs surprisingly solid.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Couldn‚Äôt spend 5 mins in this store before being followed. Once I complained one of the security guards/employees began to give his unsolicited input and the verbally assaulted me, saying ‚ÄúI need a man to calm me down‚Äù . This is the type of employees this store hires for customer service positions. He worried about me when he should be worried about working to afford a haircut.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very spacious and clean store with a wide variety of fresh food and baked goods. I highly recommend the sushi rolls,they‚Äôre always fresh and really tasty. In the sushi section, you can grab chopsticks and extra soy sauce, so don‚Äôt forget to take them before you leave. You can enjoy your food upstairs in their dining area, where there‚Äôs a nice view from the window. It‚Äôs also a great option if you want to take your food to go. Friendly staff and a relaxed, pleasant atmosphere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I shop here for the vegan and organic options that are hard to find elsewhere. This is my neighborhood Whole Foods and it‚Äôs really disappointing to see how little they care about keeping the water fountains and bathrooms maintained and usable. Especially with the need for water this time of year. They just got a new fountain with a water bottle filler, but within the first couple days the filter status had a red light. They fixed that after about a week. But now, for several weeks, the water bottle filler has only been working very very slowly. It takes about 5-10x longer to fill a bottle than normal depending on the size, and I always feel rude because there‚Äôs always someone behind me waiting to fill theirs. Oh and the amount of bottles it says has been saved is going up normally so it thinks it‚Äôs dispensing more water than it is. The last time I used it it never stopped when I took the bottle away.
The part where you sip from stopped working at all a couple weeks ago. The water coming out has no pressure so it just goes down.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Here I am, blissfully scanning my groceries. To my surprise a woman that works at whole foods start screaming in my ear about something not scanning. I'm trying to explain to her that I lost my voice but I am doing separate transactions and will be using another card for the rest of my groceries. She's ignores me and keeps repeating something didn't scan, mind you I'm tryna scan the rest of my items but she is blocking the scanner and hovering over me. Girl, relax. She finally moves so I can finish scanning. She's hootin and hollering to her coworkers about me. I promise you it's not that serious. There was no need for her blood pressure to be raised, I KNOW you ain't getting paid enough for all that. And SHE WAS COMPLETELY IN THE WRONG. I come to this whole foods all the time and have done separate transactions a handful of times without incident. Again, relax. It's too early and you're doing far far too much", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly
address: 101 Liberty St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: italian_restaurant, pizza_restaurant, grocery_store, cafe, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, store, event_venue, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': "A wonderful restaurant and eateries. The atmosphere is lively and fun, and the Italian dishes are delicious and very fresh. The service is friendly and the staff is helpful. It's a pleasant experience that makes the place a special destination for food lovers.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Eataly is one of those places that manages to capture the true essence of Italy  from the aroma of freshly baked focaccia to the sound of baristas calling out espresso orders in Italian. The moment you walk in, you‚Äôre surrounded by a vibrant mix of markets, restaurants, and wine bars that make you forget you‚Äôre even in New York. The variety is unmatched. You can grab a perfect cappuccino in the morning, a fresh plate of pasta at lunch, and finish the evening with wine and tiramisu. The ingredients are incredibly fresh most of them imported directly from Italy. The pizza is a standout, especially the Margherita with its chewy crust and fragrant basil. The gelato counter is another must-stop; the pistachio flavor alone is worth the trip. One time I stopped by just to grab olive oil and ended up in a full conversation with one of the staff members about different types of truffle salts. He actually opened a jar for me to smell and recommended pairing it with roasted potatoes or scrambled eggs. That small, genuine gesture turned a quick errand into a memorable experience and yes, I left with the truffle salt and zero regrets.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely amazing! Fresh Italian cuisine that‚Äôs hard to put into words. The supermarket section is incredible, and I even got to watch mozzarella being made (and was given a sample!). The staff was so friendly, and the meals came in generous portions and were incredibly yummy. I had to make a coffee stop and get an affogato‚Äîwow, it was the perfect finish. The Italian soda was also a big plus! I love all the fresh options in the market, with the highest-quality ingredients. So many choices, and the view is just stunning.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Claudia Andreani was an excellent host, answered all of our questions about reservations. We were seated with a great view of the city and 9/11 Memorial. Our server, Cristian C, was attentive, answered our questions and responded professionally to the one food concern that we had. Great experience!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pasta is simply irresistible. The flavors are deep and rich, and the cheese adds the perfect creamy touch. The calamari appetizer impressed me as well‚Äîcrispy without being greasy, and packed with flavor.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 66 Broadway, New York, NY 10005, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Updates: Whole Foods hot bar never disappoints us‚Ä¶ It always provides a wide range of simple, healthy, delicious foods that you can eat during a day.

Previously reviewed:
This would be one of our go-to places for healthy meals.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Fresh Salad bar and hot foods.

All foods so tasty and fresh.
So spoilt for choice in everything.
So enjoyed my Salads, Roast chicken , Sushi, Chicken wings, macaroni cheese, drinks, yogurt and fruits', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Market at 66 Broadway is a sleek addition to the Financial District. The store is well-organized, making it easy to find what you need. The prepared foods section offers a variety of options, though some items can be hit or miss. Checkout lines move efficiently, even during busy hours. It‚Äôs a convenient spot for quality groceries and a quick bite in the area.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Coffe, pastries, fruits and veggies salads, juices, fresh food like soups, all meats dishes and rice, pastas, by pound or sizes just ready to grab and go or take in the large dinner area. Panty at really good prices just ready to pick up for your daily meals,', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Whole Foods is an amazing addition to FiDi. Today I picked up La Fermiere Yogurt which always hits that sweet spot, perfect for munchies üçÉüå±ü•¨ after a gardening session or a late night snack. The lavender infusion puts me right to sleep at night.

The staff is welcoming and friendly, when I pick up the Chefs dinner the Chef really hooks it up. I‚Äôm on a high protein diet and appreciate the generous portions. The salad bar is always well stocked and organized & the coffee shop is awsome. The almond croissants are addictive ‚ÄºÔ∏è

Cool experience today. The butchers are samurai, at this location.

Meal prep by Jeff Bezos', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Tashkent Supermarket Halal Food
address: 378 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "This is a fascinating place that is a feast for the eyes and belly, if you know what you want. My daughter and I went here on my recent trip, but I was having some tooth issues so I didn't buy the delicious looking, honey-coated pistachio butterfly because it looked too crunchy.

I was a little astonished that there was no difference in price between something as expensive looking as a seafood salad with huge shrimp, calamari and more - and common salads. I also deducted a star because I went back with my friend a few days later and was sorely disappointed that they don't set up any of the bar stuff until 9 am. That's perfectly understandable for the hot and cold bar.

But you guys are completely missing the boat for New Yorkers looking to pick up one of your delectable pastries in the morning on the way to work. And I will sadly have to wait until my next visit to NYC to try the pastry that looked so inviting!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I used to ‚Äútravel‚Äù all the way down to Brighton Beach for their food - so thrilled to have found it in Manhattan! The ultimate food paradise of ‚Äúpost-Soviet‚Äù regional cuisines - Russian, Ukrainian, Central Asian, all of it! And it‚Äôs truly tastes like home ü§© huge love for the job you‚Äôre doing!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is the most comprehensive buffet-style supermarket I‚Äôve seen in Manhattan! Despite its compact size, it‚Äôs packed with everything you could need for travel or daily life in NYC.

The variety of freshly prepared foods blew me away‚ÄîAsian, Middle Eastern, Japanese, Italian, European, and classic American dishes, all vibrant, flavorful, and incredibly fresh. I was amazed at how many options were available, with new dishes being cooked right there.

Beyond the food, the store is fully stocked with other essentials. It‚Äôs super convenient, located close to the subway and NYU. My only regret is not living closer! This place is a gem for travelers or locals looking to save on delicious, affordable meals. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Happened upon this market in the village after walking around for hours and looking to buy some water. I thought oh, what fun, an Uzbek market, I'd like to give them my money instead of a corporate chain.

Oh, when I walked in, it was entering a wonderland. They had so much on offer. Bars and bars of hot food, fresh cold salads, manti, samsa, perozhki, kutabi, pastries, plov,  buffet, and if that's not enough, a made-to-order station where you can get schwarma or other hot foods to order.

There were staff everywhere making sure the self-serve food was staying clean and fresh. Replacing if needed and keeping an attentive eye on it to ensure food safety.

This wasn't even everything! I didn't get pictures of the bakery and pastries section, the deli, the produce, the cold cases, or the dry goods aisles!

I only got a few peroshki, some cut watermelon for the hot day, baba ghanoush, and drinks, since I was walking and not done for the day, but it is conveniently located right on TOP of a subway entrance.

I can't wait to go back and go big with everything I want. (Bonus, English-speaking staff but Uzbek, too, if you want to talk in Uzbek üòä)", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pros: Still looking brand new and very high-end. The selection is awesome - eastern European, Russian and Central Asian produce, really good breads. The buffet is spectacular. Last but not least, located right over the subway entrance. Cons: the buffet items seem to be about 20% pricier than in Tashkent stores in Queens and Brooklyn. Verdict: highly recommended.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 400 Grand St Cellar, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The store is bright and clean. The space is smaller than other branches. They sell daily necessities and food, but the variety is slightly less. Just personal feeling. But you still can buy what you need. When checking out, although there are many people, there are also many staff at the open counter, so it is quick to get your turn.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is my favorite grocery store! The store policy on purchases is very customer centric. If a customer is unhappy about a purchase, the managers will make it right either through a refund or replacement. The management and staff are friendly and helpful too. The Grand Street store is clean and spacious. There are always cart handle wipes available. They carry a large assortment of organic foods. New products are introduced every week or two. TJs is also a great option if you want to buy fresh flowers and plants too. Generally, all the prices are pretty reasonable. My only complaint is I wish they carried more vegan products.

It's important to note that each store is different. The Trader Joe's on 22nd & 6th Ave and 14th Street are awful! Both are very busy and small, so maneuvering with a cart is somewhat difficult. Also, the store on 22nd Street never provides cart handle wipes for customers. The dispenser is always empty or broken!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Been coming here for the past 3 years and not a single bad experience. Prices are unbeatable and food is always fresh. I would always look forward to checkout as staff members are always super kind and friendly. The food quality is great and well preserved. I would say the bathroom is sometimes out of order or not maintained its best condition but otherwise, this is one of my favorite places to shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Efficient layout, nice selection, quick lines (Friday midday in August).  Very low prices vs. other grocery chains.  Friendly and especially thoughtful and efficient checkout from Georgina - probably the most efficient bag-packer of any grocery store I've been to.  Lady probably crushes at Tetris.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '1st time visiting this location. Love the layout and endless offerings of fruits and veggies.
I was desperate for a box of cornflakes. The prices are excellent for my budget.
I will be visiting weekly to stock up on my goodies.
Thanks to Cashier #5 who assisted me and carried my groceries to his register.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 270 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': '‚ù§Ô∏èüá∫üá∏ today I picked up Electrolytes by Noom, Just Water, & a Banana Cinnamon Koia. I was happy to run into Jess Coleman‚Äôs family nearby also Patrons of this whole-foods.

I spoke with his father about community engagement, and how much this wholefoods brings our community together.

Just got a Koia vanilla Bean to start our day & a few Lacroix before we head to Sirius dog run.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The pizza here is surprisingly good. The food bar itself is top quality. One of the best Whole Foods in the city. Very large layout. Endless organic products.
Great location too by WTC, financial district, and hudson river park.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "üåª Unforgettable Service at Whole Foods‚ÄîThanks to Samantha!
I had the absolute pleasure of being helped by Samantha at the flower section inside Whole Foods, and I truly cannot say enough good things about her. From the moment I walked up hoping to find sunflowers for my sister‚Äîher favorite flower‚ÄîSamantha greeted me with warmth and genuine care.
üíê Above and Beyond Service There was only one bouquet of sunflowers available, so I decided to get roses instead. While waiting for them to be wrapped, I asked Samantha if there were any more sunflowers. She kindly asked me to wait and said she‚Äôd check in the back. She magically returned with the most stunning sunflowers I‚Äôd ever seen‚Äîfresh, golden, and vibrant, like sunshine bundled into stems. She wrapped them with beautiful attention to detail, adding her own artistic touch to make them feel like a true gift.
üòä A Touch of Humanity and Knowledge With a cheerful smile, Samantha shared a little sunflower lore, including the fact that they‚Äôre the national flower of Ukraine‚Äîsomething I hadn‚Äôt known. That moment turned a simple purchase into a meaningful encounter. She didn‚Äôt just sell flowers‚Äîshe offered joy, warmth, and a touch of culture all in one.
üåü More Than a Transaction Samantha elevated the experience from routine to unforgettable. Her kindness and enthusiasm were contagious‚Äîleaving me with a huge smile and attracting admiration wherever I went with the sunflowers.
If you ever find yourself near the flower counter at Whole Foods and Samantha‚Äôs there, trust me: you're in for more than just a bouquet. You're in for a moment of grace, beauty, and genuine human connection.
Thank you, Samantha, for turning a simple errand into a lasting memory. üåª‚ú®
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Revisited with Hope to Upgrade My Review ‚Äî Unfortunately, Things Got Worse

I came back to Whole Foods Tribeca hoping to update my last review and give the store a better rating ‚Äî as 99% of my reviews are positive. Sadly, what I witnessed made that impossible.

A known bottle and can collector, carrying two filthy bags filled with recyclables, was seen stealing what appeared to be hundreds of dollars in vitamins. He then made his way to the salad bar, where the dirty cans repeatedly brushed against the food. Shockingly, security watched and did nothing. I informed customer service, who also failed to act.

As customers, we deserve clean, healthy food and a basic standard of hygiene. This experience was unacceptable, and I will never return to the Tribeca Whole Foods salad bar again.

Please see the attached photos.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Every time I come here, I enjoy shopping and eating. You can find everything you need: fresh ingredients, ready-made meals, and a very large buffet with freshly prepared dishes. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and you never have to wait long at the checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Russ & Daughters
address: 179 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: bagel_shop, historical_landmark, meal_takeaway, historical_place, bakery, grocery_store, food_store, restaurant, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Got a poppy seed bagel with lox and scallion cream cheese (also had onion, tomato, and capers).

This was my favorite bagel on the trip and the reason was mainly the cream cheese. It was so light and mild tasting i felt like I could eat a tub of it ans feel fine. The lox was also amazing too though. The sandwitch was just perfectly executed.

I wish the in store experience was a little better though. The store become a mess when it gets crowded so plan to go at a slightly odd time for a smoother/faster experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "There's a reason this place has been around for decades. The spot takes you back to an old pharmacy with counter ordering, all items beautifully on display, and no frills. Come prepared to order because in true NY fashion they move QUICK. The everything egg bagels are tasty but I felt the cream cheese stole the show. These are highly sought out by the locals and I can see why. They offer a variety of fish options but we didn't taste test these.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Stopped by Russ & Daughters and it‚Äôs easy to see why it‚Äôs such an iconic spot. The fish quality really stands out ‚Äî fresh, flavorful, and generously portioned. You definitely get a lot for what you order, which makes it feel worthwhile. The classic bagels and spreads complement the fish perfectly, and the whole experience has a timeless, authentic New York feel. A must-visit for anyone who appreciates top-notch smoked fish and traditional deli vibes. We were able to eat right in front of the store, where there is a couple benches available.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very good place to get a cream cheese bagel and they are generous. There is a ticket system when you enter and you have to grab a ticket to be served and service is pretty quick. It‚Äôs not the best I had as it‚Äôs maybe hyped up to be, but certainly very solid. Feels like a commercial lineup with the ticket system rather than personal old style bagel shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'My brother was told about this place. Absolutely loved it. Felt like a slip back in time and you can tell this place is not only, take care of and respected, but also has quality staff that put love and attention to your order. We split the classic bagel and lox. Best bagel I have ever had in my life. I truly wish I could eat this everyday. 10/10', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 4 Union Sq E, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very good Whole Foods Market in front of the famous Union Square Park. Well stacked, organized, and has a good salad ü•ó and hot food ü•ò section. I had a feeling that some items in this particular store are little bit more expensive than that of Hudson. The security in this store is a bit hiked.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Deli service is appalling. Plenty of staff walking around, but none tending to customers, despite making eye contact and noticing there is a line. The singular employee slicing meat even asked them to help and they didn‚Äôt.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of my favorite Whole Foods stores. They have a lot of organic varieties. Our family likes them very much. My kids only like the beef and milk here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Union Square is undoubtedly my favourite location in the city. Although it tends to be quite crowded most of the time,  I still absolutely love it. The store offers an excellent selection of fresh produce, well-organized aisles. You have groceries, lunch, cafe with ample seating ‚Äì all rolled into one. Their coffee is good and actually less expensive than cafes around here. The food is great ‚Äî fresh ingredients, caloric information, healthy options and I would say hard-to-beat prices ( $14 for an entree and two sides is the best special ). Their cafe offers 90-minute seating with a table for every group ‚Äî each table seats four, but they are places side-by-side on the Union Sq side, so large groups can sit here too. And of course the views can‚Äôt be beat!  The restrooms are a bit small, if there‚Äôs one negative.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 142 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ªü™ªü™∑üíÆüåºü•Äüåª
I had the most delightful experience at Trader Joe's recently, thanks to their stunning and affordable flower selection! I picked up two breathtaking orchids for just $14.99 each‚Äîa price that‚Äôs truly unbeatable. After checking multiple locations, this store stood out not only for its affordability but also for its focus on plants and flowers, which makes it feel like a hidden gem for floral lovers.
What made the visit even more special was the joy these orchids brought to two of my friends on their birthdays. It felt amazing to gift something so beautiful without breaking the bank.
The staff was incredibly helpful and thoughtful, offering great tips on how to care for the orchids and keep them thriving. I was able to pop in while running errands and get everything I needed quickly and efficiently.
If you're looking for economical yet elegant flowers, this Trader Joe's location is a must-visit.  üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ª", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I often go this place to grab salad but yesterday I found bug in my Trader Joes Salad. I complained to the manager and he was behaving like it‚Äôs nothing new for him and he was telling me his experience in a restaurant having bug in food. I am shocked with the mangers behaviour. Though he refunded me.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great variety and prices. If you see the line to pay, no worries move fast. I love the place.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '@ traderjoes I often have a wonderful experience here. I tried calling the store today but no one picked up . I wanted to ask if anyone has turned in a light grey lid for a foldable cart. I went shopping and by the time check out came around the lid was missing , unsure if it fell out of the traderjoes red metal shopping cart. I would appreciate a reply if you find it .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love this company. Always lots of good stuff. And they have a restroom for customers to. Wich is really good for us tourist that are out walking and exploring the city.

name: Essex Market
address: 88 Essex St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: tourist_attraction, grocery_store, market, food_store, restaurant, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Definitely worth a visit.
Tons of former deli‚Äôs and options on coffee, cheeses, gourmet meats, seafood and friends / veggies.
Lots of seating upstairs.
Very nice place!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "In theory they're up until 8:00. But half the vendors have gone home by 5:30. I'm sure this is a fine place for the afternoon lunch crowd then people who live in the neighborhood.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Essex Market brings back so many memories from childhood‚Äîused to go to the old location with family all the time. The new space is definitely more modern, but it still has that same community feel. A great mix of vendors, from fresh produce and meats to amazing food stalls. It‚Äôs nice to see how it‚Äôs evolved while keeping the spirit of the original market alive. Always worth a visit when I‚Äôm in the neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The Essex Market mezzanine is the PERFECT spot to host an event. We held a Welcome to NY Wedding Open House and the guests loved seeing and experiencing all the best of the Lower East Side. Catalysts Records and Top Hops, two vendors from the market, set the just right vibe.  Rossy, the manager, ensured we had everything we needed for a smooth set up, event, and clean up. She builds incredible relationships with her team and ensured that. our vendors and support crew were in the just right place at the just right time throughout the night. Her support ensured I could enjoy our guests and the evening was seamless. Thank you Rossy, and Essex Market for an incredible event!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Absolutely loved my visit to Essex Market, a vibrant mosaic of flavors, cultures, and craftsmanship that still carries echoes of the Lower East Side‚Äôs soul. From Caf√© D‚ÄôAvignon‚Äôs buttery pastries to the bold, unforgettable dishes at Dhamaka, every vendor brings something special. I stocked up at Essex Olive & Spice, grabbed fresh fish from the family-run fishmonger, and treated myself to Chinatown Ice Cream Factory‚Äôs black sesame scoop. Pure joy.

I also had a fantastic ceviche at Don Ceviche, bursting with citrus, heat, and freshness. Their Peruvian flavors are the real deal.

The butcher shop, run by a husband-and-wife team with over two decades at Essex, is another standout. Their selection is unmatched on the Lower East Side, and you can feel the pride in every cut.

That said, I‚Äôd be lying if I claimed not to miss the old Essex Street Market across Delancey. That scrappy, character-filled space had a rhythm all its own. It‚Äôs gone now, and it‚Äôs not coming back, just like so many pieces of the city that get swept away in the tide of gentrification, which creeps like a slow disease both downtown and eastward. Even Dhamaka, brilliant as it is, feels like part of that paradox: a celebration of forgotten flavors in a space shaped by the very forces that erase them.

Still, life moves forward. The new market is beautiful, and many legacy vendors are keeping the spirit alive. I was genuinely disappointed to find the Market Line food court downstairs closed. It added a whole other layer of discovery and community. Hopefully it reopens soon, even better and even bolder, because Essex Market deserves a vibrant underground to match its street-level brilliance.

Five stars, with a bittersweet heart.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: H Mart Manhattan
address: 39 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: supermarket, asian_grocery_store, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'A very clean, beautiful, organized Korean market. But the prices are crazy. Worth going, there is a lot of variety of products. Plus, they sell my favorite fried chicken ü§§üòç bb.q Korean Fried Chicken üëå', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is actually ridiculous. How is a bottle of fish sauce $16.99‚Ä¶. They‚Äôre normally only 5.99-6.99 per bottle. Absolutely ridiculous.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was walking home from dinner with my big bro and he hit me with "Aye I need to pick up some oyster sauce, wanna pop into the grocery store with me?" That's some grown man business, picking up some oyster sauce from the Korean market lol. Respect.

We popped in and H Mart was PACKED. Standing room only. I perused around while big bro hunted for his oyster sauce, and I wanted to buy everything. So many snacks I had never seen before. I felt like I was back in Japan or Vietnam. I got analysis paralysis and ended up not getting anything. I almost bought some meat as they had such a wide selection of things I never see at TJs or Whole Foods, but it was lowkey pretty expensive and my pockets are on featherweight.

Big bro found a new oyster sauce per an employee's recommendation, as the one he currently had was "not viscous enough." He different.

IG @jnov_
Tiktok @jnov_reviews', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came here for the first time & had to come back a second time . Love love love !! From store upkeep & cleanliness to a variety of snacks, fruits and foods galore down to the employees/cashiers working in such a fast paced , well equipped positive manner . Seriously tho the cashiers are very polite & positive and emit a very welcoming and warm ambience in the market . I used to go to the hmart down in 34th but I think this will be the new go-to. Definitely check out their beers/alcohol section, you‚Äôll find gold !üçªThe store may seem a little small but the variety of produce and foods and etc make up for it by a lot . This store will not disappoint, so much so that I had to come back the next day ..and I‚Äôll do it again ü§ç! Take my word.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'the Korean supermarket is stocked with a lot of different Asian food goods. the actual space is fairly small for a supermarket BUT it doesn‚Äôt feel like that bc the store is really well organized and has so many items shelved neatly. beyond behind really clean and well-maintained, the store consistently stocks items and brands and rarely is ‚Äúout‚Äù of anything no matter the time of day or night. there is also a fair amount of Asian-centric kitchen ware close to checkout. the store has a good energy vibe and the employees are pleasant and helpful. ‚ÄòSides H Mart always has Japanese KitKats in stock which is a plus in my book for any grocery spot.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Eataly - SoHo
address: 200 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: italian_restaurant, grocery_store, cafe, market, food_store, restaurant, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'We were in the mood for pizza but wanted to sit down and some of the other places we had looked at were really busy.  when we passed by eatly we had heard about it so decided to check it out.

we were seated and greeted right away and right away ordered the rustico bread.  we then ordered the caesar salad plus marguerite pizza with eggplant.  the bread was supposed to come out first but the server messed up and everything came out at the same time.

the bread was very good, excellent in fact with good portion size and good taste.  the pizza was also good, more cheese and less eggplant but still a good, thin crust pizza.  the caesar salad was average as it was basically lettuce and dressing

overall good food and a nice ambiance', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Eataly SoHo ‚Äî My New Favorite Italian Spot in NYC üçù‚ú®

I finally stopped by Eataly in SoHo and wow‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm obsessed! The atmosphere is so warm and chic dim lighting, beautiful table settings, and that classic Italian energy that makes you feel like you‚Äôre on vacation in Milan.

I ordered the ravioli, and it was everything. Perfectly al dente pasta with the most flavorful sauce you can taste the freshness in every bite. I paired it with a glass of white wine that balanced it beautifully.

And then the dessert‚Ä¶ pure magic üçØ The pistachio cream topped with honey drizzle might be one of the best things I‚Äôve ever had rich, silky, and just sweet enough.

Service was amazing, the vibe was immaculate, and every detail felt so well-thought-out. Whether you‚Äôre here for a cute date night, a solo glass of wine, or a content-worthy meal Eataly delivers.

üìçSoHo, NYC
üí´ Must-try: The ravioli + pistachio dessert combo
üç∑ 10/10 ambience and presentation', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'i know it is now fall üçÇ and the weather has cooled down a lot. but it does not hurt to get iced, or even frozen, drinks.
Eataly Soho is my one and only spot for frozen espresso ‚òïÔ∏è ($7.25). this cremespresso is slushy-like espresso. it is super refreshing, mildly sweet, and still packed with caffeine for the day. i‚Äôd say it is creamier than slushy, but less than ice cream üç®

eataly is THE spot for italian groceries. i always get fresh pasta, sauces, and high quality cheese from here. their sandwiches, cakes, and pizza also look fire üçï

if you use too good to go app, you will also find eataly there. but i heard you will have to be fast at reserving eataly goodie bag bc it offers the best deal with high quality sandwiches, pasta, and bakery ü•ñ', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not as large as other Eataly‚Äôs, especially their Vegas  location.  Dined at the restaurant and was very satisfied with our meal.  We had their MARGHERITA ‚ÄòA RUOTA DI CARRO‚Äô pizza.  That had to be one of the best pizza I ever had.  I couldn‚Äôt believe how thin the crust was.  So tasty.  I highly recommend their pizzas.

We also had their Fettuccine Alfredo.  The pasta was cooked al dente and was so good.  To finish off our lunch we had the PANNA COTTA AI FRUTTI DI BOSCO.  Great way to end our meal.

The only knock, they need a hostess to greet and seat parties as there was nobody there.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Last time we visited, the appetizers were decent but the pastas were terrible. They got our order mixed up and insisted they were correct. The pasta was overcooked, as you can see in the photo I posted. The food also took at least 40 minutes, and when we asked why, they simply said there was a ‚Äúproblem in the kitchen.‚Äù On top of that, they charged extra for olives and pepperoni on the pizza without explaining the additional fees. The whole experience was disappointing.

However, after I left that review, the manager, Parker, replied and apologized for the inconvenience, offering us a gift card if we gave them another chance. We came back today, and the experience was completely different. They welcomed us warmly, offered us a complimentary appetizer and dessert, and also gave us a $50 gift card. On top of that, they surprised us with an extra pasta on the house. The food was much better this time, and the service had improved a lot as well.

It really felt like they cared about making things right.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Hong Kong Supermarket
address: 157 Hester St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: asian_grocery_store, supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This place has almost everything. Food and seafood and vegetables and fruit and snacks and dairy and produce and meat and candy. The only thing that I would say is, it would be great if they were a little bit cleaner and it smells fresh. But this chain of groceries provide provides a lot of groceries for the community and Taurus alike because they have so many things that they sell here. It‚Äôs best not to drive a car because it‚Äôs such a hassle. You should be taking a subway or biking around to get here. It has 2 floors! Huge.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If you are a fan of exotic foods and looking for a unique culinary experience, the "Hong Kong" supermarket in New York is definitely worth a visit. The store offers an impressive selection of Asian products, including rare fruits and vegetables that are hard to find in regular supermarkets.

The variety is remarkable ‚Äì you will find tropical fruits, exotic vegetables, and unique spices suitable for a wide range of Asian cuisines. Additionally, there is a rich selection of ready-to-eat foods, authentic sauces, and essential ingredients for traditional Chinese, Japanese, and Thai cooking.

The store is well-organized, making it easy to navigate, although it can get a bit crowded, especially during peak hours. Prices vary ‚Äì some items may be slightly more expensive compared to regular supermarkets, but given their quality and uniqueness, the shopping experience is well worth it.

In summary, "Hong Kong" is a must-visit destination for anyone who enjoys exploring new flavors and discovering high-quality Asian products. If you are looking to try something new or bring a taste of Asian cuisine home, this is the place for you.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I purchased this fruit on Friday, July 11, in the afternoon. However, when I checked it this morning (Sunday, July 13), I found that it was spoiled and moldy. I went to the supermarket with my receipt, but they refused to exchange or refund the item.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Beware when buying seafood at this supermarket.
On September 28 around 12:53 PM, I specifically chose a fish that was fresh. After handing it over to be descaled, I was given a different fish. When I got home, it smelled foul and had an unusual color. There‚Äôs not way it could have changed that much in such a short a short time- it clearly wasn‚Äôt the one I selected.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'A very disappointing experience with cashier #158 on this day. She was extremely rude and threw my shopping items as if they were garbage. When I pointed this out, she arrogantly responded, ‚ÄúJust report it to a manager; I don‚Äôt care.‚Äù

I‚Äôm not sure if this is a common issue or she just had a bad day, but I will never shop there again. There should be basic manners ÊïôÈ§ä in customer service. I do not recommend this store at all.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Happier Grocery
address: 365 Canal St Ground Floor, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have a conflicted review. As someone with a ton of food allergies, this place was a dream. SO many options, especially gluten free. I was super excited and it was like eye candy to look at all the fun brands they had. However, almost all of the food disappointed me. Expensive and not very expensive-tasting. The thing I enjoyed most was from Sixteen Mill Bakeshop, so it wasn‚Äôt exactly from Happier Grocery. However, the staff was very kind!! It‚Äôs also a beautiful place in a great location. Overall, I‚Äôd definitely come back, but I wouldn‚Äôt choose to have my whole meal here', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Although the prices are bit expensive you get variety of great healthy food options....\nI tried thier packed salad, sushi and hot food and everything was excellent üëå', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Such a cute spot with an amazing salad bar and unique beauty finds although does err a bit ‚Äòwoo woo‚Äô. The staff downstairs were so helpful and friendly but the checkout staff were rude and miserable, nothing happy about them.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is a grocery store to buy hard to access items. They sell  nuts, milks, chocolates, chips, coffee drinks, apparel, cheeses and so forth. Very few items overlap with pantry of whole foods, but those which do - the price point for most products is about $1-3 higher than whole foods. To give a sense of fanciness - the examples of items in each category are pistachio kernels, pistachio milk, sake chocolates, rose flavored potato chips. This shop is not for the masses. It is for people with a certain taste and preferences which demands a high purchasing power. I would recommend a visit to simply browse and pick a few items for novelty. Fruits, and veggies are reasonably priced. They also have a coffee bar. They also sell jackets which claim to protect against electromagnetic waves. The best and perhaps most useful item is Raw milk. They have partnered with Amish dairy and sell A2 raw milk and other dairy products on pre-order and pickup only basis. Overall, a very cool grocery store with high quality, unique products.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place gets a lot of hype online and it‚Äôs definitely elevated from your typical NYC bodega but it‚Äôs still just a grocery store. Kind of a cross between Whole Foods, Erewhon, and a foodie boutique, it‚Äôs worth a look. Plenty of items to choose from on to levels including self care, grab and go food and pantry essentials. The store definitely gets crowded - mostly with tourists and browsers. Prices are high but they are pretty much everywhere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: La Parisienne
address: 9 Maiden Ln, New York, NY 10038, USA
types: cafe, coffee_shop, brunch_restaurant, sandwich_shop, wine_bar, breakfast_restaurant, grocery_store, french_restaurant, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Such a cute little French-style brunch spot! The place is small but super cozy with a nice vibe.

Got the latte and french toast with banana, blueberries, and almond flakes ‚Äî so good! Soft, not too sweet, and perfect with the coffee. The smoked salmon and avocado toast was fresh and flavorful too ‚Äî love the combo with lemon and dill.

Great spot to chill, grab brunch, and enjoy some quality food and coffee. Definitely a hidden gem worth checking out! ‚òïÔ∏èüíôü•ê', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had the salmon brioche and a croque madame, both were very good. The coffee was solid too, but the real highlight was the dessert: the chocolate tart with ice cream is a must-try. The staff was friendly and attentive. The only downsides were the size of the space, it can feel quite cramped when crowded and the smell; our clothes held onto the food odors after leaving.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Food was delicious and priced accordingly. A little tight but makes the experience that much more memorable.  Returned to breakfast here every morning we were in NYC. Highly recommend the French toast!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome french toasts, one of the best ones in NY. Everything about it was done right. Our coffees were not right the first time. I provided the feedback to waitstaff but the owner himself took over and brought us perfect lattes.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wonderful place with plenty of healthy options. I had the multigrain avocado toast with a side of roasted sweet potato‚Äîfresh, flavorful, and satisfying. Cozy, bright atmosphere that feels welcoming. Huge thanks to Dana for the warm, attentive service!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 436 E 14th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I typically enjoy shopping at Trader Joe‚Äôs, but I had a concerning experience with the store manager, Shavana. She repeatedly contacted me outside the store without my consent, despite me leaving the store. I have never gave away my number as well. It's disturbing. I explained that my dogs are emotional support animals, yet she dismissed my requests, singled me out, and unfairly criticized my well-behaved toy Shih Tzus as untrained. Additionally, she smirked privately while I explained my mental health conditions, which felt dismissive and unprofessional. Her actions made me feel harassed and violated my privacy. Many members of my community have shared similar experiences with her. I hope Trader Joe‚Äôs addresses this serious breach of professional conduct and reinforces the importance of respecting customer boundaries, privacy, and sensitivity toward mental health. I spoke to the other manager Diego who was astonished about her actions and he seemed a little helpful. I will be reporting this to corporate should she ever harass me again. No one should be discriminated or mocked due to their disability! It's unacceptable.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Oh my favorite trader Joes in New York. Great selection, lovely freezer section too and a nice variety of chocolates and sandwiches

Very clean and spacious store with really helpful staff. Good selection of produce and more!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love my local Trader Joe‚Äôs! Come here several times a week. The store is clean, salacious, and has very helpful and friendly staff. Even when the checkout line gets long during peak hours it always moves quickly thanks to the several checkout registers. Amazing floral section, too. Only minor flaws are that what‚Äôs in stock can sometimes vary and there‚Äôs no cell service in the store since it‚Äôs underground - so definitely have a list of what you want to get before you go in.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Kathy was so nice here. I went in just before closing and we had a lovely conversation. Her positive and welcoming attitude was the highlight of my day. Whatever they are paying her she deserves a raise for being so kind!!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The perfect grocery store, unless you want a name brand thing only. Extremely large underground store with possibly everything you need at low prices, very helpful staff, great quality with a guarantee (if you don't like they will take it back and give a refund).

97% of things I have brought from trader Joe's I have loved and I still have hundreds left to try and they bring out new things every week too. The only other issue is they sometimes stop selling some things to let new products come in, so if you really love something, you may need to stockpile it.", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Jubilee Marketplace
address: 99 John St, New York, NY 10038, USA
types: supermarket, food_court, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Overall rating: 3.5

I saw this place on TikTok from one of my favorite food creators and was very excited to try since I work in the area. I told one of my Korean coworkers about it, & when she looked at the pictures she didn‚Äôt seem convinced. I, still hopeful, went solo.

There were only maybe 2-3x Korean options, the rest was all Chinese and American which is fine‚Ä¶ I just went to try Korean hot food. Unfortunately I think I had higher expectations than reality. The food quality was just alright. Nothing special. Won‚Äôt be in my lunch rotations.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "be super careful about expiration dates. prices on produce are OK but for pantry staples and meat, go elsewhere. hot bar is nice since they lowered the price but it's good for convenience, not quality.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'You would never - in 1 million years - expect to see a place like this. And what I mean by "like this" is the fact that it offers all five-star, unbelievable, completely fresh prepared food in a well-maintained buffet environment at $11.99 a pound. As you walk around the store, it's shocking to see that some of the prices are less expensive than in Westchester County. It might be because of the proximity to Chinatown, but you'll see some photos, like turmeric in perfect pieces for $5.99 per pound. Good luck finding that price anywhere. Period. The entryway makes it look so unassuming that if you don‚Äôt know it‚Äôs there, you would probably never walk in. But please trust me, it is definitely worth the visit.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The food here is great & there's no shortage of a great selection.  You can enjoy cooked food, prepared salads, you pick salads & sandwiches to order, plus they are a fully stocked grocery store.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Delicious cheese burger for $2.75. Has everything on it you could want. And the supermarket has a great selection of unique ingredients at a very fair price.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Dumbo Market
address: 66 Front St, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Very nice market. It is quite late and they truly seem to be carrying a little of everything.

As you enter the store you will find the produce straight ahead, and a very good cafe and dining area on your right.

The coffee, espresso, and cappuccino are better and less expensive than the big green shop across the street. Great service at a great price. They also bake their own pastries.

In the back of the store you will find a salad bar that is reasonably priced and has a large variety of foods.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It was my first time in a store where fruits and vegetables were so perfectly laid out on the counter shelves, everything looked so fresh and bright. I especially remember that greens in large quantities in a container are not expensive. They also have a hot food bar, I didn‚Äôt try the food, but the smell was very good. I will definitely come back here again. There is also a coffee shop inside - which is also very useful :)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We took hot box food and it was amazing. Pretty pricey but tasty. Added bonus is that they also have seating area available. The only point of improvement is that we were looking to go to toilet as we saw some customers using it and then a staff member angrily advised this is for staff only. Put a sign then so people know.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '5 stars! This grocery store is very well organized and clean, which makes shopping here a breeze. The shelves are always well-stocked with a great variety of products, including fresh produce, international items, and everyday essentials. It‚Äôs clear that a lot of care goes into keeping things tidy and efficient. The staff is friendly, approachable, and always willing to help, which really enhances the experience. It‚Äôs a place that makes grocery shopping feel easy and enjoyable. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great market that sells organic and locally freshed produce and meats especially solid venison, lamb, and grass feed beef!! Highly recommend especially if you wanna get some good fresh kitchen food on top of it to complete the experience! Keep up the great job guys', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Katz's Delicatessen
address: 205 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: deli, sandwich_shop, food_store, american_restaurant, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I finally understand what all the hype is about ‚Äî and it‚Äôs absolutely worth it! From the lively cutter line to the personalities of the cutters themselves, the energy and customer service here are top-tier. You can tell they genuinely love what they do, and it shows. Their tip jar was overflowing (and rightfully so!) ‚Äî I loved that I could even tip electronically.

They offered plenty of samples ‚Äî though my sons devoured them before I could even turn my head. We truly enjoyed the beef brisket Reuben. Wow  We ordered the Philly cheesesteak, the grilled cheese, and those thick, steak fries. My pastrami and corned beef sandwich was phenomenal ‚Äî juicy, tender, and paired with the best Dijon mustard I‚Äôve ever tasted. The Philly cheesesteak was loaded with flavor and served on bread that was just perfect.

From start to finish, this place delivers an experience as satisfying as the food itself. I‚Äôm so glad I finally checked it off my list ‚Äî and honestly, I can‚Äôt wait to go back! Sad it was to go.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "We visited on a Saturday night and stayed in the outside line for about 40 minutes and another 40 minutes inside for a table service. We were a group of 6 people visiting from Southern California. We ordered all sandwiches on the menu and the only one that was truly delicious was the Ruben pastrami sandwich. It was really good! But don't try other things like the corn beef and the brisket because they were so plain and tasteless. Not worth the price at all. Their fries were really good too! Unfortunately the staff and the servers are not nice... While we were waiting for our table, one lady who was in charge of sitting people down screamed at us when we didn‚Äôt directly answer her question! And after we sat down and we needed something, it was hard to get anyone's attention and not being ignored. In summary, it was nice trying it once, but we will not go back.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Katz‚Äôs Delicatessen lives up to its legendary reputation. The pastrami sandwich is easily the best I‚Äôve ever had. The meat is sliced thick, perfectly tender, and packed with smoky, peppery flavor. It‚Äôs juicy without being greasy, and the seasoning gives it the right balance of salt and spice. Paired with fresh rye bread and a touch of mustard, the sandwich is simple but unbeatable.

The portion size is HUGE. One sandwich could easily feed two people, but it‚Äôs hard to stop once you start. The pickles on the side add a crisp, tangy contrast that cuts through the richness of the pastrami.

Service is quick and straightforward, even with the crowds. The place can feel chaotic and the lines are long, but that‚Äôs part of the experience. Katz‚Äôs delivers authentic New York deli food at its absolute best.

If you‚Äôre in New York, this is a must-visit. The pastrami sandwich alone is worth the trip, and it shows why Katz‚Äôs has been an icon for generations. Five stars without question.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Wow, just wow. I sure know why this is such a iconic spot and a must visit for any foodie visiting NY!
Took the classic pastrami with mustard on rye, as well as a brisket on rye. Both amazing but the pastrami was unbelievable.
Amazing service from the moment you walk in the door and a fun experience talking and watching the carvers do their thing!

The line looked huge around 12 but it went smooth and fast. Roughly 25 minutes total wait time until we had the food before us', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Oh my goodness. We ordered one Pastrami, one Corned Beef, and of course  the assorted pickles. Perfect. Expensive, at almost $30/sandwich, so definitely more of a luxury sandwich, but worth it. The meat was so tender and juicy, the mustard sauce was great (a little more spice would have made it perfect), and we were able to get a good seat to eat our food. There wasn‚Äôt much direction from the staff‚Ä¶. They gave general instructions and we had to figure out quite a bit‚Ä¶. What to do with the tickets, where to stand for the lines (they were more groups of people than actual lines), where to pay (we thought up front, until we got there, waited, but then learned that was cash only and cards payments were in the back of the restaurant). Same with the tickets.. the cutters put both orders on one ticket, and we used that one to pay, so we had no idea that the other was needed to exit. Had to empty our bag off to the side to retrieve it from the bottom. All in all, a delicious, though not seamless experience. Will return ready to navigate this deli adventure.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Strand Book Store
address: 828 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: book_store, wedding_venue, event_venue, home_goods_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "A true NYC gem and absolute must-visit for book lovers. The Strand Book Store is a landmark bookstore that never disappoints ‚Äî shelves upon shelves of titles to explore, including fantastic discounted finds that are still incredibly high-quality. Beyond the books, you'll discover unique cards, artistic gifts, and quirky treasures that make wandering the store such a treat. Whether you're hunting for a specific read or just browsing for inspiration, it‚Äôs easy to lose track of time in the best way. Definitely worth a stop every time I‚Äôm in the area!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Popular bookstore with several locations throughout the city. Lots of tourists and regular students picking up books. There‚Äôs a special Rare Book Room at the top floor open during special hours to see rare and unique books with histories themselves. This location is well stocked from books to souvenirs and stationery. Clear signage everywhere you go but staff are helpful too if you‚Äôre looking for something specific.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'üôåHands down - one of the best book stores in NYC!
Anything from new, used, hard to find, coveted, rare, best sellers, signed and special editions‚Ä¶you can spend hours at a time. Great place to spend your lazy afternoons or evenings and find something special in miles upon miles of books.

üìö ‚≠êÔ∏èGreat place for bibliophiles, book nerds, collectors, book junkies, and interior decorators (great coffee table books by TASCHEN).
A very well organized store that has an accessible elevator. Lovely souvenir area with lots of NYC merchandise: fun and cool.
Just a place to be if you LOVE tangible pages and printed books.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The Strand completely lived up to the hype! As a first-time visitor, I was blown away by the sheer number of books and the cozy, old-school charm of the place. You can easily lose track of time wandering the aisles ‚Äî it‚Äôs a must-visit for any book lover in NYC. I particularly loved the banned book table, bringing some light to a very important issue.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Loved this store, could spend all day here if you have time. Great selection. There‚Äôs lots of second hand books outside as well as on shelves. Lots of added items like bookmarks and cute bits!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]
