name: Museum of Ice Cream
address: 558 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: museum, tourist_attraction, ice_cream_shop, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Such a great date activity! So much pink! The ambiance is amazing. Would recommend for friends/family/dates. The only downside was that there was an insane amount of children which is fine just a bit loud. Would recommend maybe going during school time? A lot of things to do and a lot of ice creams to try, very welcoming/high energy staff. The staff is great/understanding with children from what i‚Äôve seen!! Love the jenga/word search area the most, created a nice bonding experience. Played ping pong aswell! overall fun experience and definitely worth the price ;)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This place is located in the heart of Broadway -Lafayette such a busy area , with a lot f stores , Very clean , friendly most of the staff , met with Gingerbread one of the manager she‚Äôs been very professional and friendly with us . Museum of Ive cream Have a few activities to offer , the ice  cream they offered is decent , good flavors ( guava , pina colada and passion fruits , the bars )  . Lil  pricey but I can recommend it . Great spot for photos and kids to entertain their mind . For a quick visit .  ! I know they can improve with more activities , they have the potential. I would recommend have the staff to guide the visitors  at the entrance when is first time .  One of the staff organized the table for a game . He was very helpful and decent . Guys , you can recreate all this you‚Äôve a tons of fun to offer ! The music was on point .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Really fun! Lots unique photos opportunities, free ice cream in every room, and very interactive. I would say great for little kids or adults. Everything is pink and ice cream themed,  lots to look at and walk through. The sprinkles ball pit was probably my favorite along with the indoor swings. The staff was really friendly and they do have a little gift shop. Tickets were a bit pricey at $60 but I feel like for NYC thats not bad and they definitely had a lot to do and we were there probably an hour and a half. Loved how quirky and different the ice cream museum was!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Well, I have very mixed feelings about this place. If you like pink color you will love it but there is not much of other colors throughout the entire 3 floors. We went there 2 adults and 2 teen girls. In my opinion it should not be named a museum but an experience. There is only one room with history set up as a gallery of pictures and writing so kids who don‚Äôt read yet won‚Äôt learn much about it. Other than that one history glimpse, you walk through rooms of empty pick walls and eat lots of ice cream. They could definitely do a better job with the interior. I would say we could have gotten much better ice cream in NYC for $59 price tag. The price online adjusts base on demand‚Ä¶.. I am sure if you have small kids who love pick and eating sugar you will like the place.  Our teens said it was an ok experience but would not do it again for this price.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I took my 16 yo daughter and her friend to the Museum of Ice Cream and overall it was a fun and novel experience. The museum is definitely designed young kids but also for photos and social media. There are lots of bright, over-the-top rooms, interactive installations, and plenty of spots to take selfies and group shots. The girls loved jumping into the sprinkle pool, posing in the themed rooms, and sampling the different flavors of ice cream throughout the visit.

As an adult it was novel but definitely geared more toward young teens and kids. If you‚Äôre looking for something educational or more traditional, this probably isn‚Äôt the place. But if you‚Äôre up for something silly and lighthearted, it delivers. The staff were enthusiastic and kept the energy high, and the unlimited ice cream samples were a hit with all of us. Plus the gift shop was adorable.

It‚Äôs a bit pricey for what it is, and the experience is definitely more about the visuals and the fun atmosphere than learning anything about ice cream. That said, our teens had a good time, and we left with lots of great photos and memories. Perfect for a special treat or a unique day out in NYC!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Bubby's
address: 120 Hudson St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: american_restaurant, brunch_restaurant, bakery, breakfast_restaurant, food_store, bar, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'went to Bubby‚Äôs for breakfast, and although it was packed with about a 45-minute wait, it was absolutely worth it. The atmosphere was lively and cozy, the kind of bustling New York breakfast spot that makes you feel like you‚Äôre part of something special.
I ordered the homemade home fries, which came Southern-style with saut√©ed onions and peppers. They were perfectly seasoned and had that crispy, golden edge that‚Äôs hard to get just right.
The highlight, though, was the fried chicken and pancakes served with bourbon maple syrup. The pancakes were fluffy and rich, with a twist, there‚Äôs sour cream in the batter, which gives them a subtle tang and an extra tender texture. It‚Äôs a small detail that makes a big difference.
I also sampled the cheese grits, and they were creamy, comforting, and full of flavor, a perfect side to round out the meal.
Overall, Bubby‚Äôs delivered a fantastic Southern-inspired breakfast experience right in the heart of NYC. If you don‚Äôt mind the wait, it‚Äôs a must visit spot for a hearty and memorable brunch.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Bubby's in Tribeca offers a very welcoming atmosphere with its rustic and cozy ambiance. We had the pleasure of trying the Pancake Flight and the Chicken and Pancakes. The chicken was prepared to perfection, being both crispy and juicy, while the pancakes were delightfully fluffy and flavorful, accompanied by a variety of toppings such as caramelized banana, walnuts, blueberry, Nutella, mixed berries, and whipped cream. I also enjoyed the refreshing Hibiscus Iced Tea, which included complimentary refills.

The staff provided exceptional service; they were notably friendly and attentive. Although we were informed of an approximate 45-minute wait, we were seated much sooner. The host thoughtfully engaged with those waiting in line outside and checked on us periodically, which was a kind gesture. Our waitress demonstrated excellent knowledge and efficiency throughout our visit.

Please be aware that the pricing is on the higher side, with an expected cost of $30-$50 per person.

The location is easily accessible via the #1 train at Franklin Street, the 2 or 3 trains at Chambers Street, or the A, C, or E trains at Canal Street.

It is conveniently situated near the 9/11 Memorial & Museum and other remarkable downtown attractions.

We recommend visiting for the excellent food and staying to explore the rich history, arts, and culture of the area..", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The hostess Lena was incredibly kind and very efficient. The line for a table was long, and yet she was able to get our party seated quickly. Our server Alex was also wonderful. She was nice and very attentive. The food was great, as always! Highly highly recommend Bubby‚Äôs for anyone who may be visiting the city. Thank you guys for a wonderful experience.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Friendly service and short wait. Don‚Äôt pass it up because of the lines - we didn‚Äôt wait as long as the originally quoted.
Great coffee and even better brunch food! We tried the pancake flight and eggs Benedict - both were so tasty! It seems like they use healthier ingredients because I‚Äôm sensitive to seed oils and heavily processed ingredients and I felt great afterwards.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love Bubby‚Äôs and waiting lines are not as bad as it seems.

Must have the Nutella and berry jam‚Äôs pancakes. Huge, definitely for, at least, 3 people sharing.
I usually split a salted and a sweet dish in 2 but pancakes are huge. Should go with plenty space for that brunch!

Fries are really good too. Not the house ones tho', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: REI
address: 303 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: bicycle_store, sporting_goods_store, shoe_store, clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'recently visited the REI store on Fifth Avenue, and it was a fantastic experience! Though smaller than other retail stores I‚Äôve been to, this location is incredibly well-stocked. My family was staying at a hotel and needed a sleeping pad to make a sofa bed more comfortable. It was my first time shopping for a pad, and I initially thought we‚Äôd need a sleeping bag. The staff was amazing‚Äîdespite the store being packed, they were attentive and helpful.

One employee spent about five minutes explaining different pad materials and recommended an REI-brand pad that worked perfectly. The store‚Äôs location is super convenient, easily accessible by subway. The only downside was the checkout, which took around 10 minutes on a busy weekend due to long lines. That said, the prices were surprisingly lower than REI stores I‚Äôve seen in other cities, which is impressive for Fifth Avenue.

This store packed with quality gear, great staff, and excellent prices. Highly recommend for anyone in NYC needing outdoor equipment!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "I usually order from REI's online store. This time I was on a business trip to Manhattan and near SOHO. I had some free time, so I came to visit it. I have not been to other REI branches. But I think the space in this store is very large. There are stairs connecting floors. There are many kinds of products. You can try them on and confirm whether the functions of the products are as expected. This is something you can't experience when shopping online. There is a toilet (women's toilet) on the basement floor. The men's toilet cannot be used.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Came back to this REI with my girlfriend after a few years I remembered really liking it, and it‚Äôs still a solid spot. The store is super spacious and spread over multiple levels, with a huge range of gear for camping, biking, running, hiking pretty much anything sporty or outdoorsy.

They carry a great selection of quality brands like The North Face, Cannondale, Sportina, and more. That said, the prices are very high. Maybe it‚Äôs the New York factor, but everything felt noticeably more expensive than what you‚Äôd find online or in other stores.

I didn‚Äôt find anything particularly exciting this time, but if you need good gear and want to see it in person, this is a reliable place to go. Just be prepared to pay a premium for the convenience and selection.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'It is truly one of those grand shops that one longs for‚Äîespecially as it has no presence in London. Upon researching the store, I discovered that it offers membership discounts, annual dividend returns, high-quality outdoor gear, complimentary repair and rental services, environmentally conscious operations, and notably attentive customer care.

Though I‚Äôve yet to experience these benefits firsthand, I‚Äôve recently found myself drawn to the world of camping gear‚Äîso much in vogue these days‚Äîas well as ski equipment and bicycles, all of which are scarcely available in London. The staff appeared courteous, and I found myself pondering what I might take home on my next visit; simply browsing was a pleasure in itself.

Given the selection of fitness equipment and clever essentials that so suit the modern lifestyle, I shall certainly make better use of their website in the meantime.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I recently bought a bike online and picked it up at the store. AG was super helpful and answered all my questions when I went to store to pick it up.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Century 21 NYC
address: 22 Cortlandt St, Manhattan, NY 10007, USA
types: department_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Century 21 NYC, located at 22 Cortlandt Street, New York, is back after reopening its famous flagship store. The new version is smaller than before but modern, clean, and well organized. You‚Äôll find designer clothing, shoes, and accessories, though the selection is not as wide as in the past and prices feel a bit higher than old Century 21 days. Still, it‚Äôs worth a visit for those who remember the iconic store and want to shop for recognizable brands in Lower Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I returned Century 21 after over 10 years.

When I was tourist, this place was my favorite. I would go crazy and picked up bargains from mountains of clothes.(longtime ago, the store was a place of chaos)

As others have mentioned, there are fewer products available now, but I was surprised at how organized the store is.

The fitting rooms are as beautiful as a high end boutique, and there are many private rooms, which is great!

It‚Äôs a discount store for brands items, so prices aren‚Äôt as cheap as Marshalls or TJ Max.
But I searched carefully and found a T-shirt for my husband and workout top for myself at a great price, so I‚Äôm happy.

I recommend going to the store as soon as it opens so you can enjoy shopping without others.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Had a blast in the Suit department yesterday.  Was there to get outfits for a wedding, and my mom came with for moral support and advice.  Derek took great care of us, was super kind and helpful, was responsive when I liked and didn't like things, and helped us find a couple fits that I was really happy with.  The tailor - Jack? - also really looked after us and was a lot of fun! Especially for someone who doesn't browse the suit department very often, it was a great experience and a real boost to have the two of them on our team üôè", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Most of their outlets were closed down post Covid and this is the only outlet available now across New York. Spanning across 4 floors, they still hold a very decent amount of branded and luxury fashion goods - from sunglasses, jackets, handbags, to shoes, jeans and undergarments. Designs and sizes will vary according to availability and what you see is also depending on your luck. Grab what you can once you have your eyes on it as you never know if that will be the last piece ever. Stall was well-organized generally and staff was helpful.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love the clearance items at C21 and the amazing designer items and great quality! My fav store!! Quality items, staff is patient and helpful, great deals. C21 cannot be beat. So grateful it‚Äôs back!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 233 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, market, point_of_interest, health, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I absolutely love shopping at Trader Joe's. Always spacious and clean, and always enough cashiers.  I love the variety of frozen foods that you wouldn't usually see at a regular supermarket, and their prices are affordable too. TraderJoe's meals are easy to prepare, especially when you come in from a long day and don't know what's for dinner.  Could never just go for a couple things, I end up needing 3 pairs of hands because I get 2 of everything ü§¶üèæ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è I love shopping at Trader Joe's.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As a trainer working with Woody, a middle-aged, overweight Catahoula Pit mix, I've been on the lookout for high-value reinforcements that truly motivate him. The Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips have been a fantastic find in our training regimen.
Woody absolutely goes wild for these! The "Beef Recipe" seems to be a huge hit, making them incredibly effective for reinforcing positive behaviors, especially given that he's a middle-aged dog we're working on getting back to a healthy weight. Alongside bananas, which he also enjoys, these jerky strips provide a powerful incentive without adding too many extra calories when used strategically.
One of my main priorities with Woody, especially as an overweight dog, is managing his energy levels and ensuring he stays cool during our sessions. The compact size of these jerky strips means I can break them into smaller pieces for frequent rewards without overfeeding, which is crucial for calorie control. Plus, they're easy to carry and don't get messy, making them perfect for outdoor training sessions where keeping Woody comfortable and cool is paramount.
Overall, I highly recommend Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips for anyone looking for a high-value, palatable treat for their dog, especially for those working with an overweight or middle-aged dog like Woody. They've been an excellent addition to our training toolkit, helping us make significant progress while keeping him motivated and happy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An incredible place to go shopping for groceries.

I was particularly impressed with their affordable organic options and the wide range of flavors that you won't find in your typical grocery store.

Whether it's their delicious frozen meals, fresh produce, or quirky snacks, there's always something exciting to discover at Trader Joe's.

Plus, the layout and organization of the store made it easy to find everything I needed.

Their private-label products and friendly staff exceeded my expectations, which keeps me coming back for more.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love this location of Trader Joe‚Äôs ! Its my favorite and I‚Äôm always greeted and helped by the friendly staff ‚Ä¶Xavier especially, he‚Äôs one of those exceptional employees who smile is warm and inviting always eager to help me when I shop or need to see if my favorite snacks are in stock . MY FAVORITE STORE !!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love the staff of Trader Joe‚Äôs. Extremely friendly and helpful. I‚Äôm looking for something that has zero stocks, the staff who is senior already go the extra mile to help me look in the stockroom and find the item for me since I can‚Äôt go back anymore.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: ZARA
address: 503 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Zara ‚Äì SoHo, NYC
üìç 503 Broadway, New York, NY 10012

This is hands-down my favorite Zara location in the city. The store is huge, super clean, and always well-stocked with a great variety of clothes, including trendy seasonal pieces and classic staples. If you‚Äôre a Zara lover, this one is worth the visit.

What really makes the SoHo location stand out for me is how organized it is. Unlike some other Zara stores in NYC that can feel chaotic, this one has a separate line for purchases and returns, which makes everything so much smoother. I went on a weekend and was pleasantly surprised that the line to check out moved quickly.

The layout is spacious, and the fitting rooms were open and functioning, which is not always the case in busy Manhattan locations.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Highlights:
‚Ä¢ Best Zara in NYC for selection and space
‚Ä¢ Separate return and purchase lines (huge plus!)
‚Ä¢ Clean, organized, and less chaotic than other branches
‚Ä¢ Located right in SoHo, perfect for a shopping day out', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I visited Zara‚Äôs today and was disappointed with the experience. There were 27 people in line for returns online and 2 for in-store purchases, but only one associate working the cash register. It was clear the store wasn‚Äôt prepared to manage the crowd efficiently, which made for a frustrating experience. They really need to get their staffing and organization together. Also noticed the prices are really went up, see in the second video how they cover the previous price tag and how it compares to Europe', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The short security guard with the beard is a joke. He'll treat you like a criminal. I accidentally left a tag on my shirt that made the sensor go off. Their system failed and never texted me my receipt so instead of being a normal person, he starts to become condescending takes possession of my clothes and tells me to go upstairs and figure it out for myself without my clothes that I had just paid almost $300 for. Then after being incredibly difficult the other security guard with the glasses who is also an absolute joke takes my clothes from the other security guard brings me upstairs then leaves me there and doesn't get a manager or anything like that. I had to find someone myself and he was the nicest person I dont understand why the security guards there are trained to treat everyone like they're criminals. Don't bother coming to this location there are plenty of others Zaras", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'After four years of shopping at this location and Zara locations all over the globe, I have only returned one item. today I attempted to make a return 2, the cashier and the manager claimed they couldn‚Äôt accept the product back because it was wrinkled &  there was a difference in color. I did not see the color difference. I tried on the shirt once at home. I told him that. does fabric wrinkling communicate how I treated the item or about the material Zara uses? Terrible experience & rude staff.
Starting today shop exclusively Aritzia!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Be sure to LOVE what you buy because returns are a NIGHTMARE if you end up losing or throwing away the receipt and you do not give them your email or phone number at the time of purchase. I even asked for a gift card rather than money back and the location cannot provide anything without a receipt. IF you do not know the exact date, amount of purchase down to the penny, sku # and store location, they cannot find your purchase and you will struggle to get any credit. Most ridiculous system for such a large corporation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Apple SoHo
address: 103 Prince St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: electronics_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had an experience at this Apple Soho store yesterday that really brought me back to why I started writing these reviews in the first place. Do you ever have just such an exceptional customer service experience that you need to tell someone?

Shoutout to my guy Kevin here at the Apple store. What a legend. I walked straight into the belly of the consumerism beast to upgrade my Iphone as I shoot my dumb little food videos in 4k 60 fps, and it has absolutely MOGGED my storage. I need to delete every clip after posting a video. My 256 GB phone is no match for 4k 60 fps. I need that 1 TB to stay flowy.

When I informed Kevin of my pressing issue, he gave me every last option before letting my pockets get hit for that 1TB phone: "You should buy more Icloud storage..." -- "I did but now I gotta redownload everything when it's time to edit and that takes forever."

"You can opt to download and keep originals in your settings so they stay high quality" -- "I don't have enough storage for that..." -- "Okay that's true..." he responded.

I truly appreciate an employee looking out for a customer rather than just making a quick sale. They don't make them like Kev anymore.

We also just started chopping it up, and he was such a cool personable dude. He's been working here for 9 years... Kev not new to this!

I asked him if he could get Tim Apple on the phone so I could pitch him a few ideas including a smaller iphone (3GS size) and to bring an ipod back so I could go workout and not have my phone on me... I miss disconnecting from my phone for at least 90 min a day.

Kev responded "Yeah for sure! Let me just dial him up real quick" with a cheeky grin.

The Kevins of the world need their shine. GIVE HIM A RAISE Y'ALL!!!

IG @johnny.novo
Tiktok @jnov__
Substack @johnnynovo', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is such a nice Apple Store. It‚Äôs got 2 floors, the upstairs is essentially the Genius Bar. They also have a large screen with comfortable seating upstairs where I was told they do classes which I think is so great. The store has multiple devices of the same model so that at least 10 people can try the item out at once.
I had gone for a Genius Bar appointment. Making the appointment the day before was very easy and they were there to help me within 5 minutes of my appointment. Chris was very patient and listened to my concerns about laptop migration. He helped me through all the different options and answered all my questions. It took awhile to figure everything out and he didn‚Äôt rush me and listened to all my concerns.
Overall, I had a great experience at this store.

Insta: @TheShahLALand', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I brought my phone to Apple SoHo for repair. The process was fairly quick, and I got my phone back in working condition ‚Äî which I appreciate. However, the device was covered by AppleCare, and without informing me, they removed the AppleCare coverage after the repair. I might still want to use AppleCare, so taking it off without asking me was really disappointing. It felt like they were saying, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt bring it back if you break it again.‚Äù That attitude didn‚Äôt sit right with me. I expected a more professional experience from Apple.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Helpful and friendly staff who were able to resolve the issues at the Genius Bar with no unecesssy fanfare, quickly, and efficiently. Would highly recommend this location for its great employees (4 for 4 top notch attitudes and care level for everyone I talked to here, shoutout to Jennifer the lead plus both check in guys for Genius Bar, and the tech Richard who fixed my problems!)', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pleasant experience during my visit.  As a customer walking in and seeing  a great deal of people,  I was a bit reluctant,  however I felt acknowledged and welcomed upon entering. Surprisingly the staff appeared happy to be there,', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Mei Lai Wah
address: 41 Mott St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: chinese_restaurant, asian_restaurant, bakery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I was here with my buddy today and we stopped in for a quick bite. This is one of the best roast pork buns and shumai I ever had. Interestingly the fusion Chinese food I had in Peru might still be my favorite but this was great. The roast pork was tender and sweet, and the bun was nice and soft. I would have easily devoured another one but we still had other places to try. The shumai was packed with flavor and I enjoyed those just as much.

They‚Äôre very busy as they should be, but the line moved fast. Within 2 minutes my order was taken and I got the food very fast. The roast pork bun was $2.50 and shumai was $6.50. The menu online shows $3 and $7.50 so the prices must have recently gone down or the menu is just wrong. I would definitely come back here and try the pineapple pork bun.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The legendary ‚Äúpineapple‚Äù bbq pork bun lives up to its reputationüëçGlad that we came early while there‚Äôs no line but it‚Äôs a treat that‚Äôs worth the wait. The bun has perfect crust, generous tasty juicy filling in a thin sweet bun roll. And the size is decently large.  Also highly recommend the ‚ÄúBig‚Äù special bun. It‚Äôs basically a meal in large steam bun with tons of filling with pork, chicken, Veggies, Chinese sausage, even eggs.  Very very tasty and a real low cost and quick power-up as a refill for touring NYC and Chinatown and nearby areas.  We did not sit down and just inhaled the buns next to the shop and moved onto the next destination ü§£ Overall a great visit for the bun.  Totally worth the trip ü•∞', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is one of the most famous Chinese bakeries in Manhattan‚Äôs Chinatown, and I‚Äôd heard so much about it from food vloggers that I had to try it for myself. I went with a friend on a weekend afternoon, and even though it was later in the day, the place was still packed. We waited about 10 minutes in line, but the staff kept things moving quickly, and once we ordered, our food came right away since everything is freshly baked and ready to go.

The selection is huge, but we decided to stick with their signature items: the pineapple-crusted pork bun and the original pork bun. Both were delicious, but the pineapple version really stood out. It‚Äôs essentially the same soft, savory pork bun, but topped with a golden pineapple crust that adds a crunchy texture and a subtle sweetness‚Äîit feels like a deluxe upgrade of the classic. The original pork bun was flavorful and satisfying as well, filled generously with savory pork.

These buns work great as a snack or can easily be shared between two people. Overall, it was a fun and tasty stop, and I‚Äôd definitely come back to try more of their offerings.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great buns at affordable prices!
I loved both the pineapple roast pork buns and the roast pork buns ‚Äî sweet, savory, and uniquely delicious. The line is split into two (cash and card), and I waited about 10‚Äì15 minutes. Once I placed my order, the buns came out within a minute or two. The pork does have some fat, so if you prefer lean meat, this might not be for you. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try the egg yolk bun ‚Äî it‚Äôs something I can‚Äôt find anywhere else near where I live!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I first heard about this place through my boyfriend and his sister. She came on vacation and came back from NY with 2 bags of these delicious pork buns!!!
I tell you one of the BEST flavors I‚Äôve tried in my life! The buns are soft and fresh, and the pork is deliciously flavored! ü§§
BRING CASH!!! Because it‚Äôs faster to pay at the end; line for cards is usually slower. (If you are in a hurry that is)

PS: The buns are only $2.50 each !!!!! ü´®', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Brandy Melville - Flagship
address: 519 Broadway, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: clothing_store, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I had such a great experience shopping at Brandy Melville for the first time thanks to Destiny. She was so friendly, patient, and helpful the entire time I was in the store. She went out of her way to help me find exactly what I was looking for and made sure everything fit perfectly. She had such a positive attitude and her attention to detail made my shopping experience so enjoyable. It‚Äôs rare to come across someone who genuinely cares about customer satisfaction the way she did. Brandy Melville is so lucky to have her on the team!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We flew from Florida to New York to visit this store. The selection is huge, prices are great, and the quality is very good. I would have given a full 5 stars if it weren‚Äôt for a very rude African American woman (long dress) working at the fitting room. Her attitude was extremely unpleasant, and she shouldn‚Äôt be working in any store ‚Äî especially one that caters to teenage girls.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The clothes here are cute however the staff and security makes me extremely uncomfortable. I am a slimmer girl of color and i may not always dress the brandy ‚Äúaesthetic ‚Äú when i go into the store to shop however I do receive a lot of stares by the employees when i am shopping. I have been followed through the store as well. this location is already hard to walk through and the staff make it even more difficult when they are constantly following . The staff is rude and they are constantly profiling. I had went into the fitting room and they asked me to leave my bag in front of the door and were standing by my room as i was changing .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The workers were nice, I didn‚Äôt have issues with any of the workers, my problem was the security guard. I needed a shirt to go to a concert, so I saw brandy melville had the top I was looking for. I tried it on, bought it, and changed into it before I left the store and help my original shirt in my hand. When I left the security guard asked to see my receipt for the shirt I changed out of. I had to explain to him that the shirt it my hand was the shirt I had on when I entered the store and the shirt I changed into was the one I bought, then he said ok. I walked away so frustrated and asked why he had to see a receipt (I don‚Äôt know if he heard me). The shirt I had on was literally a forever 21 shirt from years ago. Security if worrying about the wrong people, smh', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Not very familiar with this brand ‚Äî or this store to be honest. But there was an African-American lady there whom I assumed was the manager. I was there to take some pictures for my girlfriend because she likes the brand and I wanted her to pick up a few items. Was taking pictures of products on the shelf when this lady came up to me and told me to stop. Now I assumed I because I was one of the only male customers there and I was not accompanied by anyone else, plus the store was somewhat crowded I may have looked suspicious, which I understood and told her that I was only taking pictures to send to my gf for purchase. She nodded and let me move on.

Now, when I came near the jewelry section to take some pictures, she stopped me again. This time I stopped taking pictures and apologized to her. Since I was pretty much finished at this point I went up to her and apologized again for any trouble I may have caused. Now up until this point I didn‚Äôt really have a problem with what she did.

She then proceeded to accuse me of ‚Äúcoming here everyday and taking photos‚Äù I was dumbfounded by the accusation as this has been my first time in this store. I was a tourist visiting here. I quickly told her that she misunderstood and I was not the person she was talking about. I then offered to show her pictures that I took to prove that I was, in fact, not taking pictures of other people. I then showed her my camera roll. She then decided it was not enough and basically demanded to see my chat history. I was angry at this point but still decided to show her the chat history to prevent any trouble. After seeing that I did not take pictures of others, she proceeded to ignore me and did not apologize.

according to my own research there has been plenty of pictures posted online of store products, so it was obvious that the store did not have an ‚Äúno camera‚Äù policy. There has even been faces of rude employees posted online. Now I am wondering why I was treated with such disrespect. I understand the need for caution in crowded retail spaces, but to be falsely accused, interrogated, and treated like a threat for simply taking product photos was deeply humiliating. I was calm and cooperative the entire time. Yet I was met with hostility and assumptions instead of a basic level of professionalism or decency. I did not even receive a basic apology from the lady.

This experience left a really bad impression on me, not just of this store, but of the brand as a whole. I came in with good intentions and left feeling targeted. Definitely won‚Äôt be returning to any locations by this brand and I‚Äôll be warning others about this location.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Balthazar
address: 80 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: french_restaurant, seafood_restaurant, bakery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I went to Balthazar on a Monday night and had such a great experience! I was seated right away and my server, Madeline, was super kind and attentive. She offered me a complimentary mocktail as soon as I sat down ‚Äî it was originally a champagne, but since I don‚Äôt drink, she happily swapped it for a ginger mocktail, which was really good.

This was my first time at Balthazar, and everything I ordered was amazing ‚Äî the French onion soup, steak frites, profiteroles, and coffee. The soup was rich and flavorful, my steak was cooked perfectly (medium well, just right), and dessert was the perfect finish.

Service was excellent ‚Äî Madeline checked on me at just the right times, and I never had to look around for her. Everything was delicious, and I left super happy with my experience. I‚Äôll definitely be back to try more of the menu!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had a lovely early dinner here during our city trip. The staff were super friendly, and the vibe was warm and lively. The food was delicious‚Äîespecially the truffle fries and onion soup! The short rib could‚Äôve been a bit more tender, but overall everything was great. Tables are a little close, but that‚Äôs part of the charm. Definitely worth a visit!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Our plane back to NY was delayed so we cancelled our reservation and ended up at Balthazar at 11p on a Wednesday.   The dining was lively and mostly full when we arrived.

We were seated I a 2 top, corner booth that was perfect, and very comfortable.

I ordered a gin martini that was served ice cold.

My wife and I split the endive salad (I love the pickled pears), a cheeseburger with fries delicious), haricot vert (perfectly cooked and so fresh) and a caramelized and bruleed banana tart (gorgeous and excellent).

When we left, well after midnight, the bar was still crowded with patrons enjoying themselves and bartenders who weren‚Äôt trying to rush them. What a nice and fun night!

Thanks Keith.  Also, I really enjoyed your book.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had a nice early dinner here on our trip to the city. The service was outstanding and the atmosphere is everything you‚Äôd expect. The food was great but did not quite live up to the expectations. We ordered the steak frites, gougeres, onion soup, ravioli, and short rib. Of the meal we would recommend the steak frites‚Äîthe fries were amazing! The onion soup is also a must-order. The short rib was a bit dry. One thing to be mindful of when dining here is the proximity to neighbors, they really pack everyone they can get in here. Overall, would recommend going to cross it off the list.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Breakfast at Baltazar had been on my bucket list for a while. I had the opportunity to return to New York City this past week and took advantage. With the publication of Keith McNally‚Äòs memoir earlier this year, the experience was even more poignant. The service, as expected, was outstanding. The ambience was perfect, transporting you to a Parisian brasserie. And let‚Äôs not forget the food. Simply amazing.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Lafayette Grand Caf√© & Bakery
address: 380 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: french_restaurant, bakery, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Lafayette Grand Caf√© & Bakery is more than just a restaurant; it‚Äôs a beautiful escape to a bustling Parisian grand caf√© right here in New York City. From the moment you step inside, the stunning atmosphere‚Äîcomplete with the tiled floors, warm lighting, and a gorgeous outdoor seating area‚Äîtransports you.
Culinary Highlights
The food is, simply put, a delight. I visited for brunch and was thoroughly impressed:
‚Ä¢ The Bakery: The Boulangerie Basket is a must-order. The pastries are truly world-class, with those iconic, ultra-flaky, swirled croissants being the absolute star. The texture and flavor of the different croissants (like the pistachio and chocolate pictured) are pure perfection and entirely worth the hype.
‚Ä¢ Brunch Menu: The brunch menu is an expertly executed French bistro dream. Whether you go for something savory like the Croque Madame or the classic Smoked Salmon Benedict, you can tell the ingredients are fresh and the preparation is precise.
‚Ä¢ Drinks: The drink menu is expansive, offering everything from classic cocktails like the Manhattan and a selection of fresh-pressed Jus Frais to a deep wine list. The draft beer selection is a great touch for a classic French caf√©.
Ambiance and Service
The vibe is lively and sophisticated, perfect for a celebratory meal, a special date, or a long, leisurely weekend brunch. The outdoor seating (as seen in the video) is an incredible spot to enjoy the buzz of the city while dining. Service was attentive and polished, ensuring a truly five-star experience from start to finish.
Lafayette Grand Caf√© & Bakery is a destination restaurant that absolutely lives up to its reputation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The croissant is a truly unique experience . I highly recommend it! My favorite is the pistachio, but honestly, they‚Äôre all incredible. The place is cozy and charming. On weekends, you can‚Äôt sit inside to eat your croissant (there‚Äôs a standing area available), but during the week they have a reserved caf√© area where you can sit and enjoy it peacefully. So if you can visit on a weekday, I‚Äôd definitely suggest doing that! The space is clean, and the atmosphere is very pleasant.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Had a very tasty munch outdoor the sugar snap peas were delicious. The Hamachi was very tasty with a touch of lemon that I added. The trout was very good. Maybe a little too many capers steak tartar was delicious. Service was good not great and the wines by the glass had a nice selection. This place is huge with also a bakery', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'We had a wonderful breakfast at Lafayette Grand Caf√© in New York. The atmosphere was stylish yet relaxed, and there was enough space to sit comfortably. The food and drinks were delicious ‚Äì everything was fresh, well-prepared, and full of flavor. While the prices are on the higher side, even for New York, the quality and overall experience made it absolutely worth it. A great spot to start the day in the city!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The service and food were both excellent.  I enjoyed the rainbow trout with a salad, I also had their penicillin #2 cocktail. Which was well made. The staff was friendly and very courteous.   One thing to keep in mind is that you have to order any baked goods from the Patisserie separately', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Levain Bakery
address: 340 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: bakery, food_store, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Saw this on social media and had to try it. Came on a Thursday evening for my bday treat wish and it was crowded with a long line out the door. Easy to get here by train. They had a good enough selection and can see someone in the kitchen making cookies. It‚Äôs a nice store and had some merch to purchase. Gosh, so glad we made it to try these delicious cookies while in NY!  I loved them all. I forgot to take pics of everything as everyone at them right away but they were fat cookies and moist with lots of chocolate and ingredients. The Muffin was a small size I am used to seeing.

Blueberry muffin
Two Chocolate Chip
Caramel Coconut Chocolate Chip
Double Chocolate Chip (My favorite!!!)

Prices are a little expensive but so worth it. This is a must try while in NY Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Hands down, this was one of the best experiences of my life with desserts. Never had cookies like these before. These are humongous and buttery, sweet too. I tried 4 of their flavors (choco dark chip, choco peanut butter, choco chip classic and walnut) and all were unique and tasty. Infact I took these back home with me in  a 19 hour long flight, where these lasted a week in a ziplock bag in my freezer. I would take a bit out microwave for 15 secs and there you go. Perfect dessert to complement your tea. Each bite was heavenly as if freshly baked in the oven. My personal favorite was walnut chocolate chip cookie. To those who are concerned about them being too sugary, you don't have to consume the whole cookie in one go. Save it for another time ;)", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Food: We got the chocolate chip cookie and although it was good and THICK, it didn't seem fully cooked inside. It was very sweet but just wish it was in the oven for a bit longer.
Service: Service was great and they were very helpful
Atmosphere: Very cutesy and picturesc here.
Overall, I would come back again but try something else. The pastries look and smell phenomenal, as always.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Ordered three - two were delicious, one (white chocolate and macadamia) was mind blowing. Recommended here by an NYC friend and wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Cookies were warm and melt in your mouth. Absolutely fabulous - go here without hesitation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Levain Bakery is a famous spot for a reason ‚Äî the cookies are massive and packed with flavor. We tried the classic and a dark chocolate one, and both were very sweet, almost overwhelmingly so, but still incredibly tasty. It‚Äôs hard to stop eating once you start, even though the sweetness can be a bit much. Definitely worth trying at least once while in NYC, especially if you‚Äôve got a sweet tooth. A memorable bakery experience that lives up to its reputation.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Clinton St. Baking Company
address: 4 Clinton St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: american_restaurant, brunch_restaurant, hamburger_restaurant, bakery, meal_takeaway, breakfast_restaurant, dessert_shop, confectionery, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Clinton Street Baking Co. absolutely lives up to the hype. The service and atmosphere were amazing ‚Äî warm, welcoming, and super friendly. The staff recommended the blueberry pancakes and OMG that was the best decision ever. They were so soft, fluffy, and just incredible!

We also ordered the spinach & mushroom omelette with sourdough bread, and honestly‚Ä¶ I could cry, it was THAT good. Perfectly cooked, flavorful, and comforting in every way. The latte and cappuccino were smooth, rich, and the perfect pairing.

Overall, such a delightful experience. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking for fantastic food and great vibes. I‚Äôm definitely coming back! ü´∂‚ú®', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'If there‚Äôs one NYC spot that truly lives up to its breakfast reputation, it‚Äôs Clinton St. Baking Company. I finally tried their famous pancakes this weekend, and let me tell you.. they deserve every bit of the hype. Fluffy, lil crispy on outside, and served with their homemade maple butter sauce that‚Äôs honestly addictive.. it‚Äôs what makes this dish so uniquely delicious.

We also ordered the raspberry yogurt cupcake (light, tangy, and perfectly balanced) and their fried chicken, which was crisped to perfection with a beautiful honey dressing and some hot sauce that tied everything together. Every bite felt like comfort food done right. Simple ingredients, but executed flawlessly.

The best part? Despite it being a weekend morning, I didn‚Äôt have to wait in the infamous line (which can get really long). I booked ahead on Resy, and it made the experience seamless, definitely recommend doing that if you‚Äôre planning a visit.

Bottom line: come hungry, book ahead, and don‚Äôt skip the pancakes. They might just be the best in NYC', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Hands down one of the best brunch places in NY! We been coming here for years and is always consistent! The food is delicious with great quality and the cappuccino always on point! Our favorites are the Blueberry Pancakes (super fluffy), Chicken and Waffles (crispy) and the Special Waffle with the seasonal fruit (fresh). The Maple Butter is a perfect combination! Plenty of indoor seating. Service is always excellent and efficient! Staff always friendly! Also, make a reservation it gets really busy specially on the weekends. Highly recommend it!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "My visit to Clinton St. Baking Company was an experience that certainly lived up to its reputation, though with a few caveats. Getting a reservation, especially on a weekend, felt like a quest, so I opted for a weekday evening. The atmosphere was bustling and lively, definitely on the noisier side, which meant it wasn't the spot for a quiet, lingering conversation, but it had a charming, classic diner vibe.

The service was consistently excellent; the staff were attentive and efficient despite the crowd. Now, for the food ‚Äì the pancakes are truly exceptional. Fluffy and delicious, particularly the blueberry ones with their warm maple butter, they are an absolute must-try. Their signature chicken and waffles also lived up to the hype; the chicken was huge, crispy, and paired perfectly with a fantastic hot sauce, offering great value. I was also pleasantly surprised by the salmon burger, which was incredibly tasty, and the double bacon was like delicious beef jerky.

While most dishes were fantastic, I found the truffle Brussels sprouts a tad salty, and the crispy potato pancakes weren't as crispy as I'd hoped. The seasonal drinks, like the hot buttered rum, were unique and strong. Despite the potential for long waits and the bustling environment, the quality of the food, especially the baked goods and signature dishes, makes Clinton St. Baking Company a highly recommended spot for an indulgent breakfast or brunch. Just remember to book ahead!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I went for breakfast and ordered the famous blueberry pancakes with a side of bacon. The pancakes were delicious ‚Äî light, fluffy, and perfectly cooked. The warm maple butter they serve on top is out of this world and really makes the whole dish stand out. You can tell why these pancakes have the reputation they do.

The side of bacon was great too, crispy and flavorful, and paired perfectly with the sweetness of the pancakes. The coffee was good and the service was friendly even though the place was packed.

There was a huge line when I arrived in the morning, so definitely make a reservation if you can or go early. It‚Äôs one of those NYC breakfast spots that truly lives up to the hype.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Rubirosa
address: 235 Mulberry St, New York, NY 10012, USA
types: pizza_restaurant, meal_takeaway, food_store, restaurant, food, point_of_interest, store, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'When in New York you have to get pizza right‚Ä¶ well I think they need to clarify when they say that and tell you to get Rubirosa‚Äôs pizza. Came here on a recommendation, risked the long wait, and man was it worth it. We sat at the bar and were helped by Sergio! Ordered two pizzas. One was a traditional fresco. And the other a half and half gluten free with honey pie and tie dye. The gluten free was phenomenal. They don‚Äôt make their crust in house but it is from a local establishment. The vodka sauce on their tie dye is impeccable. I loved that the crust was crispy! I devoured it all. The half and half is the way to go!!! All of that said, when in New York get pizza. But make sure it is Rubirosa‚Äôs!!

Knocking it down and star because of cost- gluten free is smaller than non but still same cost if not more‚Ä¶', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Definitely a restaurant geared for a younger crowd. But, we had a delicious dinner.  We started with a Caesar salad and asked for A side of anchovies.  The salad was generous and lightly dressed.

We also started with an order of the eggplant Parmesan.  The eggplant was tender and the red sauce was Fresh and tangy.

For our entr√©e, we shared an order of the cavatelli with broccoli rabe and Italian sausage. With that, we ordered a side of the broccoli rabe with garlic.

Everything ordered was very good and I am impressed.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Highly recommend making reservations, especially over the weekends. If not, be prepared to wait OR quick to order for pick-up and see whatever gets to you faster: your pizza to go or your seat. We arrived with no reservations ima Saturday evening and the wait for either bar or table seating was expected to be just over 1 hour, which we expected. We ordered pizza via DoorDash for pick-up of the small half classic and half hot honey pizza. The hostess was friendly and placed us on the waitlist via text system. Our pizza for pick-up arrived first and it was easy to remove yourself from the waitlist. Now the pizza was good to share between two people. Nice thin crust, nice char, loved the cheese/sauce ratio (more cheese), now the hot honey pizza I wasn‚Äôt a fan of the soppresatta and should have subbed it for pepperoni. Overall great pie and would come back, but only with reservations or for pick-up. Not able to comment on service as we picked-up but the hostess was friendly.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "The food at Rubirosa is absolutely delicious and lives up to its hype! I loved everything, and the sauce on the pizza is tangy and unique. Service was good, however I made a reservation and chose a time that specifically stated we would receive a regular table rather than bar or elevated table seating. When we arrived, we were seated at an elevated table with no alternate choice. I wish that our reservation selection was honored as we booked in advance and came on time. For me, it wasn't a big issue but it may be good to keep in mind when booking!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Awesome place with great food, service, and ambiance.  Just SOHO with the most amazing thin crust pizza, calamari, and eggplant parm.  Our server was super chill and really went above and beyond to make the experiment as good as the food!', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 675 6th Ave, New York, NY 10010, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'Artistic balloons, face painting for memorable birthdays and events @thecolorcrew_nyc and thecolorcrew-nyc Artistic and reliable party entertainment. I love the unique and detailed face painting- the kids were enchanted. The balloons were ridiculously elaborate- crowned, super hero‚Äôs, botanical and princesses. Well worth the price for entertainment as guests were absorbed watching the Color Crew make the magic.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I was never a big Trader Joe‚Äôs fan. I always thought that their things were kind of too generic. I was dead wrong. This particular store on 6th and 21st changed my view. After trying many different things from here over time, I‚Äôm all in! I really like this place. Although this one is a very small store, it‚Äôs got a lot of great things at decent prices. The produce section is pretty good, as to is the frozen foods and meat departments. The bread area is great, with lots of interesting things.

Expect a very long checkout line most of the time, but it moves quickly. The staff is very friendly and the place is nice and clean. What‚Äôs not to like when you combine that with pretty good prices and selection? This place is a winner. Check it out if you‚Äôre in the neighborhood.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I just love Trader Joe‚Äôs. There‚Äôs always something seasonal to buy. Look at these Fall leaf shaped and coloured corn tortilla chips for example!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This Trader Joe‚Äôs in Chelsea is a great spot for affordable, quality groceries in Manhattan. The selection of private-label products, snacks, and fresh items is excellent, and the staff is friendly and helpful even during busy hours.

The store does get very crowded, especially in the afternoons and on weekends, with narrow aisles and long checkout lines. Visiting early in the morning makes for a much more relaxed shopping experience.

Overall, a solid Trader Joe‚Äôs with fair prices and good quality, just not ideal if you‚Äôre in a hurry.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Finally managed to visit one of their outlets, albeit a smaller one along 6th Avenue. Fruits, flowers, vegetables and cheese selections were incredible, looked so super fresh and at reasonable discounts/prices. The queue moves efficiently here and it‚Äôs relatively easy to identify and locate items across the store. All the staff are incredibly nice and friendly. Great place to shop for all your essential items, dailies, household, perishables and more.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 233 Spring St, New York, NY 10013, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "I absolutely love shopping at Trader Joe's. Always spacious and clean, and always enough cashiers.  I love the variety of frozen foods that you wouldn't usually see at a regular supermarket, and their prices are affordable too. TraderJoe's meals are easy to prepare, especially when you come in from a long day and don't know what's for dinner.  Could never just go for a couple things, I end up needing 3 pairs of hands because I get 2 of everything ü§¶üèæ‍‚ôÄÔ∏è I love shopping at Trader Joe's.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'As a trainer working with Woody, a middle-aged, overweight Catahoula Pit mix, I've been on the lookout for high-value reinforcements that truly motivate him. The Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips have been a fantastic find in our training regimen.
Woody absolutely goes wild for these! The "Beef Recipe" seems to be a huge hit, making them incredibly effective for reinforcing positive behaviors, especially given that he's a middle-aged dog we're working on getting back to a healthy weight. Alongside bananas, which he also enjoys, these jerky strips provide a powerful incentive without adding too many extra calories when used strategically.
One of my main priorities with Woody, especially as an overweight dog, is managing his energy levels and ensuring he stays cool during our sessions. The compact size of these jerky strips means I can break them into smaller pieces for frequent rewards without overfeeding, which is crucial for calorie control. Plus, they're easy to carry and don't get messy, making them perfect for outdoor training sessions where keeping Woody comfortable and cool is paramount.
Overall, I highly recommend Trader Joe's Beef Jerky Strips for anyone looking for a high-value, palatable treat for their dog, especially for those working with an overweight or middle-aged dog like Woody. They've been an excellent addition to our training toolkit, helping us make significant progress while keeping him motivated and happy.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "An incredible place to go shopping for groceries.

I was particularly impressed with their affordable organic options and the wide range of flavors that you won't find in your typical grocery store.

Whether it's their delicious frozen meals, fresh produce, or quirky snacks, there's always something exciting to discover at Trader Joe's.

Plus, the layout and organization of the store made it easy to find everything I needed.

Their private-label products and friendly staff exceeded my expectations, which keeps me coming back for more.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I love this location of Trader Joe‚Äôs ! Its my favorite and I‚Äôm always greeted and helped by the friendly staff ‚Ä¶Xavier especially, he‚Äôs one of those exceptional employees who smile is warm and inviting always eager to help me when I shop or need to see if my favorite snacks are in stock . MY FAVORITE STORE !!!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love the staff of Trader Joe‚Äôs. Extremely friendly and helpful. I‚Äôm looking for something that has zero stocks, the staff who is senior already go the extra mile to help me look in the stockroom and find the item for me since I can‚Äôt go back anymore.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Wegmans
address: 770 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'This is an incredible grocery store if you‚Äôre looking for high quality produce, packaged snacks, and prepared foods. They make sushi, Asian bowls, cakes, breads, and cookies.

You can easily get lost here wandering the aisles.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Omg I love this place. I discovered wegmans back in 2012 when I lived in Syracuse. I brought the lobster salad which I give. 5/10 when I opened it but 10/10 as leftovers. The winner was the chocolate dome petit. For 8 dollars it was so worth it. I‚Äôm not a pastry eater but I had this and now I want to buy it again. The cake was soft and the moose was delicious. Will be back soon. No pics of the lobster salad because it‚Äôs gone lol but pic of the cake .', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'The interior design is astounding, it looks very not New York, looks a bit Southern and Midwestern.

Price is not as bad as Whole food.

Has many cook food station for you to order.

Not too bad for a first impression of Wegman in NYC.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very large supermarket with all the basics with a very good selection of Asian items, seafood and fresh meals/hot/cold food compared to other large supermarkets like Fairway or Wholefoods. Prices are quite decent and definitely recommend.

They have some of the best prices for ice cream pints of which they have a large selection. It does not feel as upscale as whole foods and the price difference reflects it, but the quality is still very good and comparable.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Love this store. Wonderful selection of foods and the staff here are amazing. More specifically the sandwiches and salads. I had a salad that was hand crafted and OUT OF THIS WORLD. Angela who works in this department was very kind and helped me choose a sandwich that was made fresh and was quite tasty and definitely worth the price as well. Truly a great go to for grabbing food on the go- highly recommend. Super clean and organized.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 95 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'I stopped into Whole Foods looking for something healthy to eat they have such a wide selection of fresh and healthy options. At first, I was leaning toward a salad, but then I saw the pizza and decided to give it a try since I love pizza, and honestly in New York you can‚Äôt really go wrong with it.

I grabbed a slice and it was pretty good cheesy, flavorful, and satisfying. It‚Äôs not your typical greasy slice; it had a fresher taste, and I liked the balance of toppings. Definitely a decent option when you‚Äôre hungry and want something quick.

What‚Äôs also nice is that Whole Foods has seating upstairs, so you can enjoy your food right there after shopping. Overall, I‚Äôd recommend trying their pizza. You can buy it by the slice or get a whole pie, and for a grocery store, it‚Äôs surprisingly solid.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Couldn‚Äôt spend 5 mins in this store before being followed. Once I complained one of the security guards/employees began to give his unsolicited input and the verbally assaulted me, saying ‚ÄúI need a man to calm me down‚Äù . This is the type of employees this store hires for customer service positions. He worried about me when he should be worried about working to afford a haircut.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Very spacious and clean store with a wide variety of fresh food and baked goods. I highly recommend the sushi rolls,they‚Äôre always fresh and really tasty. In the sushi section, you can grab chopsticks and extra soy sauce, so don‚Äôt forget to take them before you leave. You can enjoy your food upstairs in their dining area, where there‚Äôs a nice view from the window. It‚Äôs also a great option if you want to take your food to go. Friendly staff and a relaxed, pleasant atmosphere.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I shop here for the vegan and organic options that are hard to find elsewhere. This is my neighborhood Whole Foods and it‚Äôs really disappointing to see how little they care about keeping the water fountains and bathrooms maintained and usable. Especially with the need for water this time of year. They just got a new fountain with a water bottle filler, but within the first couple days the filter status had a red light. They fixed that after about a week. But now, for several weeks, the water bottle filler has only been working very very slowly. It takes about 5-10x longer to fill a bottle than normal depending on the size, and I always feel rude because there‚Äôs always someone behind me waiting to fill theirs. Oh and the amount of bottles it says has been saved is going up normally so it thinks it‚Äôs dispensing more water than it is. The last time I used it it never stopped when I took the bottle away.
The part where you sip from stopped working at all a couple weeks ago. The water coming out has no pressure so it just goes down.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Here I am, blissfully scanning my groceries. To my surprise a woman that works at whole foods start screaming in my ear about something not scanning. I'm trying to explain to her that I lost my voice but I am doing separate transactions and will be using another card for the rest of my groceries. She's ignores me and keeps repeating something didn't scan, mind you I'm tryna scan the rest of my items but she is blocking the scanner and hovering over me. Girl, relax. She finally moves so I can finish scanning. She's hootin and hollering to her coworkers about me. I promise you it's not that serious. There was no need for her blood pressure to be raised, I KNOW you ain't getting paid enough for all that. And SHE WAS COMPLETELY IN THE WRONG. I come to this whole foods all the time and have done separate transactions a handful of times without incident. Again, relax. It's too early and you're doing far far too much", 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 63 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10016, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'I have never really shopped in Whole Foods until I started to come to return my Amazon purchases. I decided to try out their croissants and then I saw they had sourdough bread. I tried both and I fell in love! I started to try their organic fruits, veggie salads, and just recently I finally bought food to go. I really liked their juicy rosemary chicken breast and their mozzarella creamy pasta. I also got my bf dark chocolate almonds and he liked them too! I honestly wish there were at least 2 Whole Foods in every borough so then customers wouldn‚Äôt have to travel to another borough! In the mean time I will just continue to shop in Manhattan.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Let‚Äôs see the only thing I‚Äôm not rooting for at this location is the pricing for hot food and to me it‚Äôs a total ripoff system they have with this scale you place the food on . Now the mac and cheese is a 8. The soups are a 7 the  sides are and 8 overall you will not go wrong as far as taste is concerned . Myb once I tired the food and it seemed tasteless but overall I ate there with cash money by accident multiple times cuz it‚Äôs no reason I should pay that much in a supermarket for food even if I was a billionaire by choice cuz now I‚Äôm saving my money . If I can change the cheap box‚Äôs  and sizes for the food as well as prices would be my favorite store . Those chefs works hard . Now the supermarket always clean and busy . I would sit and eat and hope that adjustments are made cuz that was June 28 I realized this but everyone is diff I just feel the food buffet style as suggested and one day it did make me happy eating it', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "While convenient and nicely situated, this Whole Foods doesn't give you the full stack of offerings you're used to from Whole Foods and it seems understocked. It's almost uninspiring to shop there, despite the pretty all-glass building.  Also, not sure what's going on with the roasted chicken that goes missing, since sometimes you can't even find any to buy... and the hot bar is more like a mess. The quality has definitely gone down ever since Amazon bought Whole Foods. It's a shame really, but that's the tea, I guess.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Nice, clean, with decent selection, standard for whole foods. One other nice aspect about this location is that I have never had to wait in check out lines for more than 2-3 minutes; in fact majority of the time I don't have to wait at all", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '3rd time visiting this Whole Food for weekly supermarket runs. Ample choices, good produce selection, clean and spacious. Cashier service leaves a lot to be desired. If you need help with your groceries prepare not to get it. So, I recommend self checkout.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Tashkent Supermarket Halal Food
address: 378 6th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA
types: supermarket, grocery_store, food_store, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "This is a fascinating place that is a feast for the eyes and belly, if you know what you want. My daughter and I went here on my recent trip, but I was having some tooth issues so I didn't buy the delicious looking, honey-coated pistachio butterfly because it looked too crunchy.

I was a little astonished that there was no difference in price between something as expensive looking as a seafood salad with huge shrimp, calamari and more - and common salads. I also deducted a star because I went back with my friend a few days later and was sorely disappointed that they don't set up any of the bar stuff until 9 am. That's perfectly understandable for the hot and cold bar.

But you guys are completely missing the boat for New Yorkers looking to pick up one of your delectable pastries in the morning on the way to work. And I will sadly have to wait until my next visit to NYC to try the pastry that looked so inviting!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I used to ‚Äútravel‚Äù all the way down to Brighton Beach for their food - so thrilled to have found it in Manhattan! The ultimate food paradise of ‚Äúpost-Soviet‚Äù regional cuisines - Russian, Ukrainian, Central Asian, all of it! And it‚Äôs truly tastes like home ü§© huge love for the job you‚Äôre doing!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is the most comprehensive buffet-style supermarket I‚Äôve seen in Manhattan! Despite its compact size, it‚Äôs packed with everything you could need for travel or daily life in NYC.

The variety of freshly prepared foods blew me away‚ÄîAsian, Middle Eastern, Japanese, Italian, European, and classic American dishes, all vibrant, flavorful, and incredibly fresh. I was amazed at how many options were available, with new dishes being cooked right there.

Beyond the food, the store is fully stocked with other essentials. It‚Äôs super convenient, located close to the subway and NYU. My only regret is not living closer! This place is a gem for travelers or locals looking to save on delicious, affordable meals. Highly recommend!', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Happened upon this market in the village after walking around for hours and looking to buy some water. I thought oh, what fun, an Uzbek market, I'd like to give them my money instead of a corporate chain.

Oh, when I walked in, it was entering a wonderland. They had so much on offer. Bars and bars of hot food, fresh cold salads, manti, samsa, perozhki, kutabi, pastries, plov,  buffet, and if that's not enough, a made-to-order station where you can get schwarma or other hot foods to order.

There were staff everywhere making sure the self-serve food was staying clean and fresh. Replacing if needed and keeping an attentive eye on it to ensure food safety.

This wasn't even everything! I didn't get pictures of the bakery and pastries section, the deli, the produce, the cold cases, or the dry goods aisles!

I only got a few peroshki, some cut watermelon for the hot day, baba ghanoush, and drinks, since I was walking and not done for the day, but it is conveniently located right on TOP of a subway entrance.

I can't wait to go back and go big with everything I want. (Bonus, English-speaking staff but Uzbek, too, if you want to talk in Uzbek üòä)", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Pros: Still looking brand new and very high-end. The selection is awesome - eastern European, Russian and Central Asian produce, really good breads. The buffet is spectacular. Last but not least, located right over the subway entrance. Cons: the buffet items seem to be about 20% pricier than in Tashkent stores in Queens and Brooklyn. Verdict: highly recommended.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 400 Grand St Cellar, New York, NY 10002, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': 'The store is bright and clean. The space is smaller than other branches. They sell daily necessities and food, but the variety is slightly less. Just personal feeling. But you still can buy what you need. When checking out, although there are many people, there are also many staff at the open counter, so it is quick to get your turn.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "This is my favorite grocery store! The store policy on purchases is very customer centric. If a customer is unhappy about a purchase, the managers will make it right either through a refund or replacement. The management and staff are friendly and helpful too. The Grand Street store is clean and spacious. There are always cart handle wipes available. They carry a large assortment of organic foods. New products are introduced every week or two. TJs is also a great option if you want to buy fresh flowers and plants too. Generally, all the prices are pretty reasonable. My only complaint is I wish they carried more vegan products.

It's important to note that each store is different. The Trader Joe's on 22nd & 6th Ave and 14th Street are awful! Both are very busy and small, so maneuvering with a cart is somewhat difficult. Also, the store on 22nd Street never provides cart handle wipes for customers. The dispenser is always empty or broken!", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Been coming here for the past 3 years and not a single bad experience. Prices are unbeatable and food is always fresh. I would always look forward to checkout as staff members are always super kind and friendly. The food quality is great and well preserved. I would say the bathroom is sometimes out of order or not maintained its best condition but otherwise, this is one of my favorite places to shop.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': "Efficient layout, nice selection, quick lines (Friday midday in August).  Very low prices vs. other grocery chains.  Friendly and especially thoughtful and efficient checkout from Georgina - probably the most efficient bag-packer of any grocery store I've been to.  Lady probably crushes at Tetris.", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '1st time visiting this location. Love the layout and endless offerings of fruits and veggies.
I was desperate for a box of cornflakes. The prices are excellent for my budget.
I will be visiting weekly to stock up on my goodies.
Thanks to Cashier #5 who assisted me and carried my groceries to his register.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Whole Foods Market
address: 4 Union Sq E, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, liquor_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews: [{'text': 'Very good Whole Foods Market in front of the famous Union Square Park. Well stacked, organized, and has a good salad ü•ó and hot food ü•ò section. I had a feeling that some items in this particular store are little bit more expensive than that of Hudson. The security in this store is a bit hiked.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Deli service is appalling. Plenty of staff walking around, but none tending to customers, despite making eye contact and noticing there is a line. The singular employee slicing meat even asked them to help and they didn‚Äôt.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'One of my favorite Whole Foods stores. They have a lot of organic varieties. Our family likes them very much. My kids only like the beef and milk here.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Whole Foods Union Square is undoubtedly my favourite location in the city. Although it tends to be quite crowded most of the time,  I still absolutely love it. The store offers an excellent selection of fresh produce, well-organized aisles. Despite the occasional bustle, shopping there remains an enjoyable experience every single time.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'This is a fantastic place right in the heart of the City ! You have groceries, lunch, cafe with ample seating ‚Äì all rolled into one. Their coffee is good and actually less expensive than cafes around here. The food is great ‚Äî fresh ingredients, caloric information, healthy options and I would say hard-to-beat prices ( $14 for an entree and two sides is the best special ). Their cafe offers 90-minute seating with a table for every group ‚Äî each table seats four, but they are places side-by-side on the Union Sq side, so large groups can sit here too. And of course the views can‚Äôt be beat!  The restrooms are a bit small, if there‚Äôs one negative.', 'languageCode': 'en'}]

name: Trader Joe's
address: 142 E 14th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
types: grocery_store, supermarket, market, food_store, health, food, store, point_of_interest, establishment
reviews:
[{'text': "üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ªü™ªü™∑üíÆüåºü•Äüåª
I had the most delightful experience at Trader Joe's recently, thanks to their stunning and affordable flower selection! I picked up two breathtaking orchids for just $14.99 each‚Äîa price that‚Äôs truly unbeatable. After checking multiple locations, this store stood out not only for its affordability but also for its focus on plants and flowers, which makes it feel like a hidden gem for floral lovers.
What made the visit even more special was the joy these orchids brought to two of my friends on their birthdays. It felt amazing to gift something so beautiful without breaking the bank.
The staff was incredibly helpful and thoughtful, offering great tips on how to care for the orchids and keep them thriving. I was able to pop in while running errands and get everything I needed quickly and efficiently.
If you're looking for economical yet elegant flowers, this Trader Joe's location is a must-visit.  üåπüå∏üíêüå∫üå∑üåªü•Äüåºü™∑ü™ª", 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'I often go this place to grab salad but yesterday I found bug in my Trader Joes Salad. I complained to the manager and he was behaving like it‚Äôs nothing new for him and he was telling me his experience in a restaurant having bug in food. I am shocked with the mangers behaviour. Though he refunded me.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': 'Great variety and prices. If you see the line to pay, no worries move fast. I love the place.', 'languageCode': 'en'}, {'text': '@ traderjoes I often have a wonderful experience here. I tried calling the store today but no one picked up .
